original: sgra la the tshom du 'gyur /
analyzed: sgra la the tshom du 'gyur /
translated: It would be doubtful whether it is sound.

original: de lta bas na mnyan par bya ba nyid ni rtag pa dang mi rtag pa dag las ldog pa nyid med do //
analyzed: de lta bas na mnyan par bya ba nyid ni rtag pa dang mi rtag pa dag las ldog pa nyid med do //
translated: Therefore, it is not the case that the quality of being audible is absent from both permanent and impermanent things.

original: 'o na ji ltar mnyan par bya ba nyid thun mong ma yin pa'i phyir rtag pa dang mi rtag pa dag la med do zhes brjod ce na /
analyzed: 'o na ji ltar mnyan par bya ba nyid thun mong ma yin pa'i phyir rtag pa dang mi rtag pa dag la med do zhes brjod ce na /
translated: But how can you say that the quality of being audible does not exist for permanent and impermanent things because it is not common to both?

original: yod par nges pa med pa'i phyir zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: yod par nges pa med pa'i phyir zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: He says, ‚Äúbecause there is no certainty that it exists,‚Äù and so on.

original: rtog pa dang mi rtag pa dag la mnyan par bya ba nyid yod par nges pa med pa'i phyir /
analyzed: rtog pa dang mi rtag pa dag la mnyan par bya ba nyid yod par nges pa med pa'i phyir /
translated: Because there is no certainty that the quality of being audible exists for permanent and impermanent things,

original: rtag pa dang mi rtag pa dag la mnyan par bya ba nyid med do zhes brjod do //
analyzed: rtag pa dang mi rtag pa dag la mnyan par bya ba nyid med do zhes brjod do //
translated: we say that the quality of being audible does not exist for permanent and impermanent things.

original: de lta bas na 'bras bu'i gtan tshigs la dpe dag gis bsgrub par bya ba dang sgrub pa dag rgyu dang 'bras bu'i @44a * //
analyzed: de lta bas na 'bras bu'i gtan tshigs la dpe dag gis bsgrub par bya ba dang sgrub pa dag rgyu dang 'bras bu'i @44a * //
translated: Therefore, in the case of a causal inference, the example is stated to establish the relation of cause and effect between the property to be established and the sign,

original: dngos por brjod par bya'i mthong ba dang ma mthong ba tsam ni ma yin no //
analyzed: dngos por brjod par bya'i mthong ba dang ma mthong ba tsam ni ma yin no //
translated: but not merely to show that the sign is seen or not seen.

original: de ltar na don gyis go bas gang yang rung bas cig shos rtogs par 'gyur gyi gzhan du ni ma yin pas /
analyzed: de ltar na don gyis go bas gang yang rung bas cig shos rtogs par 'gyur gyi gzhan du ni ma yin pas /
translated: Thus, by the meaning of the words, one can understand the other, but not otherwise.

original: gang gi tshe zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos so //
analyzed: gang gi tshe zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos so //
translated: Therefore, he says, ‚ÄúIf, etc.‚Äù

original: gang na du ba yod pa de ni ma yod do zhes bya ba nyid du yang mi 'gyur na zhes bya ba ni 'brel pa med pa'i phyir rjes su 'gro ba nyid du mi 'gyur ba'o //
analyzed: gang na du ba yod pa de ni ma yod do zhes bya ba nyid du yang mi 'gyur na zhes bya ba ni 'brel pa med pa'i phyir rjes su 'gro ba nyid du mi 'gyur ba'o //
translated: ‚Äú It would not be the case that where there is smoke, there is no fire‚Äù means that there would be no pervasion, because there would be no relation.

original: gang gi che rjes su 'gro ba nyid ma grub pa de'i tshe /
analyzed: gang gi che rjes su 'gro ba nyid ma grub pa de'i tshe /
translated: When pervasion is not established,

original: me med na du ba med do zhes shugs kyis ldog pa 'grub pa lta ga la 'gyur /
analyzed: me med na du ba med do zhes shugs kyis ldog pa 'grub pa lta ga la 'gyur /
translated: how could the absence of the reason be established by implication, when there is no fire, there is no smoke?

original: de bzhin du chos mi mthun pas ma mthong ba tsam brjod pas bsgrub par bya ba med na gtan tshigs med pa mi 'grub pa'i phyir de'i sgo nas rjes su 'gro ba dran par lta 'gyur re skan /
analyzed: de bzhin du chos mi mthun pas ma mthong ba tsam brjod pas bsgrub par bya ba med na gtan tshigs med pa mi 'grub pa'i phyir de'i sgo nas rjes su 'gro ba dran par lta 'gyur re skan /
translated: Similarly, when a negative example is stated by the mere nonobservation of a similar instance, the absence of the reason is not established, and therefore, how could the memory of pervasion occur?

original: de med na ji skad bshad pa'i 'brel pa med na /
analyzed: de med na ji skad bshad pa'i 'brel pa med na /
translated: If there is no such relation, as has been explained,

original: gcig yod na gzhan rab tu 'grub pa mi srid pas /
analyzed: gcig yod na gzhan rab tu 'grub pa mi srid pas /
translated: then it is impossible for one to be established when the other is present.

original: gcig yod na 'bras bu dang rang bzhin gyi gtan tshigs yod na gzhan rab tu grub par bya ba'i phyir rtags can rgyu dang rang bzhin rab tu 'grub par bya ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gcig yod na 'bras bu dang rang bzhin gyi gtan tshigs yod na gzhan rab tu grub par bya ba'i phyir rtags can rgyu dang rang bzhin rab tu 'grub par bya ba'i phyir ro //
translated: If the reason of effect and essence exist, then in order to establish the other, the reason of non-apprehension is for the purpose of establishing the cause and essence.

original: ji skad bshad pa'i zhes bya ba ni de'i bdag nyid dang de las byung ba'i mtshan nyid do //
analyzed: ji skad bshad pa'i zhes bya ba ni de'i bdag nyid dang de las byung ba'i mtshan nyid do //
translated: As explained means the characteristic of being of the same nature and arising from that.

original: de'i phyir zhes pa ni bshad ma thag pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de'i phyir zhes pa ni bshad ma thag pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Therefore means because of what was just explained.

original: rgyu dang rang bzhin dag med pa zhes bya ba ni rgyu med pa dang rang bzhin khyab par byed pa med pa'o //
analyzed: rgyu dang rang bzhin dag med pa zhes bya ba ni rgyu med pa dang rang bzhin khyab par byed pa med pa'o //
translated: The absence of cause and essence means the absence of cause and the absence of a pervader of essence.

original: 'bras bu dang khyab par bya ba 'ga' zhig dgag pa'i'o //
analyzed: 'bras bu dang khyab par bya ba 'ga' zhig dgag pa'i'o //
translated: It is the negation of some effect and pervaded.

original: yang zhes bya bas ni dgag pa'i tha snyad bsgrub pa'i yang ngo //
analyzed: yang zhes bya bas ni dgag pa'i tha snyad bsgrub pa'i yang ngo //
translated: The word also means also for the establishment of negation.

original: gtan tshigs ni rtags so //
analyzed: gtan tshigs ni rtags so //
translated: The reason is the evidence.

original: ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is it so?

original: 'di ltar rgyu dang khyab par byed pa de dag kho na ldog pa na /
analyzed: 'di ltar rgyu dang khyab par byed pa de dag kho na ldog pa na /
translated: Because in that case, when only those causes and pervaders are absent,

original: rang dang 'brel ba 'bras bu dang rang bzhin khyab par bya bzlog par byed pas /
analyzed: rang dang 'brel ba 'bras bu dang rang bzhin khyab par bya bzlog par byed pas /
translated: Because the effect and the nature are the reverse of the pervasion,

original: rgyu de'i phyir don 'bras bu'am khyab par bya ba 'ga' zhig dgag pa yang sgrub par 'dod pas so //
analyzed: rgyu de'i phyir don 'bras bu'am khyab par bya ba 'ga' zhig dgag pa yang sgrub par 'dod pas so //
translated: therefore, in order to refute some effect or pervasion, one must accept the proof.

original: yang zhes bya ba'i sgras ni tha snyad kyang ste /
analyzed: yang zhes bya ba'i sgras ni tha snyad kyang ste /
translated: The word ‚Äúalso‚Äù means ‚Äúconventionally.‚Äù

original: 'dis ni yang zhes bya ba'i sgra'i don yang brjod pa yin no //
analyzed: 'dis ni yang zhes bya ba'i sgra'i don yang brjod pa yin no //
translated: This also expresses the meaning of the word ‚Äúalso.‚Äù

original: rgyu byed rgyu'am rang bzhin khyab par byed pa'i ldog pa'i gtan tshigs nyid du brjod par bya'o //
analyzed: rgyu byed rgyu'am rang bzhin khyab par byed pa'i ldog pa'i gtan tshigs nyid du brjod par bya'o //
translated: The cause is said to be the reason of the reverse pervasion of the nature or the pervader.

original: ci'i phyir de gnyis kho na ldog pa nyid du brjod par bya'i /
analyzed: ci'i phyir de gnyis kho na ldog pa nyid du brjod par bya'i /
translated: Why are only those two said to be the reverse pervasion?

original: gzhan yang ni ma yin zhe na /
analyzed: gzhan yang ni ma yin zhe na /
translated: Why not others?

original: ma 'brel na ni zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: ma 'brel na ni zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: It is said, ‚ÄúIf there is no connection.‚Äù

original: de gnyis las gzhan pa la 'brel ba med do snyam du bsam pa yin no //üîΩgang la dmigs par rigs shing rung ba yod pa la de skad ces bya ste /
analyzed: de gnyis las gzhan pa la 'brel ba med do snyam du bsam pa yin no // gang la dmigs par rigs shing rung ba yod pa la de skad ces bya ste /
translated: The idea is that apart from those two, there is no connection.üîΩThat which is suitable and proper to be observed is said to be ‚Äúvisible.‚Äù

original: @44b bltar rung bzhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: @44b bltar rung bzhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: This means ‚Äúsuitable to be seen.‚Äù

original: de mi dmigs pa yang zhes bya ba ni bltar rung ba'i rang bzhin mi dmigs pa yang dgag pa'i gtan tshigs yin no //
analyzed: de mi dmigs pa yang zhes bya ba ni bltar rung ba'i rang bzhin mi dmigs pa yang dgag pa'i gtan tshigs yin no //
translated: The phrase ‚Äúnon-observation of that‚Äù is a logical reason for a negation, i.e., the non-observation of a nature that is suitable to appear.

original: 'di ni dgag pa nyid kyi gtan tshigs ni ma yin no //
analyzed: 'di ni dgag pa nyid kyi gtan tshigs ni ma yin no //
translated: This is not a logical reason for a negation.

original: 'on kyang dgag pa'i yul can gyi tha snyad gang yin pa de'i gtan tshigs yin pa'i phyir /
analyzed: 'on kyang dgag pa'i yul can gyi tha snyad gang yin pa de'i gtan tshigs yin pa'i phyir /
translated: However, it is a logical reason for a negation because it is a logical reason for a conventional object of negation.

original: de'i gtan tshigs te /
analyzed: de'i gtan tshigs te /
translated: Therefore, it is a logical reason for a negation.

original: dgag pa'i gtan tshigs zhes bshad do //
analyzed: dgag pa'i gtan tshigs zhes bshad do //
translated: It is explained as a logical reason for a negation.

original: ci'i phyir dgag pa'i gtan tshigs ma yin zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir dgag pa'i gtan tshigs ma yin zhe na /
translated: Why is it not a logical reason for a negation?

original: de lta bu mi dmigs pa na bltar rung ba mi dmigs pa ni /
analyzed: de lta bu mi dmigs pa na bltar rung ba mi dmigs pa ni /
translated: When there is non-observation of such a thing, the non-observation of a nature that is suitable to appear

original: rang nyid kyi 'gog pa'i ngo bo yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rang nyid kyi 'gog pa'i ngo bo yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: is itself the nature of a negation.

original: rgyu dang khyab par byed pa mi dmigs pa zhes bya ba ni rgyu mi dmigs pa dang / khyab par byed pa mi dmigs pa'o //
analyzed: rgyu dang khyab par byed pa mi dmigs pa zhes bya ba ni rgyu mi dmigs pa dang / khyab par byed pa mi dmigs pa'o //
translated: The phrase ‚Äúnon-observation of a cause and a pervader‚Äù refers to the non-observation of a cause and the non-observation of a pervader.

original: gnyi ga'i yang zhes bya ba ni dgag pa dang dgag pa'i tha snyad kyi'o //
analyzed: gnyi ga'i yang zhes bya ba ni dgag pa dang dgag pa'i tha snyad kyi'o //
translated: The phrase ‚Äúof both‚Äù refers to a negation and a conventional object of negation.

original: de ltar zhes bya ba ni de ltar na ste mi dmigs pa 'di mdor bsdus nas rnam pa gsum du bshad kyang yang rnam pa du mar bshad de /
analyzed: de ltar zhes bya ba ni de ltar na ste mi dmigs pa 'di mdor bsdus nas rnam pa gsum du bshad kyang yang rnam pa du mar bshad de /
translated: ‚ÄúThus‚Äù means ‚Äúin that case,‚Äù and although this non-observation is explained in brief as threefold, it is also explained in many ways.

original: 'di gnyis las gong du rnam pa brgyad du ji ltar phye ba lta bu'o //
analyzed: 'di gnyis las gong du rnam pa brgyad du ji ltar phye ba lta bu'o //
translated: This is like the above division into eight types.

original: rnam pa gang gis shi na /üîΩde dang de 'gal la sogs pa //
analyzed: rnam pa gang gis shi na / de dang de 'gal la sogs pa //
translated: In what way?

original: zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: ‚Äú Contradiction, etc., of that and that‚Äù

original: de zhes bya ba'i sgras ni gong du thal ba rang bzhin dang / rgyu dang khyad par byed pa gsum gzung ngo //
analyzed: de zhes bya ba'i sgras ni gong du thal ba rang bzhin dang / rgyu dang khyad par byed pa gsum gzung ngo //
translated: The word ‚Äúthat‚Äù refers to the three consequences above: the contradiction of essence, the contradiction of cause, and the contradiction of pervader.

original: rang bzhin la sogs pa gsum po de dag 'gal ba ni de 'gal te rang bzhin dang 'gal ba dang rgyu dang 'gal ba dang khyab par byed pa dang 'gal pa'i bye brag gis rnam pa gsum kho na yin no //
analyzed: rang bzhin la sogs pa gsum po de dag 'gal ba ni de 'gal te rang bzhin dang 'gal ba dang rgyu dang 'gal ba dang khyab par byed pa dang 'gal pa'i bye brag gis rnam pa gsum kho na yin no //
translated: The three‚Äîthe contradiction of essence, etc.‚Äîare only three types: the contradiction of essence, the contradiction of cause, and the contradiction of pervader.

original: gang la de dang de dang 'gal ba yod pa de ni de dang de dang 'gal ba la sogs pa ste /
analyzed: gang la de dang de dang 'gal ba yod pa de ni de dang de dang 'gal ba la sogs pa ste /
translated: That which has the contradiction of that and that is ‚Äúcontradiction, etc., of that and that.‚Äù

original: sogs pa zhes bya ba'i sgras ni 'gal ba'i 'bras bu dang ; / rgyu 'gal ba'i 'bras bu bsdu'o //
analyzed: sogs pa zhes bya ba'i sgras ni 'gal ba'i 'bras bu dang ; / rgyu 'gal ba'i 'bras bu bsdu'o //
translated: The words ‚Äúand so on‚Äù include the effect that is incompatible and the effect that is incompatible with the cause.

original: de dang de dang 'gal ba la sogs pa ni de dang de dang 'gal ba la sogs pa dag go //üîΩde dag mi rtogs pa dang rtogs pa dag ste /
analyzed: de dang de dang 'gal ba la sogs pa ni de dang de dang 'gal ba la sogs pa dag go // de dag mi rtogs pa dang rtogs pa dag ste /
translated: ‚ÄúThat and that which is incompatible‚Äù and so on refer to ‚Äúthat and that which is incompatible‚Äù and so on.üîΩ‚ÄúNot comprehending that and comprehending that which is incompatible‚Äù means

original: de mi rtogs pa dang / de dang 'gal ba la sogs pa rtogs pa zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: de mi rtogs pa dang / de dang 'gal ba la sogs pa rtogs pa zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: not comprehending that and comprehending that which is incompatible.

original: de dag gi dbye ba ste des sbyor ba'o //
analyzed: de dag gi dbye ba ste des sbyor ba'o //
translated: ‚ÄúThe division of those‚Äù refers to the division of those two.

original: de lta bas na sbyor ba'i sgo nas rnam pa du mar bshad do //
analyzed: de lta bas na sbyor ba'i sgo nas rnam pa du mar bshad do //
translated: Therefore, the three types of non-apprehension are explained in many ways from the point of view of their application.

original: de la de mi rtogs pas ni mi dmigs pa rnam pa gsum po rang bzhin mi dmigs pa dang / rgyu mi dmigs pa dang / khyab par byed pa mi dmigs pa bsdus so //üîΩde dang 'gal ba rtogs @45a * //
analyzed: de la de mi rtogs pas ni mi dmigs pa rnam pa gsum po rang bzhin mi dmigs pa dang / rgyu mi dmigs pa dang / khyab par byed pa mi dmigs pa bsdus so // de dang 'gal ba rtogs @45a * //
translated: Among them, the non-apprehension of that includes the three types of non-apprehension: the non-apprehension of intrinsic nature, the non-apprehension of cause, and the non-apprehension of the pervader.

original: pas ni / rang bzhin 'gal ba dmigs pa dang / rgyu 'gal ba dmigs pa dang / khyab par byed pa 'gal ba dmigs pa gsum bsdus so //
analyzed: pas ni / rang bzhin 'gal ba dmigs pa dang / rgyu 'gal ba dmigs pa dang / khyab par byed pa 'gal ba dmigs pa gsum bsdus so //
translated: The apprehension of that which is incompatible includes the three: the apprehension of the intrinsic nature that is incompatible, the apprehension of the cause that is incompatible, and the apprehension of the pervader that is incompatible.

original: sogs pa'i sgras ni 'gal ba'i 'bras bu dmigs pa dang / rgyu 'gal ba'i 'bras bu dmigs pa bsdus te /
analyzed: sogs pa'i sgras ni 'gal ba'i 'bras bu dmigs pa dang / rgyu 'gal ba'i 'bras bu dmigs pa bsdus te /
translated: The words ‚Äúand so on‚Äù include the observation of a contradictory effect and the observation of an effect that is contradictory with its cause.

original: de ltar na sngar bshad pa'i mi dmigs pa rnam pa brgyad bsdus pa yin no //
analyzed: de ltar na sngar bshad pa'i mi dmigs pa rnam pa brgyad bsdus pa yin no //
translated: Thus, the eight kinds of non-observation that were explained earlier are included in this.

original: dgag pa'i gtan tshigs ni rnam pa gsum kho na ste zhes bya ba la sogs pas ni tshig le'ur byas pa'i don 'chad do //
analyzed: dgag pa'i gtan tshigs ni rnam pa gsum kho na ste zhes bya ba la sogs pas ni tshig le'ur byas pa'i don 'chad do //
translated: The words ‚Äúthe reason of non-observation is of three kinds‚Äù and so on explain the meaning of the verse.üîΩThe reason of the non-observation of something that is suitable to appear is the non-observation of an existent cause.üîΩThe reason of the non-observation of something that pervades is the non-observation of an existent pervader.

original: rgyu dmigs su yod pa dmigs su rung ba mi dmigs pa'o zhes bya bar sbyar ro //üîΩkhyab par byed pa dang rang gi bdag nyid dmigs su yod pa zhes bya bar sbyar ro //
analyzed: rgyu dmigs su yod pa dmigs su rung ba mi dmigs pa'o zhes bya bar sbyar ro // khyab par byed pa dang rang gi bdag nyid dmigs su yod pa zhes bya bar sbyar ro //
translated: The reason of the non-observation of something that is related is the non-observation of an existent related object.

original: dgag pa'i gtan tshigs rnam pa gsum po de ni sbyor ba'i dbang gis rnam pa du mar bshad de zhes bya bar sbyar ro //
analyzed: dgag pa'i gtan tshigs rnam pa gsum po de ni sbyor ba'i dbang gis rnam pa du mar bshad de zhes bya bar sbyar ro //
translated: The three kinds of reasons of non-observation are explained in many ways according to the different formulations of the syllogism.

original: sbyor ba'i dbang gis ji lta bu zhe na /
analyzed: sbyor ba'i dbang gis ji lta bu zhe na /
translated: How are they explained according to the different formulations of the syllogism?

original: de dang de dang 'gal ba la sogs pa ma rtogs pa dang / rtogs pa'i dbye ba'i sbyor ba'i sgo nas zhes bya ba smos so //
analyzed: de dang de dang 'gal ba la sogs pa ma rtogs pa dang / rtogs pa'i dbye ba'i sbyor ba'i sgo nas zhes bya ba smos so //
translated: The phrase by way of the application of the divisions of non-apprehension and apprehension of that and of that which is incompatible, etc.

original: de nyid de ma rtogs pa dang zhes bya ba la sogs pas rnam par 'byed de /
analyzed: de nyid de ma rtogs pa dang zhes bya ba la sogs pas rnam par 'byed de /
translated: The phrase non-apprehension of that, etc. is the analysis.

original: de ma rtogs pa zhes bya ba ni rang bzhin dang rgyu dang khyab par byed pa mi dmigs pa'o //
analyzed: de ma rtogs pa zhes bya ba ni rang bzhin dang rgyu dang khyab par byed pa mi dmigs pa'o //
translated: The phrase non-apprehension of that refers to the non-apprehension of the essence, cause, and pervader.

original: de dang 'gal ba rtogs pa zhes bya ba ni rang bzhin dang rgyu dang khyab bar byed pa dang 'gal ba dmigs pa'o //
analyzed: de dang 'gal ba rtogs pa zhes bya ba ni rang bzhin dang rgyu dang khyab bar byed pa dang 'gal ba dmigs pa'o //
translated: The phrase apprehension of that which is incompatible with that refers to the apprehension of the essence, cause, and pervader that is incompatible with that.üîΩ The phrase apprehension of the effect that is incompatible with that refers to the apprehension of the effect that is incompatible with that.

original: 'gal ba'i 'bras bu rtogs pa zhes bya ba ni 'gal ba'i 'bras bu dmigs pa'o zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i dbye ba'i sbyor ba dag gis zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: 'gal ba'i 'bras bu rtogs pa zhes bya ba ni 'gal ba'i 'bras bu dmigs pa'o zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i dbye ba'i sbyor ba dag gis zhes bya ba ni /
translated: The phrase by way of the application of the divisions of those, etc. refers to

original: rgyu 'gal ba'i 'bras bu dmigs pa la sogs pa'i dbye ba'i sbyor ba dag gis so //
analyzed: rgyu 'gal ba'i 'bras bu dmigs pa la sogs pa'i dbye ba'i sbyor ba dag gis so //
translated: the application of the divisions of the apprehension of the effect that is incompatible with the cause, etc.

original: ji skad bshad pa bzhin no zhes bya ba ni gong du mi dmigs pa'i rab tu dbye ba bsam pa'i skabs su'o //
analyzed: ji skad bshad pa bzhin no zhes bya ba ni gong du mi dmigs pa'i rab tu dbye ba bsam pa'i skabs su'o //
translated: ‚ÄúJust as it was explained‚Äù refers to the above section on the categories of nonapprehension.

original: gang gi phyir de ltar 'brel ba'i dbang gis rtogs par byed pa nyid yin pa de'i phyir /
analyzed: gang gi phyir de ltar 'brel ba'i dbang gis rtogs par byed pa nyid yin pa de'i phyir /
translated: Since it is understood through the power of the relation,üîΩthe proof of the invariable concomitance of the reason with the property of the thesis is established.

original: rgyu dang 'bras bu'i dngos po nges par byed pa'i bsgrub par bya ba dang sgrub pa dag mi 'khrul bar sgrub par byed pa'am rang bzhin nges par byed pa de'i bdag nyid kyi mtshan nyid las 'bras bu dang rang bzhin gyi rtags bsgrub par bya ba med naüîΩmi 'byung bar nges pa yin no //
analyzed: rgyu dang 'bras bu'i dngos po nges par byed pa'i bsgrub par bya ba dang sgrub pa dag mi 'khrul bar sgrub par byed pa'am rang bzhin nges par byed pa de'i bdag nyid kyi mtshan nyid las 'bras bu dang rang bzhin gyi rtags bsgrub par bya ba med na mi 'byung bar nges pa yin no //
translated: The proof of the invariable concomitance of the reason with the property of the thesis is established either by the proof of the relation of cause and effect or by the proof of the nature of the reason.üîΩThe invariable concomitance of the effect reason and the nature reason is established by the invariable relation of the property of the thesis.

original: ma mthong ba las min zhes bya ba ni bsgrub par bya ba med na gtan tshigs ma mthong ba tsam las med na mi 'byung bar nges pa ni ma yin @45b pa'o ;
analyzed: ma mthong ba las min zhes bya ba ni bsgrub par bya ba med na gtan tshigs ma mthong ba tsam las med na mi 'byung bar nges pa ni ma yin @45b pa'o ;
translated: The invariable concomitance of the effect reason and the nature reason is not established by the mere nonobservation of the nonexistence of the property of the thesis.

original: / mthong las min zhes bya ba ni bsgrub par bya ba dang / sgrub pa dag lhan cig yod par mthong pa las kyang ma yin pa'o ;
analyzed: / mthong las min zhes bya ba ni bsgrub par bya ba dang / sgrub pa dag lhan cig yod par mthong pa las kyang ma yin pa'o ;
translated: Not from seeing means that the probandum and the probans are not seen to exist together.

original: ; de lta bas na de las byung ba kho nas don gzhan med na mi 'byung ba yin te /
analyzed: ; de lta bas na de las byung ba kho nas don gzhan med na mi 'byung ba yin te /
translated: Therefore, it is only because of that that the other thing does not occur without it.

original: ji ltar gzhan du na ste de las byung ba ma yin na /
analyzed: ji ltar gzhan du na ste de las byung ba ma yin na /
translated: How is it that if it were otherwise, that is, if it did not arise from that,

original: gzhan dag nyid du gyur bam yin pa'i rtags gzhan dag dang ste /
analyzed: gzhan dag nyid du gyur bam yin pa'i rtags gzhan dag dang ste /
translated: it would not be different from the other, that is, from the other signs?

original: bsgrub par 'dod pa'i don gzhan dag dang / nges par yod pa'i nges pa gang de ltar na de zhig gzhan du gyur pa'i rtags mdun du byas te bshad pa yin no //
analyzed: bsgrub par 'dod pa'i don gzhan dag dang / nges par yod pa'i nges pa gang de ltar na de zhig gzhan du gyur pa'i rtags mdun du byas te bshad pa yin no //
translated: The other things that are to be established, and the certainty that they definitely exist, are like that. Thus, having made the sign of the other thing that is destroyed present, it is explained.

original: don gzhan ma yin pa'i rtags la ni bsgrub par bya ba'i chos de tsam dang 'brel ba nyid du 'dod bar bya'o //
analyzed: don gzhan ma yin pa'i rtags la ni bsgrub par bya ba'i chos de tsam dang 'brel ba nyid du 'dod bar bya'o //
translated: In the case of a sign that is not another thing, it should be accepted that the property to be established is merely connected with that.

original: de lta ma yin te mi rtag pa nyid gang zhig la byas pa nyid kyi rgyu mtshan skyed par byed pa gang yin pa de las don gzhan pa tho ba la sogs pa'i rgyu mtshan yod par 'dod na chos de las /
analyzed: de lta ma yin te mi rtag pa nyid gang zhig la byas pa nyid kyi rgyu mtshan skyed par byed pa gang yin pa de las don gzhan pa tho ba la sogs pa'i rgyu mtshan yod par 'dod na chos de las /
translated: If it were not so, if one maintained that the reason for impermanence is the cause of production, and that the reason for the hammer, etc. is a different object, then

original: nges par yod pa'i nges pa gang ci dang 'dra zhe na /
analyzed: nges par yod pa'i nges pa gang ci dang 'dra zhe na /
translated: what certainty is there that it exists from that phenomenon?

original: gos la tshon bzhin no //
analyzed: gos la tshon bzhin no //
translated: Like the color of cloth.

original: ji ltar gos grub zin pa la le brgan rtsil sogs pa'i rgyu mtshan can gyi tshon phyis 'byung ba gang yin pa de la gdon mi za bar 'byung bar ma nges pa de dang 'dra'o //
analyzed: ji ltar gos grub zin pa la le brgan rtsil sogs pa'i rgyu mtshan can gyi tshon phyis 'byung ba gang yin pa de la gdon mi za bar 'byung bar ma nges pa de dang 'dra'o //
translated: Just as the color of cloth that is produced later, which has the reason of the dye, etc., is not certain to occur, so it is with that.

original: mi rtag pa nyid kyi rgyu don gzhan yin ba nyid du 'dod pa la nyes pa 'di 'ba' zhig tu ma zad kyi /
analyzed: mi rtag pa nyid kyi rgyu don gzhan yin ba nyid du 'dod pa la nyes pa 'di 'ba' zhig tu ma zad kyi /
translated: Not only is this fault in maintaining that the cause of impermanence is a different object,

original: nyes pa gzhan 'di yang yod pas /üîΩgzhan yang zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: nyes pa gzhan 'di yang yod pas /üîΩgzhan yang zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: but there is also this other fault.üîΩMoreover, if one maintains that the cause of impermanence is a different object, thenüîΩthe cause of impermanence would not be the cause of the object.

original: mi rtag pa nyid ces bya ba'i chos don gzhan gyi rgyu mtshan can yin par gyur na de rang gi ngo bor gyur pa byas pa la sogs pa de las gzhan nyid yin no //
analyzed: mi rtag pa nyid ces bya ba'i chos don gzhan gyi rgyu mtshan can yin par gyur na de rang gi ngo bor gyur pa byas pa la sogs pa de las gzhan nyid yin no //
translated: If impermanence were a phenomenon that is the reason for another object, then it would be different from that which is its nature, such as that which is produced.

original: 'di ltar bsgrub par bya ba'i chos don gzhan gyi rgyu mtshan can nyid du khas len na /
analyzed: 'di ltar bsgrub par bya ba'i chos don gzhan gyi rgyu mtshan can nyid du khas len na /
translated: Thus, if one asserts that the phenomenon to be established is the reason for another object,

original: sgrub pa'i chos grub na ma grub pa dang rgyu tha dad pa can dang gnyis su 'dod pa yin no //
analyzed: sgrub pa'i chos grub na ma grub pa dang rgyu tha dad pa can dang gnyis su 'dod pa yin no //
translated: then the established phenomenon and the unestablished phenomenon would be different causes, and one would assert that they are two.

original: de yang rang bzhin tha dad pa med par mi rung ste /
analyzed: de yang rang bzhin tha dad pa med par mi rung ste /
translated: Moreover, it is not suitable for them to be without a different nature.

original: 'di ltar grub pa'i ngo bo de grub kyang bsgrub par bya ba'i chos ma grub pa'am /
analyzed: 'di ltar grub pa'i ngo bo de grub kyang bsgrub par bya ba'i chos ma grub pa'am /
translated: Thus, even if the established nature is established, the phenomenon to be established would not be established.

original: rgyu tha dad pa can ni de'i rang bzhin du rigs pa ma yin te /
analyzed: rgyu tha dad pa can ni de'i rang bzhin du rigs pa ma yin te /
translated: Or, if they are different causes, it is not reasonable for them to be the same nature.

original: rtags sngar grub pa dang rgyu tha dad pa can gyi rang bzhin du rigs pa ma yin no //
analyzed: rtags sngar grub pa dang rgyu tha dad pa can gyi rang bzhin du rigs pa ma yin no //
translated: It is not reasonable for the nature of the established sign to be different from the cause.

original: 'di ltar dngos po rnams kyi tha dad pa ni 'di kho na yin te /
analyzed: 'di ltar dngos po rnams kyi tha dad pa ni 'di kho na yin te /
translated: Thus, the difference of things is just this.

original: chos 'gal ba gnas shing chos 'gal ba dang ldan pa yin te /
analyzed: chos 'gal ba gnas shing chos 'gal ba dang ldan pa yin te /
translated: and the contradictory properties are present in it, and it possesses contradictory properties.

original: grub pa 'dang ma grub pa dag ni 'dir chos 'gal ba dag yin no //
analyzed: grub pa 'dang ma grub pa dag ni 'dir chos 'gal ba dag yin no //
translated: Here, the established and the non-established are contradictory properties.

original: de bzhin du rgyu tha dad pa ni 'di kho @46a * //üîΩna yin te /
analyzed: de bzhin du rgyu tha dad pa ni 'di kho @46a * // na yin te /
translated: In the same way, the difference of cause is just this.

original: tha dad pa skyed par byed pa'i rgyu tha dad pa gang yin pa'o //
analyzed: tha dad pa skyed par byed pa'i rgyu tha dad pa gang yin pa'o //
translated: The difference of cause is that which produces the difference.

original: rgyu tha dad pa ni 'dir tshogs pa tha dad pa yin par blta bar bya ste /
analyzed: rgyu tha dad pa ni 'dir tshogs pa tha dad pa yin par blta bar bya ste /
translated: Here, the difference of cause should be regarded as the difference of assemblage.

original: 'dis ni tha dad pa'i rang gi ngo bo dang / tha dad pa'i rgyu yang bshad do //
analyzed: 'dis ni tha dad pa'i rang gi ngo bo dang / tha dad pa'i rgyu yang bshad do //
translated: This explains the difference of intrinsic nature and the difference of cause.

original: gal te chos 'gal ba gnas pa dang / rgyu tha dad pa de dag kyang tha dad par byed pa ma yin par 'dod na /
analyzed: gal te chos 'gal ba gnas pa dang / rgyu tha dad pa de dag kyang tha dad par byed pa ma yin par 'dod na /
translated: If you maintain that the presence of contradictory properties and the difference of cause are not the makers of difference,

original: de'i tshe dngos po gang yang don gang las kyang tha dad pa med pas 'gro ba ril rdzas gcig tu 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de'i tshe dngos po gang yang don gang las kyang tha dad pa med pas 'gro ba ril rdzas gcig tu 'gyur ro //
translated: then, since no entity is different from any object whatsoever, the entire world would be a single substance.

original: gal te yon tan gsum khyad par med pa'i phyir thams cad gcig pa nyid du 'dod pa kho na'o zhe na /
analyzed: gal te yon tan gsum khyad par med pa'i phyir thams cad gcig pa nyid du 'dod pa kho na'o zhe na /
translated: If you maintain that everything is just the same because the three properties are not different,

original: des na zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: des na zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: Therefore, etc.

original: des na zhes bya ba ni gcig pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: des na zhes bya ba ni gcig pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Therefore means because of being one.

original: lhan cig skye ba dang 'jig pa dag na /
analyzed: lhan cig skye ba dang 'jig pa dag na /
translated: If arising and destruction were simultaneous,

original: gcig skye na yang thams cad skye la /
analyzed: gcig skye na yang thams cad skye la /
translated: then when one thing arises, all would arise.üîΩAnd when one thing is destroyed, all would be destroyed.

original: 'jig na yang 'jig par 'gyur ro zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: 'jig na yang 'jig par 'gyur ro zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: This is the meaning of the passage.

original: 'bras bu thams cad la thams cad nye bar sbyar te /
analyzed: 'bras bu thams cad la thams cad nye bar sbyar te /
translated: All would be applied to all effects,

original: rgyu nyid du 'gyur ro//
analyzed: rgyu nyid du 'gyur ro//
translated: and all would be causes.

original: de lta ma yin na zhes bya ba ni lhan cig skye ba la sogs par khas mi len na thams cad gcig ces bya ba nyid du mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de lta ma yin na zhes bya ba ni lhan cig skye ba la sogs par khas mi len na thams cad gcig ces bya ba nyid du mi 'gyur ro //
translated: Otherwise, etc. means if one does not accept arising, etc. as simultaneous, then all would not be one.

original: 'on te nye bar sbyar ba la sogs pa'i bye brag gis phan tshun tha dad pa'i bdag nyid du 'dod na /
analyzed: 'on te nye bar sbyar ba la sogs pa'i bye brag gis phan tshun tha dad pa'i bdag nyid du 'dod na /
translated: But if one asserts that they are different in mutual dependence,

original: de'i tshe ming tha dad par 'gyur bar zad de /
analyzed: de'i tshe ming tha dad par 'gyur bar zad de /
translated: then they would be different in name.

original: mang po rnams la gcig ces ming du btags pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: mang po rnams la gcig ces ming du btags pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because many are designated by the name one.

original: ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why?

original: phan tshun tha dad pa'i don khas blangs nas /
analyzed: phan tshun tha dad pa'i don khas blangs nas /
translated: Because having accepted the meaning of mutual difference,

original: de skad du brjod pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: de skad du brjod pa'i phyir te /
translated: Because it is said to be one.

original: gcig ces brjod pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gcig ces brjod pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it is said to be one.

original: gzhan gyi rgyu don tha dad pa nyid med kyang zhes bya ba la sogs pa smras te /
analyzed: gzhan gyi rgyu don tha dad pa nyid med kyang zhes bya ba la sogs pa smras te /
translated: Although the cause of another is not a different object, etc.

original: khyed kyi gzhung lugs kyis mi rtag pa nyid kyi rgyu don tha dad pa nyid med cing 'jig pa'i rgyu la mi ltos pa nyid yin yang /
analyzed: khyed kyi gzhung lugs kyis mi rtag pa nyid kyi rgyu don tha dad pa nyid med cing 'jig pa'i rgyu la mi ltos pa nyid yin yang /
translated: Although the cause of impermanence is not a different object according to your system and does not rely on a cause of destruction,

original: dngos po'i dus na mi rtag pa nyid ma grub pa'i phyir dngos po yod pa'i dus na mi rtag pa de ma grub pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: dngos po'i dus na mi rtag pa nyid ma grub pa'i phyir dngos po yod pa'i dus na mi rtag pa de ma grub pa'i phyir te /
translated: impermanence is not established at the time of the thing because impermanence is not established at the time the thing exists.

original: dngos po'i 'og rol gyi dus su mi rtag pa nyid du 'gyur ro snyam du bsam pa yin no //
analyzed: dngos po'i 'og rol gyi dus su mi rtag pa nyid du 'gyur ro snyam du bsam pa yin no //
translated: It is thought that impermanence occurs at the time after the thing.üîΩIsn‚Äôt it similar that it is not its nature?

original: de'i rang bzhin ma yin par mtshungs pa ma yin nam zhes bya ba na ji ltar kho bo cag gi ltar na mi rtag pa nyid don gzhan la ltos pas byas pa'i ngo bo nyid ma yin pa de bzhin du rgyu med par smra ba khyed kyi ltar
analyzed: de'i rang bzhin ma yin par mtshungs pa ma yin nam zhes bya ba na ji ltar kho bo cag gi ltar na mi rtag pa nyid don gzhan la ltos pas byas pa'i ngo bo nyid ma yin pa de bzhin du rgyu med par smra ba khyed kyi ltar
translated: Just as for us impermanence is not created by relying on another object, in the same way, according to you, who advocate causelessness,

original: na yang / 'jig pa byas pa'i ngo bo nyid du mi 'gyur ro zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go /
analyzed: na yang / 'jig pa byas pa'i ngo bo nyid du mi 'gyur ro zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go /
translated: but it does not follow that it is by nature something that is destroyed.

original: @46b mi rtag pa nyid ces bya ba la sogs pas ni lan 'debs so //
analyzed: @46b mi rtag pa nyid ces bya ba la sogs pas ni lan 'debs so //
translated: He replies to this in the following:

original: skad cig mar gnas pa'i chos zhes bya ba ni skad cig mar gnas pa'i ngo bo nyid do //
analyzed: skad cig mar gnas pa'i chos zhes bya ba ni skad cig mar gnas pa'i ngo bo nyid do //
translated: The nature of a thing that endures for an instant is called ‚Äúmomentariness.‚Äù

original: gal te dngos po nyid mi rtag pa nyid yin na /
analyzed: gal te dngos po nyid mi rtag pa nyid yin na /
translated: If a thing itself is impermanence,

original: 'o na ji ltar chos can sgra'i chos mi rtag pa nyid ces tshig tha dad ce na /üîΩde'i phyir chos dang zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: 'o na ji ltar chos can sgra'i chos mi rtag pa nyid ces tshig tha dad ce na / de'i phyir chos dang zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: then why is the impermanence of sound stated as a property of the sound, which is the basis of the property?üîΩTherefore, he says, ‚ÄúThe expression of the property and the basis of the property as distinct things,‚Äù

original: chos dang chos can gyi tshig tha dad pa rjod par byed pa tha dad pa nyid gang yin pa de la yang rgyu mtshan 'og nas bshad par bya'o //
analyzed: chos dang chos can gyi tshig tha dad pa rjod par byed pa tha dad pa nyid gang yin pa de la yang rgyu mtshan 'og nas bshad par bya'o //
translated: and the reason for this will be explained later.

original: ji ste gal te dngos po nyid mi rtag pa nyid yin na /
analyzed: ji ste gal te dngos po nyid mi rtag pa nyid yin na /
translated: If a thing itself is impermanence,

original: dngos po mngon sum du byed pa na /
analyzed: dngos po mngon sum du byed pa na /
translated: then when a thing is perceived,

original: ci'i phyir de mngon sum du mi 'gyur /
analyzed: ci'i phyir de mngon sum du mi 'gyur /
translated: why is impermanence not perceived?

original: gang gis na rtags las go bar 'gyur zhe na /
analyzed: gang gis na rtags las go bar 'gyur zhe na /
translated: How is it understood from the reason?

original: bden te 'dzin pa kho na yin na dngos po 'di'i rang bzhin skad cig mar gnas pa'i chos de nyid mi rtag pa nyid ces bya ba de ni mthong ba bzhin du yang mngon sum du byas su zin kyang mi rtogs pa 'ba' zhig tu yang zad do
analyzed: bden te 'dzin pa kho na yin na dngos po 'di'i rang bzhin skad cig mar gnas pa'i chos de nyid mi rtag pa nyid ces bya ba de ni mthong ba bzhin du yang mngon sum du byas su zin kyang mi rtogs pa 'ba' zhig tu yang zad do
translated: It is true, but if it were apprehended, then the nature of this thing, the reality of momentary duration, would be called impermanence. Even though it is directly perceived, just like seeing, it is only not realized.

original: zhes bya ba 'di dang sbyar ro //
analyzed: zhes bya ba 'di dang sbyar ro //
translated: This is to be connected with the statement.

original: ci'i phyir dngos po'i rang bzhin skad cig mar gnas pa'i chos nyid yin zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir dngos po'i rang bzhin skad cig mar gnas pa'i chos nyid yin zhe na /
translated: Why is the nature of a thing the reality of momentary duration?

original: rang gi rgyu kho na las de ltar skye ba'i phyir zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: rang gi rgyu kho na las de ltar skye ba'i phyir zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: It is said that it arises in that way from its own cause alone.

original: dngos po'i rgyu kho na las skad cig mar gnas pa'i chos nyid du skye ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: dngos po'i rgyu kho na las skad cig mar gnas pa'i chos nyid du skye ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it arises as the reality of momentary duration from the cause of a thing alone.

original: gal te mthong bzhin du yang ci ste mi rtogs she na /üîΩblo zhan pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: gal te mthong bzhin du yang ci ste mi rtogs she na / blo zhan pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: If it is directly perceived, why is it not realized?üîΩIt is said that it is due to the weakness of the mind, etc.

original: gang la blo zhan cing g-yer bag med pa zhes tshig rnam par sbyar ro //
analyzed: gang la blo zhan cing g-yer bag med pa zhes tshig rnam par sbyar ro //
translated: The phrase ‚Äúweak mind‚Äù is to be connected with the statement.

original: rtag tu zhes bya ba'i sgra ni de ltar yod par dogs pas bslus pa zhes bya ba 'di dang sbyar te /üîΩdus res 'ga' ni yod pa dmigs pa yod pa nyams su myong ba'i rgyus rtag tu de ltar yod par dogs pas bslus te /
analyzed: rtag tu zhes bya ba'i sgra ni de ltar yod par dogs pas bslus pa zhes bya ba 'di dang sbyar te / dus res 'ga' ni yod pa dmigs pa yod pa nyams su myong ba'i rgyus rtag tu de ltar yod par dogs pas bslus te /
translated: The term ‚Äúalways‚Äù is connected with the term ‚Äúdeceived‚Äù by the phrase ‚Äúbecause of the apprehension of existence.‚ÄùüîΩBecause of the experience of the cause of the apprehension of existence, one is deceived by the apprehension of existence in that way.

original: 'di ni skad cig ma gcig la ji lta bu dmigs pa ltar dus thams cad du de kho na lta bu yin no zhes rtag tu de ltar yod par dogs shing gcig pa nyid du sgro 'dogs par byed pa'i 'khrul par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: 'di ni skad cig ma gcig la ji lta bu dmigs pa ltar dus thams cad du de kho na lta bu yin no zhes rtag tu de ltar yod par dogs shing gcig pa nyid du sgro 'dogs par byed pa'i 'khrul par 'gyur ro //
translated: One is deceived by the apprehension of existence in that way, and one superimposes identity by thinking, ‚ÄúJust as it is observed in one moment, it is just like that at all times.‚Äù

original: dogs pa zhes bya ba'i sgras 'dir 'khrul pa kho na la bya'i the tshom ni ma yin no //
analyzed: dogs pa zhes bya ba'i sgras 'dir 'khrul pa kho na la bya'i the tshom ni ma yin no //
translated: The term ‚Äúapprehension‚Äù here refers to error, not to doubt.

original: des bslus shing bri ba ni skad cig mar gnas pa'i chos nyid de mngon sum gyi tshad mas mthong bzhin du yang ji ltar nyams su myong ba mi rtogs shing nges par mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: des bslus shing bri ba ni skad cig mar gnas pa'i chos nyid de mngon sum gyi tshad mas mthong bzhin du yang ji ltar nyams su myong ba mi rtogs shing nges par mi 'gyur ro //
translated: Deceived by that, one does not understand and does not ascertain the reality of momentary abiding, even though one sees it with the valid knowledge of direct perception.

original: ma nges pa'i rgyu gnyis pa /
analyzed: ma nges pa'i rgyu gnyis pa /
translated: The second reason for non-ascertainment is:

original: 'dra ba gzhan 'byung bas @47a * //
analyzed: 'dra ba gzhan 'byung bas @47a * //
translated: Because of the arising of another similar to it,

original: bslus pas zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: bslus pas zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: it is deceived.

original: yang na skad cig ma dang po dang 'dra ba skad cig ma gnyis pa la sogs pa 'byung ba des bslus pas mthong bzhin du yang mi rtogs so zhes bya bar sbyar te /
analyzed: yang na skad cig ma dang po dang 'dra ba skad cig ma gnyis pa la sogs pa 'byung ba des bslus pas mthong bzhin du yang mi rtogs so zhes bya bar sbyar te /
translated: Or, because the second moment and so on arise similar to the first moment, it is deceived by that and does not realize it even though it sees it.

original: kha cig ni de skad du 'chad do //
analyzed: kha cig ni de skad du 'chad do //
translated: Some explain it in that way.

original: 'di ni 'dir bsam par bya ba yin te /
analyzed: 'di ni 'dir bsam par bya ba yin te /
translated: This is what should be contemplated here:

original: gal te dngos po'i rang bzhin yin pa'i phyir skad cig mar gnas pa'i chos nyid dngos po bzhin mngon sum pa yin na /
analyzed: gal te dngos po'i rang bzhin yin pa'i phyir skad cig mar gnas pa'i chos nyid dngos po bzhin mngon sum pa yin na /
translated: If the momentary intrinsic nature of things is directly perceived like the intrinsic nature of things,üîΩthen like the intrinsic nature of blue and so on, why is it not ascertained just as it is experienced?

original: sngon po la sogs pa'i rang gi ngo bo ltar de yang ji ltar myong ba bzhin ci'i phyir nges par mi 'gyur zhes de skad du brgal ba'i lan du rtag tu de ltar yod par dogs pas bslus pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba 'di bshad pa gzhan gyis
analyzed: sngon po la sogs pa'i rang gi ngo bo ltar de yang ji ltar myong ba bzhin ci'i phyir nges par mi 'gyur zhes de skad du brgal ba'i lan du rtag tu de ltar yod par dogs pas bslus pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba 'di bshad pa gzhan gyis
translated: In response to such an objection, this other explanation is given: Because it is deceived by the doubt that it always exists in that way.

original: gal te skad cig ma nyid mngon sum pa yin na /
analyzed: gal te skad cig ma nyid mngon sum pa yin na /
translated: If momentariness is directly perceived,

original: ci'i phyir rtag tu yod pa nyid du dogs par 'gyur /
analyzed: ci'i phyir rtag tu yod pa nyid du dogs par 'gyur /
translated: Why would there be the doubt that it is always existent?

original: nyams su myong ba'i shes pas gzung ba'i sngon po la ni ser por sgro 'dogs par byed pa'i 'khrul par mi 'gyur ro zhes 'di lta bu nyid rgol ba ma yin nam /
analyzed: nyams su myong ba'i shes pas gzung ba'i sngon po la ni ser por sgro 'dogs par byed pa'i 'khrul par mi 'gyur ro zhes 'di lta bu nyid rgol ba ma yin nam /
translated: ‚ÄúThe cognition that experiences the blue that is apprehended by perception does not become a delusion that superimposes yellow onto it.‚Äù Is this not the opponent‚Äôs position?

original: de ltar ni brgal ba gang yin pa de nyid lan du byas par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de ltar ni brgal ba gang yin pa de nyid lan du byas par 'gyur ro //
translated: If that is so, then the response would be the same as the objection.

original: de lta bas na rtag tu de ltar yod par sgro 'dogs par byed pa 'khrul pa de nyid kyi rgyu mtshan brjod dgos so //
analyzed: de lta bas na rtag tu de ltar yod par sgro 'dogs par byed pa 'khrul pa de nyid kyi rgyu mtshan brjod dgos so //
translated: Therefore you must state the reason why there is the delusion that superimposes the existence of the object in that way.

original: yod pa dmigs pas zhes rgyu bshad pa nyid ma yin nam zhe na /
analyzed: yod pa dmigs pas zhes rgyu bshad pa nyid ma yin nam zhe na /
translated: But isn‚Äôt the cause of that delusion explained to be the apprehension of existence?

original: de skad du ni bshad mod kyi rigs pa ni ma yin te /
analyzed: de skad du ni bshad mod kyi rigs pa ni ma yin te /
translated: Although that is explained, it is not reasonable.

original: 'di ltar dngos po skad cig ma nyams su myong ba nyid yod pa dmigs pa yin la de nyid la brten nas /
analyzed: 'di ltar dngos po skad cig ma nyams su myong ba nyid yod pa dmigs pa yin la de nyid la brten nas /
translated: In this way, the experience of momentary things is the apprehension of existence.

original: gzhan gyis gal te skad cig ma nyid mngon sum gyis bzung na /
analyzed: gzhan gyis gal te skad cig ma nyid mngon sum gyis bzung na /
translated: If another says that momentariness is apprehended by direct perception,

original: ci'i phyir de la phyin ci log tu rtogs zhes brgal ba dang / yod pa dmigs pas zhes de nyid gtan tshigs nyid du brjod de /
analyzed: ci'i phyir de la phyin ci log tu rtogs zhes brgal ba dang / yod pa dmigs pas zhes de nyid gtan tshigs nyid du brjod de /
translated: The meaning of the term ‚Äúexistence is observed‚Äù is that it is the reason itself.

original: brgal ba'i gtan tshigs gang yin pa de nyid lan gyi gtan tshigs su ni mi rung ngo //
analyzed: brgal ba'i gtan tshigs gang yin pa de nyid lan gyi gtan tshigs su ni mi rung ngo //
translated: It is not suitable for the reason that is the objection to be the reason that is the response.

original: 'on te skad cig ma snga ma dang 'dra bar skad cig ma gnyis pa la sogs pa'i yod pa gang yin pa de dmigs pas /
analyzed: 'on te skad cig ma snga ma dang 'dra bar skad cig ma gnyis pa la sogs pa'i yod pa gang yin pa de dmigs pas /
translated: If the existence of the second moment and so on is similar to the first moment, then the existence of the second moment and so on is observed.

original: 'di ni yod pa dmigs pa zhes bya ba'i sgra'i don yin te /
analyzed: 'di ni yod pa dmigs pa zhes bya ba'i sgra'i don yin te /
translated: This is the meaning of the term ‚Äúexistence is observed.‚Äù

original: des na 'di skad du skad cig ma dang po dang 'dra ba skad cig ma gnyis pa la sogs pa yod pa dmigs pa'i phyir /
analyzed: des na 'di skad du skad cig ma dang po dang 'dra ba skad cig ma gnyis pa la sogs pa yod pa dmigs pa'i phyir /
translated: Therefore this is saying that because the existence of the second moment and so on, which is similar to the first moment, is observed,

original: skad cig ma snga phyi dag gi bye brag dbye bar mi nus pas mi rtogs so zhes bshad pa yin no zhes bya bar 'dod na /
analyzed: skad cig ma snga phyi dag gi bye brag dbye bar mi nus pas mi rtogs so zhes bshad pa yin no zhes bya bar 'dod na /
translated: the difference between the earlier and later moments cannot be distinguished and therefore is not understood.

original: de yang shin tu rnar mi 'ong ba yin te /
analyzed: de yang shin tu rnar mi 'ong ba yin te /
translated: If that is asserted, that is also very unappealing.

original: 'dra ba gzhan 'byung bas bslus pa zhes bya ba 'dis 'di'i don bshad zin ba'i @47b phyir zlos par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: 'dra ba gzhan 'byung bas bslus pa zhes bya ba 'dis 'di'i don bshad zin ba'i @47b phyir zlos par 'gyur ro //
translated: ‚ÄúDeceived by the appearance of something similar‚Äù repeats the meaning of what has already been explained.

original: gzhan yang bslus pa'i rgyu 'di nyid la khyad par ci zhig yod pa 'di yang brjod dgos so //
analyzed: gzhan yang bslus pa'i rgyu 'di nyid la khyad par ci zhig yod pa 'di yang brjod dgos so //
translated: Moreover, it must be explained what the difference is between this cause of deception and the previous one.

original: 'di ltar yod pa dmigs pa na yang skad cig ma 'dra ba gzhan 'byung ba yod la /
analyzed: 'di ltar yod pa dmigs pa na yang skad cig ma 'dra ba gzhan 'byung ba yod la /
translated: In this way, when existence is perceived, there is the appearance of another similar instant.

original: skad cig ma gcig kho na la yod pa dmigs pa gang yin pa de ni 'dir brjod par 'dod pa ma yin te /
analyzed: skad cig ma gcig kho na la yod pa dmigs pa gang yin pa de ni 'dir brjod par 'dod pa ma yin te /
translated: But the existence that is perceived in just one instant is not what is intended here.

original: 'di ni tshu rol mthong ba'i tha snyad du btub par rung ba ma yin pa'i phyir dang / mi srid pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'di ni tshu rol mthong ba'i tha snyad du btub par rung ba ma yin pa'i phyir dang / mi srid pa'i phyir ro //
translated: This is because it is not suitable to be a convention that is perceived by those with limited vision, and because it is impossible.

original: yod pa de lta bu dmigs pa ni 'khrul pa'i rgyu mtshan yang ma yin no //
analyzed: yod pa de lta bu dmigs pa ni 'khrul pa'i rgyu mtshan yang ma yin no //
translated: Such a perception of existence is not even a cause of error.

original: 'on kyang 'dir ni rgyun chags pa'i dmigs pa kho na brjod par 'dod de /
analyzed: 'on kyang 'dir ni rgyun chags pa'i dmigs pa kho na brjod par 'dod de /
translated: However, here it is only the perception of a continuum that is intended.

original: de la ni 'dra ba gzhan 'byung ba yod pa kho na'o //
analyzed: de la ni 'dra ba gzhan 'byung ba yod pa kho na'o //
translated: And in that case, the appearance of another similar instant does exist.

original: de bzhin du 'dra ba gzhan 'byung ba na yang dmigs pa yod de /
analyzed: de bzhin du 'dra ba gzhan 'byung ba na yang dmigs pa yod de /
translated: Likewise, when another similar one arises, there is an observation of it.

original: 'dra ba gzhan 'byung ba mi dmigs pa ni 'khrul pa'i rgyu ma yin te /
analyzed: 'dra ba gzhan 'byung ba mi dmigs pa ni 'khrul pa'i rgyu ma yin te /
translated: The non-observation of the arising of another similar one is not a cause of error,

original: rtag tu thams cad 'khrul par thal bar 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rtag tu thams cad 'khrul par thal bar 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
translated: because it would follow that there would always be error in all cases.

original: de lta bas na phyogs 'di gnyis la khyad par 'ga' yang med do //
analyzed: de lta bas na phyogs 'di gnyis la khyad par 'ga' yang med do //
translated: Therefore, there is no difference at all between these two positions.

original: 'di la kha cig snga ma la ni yod pa dmigs pa bshad do //
analyzed: 'di la kha cig snga ma la ni yod pa dmigs pa bshad do //
translated: In this regard, some explain the difference as follows: In the first case, the observation of an existent is explained.

original: gnyis pa la ni 'dra ba gzhan 'byung ba dmigs pa'o zhes khyad par 'chad par byed do //
analyzed: gnyis pa la ni 'dra ba gzhan 'byung ba dmigs pa'o zhes khyad par 'chad par byed do //
translated: In the second case, the observation of the arising of another similar one is explained.

original: de yang rigs pa ma yin te /
analyzed: de yang rigs pa ma yin te /
translated: But that is illogical,

original: yod pa dmigs pa yang ji skad bshad pa'i tshul gyis 'dra ba gzhan 'byung ba dmigs pa yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: yod pa dmigs pa yang ji skad bshad pa'i tshul gyis 'dra ba gzhan 'byung ba dmigs pa yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because the observation of an existent is also the observation of the arising of another similar one, in the manner that has been explained.

original: gzhan dag na re yod pa dmigs pa na yang 'dra ba gzhan 'byung ba yod kyang brjod par mi 'dod la /
analyzed: gzhan dag na re yod pa dmigs pa na yang 'dra ba gzhan 'byung ba yod kyang brjod par mi 'dod la /
translated: Others say: Even when the observation of an existent is made, the arising of another similar one exists, but it is not asserted.

original: 'dra ba gzhan skye ba na yang yod pa dmigs pa yod kyang brjod par mi 'dod do zhes zer ro //
analyzed: 'dra ba gzhan skye ba na yang yod pa dmigs pa yod kyang brjod par mi 'dod do zhes zer ro //
translated: Even when another similar one arises, it is observed to exist, but it is not asserted.

original: de yang yang dag pa ma yin te /
analyzed: de yang yang dag pa ma yin te /
translated: That is also not correct.

original: yod pa dmigs pa la 'dra ba gzhan 'byung ba brjod par mi 'dod na 'khrul ba'i rgyu mtshan nyid ma bsnyad par 'gyur la /
analyzed: yod pa dmigs pa la 'dra ba gzhan 'byung ba brjod par mi 'dod na 'khrul ba'i rgyu mtshan nyid ma bsnyad par 'gyur la /
translated: If it is not asserted that another similar one arises when it is observed to exist, then the reason for error would not be explained.

original: 'dra ba gzhan 'byung ba yang dmigs pa med na 'khrul pa'i rgyu mtshan nyid du mi 'gyur ba'i phyir de dag brjod par mi 'dod pa ni rigs pa ma yin no //
analyzed: 'dra ba gzhan 'byung ba yang dmigs pa med na 'khrul pa'i rgyu mtshan nyid du mi 'gyur ba'i phyir de dag brjod par mi 'dod pa ni rigs pa ma yin no //
translated: And if the arising of another similar one is not observed, it would not be the reason for error. Therefore it is not reasonable not to assert them.

original: de lta bas na gzhan du rnam par bshad par bya ste /
analyzed: de lta bas na gzhan du rnam par bshad par bya ste /
translated: Therefore, it should be explained differently.

original: 'khrul pa'i rgyu mtshan dang pos ni mu stegs can rnams kyi 'khrul pa'i rgyu mtshan lta ba ngan pa la mngon par zhen pa'i bag chags kyi sa bon nang na yod pa bstan to //
analyzed: 'khrul pa'i rgyu mtshan dang pos ni mu stegs can rnams kyi 'khrul pa'i rgyu mtshan lta ba ngan pa la mngon par zhen pa'i bag chags kyi sa bon nang na yod pa bstan to //
translated: The first reason for error shows the seed of the latent tendency of non-Buddhists' attachment to bad views.

original: 'di la tshig gi don ni 'di yin te /
analyzed: 'di la tshig gi don ni 'di yin te /
translated: Here is the meaning of the words.

original: rtag tu de ltar yod par dogs pas bslus pa zhes bya ba ni skad cig ma ma yin pa nyid du mngon par zhen pa'i 'khrul pas @48a * //üîΩbslus pa zhes bya ba'i don te /
analyzed: rtag tu de ltar yod par dogs pas bslus pa zhes bya ba ni skad cig ma ma yin pa nyid du mngon par zhen pa'i 'khrul pas @48a * // bslus pa zhes bya ba'i don te /
translated: The meaning of ‚Äúdeceived by the doubt that it always exists in that way‚Äù is that one is deceived by the error of conceiving it to be nonmomentary.

original: skad cig ma ma yin par smra ba skad cig ma ma yin par mngon par zhen pa'i phyir mthong bzhin du yang mi rtogs so zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: skad cig ma ma yin par smra ba skad cig ma ma yin par mngon par zhen pa'i phyir mthong bzhin du yang mi rtogs so zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: The meaning of ‚Äúdeceived‚Äù is that because the proponents of nonmomentariness conceive of it as nonmomentary, they do not understand it even though they see it.

original: gal te rtag tu de ltar yod par dogs pas bslus pa nyid du yang ji ltar 'gyur zhe na /
analyzed: gal te rtag tu de ltar yod par dogs pas bslus pa nyid du yang ji ltar 'gyur zhe na /
translated: If one is deceived by the doubt that it always exists in that way, how could it be?

original: yod par mi dmigs pas zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: yod par mi dmigs pas zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: The root text states, ‚Äúbecause it is not observed to exist.‚Äù

original: dmigs pa zhes bya ba'i sgra ni lhag pa ste /
analyzed: dmigs pa zhes bya ba'i sgra ni lhag pa ste /
translated: The term ‚Äúobserved‚Äù is an ellipsis.

original: skad cig ma ji ltar gnas pa bzhin yod pa las lhag par skad cig ma ma yin pa nyid la sogs pa'i rnam par dmigs par byed /
analyzed: skad cig ma ji ltar gnas pa bzhin yod pa las lhag par skad cig ma ma yin pa nyid la sogs pa'i rnam par dmigs par byed /
translated: It is observed, or apprehended, as nonmomentary and so on, in a way that exceeds how it exists as momentary.

original: 'dzin par byed pas yod pa dmigs pa ni skad cig ma ma yin pa nyid la sogs pa 'khrul pa'i sa bon yin te /
analyzed: 'dzin par byed pas yod pa dmigs pa ni skad cig ma ma yin pa nyid la sogs pa 'khrul pa'i sa bon yin te /
translated: The observation of its existence is the seed of the error of conceiving it to be nonmomentary and so on.

original: de'i dbang gis de ltar 'khrul pa 'byung ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de'i dbang gis de ltar 'khrul pa 'byung ba'i phyir ro //
translated: because of the power of that, the error occurs in that way.

original: 'di skad du thog ma med pa nas lta ba ngan pa la mngon par zhen pa'i sa bon nang na yod pas bskyed pa skad cig ma ma yin pa nyid du 'khrul pa gang yin pa des bslus pas mi rtogs so zhes bshad pa yin no //
analyzed: 'di skad du thog ma med pa nas lta ba ngan pa la mngon par zhen pa'i sa bon nang na yod pas bskyed pa skad cig ma ma yin pa nyid du 'khrul pa gang yin pa des bslus pas mi rtogs so zhes bshad pa yin no //
translated: In this way, it is explained: ‚ÄúThe seed of the bad views that have been adhered to since beginningless time exists internally, and the error of non-momentariness is generated by that. Because of being deceived by that, it is not realized.‚Äù

original: 'khrul pa'i sa bon nang na lta yod du zad mod /
analyzed: 'khrul pa'i sa bon nang na lta yod du zad mod /
translated: It is just that the seed of error exists internally.

original: nyams su myong ba'i shes pa de nyid kyis ji ltar gzung ba'i rnam pa go ci'i phyir nges par mi byed ce na /
analyzed: nyams su myong ba'i shes pa de nyid kyis ji ltar gzung ba'i rnam pa go ci'i phyir nges par mi byed ce na /
translated: Why does the consciousness that experiences it not ascertain the aspect that is apprehended?

original: blo zhan pa zhes bya ba smos so //
analyzed: blo zhan pa zhes bya ba smos so //
translated: He says, ‚Äúbecause of the weakness of the mind.‚Äù

original: skad cig ma ma yin par lta ba la mngon par zhen pa rnams ni bstan bcos ngan pa'i lta ba la goms par byed pa'i phyir /
analyzed: skad cig ma ma yin par lta ba la mngon par zhen pa rnams ni bstan bcos ngan pa'i lta ba la goms par byed pa'i phyir /
translated: Those who adhere to the view of non-momentariness are accustomed to the views of bad treatises.

original: nang gi nyes bas skad cig ma nyid mthong ba yang ji lta ba bzhin gtan la mi phebs grang na /
analyzed: nang gi nyes bas skad cig ma nyid mthong ba yang ji lta ba bzhin gtan la mi phebs grang na /
translated: Because of internal faults, even though they see momentariness, they do not ascertain it as it is.

original: sangs rgyas pa rigs pa dang lung dag gis skad cig ma nyid du gtan la phebs pa rnams la go ji ste mngon sum gyi stobs kho nas skad cig ma nyid du nges pa mi skye ste /
analyzed: sangs rgyas pa rigs pa dang lung dag gis skad cig ma nyid du gtan la phebs pa rnams la go ji ste mngon sum gyi stobs kho nas skad cig ma nyid du nges pa mi skye ste /
translated: They do not ascertain that things are momentary by the power of direct perception alone.

original: de dag la bstan bcos ngan pa la mngon par zhen pa ni med do zhe na /
analyzed: de dag la bstan bcos ngan pa la mngon par zhen pa ni med do zhe na /
translated: But they do not cling to bad treatises.

original: de'i phyir 'dra ba gzhan 'byung bas bslus pas zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: de'i phyir 'dra ba gzhan 'byung bas bslus pas zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: Therefore it says, ‚ÄúThey are deceived by the arising of other similar ones.‚Äù

original: de'i 'khrul pa'i rgyu spyi yin no //
analyzed: de'i 'khrul pa'i rgyu spyi yin no //
translated: The cause of their error is a universal.

original: yang ji skad bshad pa'i 'khrul pa'i rgyus mthong bzhin du yang mi rtogs kyi dngos po nyid skad cig ma ma yin pa'i phyir ni ma yin no zhes bya ba 'di ji ltar shes she na /
analyzed: yang ji skad bshad pa'i 'khrul pa'i rgyus mthong bzhin du yang mi rtogs kyi dngos po nyid skad cig ma ma yin pa'i phyir ni ma yin no zhes bya ba 'di ji ltar shes she na /
translated: How do we know that they do not understand that things are momentary because of the cause of error as it has been explained, but that it is because things themselves are not momentary?

original: de'i phyir skad cig ma tha ma zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: de'i phyir skad cig ma tha ma zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: Therefore it says, ‚ÄúThe final moment,‚Äù and so on.

original: skad cig ma 'dra ba gzhan dang mtshams mi sbyor ba'i skad cig ma ni skad cig ma tha ma ste /
analyzed: skad cig ma 'dra ba gzhan dang mtshams mi sbyor ba'i skad cig ma ni skad cig ma tha ma ste /
translated: The final moment is the moment that does not link to another similar moment.

original: de mthong ba rnams la zhig go zhes bya bar nges pa'i phyir /
analyzed: de mthong ba rnams la zhig go zhes bya bar nges pa'i phyir /
translated: Because those who see it ascertain that it has disintegrated.

original: 'di ni sngar yang skad cig re re kho na la 'jig ste /
analyzed: 'di ni sngar yang skad cig re re kho na la 'jig ste /
translated: It is understood that it disintegrates in every moment, as previously explained,

original: ji skad bshad pa'i @48b bslus pa'i rgyus gtan tshigs la mi phebs pa 'ba' zhig tu zad do zhes bya bar rtogs so //
analyzed: ji skad bshad pa'i @48b bslus pa'i rgyus gtan tshigs la mi phebs pa 'ba' zhig tu zad do zhes bya bar rtogs so //
translated: because it is not established by the reason of the cause of deception.

original: gal te skad cig ma ma yin par gyur na ni phyis kyang 'gyur ba kho na ste khyad par med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gal te skad cig ma ma yin par gyur na ni phyis kyang 'gyur ba kho na ste khyad par med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: If it were not momentary, it would not disintegrate later, because there would be no difference.

original: 'jig pa'i rgyu ni mi rung ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'jig pa'i rgyu ni mi rung ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Because the cause of disintegration is not tenable.

original: skad cig ma tha ma mthong ba na yang ji ltar 'jig pa'i dad can nyid du nges te /
analyzed: skad cig ma tha ma mthong ba na yang ji ltar 'jig pa'i dad can nyid du nges te /
translated: When the final moment is seen, how is it ascertained that it definitely disintegrates?

original: 'di ltar de'i tshe yang yod pa dmigs pa ni yod de /
analyzed: 'di ltar de'i tshe yang yod pa dmigs pa ni yod de /
translated: Because at that time, it is still observed to exist.

original: yod pa nyid dmigs na de med par rtogs pa ni ma yin no zhe na /
analyzed: yod pa nyid dmigs na de med par rtogs pa ni ma yin no zhe na /
translated: When existence is observed, it is not realized that it does not exist.

original: phyis zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: phyis zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: Later, etc.

original: skad cig ma tha ma mthong ba tsam gyis nges par 'gyur ro zhes ni mi smra'o //
analyzed: skad cig ma tha ma mthong ba tsam gyis nges par 'gyur ro zhes ni mi smra'o //
translated: It is not said that it is ascertained merely by seeing the final moment.

original: 'on kyang skad cig ma tha ma mthong nas /
analyzed: 'on kyang skad cig ma tha ma mthong nas /
translated: However, after seeing the last moment,

original: phyis rgyun chad pa na /
analyzed: phyis rgyun chad pa na /
translated: if the continuum is later interrupted,

original: 'di zhes bya ba skad cig ma gzhan dang mtshams mi sbyor ba'i bum pa la sogs pa mi dmigs pas zhes bya ba de dang mi 'dra ba'i dngos po gzhan dmigs pas dang / mi gnas pa rtogs pa'i phyir de'i tshe 'di zhig go zhes bya bar nges pa'i dus yin pas /
analyzed: 'di zhes bya ba skad cig ma gzhan dang mtshams mi sbyor ba'i bum pa la sogs pa mi dmigs pas zhes bya ba de dang mi 'dra ba'i dngos po gzhan dmigs pas dang / mi gnas pa rtogs pa'i phyir de'i tshe 'di zhig go zhes bya bar nges pa'i dus yin pas /
translated: then it is not similar to the statement, ‚ÄúThe vase, etc. are not apprehended because they do not connect with another moment called this,‚Äù because another thing that is not similar to that is apprehended, and because non-endurance is realized.üîΩTherefore, at that time, it is the time of ascertaining that this has perished.

original: nges pa'i dus de nyid na de mngon sum gyi stobs kyis mi rtag pa nyid du rnam par gzhag ste /
analyzed: nges pa'i dus de nyid na de mngon sum gyi stobs kyis mi rtag pa nyid du rnam par gzhag ste /
translated: At that very time of ascertainment, impermanence is established by the power of direct perception,

original: rjes su dpag pas ni sngar yang rnam par gzhag pa nyid do //
analyzed: rjes su dpag pas ni sngar yang rnam par gzhag pa nyid do //
translated: and it is also established by inference previously.

original: dpe yang 'bras bu bskyed pa'i zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: dpe yang 'bras bu bskyed pa'i zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: An example is stated: ‚ÄúThe ability to produce an effect, etc.‚Äù

original: 'bras bu bskyed pa'i nus pa ni 'bras bu bskyed pa'i nus pa'o //
analyzed: 'bras bu bskyed pa'i nus pa ni 'bras bu bskyed pa'i nus pa'o //
translated: The ability to produce an effect is the ability to produce an effect.

original: de ni rgyu'i ngo bo nyid yin yang yin te /
analyzed: de ni rgyu'i ngo bo nyid yin yang yin te /
translated: That is the intrinsic reality of the cause, but it is also the ability.

original: nus pa ni rgyu las tha dad pa ma yin no //
analyzed: nus pa ni rgyu las tha dad pa ma yin no //
translated: The ability is not different from the cause.

original: des na rgyu gzung ba na de gzung ba kho na'o snyam du bsam pa yin no //üîΩ'on kyang de'i 'bras bu ma mthong ba zhes bya ba mi gang gis rgyu de'i 'bras bu ma mthong ba rgyu mthong du zin kyang de'i ngo bo ma rtogs pas /
analyzed: des na rgyu gzung ba na de gzung ba kho na'o snyam du bsam pa yin no // 'on kyang de'i 'bras bu ma mthong ba zhes bya ba mi gang gis rgyu de'i 'bras bu ma mthong ba rgyu mthong du zin kyang de'i ngo bo ma rtogs pas /
translated: Therefore, when the cause is perceived, the person thinks, ‚ÄúIt is perceived.‚ÄùüîΩBut the effect is not seen, that is, the person does not see the effect of the cause.üîΩEven though the cause is seen, the person does not understand its nature, that is, he does not understand the nature of its potentiality.

original: nus pa'i rang gi ngo bo ma rtogs pa'i mi des phyis gang gi tshe rgyu de las 'bras bu byung ba de'i tshe /
analyzed: nus pa'i rang gi ngo bo ma rtogs pa'i mi des phyis gang gi tshe rgyu de las 'bras bu byung ba de'i tshe /
translated: Later, when the effect arises from that cause,

original: 'bras bu mthong bas rtogs pa bzhin te /
analyzed: 'bras bu mthong bas rtogs pa bzhin te /
translated: the effect is seen and the person understands it.

original: rgyu'i nus pa rtogs pa bzhin no //
analyzed: rgyu'i nus pa rtogs pa bzhin no //
translated: In the same way, the potentiality of the cause is understood.

original: de lta bas na byas pa grub pa'i dus na /
analyzed: de lta bas na byas pa grub pa'i dus na /
translated: Therefore, when the effect is established,

original: byas pa'i rgyu kho na las byas pa'i bdag nyid du gyur pa mi rtag pa nyid grub po zhes bya ba de ltar 'dod par bya'o //
analyzed: byas pa'i rgyu kho na las byas pa'i bdag nyid du gyur pa mi rtag pa nyid grub po zhes bya ba de ltar 'dod par bya'o //
translated: the impermanence that is the nature of the effect is established as arising from the cause of the effect alone.

original: de lta ma yin na gzhan gyi rgyu mtshan can nyid yin nam zhes bya ba ni yod pa'i rgyu las gzhan pa'i rgyu de'i rgyu mtshan can yin yang rung ba'o //
analyzed: de lta ma yin na gzhan gyi rgyu mtshan can nyid yin nam zhes bya ba ni yod pa'i rgyu las gzhan pa'i rgyu de'i rgyu mtshan can yin yang rung ba'o //
translated: Otherwise, it would be dependent on another cause, that is, it would be dependent on a cause other than the cause of the existent.

original: rgyu mtshan med pa can nyid yin yang rung zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: rgyu mtshan med pa can nyid yin yang rung zhes bya ba ni /
translated: Or, it is causeless.

original: rgyu la mi ltos pa kho nar mi rtag pa nyid du 'gyur ba yang rung ba ste /üîΩde ni kha cig gi gzhung lugs kyis dus gzhan na'o zhes 'byung ba de @49a * //
analyzed: rgyu la mi ltos pa kho nar mi rtag pa nyid du 'gyur ba yang rung ba ste / de ni kha cig gi gzhung lugs kyis dus gzhan na'o zhes 'byung ba de @49a * //
translated: It would be impermanent without depending on a cause.

original: dag gi lta bas 'di bshad do //
analyzed: dag gi lta bas 'di bshad do //
translated: This is explained from the perspective of those who maintain in their system that it is at another time.

original: mi rtag pa nyid don gzhan kho nar 'gyur ro zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: mi rtag pa nyid don gzhan kho nar 'gyur ro zhes bya ba ni /
translated: Impermanence would be a different object.

original: chos don gzhan gyi rgyu mtshan can yin par gyur na de bzhin nyid ces bya bas don 'di bshad zin pa nyid de /
analyzed: chos don gzhan gyi rgyu mtshan can yin par gyur na de bzhin nyid ces bya bas don 'di bshad zin pa nyid de /
translated: If impermanence were the cause of another object, it would be just as explained in the statement ‚Äúsuchness.‚Äù

original: nyes pa gzhan brjod pa'i phyir yang nye bar bkod do //
analyzed: nyes pa gzhan brjod pa'i phyir yang nye bar bkod do //
translated: Another fault is stated in order to demonstrate that.

original: de lta na ni zhes bya ba ni mi rtag pa nyid don gzhan yin na'o //
analyzed: de lta na ni zhes bya ba ni mi rtag pa nyid don gzhan yin na'o //
translated: ‚ÄúIn that case‚Äù means if impermanence were a different object.

original: dngos po de dang ldan par mi rtag pa nyid dang ldan par mi 'gyur te 'brel pa med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: dngos po de dang ldan par mi rtag pa nyid dang ldan par mi 'gyur te 'brel pa med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: That thing would not possess impermanence, because there would be no connection.

original: de nyid bsnyad pa'i phyir de la mi dgos pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: de nyid bsnyad pa'i phyir de la mi dgos pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: In order to explain that, he says, ‚Äúbecause it is not necessary for that.‚Äù

original: dngos po de la mi rtag pa nyid dam /üîΩde la dngos po mi dgos pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: dngos po de la mi rtag pa nyid dam / de la dngos po mi dgos pa'i phyir te /
translated: Impermanence does not depend on things,üîΩbecause it has no purpose.

original: phan par byed pa med pa'i phyir ro //üîΩ'on te 'brel pa grub par bya ba'i phyir /
analyzed: phan par byed pa med pa'i phyir ro // 'on te 'brel pa grub par bya ba'i phyir /
translated: It has no purpose because it does not benefit anything.üîΩIf you accept that things are impermanent

original: dngos po la mi rtag pa nyid kyis byas pa'i dgos pa ngang gis 'jig pa nyid kyi mtshan nyid khas len na /
analyzed: dngos po la mi rtag pa nyid kyis byas pa'i dgos pa ngang gis 'jig pa nyid kyi mtshan nyid khas len na /
translated: because they are produced by impermanence,

original: de'i tshe dngos po'i rang gi bdag nyid du gyur par 'dod par bya ste /
analyzed: de'i tshe dngos po'i rang gi bdag nyid du gyur par 'dod par bya ste /
translated: then you must accept that impermanence is the intrinsic reality of things.

original: gzhan du na de la yang 'brel par mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gzhan du na de la yang 'brel par mi 'gyur ro //
translated: Otherwise, it would not be related to them.

original: mi rtag pa nyid kyis byas pa'i dgos pa ji skad bshad pa khas len pa de'i tshe yang dgos pa de nyid dngos po'i rang gi bdag nyid du gyur ba'i mi rtag pa nyid yin pas /
analyzed: mi rtag pa nyid kyis byas pa'i dgos pa ji skad bshad pa khas len pa de'i tshe yang dgos pa de nyid dngos po'i rang gi bdag nyid du gyur ba'i mi rtag pa nyid yin pas /
translated: If you accept that things are impermanent because they are produced by impermanence, as explained above, then impermanence is the intrinsic reality of things.

original: don gzhan du gyur ba'i mi rtag pa nyid gzhan gyis ci zhig bya ste /
analyzed: don gzhan du gyur ba'i mi rtag pa nyid gzhan gyis ci zhig bya ste /
translated: What purpose is served by another impermanence that is a different object?

original: gal te mi rtag pa nyid las ngang gis 'jig pa'i ngo bo nyid 'byung bar khas len na /
analyzed: gal te mi rtag pa nyid las ngang gis 'jig pa'i ngo bo nyid 'byung bar khas len na /
translated: If you accept that the intrinsic reality of things is produced by impermanence,üîΩthen what purpose is served by another impermanence?

original: rang gi rgyu kho na las de ltar 'byung du zad mod /
analyzed: rang gi rgyu kho na las de ltar 'byung du zad mod /
translated: It is simply the case that it arises in that way from its own cause alone.

original: mi rtag pa nyid ni don med do zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: mi rtag pa nyid ni don med do zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: Impermanence is pointless.

original: gzhan yang dngos po rang bzhin gyis g-yo ba'am mi g-yo ba zhig yin grang na /
analyzed: gzhan yang dngos po rang bzhin gyis g-yo ba'am mi g-yo ba zhig yin grang na /
translated: Moreover, is a thing by nature moving or not moving?

original: phyogs dang po la ni mi rtag pa nyid don med do //üîΩgnyis pa la yang rang bzhin gyis mi g-yo ba ni don gzhan mi rtag pa nyid dang ldan yang /
analyzed: phyogs dang po la ni mi rtag pa nyid don med do // gnyis pa la yang rang bzhin gyis mi g-yo ba ni don gzhan mi rtag pa nyid dang ldan yang /
translated: In the first case, impermanence is pointless.

original: de'i ngo bor mi 'thad pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: de'i ngo bor mi 'thad pa'i phyir te /
translated: In the second case, that which is by nature not moving is not tenable as having a different impermanence.

original: mi rtag pa'i ngo bo nyid du mi 'thad pa'i phyir /
analyzed: mi rtag pa'i ngo bo nyid du mi 'thad pa'i phyir /
translated: Because it is not tenable that it has the nature of impermanence.

original: mi rtag pa nyid don med do //üîΩbsgrub par bya ba'i chos sgrub par 'dod pa mi rtag pa nyid ces bya ba'am /üîΩsdug bsngal nyid la sogs pa chos gzhan de yang don gzhan las 'byung ba na rtags gang gis de bsgrub par bya ba de'i rgyu yin pa'am /
analyzed: mi rtag pa nyid don med do // bsgrub par bya ba'i chos sgrub par 'dod pa mi rtag pa nyid ces bya ba'am / sdug bsngal nyid la sogs pa chos gzhan de yang don gzhan las 'byung ba na rtags gang gis de bsgrub par bya ba de'i rgyu yin pa'am /
translated: Impermanence is pointless.

original: 'bras bu nyid yin pa zhig tu 'gyur grang ste /
analyzed: 'bras bu nyid yin pa zhig tu 'gyur grang ste /
translated: If the property to be established, called ‚Äúimpermanence,‚Äù or another property such as ‚Äúsuffering,‚Äù arises from another object, then by what reason is it established as the cause of that or as the effect of that?

original: nga'am zhes bya ba'i sgras ni rgyu dang 'bras bu yin pa'am zhes bsdu ba yin no //
analyzed: nga'am zhes bya ba'i sgras ni rgyu dang 'bras bu yin pa'am zhes bsdu ba yin no //
translated: The words ‚ÄúI‚Äù or ‚Äúit‚Äù in the root text include the terms ‚Äúcause‚Äù and ‚Äúeffect.‚Äù

original: de la rnam par brtag pa gsum la skyon rgyu dang 'bras bu ma yin pa ni @49b zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos so //
analyzed: de la rnam par brtag pa gsum la skyon rgyu dang 'bras bu ma yin pa ni @49b zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos so //
translated: With regard to that, the error in the three alternatives is stated in the lines: ‚ÄúIf it is not a cause or effect, etc.‚Äù

original: yang na rgyu'am 'bras bu zhig yin grang zhes rnam par brtag pa gnyis byas pa la /
analyzed: yang na rgyu'am 'bras bu zhig yin grang zhes rnam par brtag pa gnyis byas pa la /
translated: Or, the error in the two alternatives is stated in the lines: ‚ÄúIf it is a cause or effect.‚Äù

original: gzhan rnam par brtag pa gsum pa rgyu dang 'bras bu ma yin pa yang ji ste dgos par ma byas zhes smra na /
analyzed: gzhan rnam par brtag pa gsum pa rgyu dang 'bras bu ma yin pa yang ji ste dgos par ma byas zhes smra na /
translated: If you say that the third alternative, ‚ÄúIt is neither a cause nor an effect,‚Äù is not needed,

original: de'i phyir rgyu dang 'bras bu ma yin pa ni zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te ;
analyzed: de'i phyir rgyu dang 'bras bu ma yin pa ni zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te ;
