translated: then the response is: ‚ÄúIf it is neither a cause nor an effect, etc.‚Äù

original: shin tu rnar mi 'ong ba'i phyir phyogs de ni dogs par ma byas te /
analyzed: shin tu rnar mi 'ong ba'i phyir phyogs de ni dogs par ma byas te /
translated: We do not consider that position because it is so absurd.

original: de ni bsdus pa'i don yin no rgyu yang ma yin la 'bras bu yang ma yin pa ni bsgrub par bya ba'i rtags dang 'brel pa med pa'i phyir de la rtags dang ldan pa'i chos can de la bsgrub par bya ba'i chos de yod par rjes su dpag
analyzed: de ni bsdus pa'i don yin no rgyu yang ma yin la 'bras bu yang ma yin pa ni bsgrub par bya ba'i rtags dang 'brel pa med pa'i phyir de la rtags dang ldan pa'i chos can de la bsgrub par bya ba'i chos de yod par rjes su dpag
translated: This is the summary meaning.üîΩThat which is neither a cause nor an effect is not related to the evidence, because the evidence is not present in the subject that possesses the evidence.

original: par te / yod pa nyid du rjes su dpag par mi srid pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: par te / yod pa nyid du rjes su dpag par mi srid pa'i phyir ro //
translated: It is impossible to infer that the property to be established exists there, that is, it is impossible to infer that it exists.

original: phyogs gsum pa bstsal na rnam par brtag pa nyid gnas te de la yang mi rung bar bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: phyogs gsum pa bstsal na rnam par brtag pa nyid gnas te de la yang mi rung bar bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: If a third alternative is proposed, the analysis itself remains, and it is shown that that also is not tenable.

original: de la zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos so //
analyzed: de la zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos so //
translated: To that end, he says,

original: byas pa'i ngo bo nyid pas don gzhan gyi rgyu mtshan can gyi chos phyis 'byung ba'i phyir byas pa sngar grub pa'i rgyu nyid yin no //
analyzed: byas pa'i ngo bo nyid pas don gzhan gyi rgyu mtshan can gyi chos phyis 'byung ba'i phyir byas pa sngar grub pa'i rgyu nyid yin no //
translated: Since the property of being a product is a property that occurs later, having a different object as its reason, the property of being a product is the cause of the prior establishment.

original: phyis 'byung ba de 'bras bu yin par khas len na yang ga la nges te /
analyzed: phyis 'byung ba de 'bras bu yin par khas len na yang ga la nges te /
translated: Even if one accepts that the later occurrence is the effect, how is it ascertained?

original: nges pa med pa kho na'o //
analyzed: nges pa med pa kho na'o //
translated: It is not ascertained at all.

original: de zhes bya ba ni mi rtag pa la sogs pa'i chos de byas pa'i dngos po grub nas so //
analyzed: de zhes bya ba ni mi rtag pa la sogs pa'i chos de byas pa'i dngos po grub nas so //
translated: ‚ÄúThat‚Äù refers to the impermanent, etc.,

original: ji ltar de'i zhes bya ba ni dngos po pa'o //
analyzed: ji ltar de'i zhes bya ba ni dngos po pa'o //
translated: ‚ÄúJust like that‚Äù refers to the entity.

original: 'bras bu yang rgyu mtshan gzhan la ltos pa ni rgyu byas pa nyid la yod par gdon mi za ba ma yin te /
analyzed: 'bras bu yang rgyu mtshan gzhan la ltos pa ni rgyu byas pa nyid la yod par gdon mi za ba ma yin te /
translated: And it is not necessarily the case that the effect, which depends on another reason, exists when the cause is produced,

original: rgyu mtshan rnams ni 'bras bu rtsom pa la ma nges pa'i phyir ro //üîΩ'bras bur gyur pa'i chos de shes par byed pa'i gtan tshigs te /
analyzed: rgyu mtshan rnams ni 'bras bu rtsom pa la ma nges pa'i phyir ro // 'bras bur gyur pa'i chos de shes par byed pa'i gtan tshigs te /
translated: because the reasons are not ascertained to be the beginning of the effect.üîΩThat dharma which is the effect is the reason that proves it.

original: byas pa nyid bsgrub pa bya ba'i chos de go bar byed /
analyzed: byas pa nyid bsgrub pa bya ba'i chos de go bar byed /
translated: It is the reason that proves the probandum, namely, being produced.

original: rtogs par byed pas na de go bar byed pa'o //
analyzed: rtogs par byed pas na de go bar byed pa'o //
translated: It is the reason that makes it understood, because it makes it understood.

original: 'di ni de lta bu chos yang yin la gtan tshigs kyang yin pas zhes khyad par gyi tshig bsdus te de ma nges pa nyid yin no //
analyzed: 'di ni de lta bu chos yang yin la gtan tshigs kyang yin pas zhes khyad par gyi tshig bsdus te de ma nges pa nyid yin no //
translated: This is a dharma that is like that and also a reason, and so on, and so the words of the distinction are abbreviated.

original: de'i phyir zhes bya ba la sogs pas ni mjug sdud de /
analyzed: de'i phyir zhes bya ba la sogs pas ni mjug sdud de /
translated: ‚ÄúTherefore‚Äù and so on concludes.

original: de'i phyir zhes bya ba ni de lta bas na'o //
analyzed: de'i phyir zhes bya ba ni de lta bas na'o //
translated: ‚ÄúTherefore‚Äù means ‚Äúfor that reason.‚Äù

original: don gzhan gyi rgyu mtshan gyis bsgrub par bya ba'i chos ni byas pa la sogs pa'i ngo bo la gdon mi za bar yod pa ma yin pas /
analyzed: don gzhan gyi rgyu mtshan gyis bsgrub par bya ba'i chos ni byas pa la sogs pa'i ngo bo la gdon mi za bar yod pa ma yin pas /
translated: The property to be established, such as being produced, does not exist by the nature of another reason.

original: de rjes su dpag tu med do //üîΩgzhan gyis 'o na gal te zhes bya ba la sogs pa smras te /
analyzed: de rjes su dpag tu med do // gzhan gyis 'o na gal te zhes bya ba la sogs pa smras te /
translated: Therefore, it is not inferred.üîΩAnother says, ‚ÄúIf that is so,‚Äù and so on.

original: med na mi 'byung nges pa ste //
analyzed: med na mi 'byung nges pa ste //
translated: The meaning of the passage is that the existence of fire is not ascertained by the mere seeing of smoke, because the existence of fire is not ascertained by the mere seeing of smoke.

original: ma mthong las min mthong las min//üîΩ@50a * // zhes smras pas /
analyzed: ma mthong las min mthong las min// @50a * // zhes smras pas /
translated: The meaning of the passage is that the existence of fire is not ascertained by the mere seeing of smoke, because the existence of fire is not ascertained by the mere seeing of smoke.

original: mthong ba dang ma mthong ba dag rjes su 'gro ba dang ldog pa rtogs pa'i rten ma yin no zhes smras pa yin no //üîΩgal te de lta yin na ji ltar du bas me mi 'khrul lo zhes bya bar rtogs te /
analyzed: mthong ba dang ma mthong ba dag rjes su 'gro ba dang ldog pa rtogs pa'i rten ma yin no zhes smras pa yin no // gal te de lta yin na ji ltar du bas me mi 'khrul lo zhes bya bar rtogs te /
translated: The meaning of the passage is that the existence of fire is not ascertained by the mere seeing of smoke, because the existence of fire is not ascertained by the mere seeing of smoke.üîΩThe meaning of the passage is that the existence of fire is not ascertained by the mere seeing of smoke, because the existence of fire is not ascertained by the mere seeing of smoke.üîΩThe meaning of the passage is that the existence of fire is not ascertained by the mere seeing of smoke, because the existence of fire is not ascertained by the mere seeing of smoke.üîΩThe meaning of the passage is that the existence of fire is not ascertained by the mere seeing of smoke, because the existence of fire is not ascertained by the mere seeing of smoke.üîΩThe meaning of the passage is that the existence of fire is not ascertained by the mere seeing of smoke, because the existence of fire is not ascertained by the mere seeing of smoke.

original: me yod na du ba mthong la de med na du ba ma mthong ba ma rtogs rnam pa gzhan gyi du bas mi 'khrul pa ni med de /
analyzed: me yod na du ba mthong la de med na du ba ma mthong ba ma rtogs rnam pa gzhan gyi du bas mi 'khrul pa ni med de /
translated: The meaning of the passage is that the existence of fire is not ascertained by the mere seeing of smoke, because the existence of fire is not ascertained by the mere seeing of smoke.

original: rgyu dang 'bras bu'i dngos po yang mthong ba dang ma mthong ba dag kho nas rtogs so snyam du bsam pa yin no //
analyzed: rgyu dang 'bras bu'i dngos po yang mthong ba dang ma mthong ba dag kho nas rtogs so snyam du bsam pa yin no //
translated: One might think that the existence of cause and effect is understood only through seeing and not seeing.

original: 'di ltar zhes bya ba la sogs pas ni lan 'debs te /üîΩme yod na du ba mthong la /
analyzed: 'di ltar zhes bya ba la sogs pas ni lan 'debs te / me yod na du ba mthong la /
translated: In response to this, the text says ‚Äúin this way‚Äù and so on.

original: de med na ma mthong ba zhes bya ba de tsam gyis du bas mi 'khrul par ni mi smra'o //
analyzed: de med na ma mthong ba zhes bya ba de tsam gyis du bas mi 'khrul par ni mi smra'o //
translated: It is not said that the mere fact that smoke is seen when there is fire and that smoke is not seen when there is no fire is the nonerroneous cause of smoke.

original: 'on kyang me'i 'bras bu du ba ste ji lta zhe na /
analyzed: 'on kyang me'i 'bras bu du ba ste ji lta zhe na /
translated: But how is smoke the effect of fire?

original: 'bras bu'i chos kyi rjes 'jug phyir //
analyzed: 'bras bu'i chos kyi rjes 'jug phyir //
translated: Because it follows the effect property.

original: 'bras bu'i chos kyi rjes su 'jug pa de yang mthong ba dang ma mthong ba tsam las ni ma yin no //
analyzed: 'bras bu'i chos kyi rjes su 'jug pa de yang mthong ba dang ma mthong ba tsam las ni ma yin no //
translated: That following of the effect property is not due to the mere fact of seeing and not seeing.

original: 'on kyang mngon sum dang mi dmigs pa zhes bya ba'i tshad ma khyad par can las yin no //
analyzed: 'on kyang mngon sum dang mi dmigs pa zhes bya ba'i tshad ma khyad par can las yin no //
translated: But it is due to the special means of valid cognition called perception and nonapprehension.

original: mngon sum dang mi dmigs pa zhes bya ba'i sgra dag gis kyang mngon sum tshad ma kho na bstan te /
analyzed: mngon sum dang mi dmigs pa zhes bya ba'i sgra dag gis kyang mngon sum tshad ma kho na bstan te /
translated: The words ‚Äúperception‚Äù and ‚Äúnonapprehension‚Äù indicate only the valid cognition of perception.

original: rgyu dang 'bras bur mngon par 'dod pa'i dngos po'i rnam pa can ni mngon sum mo //
analyzed: rgyu dang 'bras bur mngon par 'dod pa'i dngos po'i rnam pa can ni mngon sum mo //
translated: Perception is that which has the form of a thing that is accepted as cause or effect.

original: de dag gis dben pa'i dngos po gzhan gyi rnam pa can ni dmigs pa'o //
analyzed: de dag gis dben pa'i dngos po gzhan gyi rnam pa can ni dmigs pa'o //
translated: Non-perception is that which has the form of a thing that is devoid of those.

original: mngon sum dang mi dmigs pa de dag kyang phan tshun grogs byed na bsgrub pa yin gyi 'ba' zhig ni ma yin te /
analyzed: mngon sum dang mi dmigs pa de dag kyang phan tshun grogs byed na bsgrub pa yin gyi 'ba' zhig ni ma yin te /
translated: And those two, perception and non-perception, are proofs when they mutually assist each other, not when they are alone.

original: res 'ga' ni mi dmigs pa sngon du 'gro ba'i mngon sum bsgrub pa yin la /
analyzed: res 'ga' ni mi dmigs pa sngon du 'gro ba'i mngon sum bsgrub pa yin la /
translated: Sometimes non-perception is the proof that precedes perception.

original: res 'ga' ni mngon sum sngon du 'gro ba'i mi dmigs pa'o //
analyzed: res 'ga' ni mngon sum sngon du 'gro ba'i mi dmigs pa'o //
translated: Sometimes perception is the non-perception that precedes.

original: de la re zhig dang po de'i mtshan nyid kyir gyur pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos so //
analyzed: de la re zhig dang po de'i mtshan nyid kyir gyur pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos so //
translated: In that regard, first of all, he mentions ‚Äúthat which has the nature of its characteristic.

original: de'i mtshan nyid ni mi rtag pa'i mtshan nyid de rgyur 'dod pa rnams nye ba'i sngon rol na mi dmigs pa las so //
analyzed: de'i mtshan nyid ni mi rtag pa'i mtshan nyid de rgyur 'dod pa rnams nye ba'i sngon rol na mi dmigs pa las so //
translated: ‚Äù The characteristic of that is the characteristic of impermanence. From the non-perception prior to the cause, those who assert the cause are close.

original: dmigs pa'i mtshan nyid kyir gyur pa mi dmigs pa 'dis ni de na me nye ba'i sngon rol na yang yod pa dang yul gzhan nas 'ongs pa dang me nye ba'i sngon rol na re lde dang rtsig pa la sogs pa gang dag yod pa de dag rgyu
analyzed: dmigs pa'i mtshan nyid kyir gyur pa mi dmigs pa 'dis ni de na me nye ba'i sngon rol na yang yod pa dang yul gzhan nas 'ongs pa dang me nye ba'i sngon rol na re lde dang rtsig pa la sogs pa gang dag yod pa de dag rgyu
translated: This nonobservation of that which has the character of the observed object refutes that fire exists there prior to the fuel, that it comes from another place, and that that which exists prior to the contact of fuel and fire, such as a wall or a fence, is the cause of fire.

original: nyid yin pa bkag ste /
analyzed: nyid yin pa bkag ste /
translated: This non-apprehension of that which has the characteristic of an object refutes that which exists prior to the proximity of fire, that which comes from another place, and that which exists prior to the proximity of fire, such as a straw mat or a wall, etc.,üîΩas the cause.

original: de dag rgyu nyid yin na ni /
analyzed: de dag rgyu nyid yin na ni /
translated: If they were the cause,

original: me nye ba'i sngon rol na yang du ba dmigs par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: me nye ba'i sngon rol na yang du ba dmigs par 'gyur ro //
translated: smoke would be apprehended prior to the proximity of fire.

original: me nye ba'i sngon rol na yang yul de na yod pa'am /
analyzed: me nye ba'i sngon rol na yang yul de na yod pa'am /
translated: That which exists in that place prior to the proximity of fire,

original: yul gzhan nas 'ongs pa'am /
analyzed: yul gzhan nas 'ongs pa'am /
translated: that which comes from another place,

original: gzhan gyi rgyu can yin pa'i rnam pa 'di @50b tsam gyis na du ba mes bskyed par bya ba ma yin par 'gyur na /
analyzed: gzhan gyi rgyu can yin pa'i rnam pa 'di @50b tsam gyis na du ba mes bskyed par bya ba ma yin par 'gyur na /
translated: or that which has another cause, by this mere aspect, smoke is not generated by fire.

original: 'gyur na / de dag thams cad ni ji skad bshad pa'i mi dmigs pas bsal to //
analyzed: 'gyur na / de dag thams cad ni ji skad bshad pa'i mi dmigs pas bsal to //
translated: If it were, all of those are refuted by the non-apprehension explained above.

original: dmigs pa'i mtshan nyid kyir gyur pa de nyid snga na mi dmigs pa las gang dag dmigs na dmigs pa de ni de dag gi 'bras bu yin no zhes bya bar nges par byed de /
analyzed: dmigs pa'i mtshan nyid kyir gyur pa de nyid snga na mi dmigs pa las gang dag dmigs na dmigs pa de ni de dag gi 'bras bu yin no zhes bya bar nges par byed de /
translated: That very non-apprehension of the object‚Äôs characteristics is the cause of the subsequent apprehension of the object.üîΩThus, non-apprehension is explained as the cause of the direct perception that is its assistant.üîΩOr, it is explained that the establishment of the entity of cause and effect is due to the non-apprehension of the object‚Äôs characteristics.

original: gal te de na yang rta snga na med pa dang / yul gzhan nas ma 'ongs pa dang rgyud gzhan gyi rgyu can ma yin pa nyid du nges par bya bar nus na der yang rgyu dang 'bras bu'i dngos por 'gyur ro //üîΩde bas na 'khrul par lta ga la 'gyur ba zhig na /
analyzed: gal te de na yang rta snga na med pa dang / yul gzhan nas ma 'ongs pa dang rgyud gzhan gyi rgyu can ma yin pa nyid du nges par bya bar nus na der yang rgyu dang 'bras bu'i dngos por 'gyur ro // de bas na 'khrul par lta ga la 'gyur ba zhig na /
translated: Or, it is explained that the establishment of the entity of cause and effect is due to the non-apprehension of the object‚Äôs characteristics.

original: de nyid nges par bya ba ni mi nus so //
analyzed: de nyid nges par bya ba ni mi nus so //
translated: It is not possible to ascertain that.üîΩ

original: de ltar na re zhig mi dmigs pa sngon du 'gro ba'i mngon sum sgrub pa nyid du bshad pa yin no //
analyzed: de ltar na re zhig mi dmigs pa sngon du 'gro ba'i mngon sum sgrub pa nyid du bshad pa yin no //
translated: Thus, non-apprehension is explained as the means of establishing perception, which precedes it.

original: da ni mngon sum sngon du 'gro ba mi dmigs pa de las gcig ces bya ba la sogs pa smos te /üîΩgang dag nye bas 'bras bu de 'byung bar mthong ba de dag gi nang nas gang gi tshe gcig med par gyur ba de'i tshe mi dmigs pa de ni /
analyzed: da ni mngon sum sngon du 'gro ba mi dmigs pa de las gcig ces bya ba la sogs pa smos te / gang dag nye bas 'bras bu de 'byung bar mthong ba de dag gi nang nas gang gi tshe gcig med par gyur ba de'i tshe mi dmigs pa de ni /
translated: Now, in regard to non-apprehension, which precedes perception, he says, ‚Äúwhen one of them is absent,‚Äù etc.üîΩWhen one of them is absent, then there is non-apprehension of the effect.

original: de'i 'bras bu yin no //
analyzed: de'i 'bras bu yin no //
translated: When one of them is absent, then there is non-apprehension of the effect.

original: me dang shing la sogs pa nye na yod pa'i du ba rta la sogs pa med na mi dmigs pa med kyi /
analyzed: me dang shing la sogs pa nye na yod pa'i du ba rta la sogs pa med na mi dmigs pa med kyi /
translated: When fire, wood, etc. are present, smoke is present, but when a horse, etc. is absent, non-apprehension is not present.

original: me la sogs pa med na ni mi dmigs par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: me la sogs pa med na ni mi dmigs par 'gyur ro //
translated: But when fire, etc. is absent, non-apprehension is present.

original: de ltar na phan tshun lhan cig pa'i mngon sum dang / mi dmigs pa dag ni mngon par 'dod pa'i rgyu rnams la rgyu nyid du the tshom med par sgrub par byed pa yin no //
analyzed: de ltar na phan tshun lhan cig pa'i mngon sum dang / mi dmigs pa dag ni mngon par 'dod pa'i rgyu rnams la rgyu nyid du the tshom med par sgrub par byed pa yin no //
translated: Thus, perception and non-apprehension, which are mutually concomitant, unerringly establish the causal nature of the causes of the desired effect.

original: de yang zhes bya ba ni 'bras bu'i mtshan nyid ji skad bshad pa ste /
analyzed: de yang zhes bya ba ni 'bras bu'i mtshan nyid ji skad bshad pa ste /
translated: ‚ÄúThat‚Äù refers to the characteristic of the effect as it has been explained.

original: du ba la yod do //
analyzed: du ba la yod do //
translated: Smoke exists in a kitchen.

original: de bas na me kho na las du ba 'byung ngo //
analyzed: de bas na me kho na las du ba 'byung ngo //
translated: Therefore, smoke arises only from fire.

original: gal te de las gzhan pa las kyang 'byung na ni de'i tshe /
analyzed: gal te de las gzhan pa las kyang 'byung na ni de'i tshe /
translated: If it arose from something else,

original: de med par ni me med par du ba de yod na /üîΩrgyu dang ldan pa las 'das 'gyur //
analyzed: de med par ni me med par du ba de yod na / rgyu dang ldan pa las 'das 'gyur //
translated: then smoke would exist without fire.üîΩIt would be without a cause.

original: rgyu med pa can du 'gyur ro //üîΩgal te me la sogs pa'i tshogs pa gcig las kyang du ba gcig cig lan cig mthong bar zad kyi /
analyzed: rgyu med pa can du 'gyur ro // gal te me la sogs pa'i tshogs pa gcig las kyang du ba gcig cig lan cig mthong bar zad kyi /
translated: It would be causeless.

original: phyis mthong ba gang yin pa de ni gzhan kho na yin na de ji ltar lan cig mthong bas me'i 'bras bu 'grub snyam du sems na /üîΩde'i phyir lan cig de ltar mthong bas @51a * //
analyzed: phyis mthong ba gang yin pa de ni gzhan kho na yin na de ji ltar lan cig mthong bas me'i 'bras bu 'grub snyam du sems na / de'i phyir lan cig de ltar mthong bas @51a * //
translated: If one sees only one instance of smoke arising from a single collection of fire and so on, and later sees that it is different, how can one establish that fire is the cause of smoke by seeing it only once?

original: kyang zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te //
analyzed: kyang zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te //
translated: Therefore, he says, ‚ÄúEven though one sees it that way only once,‚Äù and so on.

original: de ltar mthong bas zhes bya ba ni mngon sum dang mi dmigs pa ji ltar bshad ma thag pa lta bus so //
analyzed: de ltar mthong bas zhes bya ba ni mngon sum dang mi dmigs pa ji ltar bshad ma thag pa lta bus so //
translated: ‚ÄúSeeing it that way‚Äù means by direct perception and non-apprehension, as they have just been explained.

original: ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why?

original: 'bras bu nyid ma yin na rgyu ma yin pa las lan cig kyang mi mthong ba'i phyir te /
analyzed: 'bras bu nyid ma yin na rgyu ma yin pa las lan cig kyang mi mthong ba'i phyir te /
translated: Because if it is not an effect, it is never seen to arise from a non-cause.

original: bye ma dag las ni 'bru mar lan 'ga' yang mi 'byung ngo //
analyzed: bye ma dag las ni 'bru mar lan 'ga' yang mi 'byung ngo //
translated: Oil never arises from sand.

original: 'bras bu yang zhes bya ba la sogs pas ni tshig le'ur byas pa'i don ston to //
analyzed: 'bras bu yang zhes bya ba la sogs pas ni tshig le'ur byas pa'i don ston to //
translated: The meaning of the verse is taught by ‚ÄúThe effect, etc.‚Äù

original: gang zhig ces bya ba la sogs pas ni de nyid gzhung 'dzugs te /
analyzed: gang zhig ces bya ba la sogs pas ni de nyid gzhung 'dzugs te /
translated: The text is established by ‚ÄúWhatever, etc.‚Äù

original: 'dis ni khyab pa bsnyad do //
analyzed: 'dis ni khyab pa bsnyad do //
translated: This teaches the pervasion.

original: 'khrul par smra bas me med par yang du ba yod de zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: 'khrul par smra bas me med par yang du ba yod de zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: The one who speaks erroneously says, ‚ÄúSmoke exists without fire, etc.‚Äù

original: 'dis ni phyogs kyi chos bstan to //
analyzed: 'dis ni phyogs kyi chos bstan to //
translated: This teaches the property of the subject.

original: des na zhes bya ba ni me med par du ba yod pa de'i phyir ro //
analyzed: des na zhes bya ba ni me med par du ba yod pa de'i phyir ro //
translated: ‚ÄúTherefore‚Äù means because smoke exists without fire.

original: de'i rgyu ma yin par 'gyur ro zhes bya ba ni me du ba de'i rgyu ma yin par 'gyur ba ste /
analyzed: de'i rgyu ma yin par 'gyur ro zhes bya ba ni me du ba de'i rgyu ma yin par 'gyur ba ste /
translated: ‚ÄúIt would not be its cause‚Äù means fire would not be the cause of that smoke.

original: 'di ni bsgrub pa'i 'bras bu yin no //
analyzed: 'di ni bsgrub pa'i 'bras bu yin no //
translated: This is the conclusion.

original: sbyor ba ni gang zhig gang med par yod pa de ni rgyu ma yin te /
analyzed: sbyor ba ni gang zhig gang med par yod pa de ni rgyu ma yin te /
translated: The syllogism is: Whatever exists without something else does not cause that other thing.

original: dper na rta'i pa lang lta bu'o //
analyzed: dper na rta'i pa lang lta bu'o //
translated: For example, a horse is a cow.

original: me med par yang du ba yod pas zhes bya ba ni khyab par byed pa 'gal ba yin no //
analyzed: me med par yang du ba yod pas zhes bya ba ni khyab par byed pa 'gal ba yin no //
translated: And, ‚ÄúSmoke exists without fire‚Äù is a contradiction of the pervasion.

original: de lta na ni rgyu med par 'gyur ro snyam du bsam pa yin no //
analyzed: de lta na ni rgyu med par 'gyur ro snyam du bsam pa yin no //
translated: The idea is that it would be causeless.

original: gal te gzhan gyi rgyu can yin pa'i phyir zhes bya ba ni gal te du ba ni me las gzhan pa brgya byin gyi spyi po la sogs pa gang yin pa de'i rgyu can yin pa'i phyir rgyu med pa can ma yin no zhes zer na /
analyzed: gal te gzhan gyi rgyu can yin pa'i phyir zhes bya ba ni gal te du ba ni me las gzhan pa brgya byin gyi spyi po la sogs pa gang yin pa de'i rgyu can yin pa'i phyir rgyu med pa can ma yin no zhes zer na /
translated: If you say, ‚ÄúBecause it has another cause,‚Äù if you say, ‚ÄúSmoke is not causeless because it has a cause that is other than fire, such as the head of Indra,‚Äù

original: de lta na ni ma yin te rgyu don gzhan du brtags pa de la yang mtshungs pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: de lta na ni ma yin te rgyu don gzhan du brtags pa de la yang mtshungs pa'i phyir te /
translated: then that is not so, because the imputation of a cause that is a different object is similar.

original: 'di ltar de med na yang rgyu gzhan po med na yang me yod na yod pas rgyu gzhan po de yang rgyu ma yin par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: 'di ltar de med na yang rgyu gzhan po med na yang me yod na yod pas rgyu gzhan po de yang rgyu ma yin par 'gyur ro //
translated: Thus, even if it does not exist, if fire exists, it exists, so that other cause also would not be a cause.

original: gzhan yang me gang yin pa de dang / de las gzhan pa'i rgyu gang yin pa de yang ci du ba bskyed pa'i rang bzhin zhig yin nam 'on te ma yin /
analyzed: gzhan yang me gang yin pa de dang / de las gzhan pa'i rgyu gang yin pa de yang ci du ba bskyed pa'i rang bzhin zhig yin nam 'on te ma yin /
translated: Moreover, is that which is fire and that which is a cause other than that the nature of generating smoke or not?

original: gal te rang bzhin ma yin na ni de'i tshe me de'am brgya byin gyi spyi bo la sogs pa gzhan yang rung ste /
analyzed: gal te rang bzhin ma yin na ni de'i tshe me de'am brgya byin gyi spyi bo la sogs pa gzhan yang rung ste /
translated: If it is not the nature of generating smoke, then at that time, whether it is fire or something else, such as Indra‚Äôs head,

original: bstan pa'i rang bzhin ma yin pa las du ba bskyed pa'i rang bzhin ma yin pa las ji ltar du ba 'byung bar 'gyur /
analyzed: bstan pa'i rang bzhin ma yin pa las du ba bskyed pa'i rang bzhin ma yin pa las ji ltar du ba 'byung bar 'gyur /
translated: how could smoke arise from that which is not the nature of generating smoke?

original: ci'i phyir zhe na /üîΩrang gis de'i rang bzhin ma yin pas /
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na / rang gis de'i rang bzhin ma yin pas /
translated: Why is it so?

original: du ba bskyed pa'i rang bzhin ma yin pas mi skyed pa'i phyir /
analyzed: du ba bskyed pa'i rang bzhin ma yin pas mi skyed pa'i phyir /
translated: Because it is not the nature of generating smoke, it does not generate smoke.

original: du ba de rgyu med pa nyid du 'gyur ro //
analyzed: du ba de rgyu med pa nyid du 'gyur ro //
translated: Smoke would arise without a cause.

original: 'on te du ba bskyed pa'i rang bzhin zhig yin na ni /
analyzed: 'on te du ba bskyed pa'i rang bzhin zhig yin na ni /
translated: But if it is the nature of generating smoke,

original: de'i tshe gnyis ka yang me nyid yin te /
analyzed: de'i tshe gnyis ka yang me nyid yin te /
translated: then both are fire,

original: me'i mtshan nyid ni du @51b ba bskyed pa'i rang bzhin yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: me'i mtshan nyid ni du @51b ba bskyed pa'i rang bzhin yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because the definition of fire is the nature of generating smoke.

original: de ni 'og nas bshad par bya'o //
analyzed: de ni 'og nas bshad par bya'o //
translated: This will be explained below.

original: 'khrul par smra bas /
analyzed: 'khrul par smra bas /
translated: The opponent says:

original: de nyid ni ma yin te zhes bya ba la sogs pa smras te /
analyzed: de nyid ni ma yin te zhes bya ba la sogs pa smras te /
translated: It is not like that.

original: du ba gang zhig mes bskyed pa de kho na gzhan las 'byung ngo zhes de skad ni mi zer te /
analyzed: du ba gang zhig mes bskyed pa de kho na gzhan las 'byung ngo zhes de skad ni mi zer te /
translated: We do not say that smoke that is generated by fire is produced from another,

original: gal te de nyid gzhan las 'byung na ni rgyu med pa can nyid du 'gyur ba zhig / de dang 'dra ba mes bskyed pa'i du ba'i rang bzhin dang 'dra ba zhig gzhan las 'byung ba'i phyir ro zhe na /
analyzed: gal te de nyid gzhan las 'byung na ni rgyu med pa can nyid du 'gyur ba zhig / de dang 'dra ba mes bskyed pa'i du ba'i rang bzhin dang 'dra ba zhig gzhan las 'byung ba'i phyir ro zhe na /
translated: but if it were produced from another, it would be causeless, because that which is similar to it, the nature of smoke generated by fire, would arise from another.

original: grub pa'i mtha' smra bas /
analyzed: grub pa'i mtha' smra bas /
translated: The proponent of the tenets says:

original: mi 'dra ba las zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: mi 'dra ba las zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: It arises from that which is dissimilar.

original: me dang mi 'dra ba du ba bskyed pa'i rang bzhin ma yin pa las 'byung ba ji ltar de dang 'dra ba yin /
analyzed: me dang mi 'dra ba du ba bskyed pa'i rang bzhin ma yin pa las 'byung ba ji ltar de dang 'dra ba yin /
translated: How could it be similar to that which arises from that which is dissimilar to fire, which is not the nature that generates smoke?

original: mes bskyed pa'i du ba'i rang bzhin yin /
analyzed: mes bskyed pa'i du ba'i rang bzhin yin /
translated: It is the nature of smoke generated by fire.

original: ma yin pa nyid de 'di ltar 'khrul pa'i yul du 'dod pa de ni de dang 'dra ba las me dang 'dra ba'i rgyu las 'byung ba'i phyir /
analyzed: ma yin pa nyid de 'di ltar 'khrul pa'i yul du 'dod pa de ni de dang 'dra ba las me dang 'dra ba'i rgyu las 'byung ba'i phyir /
translated: It is not so, because that which is asserted to be the object of error arises from a cause that is similar to fire, and

original: skye ba'i phyir de dang 'dra bar 'gyur te /
analyzed: skye ba'i phyir de dang 'dra bar 'gyur te /
translated: because it arises, it is similar to that.

original: du ba dang 'dra bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: du ba dang 'dra bar 'gyur ro //
translated: It is similar to smoke.

original: mi 'dra ba las kyang me dang mi 'dra ba las kyang de dang 'dra bar 'byung na ni mes bskyed pa'i du ba'i rang bzhin dang 'dra ba 'byung na ni de dag gi nus pa ma nges pa'i phyir /
analyzed: mi 'dra ba las kyang me dang mi 'dra ba las kyang de dang 'dra bar 'byung na ni mes bskyed pa'i du ba'i rang bzhin dang 'dra ba 'byung na ni de dag gi nus pa ma nges pa'i phyir /
translated: If it arises from a dissimilar cause, it is similar to that which is dissimilar to fire, because the nature of smoke generated by fire is similar to that.üîΩIf the capacity of similar and dissimilar causes is uncertain,

original: rgyu 'dra ba dang mi 'dra ba dag gi nus pa gang yin pa de'i nges pa gang yin pa dang 'dra ba kho na bskyed la /
analyzed: rgyu 'dra ba dang mi 'dra ba dag gi nus pa gang yin pa de'i nges pa gang yin pa dang 'dra ba kho na bskyed la /
translated: then the capacity of that which is similar to that which is generated is similar,üîΩand that which is dissimilar generates only that which is dissimilar.

original: mi 'dra bas ni mi 'dra ba kho na bskyed pa zhes bya ba de med pa'i phyir rgyu'i tha dad pa 'bras bu'i tha dad par byed pa ma yin pas mtha' dag gi sna tshogs nyid rgyu med pa can du 'gyur ro //
analyzed: mi 'dra bas ni mi 'dra ba kho na bskyed pa zhes bya ba de med pa'i phyir rgyu'i tha dad pa 'bras bu'i tha dad par byed pa ma yin pas mtha' dag gi sna tshogs nyid rgyu med pa can du 'gyur ro //
translated: Since that does not exist, the difference in effects is not made by the difference in causes. Therefore the diversity of all things would be causeless.

original: gal te rgyu gang las skye yang rung ste /
analyzed: gal te rgyu gang las skye yang rung ste /
translated: But if it is asked, ‚ÄúFrom what cause does it arise?‚Äù

original: rgyu med pa can nyid ma yin no zhe na /
analyzed: rgyu med pa can nyid ma yin no zhe na /
translated: it is not causeless.

original: thams cad las thams cad ces bya ba la sogs pa smos te ;
analyzed: thams cad las thams cad ces bya ba la sogs pa smos te ;
translated: To this it is replied, ‚ÄúEverything from everything,‚Äù etc.

original: / gal te mi nus pa las kyang skye na ni thams cad las thams cad skye bar 'gyur ba zhig na de ltar yang ma yin no //
analyzed: / gal te mi nus pa las kyang skye na ni thams cad las thams cad skye bar 'gyur ba zhig na de ltar yang ma yin no //
translated: If it were to arise from what is incapable of producing it, then everything would arise from everything. But that is not the case.üîΩTherefore, etc.

original: de lta bas na zhes bya ba la sogs pa la de bas na zhes bya ba ni de'i phyir te /
analyzed: de lta bas na zhes bya ba la sogs pa la de bas na zhes bya ba ni de'i phyir te /
translated: Therefore means for that reason.

original: du ba gang las 'byung bar mthong ba de ni mthong ba'i rnam pas te me'o //
analyzed: du ba gang las 'byung bar mthong ba de ni mthong ba'i rnam pas te me'o //
translated: That from which smoke is seen to arise is the cause of smoke, because it is seen to be the cause of smoke.

original: de dang rigs mi mthun pa'i don las zhes bya ba ni me ma yin pa las zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //üîΩde lta yin na zhes bya ba ni du ba rgyu med pa can nyid yin na rtag tu yod pa'am /
analyzed: de dang rigs mi mthun pa'i don las zhes bya ba ni me ma yin pa las zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go // de lta yin na zhes bya ba ni du ba rgyu med pa can nyid yin na rtag tu yod pa'am /
translated: From a thing that is not of the same type as that means from what is not fire.üîΩIf that were so, etc.

original: med par 'gyur /
analyzed: med par 'gyur /
translated: If smoke were causeless, it would either always exist or never exist.

original: ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why?

original: dngos po rgyu med pa ni rang 'grub par bya ba la mi ltos pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: dngos po rgyu med pa ni rang 'grub par bya ba la mi ltos pa'i phyir te /
translated: Because a thing without a cause does not depend on anything else for its existence.

original: rgyu gzhan @52a * //
analyzed: rgyu gzhan @52a * //
translated: Other causesüîΩ

original: la mi ltos pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: la mi ltos pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it does not depend on another cause.

original: gal te rgyu gzhan la mi ltos pa nyid yin du zin kyang res 'ga' bar 'gyur ro zhe na /
analyzed: gal te rgyu gzhan la mi ltos pa nyid yin du zin kyang res 'ga' bar 'gyur ro zhe na /
translated: If, even though it does not depend on another cause, it sometimes occurs,

original: dngos po rnams ni res 'ga' zhig / ces bya ba la sogs pa smos so //
analyzed: dngos po rnams ni res 'ga' zhig / ces bya ba la sogs pa smos so //
translated: he says, ‚ÄúThings would sometimes not exist,‚Äù etc.

original: du ba de zhes bya ba la sogs pas ni de nyid ston te /
analyzed: du ba de zhes bya ba la sogs pas ni de nyid ston te /
translated: He shows just that with ‚ÄúThat smoke, etc.‚Äù

original: nam yang mi 'byung bar mi 'gyur gyi dus thams cad du 'byung bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: nam yang mi 'byung bar mi 'gyur gyi dus thams cad du 'byung bar 'gyur ro //
translated: It would never not occur, but it would occur at all times.

original: ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why?

original: de 'byung ba la du ba'i rang gi ngo bo 'byung ba las rgyu la mi ltos pa nyid kyis ma tshang ba med pa'i phyir 'dod pa'i dus bzhin te /
analyzed: de 'byung ba la du ba'i rang gi ngo bo 'byung ba las rgyu la mi ltos pa nyid kyis ma tshang ba med pa'i phyir 'dod pa'i dus bzhin te /
translated: Because, for its occurrence, the nature of smoke, not depending on a cause, is complete, just like the desired time.

original: gang gi dus na du ba 'byung bar 'dod pa'i dus bzhin no //
analyzed: gang gi dus na du ba 'byung bar 'dod pa'i dus bzhin no //
translated: Just like the time when the occurrence of smoke is desired.

original: yang na ni de'i tshe yang zhes bya ba ni 'dod pa'i dus na yang du ba 'byung bar mi 'gyur te /
analyzed: yang na ni de'i tshe yang zhes bya ba ni 'dod pa'i dus na yang du ba 'byung bar mi 'gyur te /
translated: Or, ‚ÄúEven at that time,‚Äù i.e., even at the desired time, smoke would not occur,

original: du ba med pa'i dus na khyad par med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: du ba med pa'i dus na khyad par med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because there would be no difference from the time when there is no smoke.

original: phyed 'og ma rnam par dbye ba'i phyir dngos po ltos pa rnams ni zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: phyed 'og ma rnam par dbye ba'i phyir dngos po ltos pa rnams ni zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: The second half of the verse is stated in order to analyze that.

original: 'di ltar rung ba'i yul dang du ba la ltos nas /
analyzed: 'di ltar rung ba'i yul dang du ba la ltos nas /
translated: Thus, in dependence on a suitable place and smoke,

original: 'bras bu yod pa dang med pa gang dag yin pa'i yod pa dang med pa'i dus de dag ni go rims bzhin du de 'byung bar 'bras bu 'byung bar rung ba dang mi rung ba nyid /üîΩgang dag yin pa de dag dang ldan pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'bras bu yod pa dang med pa gang dag yin pa'i yod pa dang med pa'i dus de dag ni go rims bzhin du de 'byung bar 'bras bu 'byung bar rung ba dang mi rung ba nyid / gang dag yin pa de dag dang ldan pa'i phyir ro //
translated: the times of the existence and nonexistence of the effect are, respectively, the times when the effect is suitable and unsuitable to arise.

original: dus smos pa ni mtshon pa ste /
analyzed: dus smos pa ni mtshon pa ste /
translated: The times are mentioned as an illustration.

original: yul dang rdzas dag la yang de bzhin du brjod par bya'o //
analyzed: yul dang rdzas dag la yang de bzhin du brjod par bya'o //
translated: Place and substance should be similarly expressed.

original: 'on te de ltar mi 'dod na ni 'bras bu yod pa dang med pa dang ldan pa'i yul dang dus gang dag la rung ba dang mi rung ba 'dra ba nyid yod pa de dag la ni de dang ldan pa dang cig shos dag tu nges par mi
analyzed: 'on te de ltar mi 'dod na ni 'bras bu yod pa dang med pa dang ldan pa'i yul dang dus gang dag la rung ba dang mi rung ba 'dra ba nyid yod pa de dag la ni de dang ldan pa dang cig shos dag tu nges par mi
translated: But if you do not accept that, then the times of the existence and nonexistence of the effect and the place where the effect is suitable and unsuitable would not be ascertained as possessing that or something else.

original: rung ba'i phyir te /
analyzed: rung ba'i phyir te /
translated: Because it is not suitable.

original: 'bras bu'i dus nyid de dang ldan pa ste /
analyzed: 'bras bu'i dus nyid de dang ldan pa ste /
translated: At the time of the fruition, one is endowed with that.üîΩ

original: 'bras bu dang ldan pa'o //
analyzed: 'bras bu dang ldan pa'o //
translated: and at the time of the effect, it is endowed with the effect.

original: de las gzhan pa ni cig shos te /
analyzed: de las gzhan pa ni cig shos te /
translated: The other is the opposite of that,

original: 'bras bu dang mi ldan pa'o //
analyzed: 'bras bu dang mi ldan pa'o //
translated: that is, not endowed with the effect.

original: 'di dag nges par mi rung ba'i phyir yang na ni rung ba nyid du 'dra ba'i phyir 'bras bu yod pa dang med pa'i dus de gnyi gar 'bras bu dang ldan par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: 'di dag nges par mi rung ba'i phyir yang na ni rung ba nyid du 'dra ba'i phyir 'bras bu yod pa dang med pa'i dus de gnyi gar 'bras bu dang ldan par 'gyur ro //
translated: Because of the impossibility of these, either the effect would be endowed with the effect at both times, when it exists and when it does not, because of the similarity of the possibility of both,

original: yang na ni mi rung ba nyid du 'dra ba'i phyir 'bras bu dang ldan par mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: yang na ni mi rung ba nyid du 'dra ba'i phyir 'bras bu dang ldan par mi 'gyur ro //
translated: or it would not be endowed with the effect, because of the similarity of the impossibility of both.

original: de lta bas na de yod pa'i dus kho na rung ba nyid yin la dngos po rnams kyang de la ltos nas res 'ga' bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de lta bas na de yod pa'i dus kho na rung ba nyid yin la dngos po rnams kyang de la ltos nas res 'ga' bar 'gyur ro //
translated: Therefore, the existence of the effect is possible only at the time when it exists, and things are occasional in dependence on that.

original: 'dod pa'i yul dang dus la sogs pa bltar rung ba nyid yin du zad mod de tsam gyis rgyu'i dngos po ni ma yin no zhe na /
analyzed: 'dod pa'i yul dang dus la sogs pa bltar rung ba nyid yin du zad mod de tsam gyis rgyu'i dngos po ni ma yin no zhe na /
translated: But it is only the desirable object, time, etc., that are possible, and that is not the cause of things.

original: de'i phyir rung ba nyid de yang zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos so //
analyzed: de'i phyir rung ba nyid de yang zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos so //
translated: Therefore, he says, that possibility also, etc.

original: gang gi phyir de ltar rgyu med pa nyid gcig yin na rtag tu yod @52b pa'am med par 'gyur ba zhig na /
analyzed: gang gi phyir de ltar rgyu med pa nyid gcig yin na rtag tu yod @52b pa'am med par 'gyur ba zhig na /
translated: If there were only causelessness, then things would always exist or never exist.

original: ma gyur pa de'i phyir zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /üîΩgang zhig spangs nas yod pa de la ni mi ltos la /
analyzed: ma gyur pa de'i phyir zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te / gang zhig spangs nas yod pa de la ni mi ltos la /
translated: But since that is not the case, he says, ‚ÄúTherefore, etc.‚ÄùüîΩIf something exists without depending on another, then it is independent.

original: gang la yod pa de la ni ltos pa dang bcas pa yin no //
analyzed: gang la yod pa de la ni ltos pa dang bcas pa yin no //
translated: If something exists in dependence on another, then it is dependent.

original: gal te yul la sogs pa 'ga' zhig na yod du zin kyang 'on kyang ji ltar de dag la ltos pa dang bcas pa yin zhe na /
analyzed: gal te yul la sogs pa 'ga' zhig na yod du zin kyang 'on kyang ji ltar de dag la ltos pa dang bcas pa yin zhe na /
translated: But if objects, etc. do exist, then how are they dependent?

original: 'di ltar zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: 'di ltar zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: He says, ‚ÄúIn this way, etc.‚Äù

original: de ltar yod pa zhes bya ba ni gcig spangs nas gzhan na yod pa'o //
analyzed: de ltar yod pa zhes bya ba ni gcig spangs nas gzhan na yod pa'o //
translated: ‚ÄúIn this way‚Äù means that they exist without depending on another.

original: gal te dngos po ni yul la sogs pa la ltos pa kho na yin gyi yul la sogs pa des ni de la phan pa mi byed do zhe na /
analyzed: gal te dngos po ni yul la sogs pa la ltos pa kho na yin gyi yul la sogs pa des ni de la phan pa mi byed do zhe na /
translated: But if things exist only in dependence on objects, etc., then those objects, etc. do not benefit them.

original: de dag gis byas pa'i phan pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: de dag gis byas pa'i phan pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: He says, ‚ÄúThe benefit that they create, etc.‚Äù

original: der nges par mi rung ba'i phyir ro zhes bya ba ni yul la sogs pa de kho na yod do zhes bya bar nges par mi rung ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: der nges par mi rung ba'i phyir ro zhes bya ba ni yul la sogs pa de kho na yod do zhes bya bar nges par mi rung ba'i phyir ro //
translated: because it is not possible to ascertain that only those objects, etc. exist.

original: de bas na zhes bya ba ni de lta bas na'o //
analyzed: de bas na zhes bya ba ni de lta bas na'o //
translated: Therefore, means thus.

original: yul dang dus zhes smos pa ni mtshon pa ste rdzas kyang gzung ngo //
analyzed: yul dang dus zhes smos pa ni mtshon pa ste rdzas kyang gzung ngo //
translated: The mention of place and time is illustrative; substance is also to be included.

original: gang na zhes bya ba ni yul la sogs pa na'o //
analyzed: gang na zhes bya ba ni yul la sogs pa na'o //
translated: Where means in a place, etc.

original: lan cig mthong la zhes bya ba ni ji skad bshad pa'i mngon sum gyis te gang dag nye na mthong ba de dag las gang yang rung ba zhig ma tshang na'o //
analyzed: lan cig mthong la zhes bya ba ni ji skad bshad pa'i mngon sum gyis te gang dag nye na mthong ba de dag las gang yang rung ba zhig ma tshang na'o //
translated: Having seen once means by the direct perception as explained above; that is, when one of those is absent, which is seen when near.

original: gzhan du na zhes bya ba ni gal te 'di des bskyed par bya ba'i rang bzhin ma yin na'o //
analyzed: gzhan du na zhes bya ba ni gal te 'di des bskyed par bya ba'i rang bzhin ma yin na'o //
translated: Otherwise means if it is not of the nature to be produced by that.

original: de zhes bya ba ni du ba'o //
analyzed: de zhes bya ba ni du ba'o //
translated: That means smoke.

original: der nges pa yin na me la sogs pa'i tshogs pa la yod par nges pa yin na ji ltar me las gzhan pa las 'byung bar 'gyur te /
analyzed: der nges pa yin na me la sogs pa'i tshogs pa la yod par nges pa yin na ji ltar me las gzhan pa las 'byung bar 'gyur te /
translated: If it is ascertained there, then if it is ascertained to exist in the collection of fire, etc., how could it arise from something other than fire?

original: 'byung bar mi 'gyur ba nyid do //
analyzed: 'byung bar mi 'gyur ba nyid do //
translated: It could not arise.

original: 'byung na ni du ba ma yin par 'gyur te /
analyzed: 'byung na ni du ba ma yin par 'gyur te /
translated: If it did, it would not be smoke.

original: 'di ltar du ba ni des bskyed pa ste /
analyzed: 'di ltar du ba ni des bskyed pa ste /
translated: Because smoke is generated by that,

original: mes bskyed pa'i rang bzhin gyi khyad par yin no //
analyzed: mes bskyed pa'i rang bzhin gyi khyad par yin no //
translated: it is a particular nature generated by fire.

original: de bzhin du rgyu yang 'bras bu de lta bu bskyed pa'i rang bzhin yin te /
analyzed: de bzhin du rgyu yang 'bras bu de lta bu bskyed pa'i rang bzhin yin te /
translated: In the same way, the cause is the nature that generates that effect,

original: du ba bskyed par rung ba'i rang bzhin no //
analyzed: du ba bskyed par rung ba'i rang bzhin no //
translated: the nature suitable to generate smoke.

original: rgyur gyur pa la ni du ba dang bral ba'i gnas skabs na yang rung ba nyid yod de des na ma khyab pa'i mtshan nyid ma yin no //
analyzed: rgyur gyur pa la ni du ba dang bral ba'i gnas skabs na yang rung ba nyid yod de des na ma khyab pa'i mtshan nyid ma yin no //
translated: When it is a cause, even in the state of being free of smoke, it is suitable, and therefore it is not a definition that is not pervasion.

original: de ltar me dang du ba dag phan tshun ltos pa nyid du nges pa'i rang bzhin du gnas pa las gal te du ba me las gzhan pa las kyang 'byung bar 'dod na ni de'i tshe me de du ba bskyed pa de'i rang bzhin ma yin te /
analyzed: de ltar me dang du ba dag phan tshun ltos pa nyid du nges pa'i rang bzhin du gnas pa las gal te du ba me las gzhan pa las kyang 'byung bar 'dod na ni de'i tshe me de du ba bskyed pa de'i rang bzhin ma yin te /
translated: Thus, if fire and smoke are definitely established as having a nature that is mutually dependent, and if it is asserted that smoke arises from something other than fire, then at that time fire is not the nature that generates smoke.

original: 'di ltar gang gi tshe du ba me ma yin pa las 'byung ba de'i tshe du ba bskyed pa na me kho na'i rang bzhin ma yin par gyur to //
analyzed: 'di ltar gang gi tshe du ba me ma yin pa las 'byung ba de'i tshe du ba bskyed pa na me kho na'i rang bzhin ma yin par gyur to //
translated: Thus, when smoke arises from something that is not fire, then when smoke is produced, it does not have the nature of fire.

original: me'i rang bzhin ma yin pa de @53a * //
analyzed: me'i rang bzhin ma yin pa de @53a * //
translated: And that which does not have the nature of fire

original: yang ji ltar me'i yin par 'gyur /
analyzed: yang ji ltar me'i yin par 'gyur /
translated: how could it be of fire?

original: de bas na du ba bskyed pa'i rang bzhin ma yin pa'i phyir mes lan 'ga' yang du ba bskyed par mi 'gyur ro //üîΩdu ba yang du ba'i rang bzhin du mi 'gyur bar yang na du ba zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: de bas na du ba bskyed pa'i rang bzhin ma yin pa'i phyir mes lan 'ga' yang du ba bskyed par mi 'gyur ro // du ba yang du ba'i rang bzhin du mi 'gyur bar yang na du ba zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: Therefore, because it is not the nature of fire to produce smoke, fire would never produce smoke.üîΩAnd smoke would not be smoke,

original: yang na me las gzhan pa las 'byung na ni de du ba ma yin no //
analyzed: yang na me las gzhan pa las 'byung na ni de du ba ma yin no //
translated: if it arose from something other than fire, it would not be smoke.

original: ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is it so?

original: du ba bskyed pa'i rang bzhin ma yin pa me las gzhan pa las byung zhing mthong ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: du ba bskyed pa'i rang bzhin ma yin pa me las gzhan pa las byung zhing mthong ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Because that which is not the nature of fire to produce smoke is seen to arise from something other than fire.

original: 'on te du ba'i rgyu nyid du 'dod pa me las gzhan pa yang me kho na bzhin du du ba bskyed pa'i rang bzhin yin par khas len na ni de'i tshe de'i rang bzhin nyid yin na ni du ba bskyed pa'i rang bzhin nyid yin na ni de
analyzed: 'on te du ba'i rgyu nyid du 'dod pa me las gzhan pa yang me kho na bzhin du du ba bskyed pa'i rang bzhin yin par khas len na ni de'i tshe de'i rang bzhin nyid yin na ni du ba bskyed pa'i rang bzhin nyid yin na ni de
translated: But if you accept that the cause of smoke is fire, and that it is of the nature to produce smoke, just like fire, then

original: nyid me yin pas du ba 'khrul pa med do //
analyzed: nyid me yin pas du ba 'khrul pa med do //
translated: since it is of the nature of fire, it is fire itself. Therefore, there is no error in the production of smoke.

original: don 'das pa nyid gzung ba bde bar bya ba'i phyir tshigs su bcad pa /
analyzed: don 'das pa nyid gzung ba bde bar bya ba'i phyir tshigs su bcad pa /
translated: In order to make the meaning even clearer, he states a verse:

original: gal te brgya byin spyi bo me'i //
analyzed: gal te brgya byin spyi bo me'i //
translated: If the head of Indra were fire,

original: zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos so //
analyzed: zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos so //
translated: and so on.

original: me'i rang bzhin yin na zhes bya ba ni gal te du ba bskyed pa'i rang bzhin min na zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: me'i rang bzhin yin na zhes bya ba ni gal te du ba bskyed pa'i rang bzhin min na zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: If it were of the nature of fire means if it were not of the nature to produce smoke.

original: bla chos su de skad bshad do //üîΩbrgya byin gyi spyi bo de nyid me yin te /
analyzed: bla chos su de skad bshad do // brgya byin gyi spyi bo de nyid me yin te /
translated: This is explained in the commentary.üîΩThe head of Indra is fire itself,

original: mer tha snyad gdags pa'i rgyu ni de tsam du zad pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: mer tha snyad gdags pa'i rgyu ni de tsam du zad pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because that is the extent of the cause for the designation of fire.

original: 'on te de me'i rang bzhin min zhes bya ba ni du ba bskyed pa'i rang bzhin ma yin te /üîΩde zhes bya ba ni brgya byin gyi spyi bo'o //
analyzed: 'on te de me'i rang bzhin min zhes bya ba ni du ba bskyed pa'i rang bzhin ma yin te / de zhes bya ba ni brgya byin gyi spyi bo'o //
translated: Or else, it is not the nature of fire, i.e., it is not the nature of the cause of smoke.üîΩ‚ÄúThat‚Äù refers to the head of Indra.

original: de las zhes bya ba ni brgya byin gyi spyi bo las so //
analyzed: de las zhes bya ba ni brgya byin gyi spyi bo las so //
translated: ‚ÄúFrom that‚Äù refers from the head of Indra.

original: ci'i phyir mi 'byung zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir mi 'byung zhe na /
translated: Why does it not arise?

original: du ba'i rgyu'i rang bzhin me zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: du ba'i rgyu'i rang bzhin me zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: He says, ‚ÄúThe nature of the cause of smoke is fire,‚Äù etc.

original: gang la du ba'i rgyu'i rang bzhin yod pa zhes tshig rnam par sbyar nas /
analyzed: gang la du ba'i rgyu'i rang bzhin yod pa zhes tshig rnam par sbyar nas /
translated: The phrase ‚Äúthat which has the nature of the cause of smoke‚Äù is to be construed with the word ‚Äúis.‚Äù

original: me kho na yin no zhes nges bar gzung ngo //
analyzed: me kho na yin no zhes nges bar gzung ngo //
translated: It is only fire that is definitely ascertained.

original: de yi nus pa'i bye brag ldan //
analyzed: de yi nus pa'i bye brag ldan //
translated: It has a special power.

original: zhes bya ba ni du ba bskyed pa'i nus pa can gyi rgyur gyur pa nyid kyis dngos po gzhan las bye brag ldan pa ste /üîΩmi 'dra ba yin no //
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni du ba bskyed pa'i nus pa can gyi rgyur gyur pa nyid kyis dngos po gzhan las bye brag ldan pa ste / mi 'dra ba yin no //
translated: It is a cause that has the power to produce smoke. It has a special nature, i.e., it is different, from other things.

original: du ba du ba'i rgyu min las //
analyzed: du ba du ba'i rgyu min las //
translated: Smoke does not arise from what is not the cause of smoke.

original: zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni /
translated: This is what is meant by the phraseüîΩ‚Äúfrom what is not the cause of smoke.‚Äù

original: du ba me'i rang bzhin ma yin pa las 'byung zhing 'thon par khas len na du ba de ni rgyu med par 'gyur te ;
analyzed: du ba me'i rang bzhin ma yin pa las 'byung zhing 'thon par khas len na du ba de ni rgyu med par 'gyur te ;
translated: If you accept that smoke arises from and emerges from what is not the nature of fire, then that smoke would be without a cause,

original: / ji skad bshad pa bzhin no //
analyzed: / ji skad bshad pa bzhin no //
translated: just as it was explained.

original: gzhan gyis 'o na da ni ji ltar zhes bya ba la sogs pa smras te /
analyzed: gzhan gyis 'o na da ni ji ltar zhes bya ba la sogs pa smras te /
translated: Another says, ‚ÄúWell then, how?‚Äù and so on.

original: 'o na zhes bya ba ni mi bzod pa'o //
analyzed: 'o na zhes bya ba ni mi bzod pa'o //
translated: ‚ÄúWell then‚Äù is impatience.

original: da ni zhes bya ba ni du ba la sogs pa gcig rigs mi mthun pa las 'byung bar khas mi len na /
analyzed: da ni zhes bya ba ni du ba la sogs pa gcig rigs mi mthun pa las 'byung bar khas mi len na /
translated: ‚ÄúNow‚Äù means that if one does not accept that a single thing such as smoke arises from a heterogeneous cause,

original: ji ltar lhan cig byed pa tha dad pa las phan tshun @53b rigs mi mthun pa las 'bras bu gcig skye /
analyzed: ji ltar lhan cig byed pa tha dad pa las phan tshun @53b rigs mi mthun pa las 'bras bu gcig skye /
translated: how does a single effect arise from different coemergent causes that are mutually heterogeneous?

original: ji lta bu zhe na /
analyzed: ji lta bu zhe na /
translated: How is that?

original: dper na zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: dper na zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: He says, ‚ÄúFor example,‚Äù and so on.

original: sogs pa zhes bya ba'i sgras ni snang ba dang / yid la byed pa dag bsdu'o //
analyzed: sogs pa zhes bya ba'i sgras ni snang ba dang / yid la byed pa dag bsdu'o //
translated: The word ‚Äúand so on‚Äù includes light and attention.

original: klan ka pa'i bsam pa ni de lta yin na ni rnam par shes pa mig gi rang bzhin las kyang skye /
analyzed: klan ka pa'i bsam pa ni de lta yin na ni rnam par shes pa mig gi rang bzhin las kyang skye /
translated: The opponent‚Äôs thought is this: If that is so, consciousness arises from the nature of the eye,

original: mig gi rang bzhin ma yin pa gzugs dang yid la byed pa las kyang skye ba la 'di rgyu med pa yang ma yin pa de bzhin du du ba yang me las kyang 'byung me las kyang 'byung me ma yin pa brgya byin gyi spyi bo las kyang
analyzed: mig gi rang bzhin ma yin pa gzugs dang yid la byed pa las kyang skye ba la 'di rgyu med pa yang ma yin pa de bzhin du du ba yang me las kyang 'byung me las kyang 'byung me ma yin pa brgya byin gyi spyi bo las kyang
translated: In the same way, smoke arises from fire, but it also arises from the head of Indra, and it also arises from cow dung.

original: 'byung la / rgyu med par yang mi 'gyur ro snyam pa yin no //üîΩde'i rang bzhin gcig pus skyed par byed pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa las ni len 'debs te /
analyzed: 'byung la / rgyu med par yang mi 'gyur ro snyam pa yin no // de'i rang bzhin gcig pus skyed par byed pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa las ni len 'debs te /
translated: It is not causeless.

original: mig la sogs pa'i nang na de'i rang bzhin skyed par byed pa'i rang bzhin yin pa las phan tshun mi ltos par re res skyed par byed pa ni med do //
analyzed: mig la sogs pa'i nang na de'i rang bzhin skyed par byed pa'i rang bzhin yin pa las phan tshun mi ltos par re res skyed par byed pa ni med do //
translated: The opponent replies: ‚ÄúThe nature of the eye, etc., is not such that each of them individually produces consciousness, etc., because they are not independent of each other.‚Äù

original: gal te yod pa zhig tu gyur na ni de'i tshe rgyu so sor 'khrul pa'i phyir rgyu med pa can du gyur pa zhig na /
analyzed: gal te yod pa zhig tu gyur na ni de'i tshe rgyu so sor 'khrul pa'i phyir rgyu med pa can du gyur pa zhig na /
translated: If they were, then since the causes would be confused, they would be causeless.

original: 'on kyang tshogs pas skyed par byed pa de'i rang bzhin yin te skyed par byed pa'i rang bzhin yin no //
analyzed: 'on kyang tshogs pas skyed par byed pa de'i rang bzhin yin te skyed par byed pa'i rang bzhin yin no //
translated: However, the collection is the nature of the producer, i.e., it is the nature of the producer.

original: de'i rang bzhin ma yin pa las skyed par byed pa nyid mi rung ba'i phyir /
analyzed: de'i rang bzhin ma yin pa las skyed par byed pa nyid mi rung ba'i phyir /
translated: Because it is not tenable that the producer is the nature of that which is not its nature.

original: tshogs pas skyed par byed pa zhes bya ba de tsam kho nas de'i rang bzhin yin te zhes bya ba nyid du gyur zin na de ci ste /
analyzed: tshogs pas skyed par byed pa zhes bya ba de tsam kho nas de'i rang bzhin yin te zhes bya ba nyid du gyur zin na de ci ste /
translated: The mere fact that the collection is the producer is the very fact that it is the nature of the producer.

original: de'i rang bzhin yin te zhes logs shig tu brjod ce na /
analyzed: de'i rang bzhin yin te zhes logs shig tu brjod ce na /
translated: So why is it said separately that it is the nature of the producer?

original: bden mod kyi 'on kyang tshogs pa'i gnas skabs kho na na de'i rang bzhin nyid yin gyi sngar yang ma yin phyis kyang ma yin /
analyzed: bden mod kyi 'on kyang tshogs pa'i gnas skabs kho na na de'i rang bzhin nyid yin gyi sngar yang ma yin phyis kyang ma yin /
translated: It is true, but it is only at the time of the collection that it is the nature of the producer, not before and not after,

original: re re yang ma yin no zhes nges par gzung ba'i phyir bshad par zad do //
analyzed: re re yang ma yin no zhes nges par gzung ba'i phyir bshad par zad do //
translated: and not individually.

original: bsdus pa'i don ni rgyu ni 'bras bu gcig la rang gi rgyu'i nus pa nges pa nye ba na byed rgyu so sor nges pa mtha' dag yin no zhes bya ba yin no //
analyzed: bsdus pa'i don ni rgyu ni 'bras bu gcig la rang gi rgyu'i nus pa nges pa nye ba na byed rgyu so sor nges pa mtha' dag yin no zhes bya ba yin no //
translated: The meaning of the summary is that the cause is the totality of the individual certainties of the power of the cause with regard to a single effect when it is near.

original: kha cig ni tshogs pas skyed par byed pa'am /
analyzed: kha cig ni tshogs pas skyed par byed pa'am /
translated: Some say: The collection generates it,

original: de'i rang bzhin na rang bzhin yin te zhes bya ba'i sgra 'don te /
analyzed: de'i rang bzhin na rang bzhin yin te zhes bya ba'i sgra 'don te /
translated: or it has the nature of the collection.

original: 'dir ni 'am zhes bya ba'i sgra cung zad kyang mi dgos pas 'di ni gdon par mi bya ba nyid do //
analyzed: 'dir ni 'am zhes bya ba'i sgra cung zad kyang mi dgos pas 'di ni gdon par mi bya ba nyid do //
translated: But here the term ‚Äúor‚Äù is not needed at all, so it should not be uttered.

original: gal te tshogs pa de bor nas tshogs pa gzhan las kyang mig gi rnam par shes pa bskyad na ni de'i tshe gzhan las skye ba'i phyir rgyu med pa nyid du 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gal te tshogs pa de bor nas tshogs pa gzhan las kyang mig gi rnam par shes pa bskyad na ni de'i tshe gzhan las skye ba'i phyir rgyu med pa nyid du 'gyur ro //
translated: If visual consciousness were generated from another collection apart from that collection, then it would arise causelessly because it would arise from another.

original: 'bras bu tshogs pa de lo na rjes su dpag gi rgyu so so ni ma yin pas de'i phyir 'khrul pa @54a * //
analyzed: 'bras bu tshogs pa de lo na rjes su dpag gi rgyu so so ni ma yin pas de'i phyir 'khrul pa @54a * //
translated: The effect is inferred from the collection, but not from each individual cause, so there is no error.

original: med do snyam du bsam pa yin no //
analyzed: med do snyam du bsam pa yin no //
translated: This is what they think.

original: gal te 'di snyam du me la sogs pa'i tshogs pa ni /üîΩdu ba'i skad cig ma dang po kho na bskyed na de yang rtags nyid ma yin te /
analyzed: gal te 'di snyam du me la sogs pa'i tshogs pa ni / du ba'i skad cig ma dang po kho na bskyed na de yang rtags nyid ma yin te /
translated: If you think that a collection of fire and so on

original: de mi 'dzin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de mi 'dzin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: generates only the first moment of smoke, then that is not a reason because it is not apprehended.

original: du ba'i rgyu 'dzin pa gang yin pa de ni du ba snga ma snga ma'i rgyun 'dzin pa'i rgyu can kho na yin na /
analyzed: du ba'i rgyu 'dzin pa gang yin pa de ni du ba snga ma snga ma'i rgyun 'dzin pa'i rgyu can kho na yin na /
translated: Whatever apprehends the cause of smoke is only caused by the continuity of the prior smoke.

original: ji ltar de las me la sogs pa'i tshogs pa rjes su dpag snyam du sems na /
analyzed: ji ltar de las me la sogs pa'i tshogs pa rjes su dpag snyam du sems na /
translated: If you think, ‚ÄúHow could one infer a collection of fire and so on from that?‚Äù

original: de'i phyir tshogs pa de nyid ces bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: de'i phyir tshogs pa de nyid ces bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: then to respond to that, he says, ‚ÄúThat very collection‚Äù and so on.

original: 'bras bu'i rgyun gyi rang gi ngo bo gnas pa'i rten rgyu dang po'i tshogs pa de med na /
analyzed: 'bras bu'i rgyun gyi rang gi ngo bo gnas pa'i rten rgyu dang po'i tshogs pa de med na /
translated: If the first collection of causes that is the basis for the endurance of the nature of the continuum of the effect did not exist,

original: du ba'i rgyun nyid med pa'i phyir de bas na du ba'i rgyun me'i 'bras bu nyid du gcig tu byas nas rgyur gyur pa sreg pa la sogs pa'i rgyun rjes su dpag ste /
analyzed: du ba'i rgyun nyid med pa'i phyir de bas na du ba'i rgyun me'i 'bras bu nyid du gcig tu byas nas rgyur gyur pa sreg pa la sogs pa'i rgyun rjes su dpag ste /
translated: then the continuum of smoke itself would not exist. Therefore, having made the continuum of smoke into the single effect of fire, one infers the cause, the continuum of burning and so on.

original: tshu rol mthong ba la skad cig ma rnam par dbye bas tha snyad du byed pa ni mi srid do //
analyzed: tshu rol mthong ba la skad cig ma rnam par dbye bas tha snyad du byed pa ni mi srid do //
translated: It is impossible to make a convention by distinguishing the instants for one who sees only this side.

original: 'dis ni gal te 'di snyam du me 'das pa kho na rjes su dpog par byed la /
analyzed: 'dis ni gal te 'di snyam du me 'das pa kho na rjes su dpog par byed la /
translated: This is responding to the following: Suppose someone thinks as follows: One infers only past fire.

original: de ni don byed pa don du gnyer ba la cung zad kyang mi dgos so snyam du sems na de yang yongs su spangs pa yin no //
analyzed: de ni don byed pa don du gnyer ba la cung zad kyang mi dgos so snyam du sems na de yang yongs su spangs pa yin no //
translated: But if you think that it is not necessary for the effect to be present in order for the cause to be engaged in the activity of causing, then that is also completely rejected.

original: de'i tshe don ni 'di yin te me la sogs pa'i skad cig ma snga ma snga ma la brten nas /
analyzed: de'i tshe don ni 'di yin te me la sogs pa'i skad cig ma snga ma snga ma la brten nas /
translated: At that time, this is the meaning: the later and later moments of smoke arise in dependence on the earlier and earlier moments of fire.

original: du ba'i skad cig ma phyi ma phyi ma 'byung ba'i phyir tshogs pa rgyun gyi 'jug pa de nyid 'bras bu rang gi ngo bo gnas shig 'bras bu'i rgyu 'jug pa'i rgyu yin no //üîΩdu ba'i skad cig ma cig kho na mes bskyed par bya ba yin gyi gzhan ni ma yin no zhes bya ba gang yin pa de'i nges pa 'di ni med kyi ji sred du bud shing rnam pa thams cad du thal ba ma lhag pa de srid du
analyzed: du ba'i skad cig ma phyi ma phyi ma 'byung ba'i phyir tshogs pa rgyun gyi 'jug pa de nyid 'bras bu rang gi ngo bo gnas shig 'bras bu'i rgyu 'jug pa'i rgyu yin no // du ba'i skad cig ma cig kho na mes bskyed par bya ba yin gyi gzhan ni ma yin no zhes bya ba gang yin pa de'i nges pa 'di ni med kyi ji sred du bud shing rnam pa thams cad du thal ba ma lhag pa de srid du
translated: Therefore, that very engagement of the continuum of the collection is the cause of the effect, either remaining in its own nature or engaged in the activity of causing the effect.

original: du ba'i skad cig ma rnams 'byung pa mi 'gal lo //
analyzed: du ba'i skad cig ma rnams 'byung pa mi 'gal lo //
translated: There is no certainty in the statement that only one moment of smoke is to be produced by fire and not another, because it is not contradictory for the moments of smoke to arise for as long as the fuel is completely consumed without any embers remaining.

original: de lta bas na bsdus pa'i don ni sreg pa'i skad cig ma phyi ma phyi ma skyed par nus pa'i rgyun 'jug pa'i mes du ba'i rgyun 'jug pa 'dug pa skyed par mngon sum gyis nges par gzung la de lta bu gzhan du nges par bzung nas /
analyzed: de lta bas na bsdus pa'i don ni sreg pa'i skad cig ma phyi ma phyi ma skyed par nus pa'i rgyun 'jug pa'i mes du ba'i rgyun 'jug pa 'dug pa skyed par mngon sum gyis nges par gzung la de lta bu gzhan du nges par bzung nas /
translated: Therefore, the meaning of the summary is this: One directly perceives that the fire which is the cause capable of generating the later and later moments of burning generates the existence of the continuum of smoke.

original: de don du gnyer ba la sreg pa'i rgyun don byed par nus pa rjes su dpag pa mi 'gal lo //
analyzed: de don du gnyer ba la sreg pa'i rgyun don byed par nus pa rjes su dpag pa mi 'gal lo //
translated: Having ascertained that in that way, it is not contradictory to infer that the continuum of burning is capable of functioning for the sake of one who desires that.

original: sreg pa'i rgyun ma chad pa'i du ba'i khyad par yang gzhan yin la /
analyzed: sreg pa'i rgyun ma chad pa'i du ba'i khyad par yang gzhan yin la /
translated: The difference of smoke that is not interrupted by the continuum of burning is also different.

original: sreg pa'i rgyun 'gags pa gnas khang la sogs pa na yod pa'i du ba'i yang gzhan kho na yin te /
analyzed: sreg pa'i rgyun 'gags pa gnas khang la sogs pa na yod pa'i du ba'i yang gzhan kho na yin te /
translated: And the difference of smoke that exists in a house, etc., where the continuum of burning is stopped is also different.

original: de gnyis kyi khyad par yang gsal bar 'jig rten nges par 'dzin to zhes bya ba yin no //
analyzed: de gnyis kyi khyad par yang gsal bar 'jig rten nges par 'dzin to zhes bya ba yin no //
translated: The difference between those two is also ascertained by the world through perception.

original: de ni de lta bu yin no //
analyzed: de ni de lta bu yin no //
translated: That is the way it is.

original: yang na rnam pa gzhan du bshad par bya ste /
analyzed: yang na rnam pa gzhan du bshad par bya ste /
translated: Or, it should be explained in another way.

original: @54b tshogs pa ni mang po rnams la bya bas /
analyzed: @54b tshogs pa ni mang po rnams la bya bas /
translated: An assemblage is a collection of many things.

original: mang po las gcig 'byung na rgyu'i tha dad pa tha dad par byed pa ma yin par 'gyur ba ma yin nam /
analyzed: mang po las gcig 'byung na rgyu'i tha dad pa tha dad par byed pa ma yin par 'gyur ba ma yin nam /
translated: But if one effect arises from many causes, then the difference of the causes would not make a difference, would it?

original: 'on te rgyu so so'i nye bar sbyor ba'i khyad par 'dod na /üîΩde'i tshe nye bar sbyor ba tha dad pa dag dang 'bras bu tha mi dad pa'i phyir du ma nyid du 'gyur ba'am /
analyzed: 'on te rgyu so so'i nye bar sbyor ba'i khyad par 'dod na / de'i tshe nye bar sbyor ba tha dad pa dag dang 'bras bu tha mi dad pa'i phyir du ma nyid du 'gyur ba'am /
translated: But if you assert that the difference of the causes is due to the difference of their individual application,

original: 'bras bu gcig dang tha mi dad pa'i phyir nye bar sbyor ba rnams gcig pa nyid du 'gyur ro zhe na /
analyzed: 'bras bu gcig dang tha mi dad pa'i phyir nye bar sbyor ba rnams gcig pa nyid du 'gyur ro zhe na /
translated: then, because of the difference of the application, the effect would be multiple, or, because of the nondifference of the effect, the applications would be one.

original: de'i phyir tshogs pa de nyid ces bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: de'i phyir tshogs pa de nyid ces bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: Therefore, he says, ‚ÄúThat very assemblage,‚Äù etc.

original: rang gi ngo bo gnas pa'i 'bras bu'i rang gi ngo bo gnas pa'i rten yin no //
analyzed: rang gi ngo bo gnas pa'i 'bras bu'i rang gi ngo bo gnas pa'i rten yin no //
translated: The assemblage is the basis of the effect‚Äôs existence, since it is the cause of the effect‚Äôs existence.

original: de nyid bstan te gang gis na de'i sgo nas 'bras bu du ma nyid du 'gyur ba lhan cig byed pa dag las nye bar sbyor ba dum bur 'gyur ba ni ma yin no //
analyzed: de nyid bstan te gang gis na de'i sgo nas 'bras bu du ma nyid du 'gyur ba lhan cig byed pa dag las nye bar sbyor ba dum bur 'gyur ba ni ma yin no //
translated: He shows just that, since the effect‚Äôs multiplicity would follow from that, the application to the cooperating causes is not partial.

original: 'on kyang tshogs pa dag las 'bras bu skye ba na /
analyzed: 'on kyang tshogs pa dag las 'bras bu skye ba na /
translated: But when the effect arises from the assemblage,

original: gang gis na rigs mthun pa dang rigs mi mthun pa las log par gyur pa de lta bu gcig kho na skye ste /
analyzed: gang gis na rigs mthun pa dang rigs mi mthun pa las log par gyur pa de lta bu gcig kho na skye ste /
translated: But it is only a single effect that arises from a cause that is homogeneous or heterogeneous.

original: 'di ltar mig dang gzugs dang yid la byed pa dag las mig gi rnam par shes pa skye ba na mig gi skad cig ma mig tsam gyi rgyu can dang / gzugs kyi skad cig ma gzugs tsam gyi nye bar len pa can dang / de bzhin du rnam par rtog pa dang bcas pa'i rnam par shes pa yid la byed pa tsam gyi rgyu can las tha dad par skye'o //
analyzed: 'di ltar mig dang gzugs dang yid la byed pa dag las mig gi rnam par shes pa skye ba na mig gi skad cig ma mig tsam gyi rgyu can dang / gzugs kyi skad cig ma gzugs tsam gyi nye bar len pa can dang / de bzhin du rnam par rtog pa dang bcas pa'i rnam par shes pa yid la byed pa tsam gyi rgyu can las tha dad par skye'o //
translated: For example, when visual consciousness arises from eye, form, and attention, the moment of the eye is the effect of the eye alone, the moment of the form is the effect of the form alone, and the moment of the visual consciousness is the effect of the eye and form.üîΩThe effect of the homogeneous cause and the effect of the heterogeneous cause are distinguished only in terms of the cause.

original: 'bras bu la nye bar sbyor ba tha dad par ni rigs mthun pa dang rigs mi mthun pa las log pa nyid gang yin pa 'di kho nar zad la de yang tshogs pa dag kho na las skye ba yod kyi gzhan du ni ma yin no //
analyzed: 'bras bu la nye bar sbyor ba tha dad par ni rigs mthun pa dang rigs mi mthun pa las log pa nyid gang yin pa 'di kho nar zad la de yang tshogs pa dag kho na las skye ba yod kyi gzhan du ni ma yin no //
translated: But the effect arises from the collection of causes and conditions, not from anything else.

original: 'di ni brjod par bya ba mang bas re zhig gzhag go //
analyzed: 'di ni brjod par bya ba mang bas re zhig gzhag go //
translated: This is a very extensive topic, so we will leave it for the time being.

original: gang gi phyir tshogs pa skyed par byed pa yin pa de nyid kyi phyir lhan cig byed pa rnams kyang rnam grangs med par byed pa yin te /
analyzed: gang gi phyir tshogs pa skyed par byed pa yin pa de nyid kyi phyir lhan cig byed pa rnams kyang rnam grangs med par byed pa yin te /
translated: Because the collection is the producer, therefore the co-operators are the producers without exception.

original: rim gyis skye ba med de zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: rim gyis skye ba med de zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: The meaning is that there is no gradual production.

original: gang yang zhes bya ba la sogs pas rigs mi mthun pa las skye ba'i dogs pa bsu bar lan 'debs so //
analyzed: gang yang zhes bya ba la sogs pas rigs mi mthun pa las skye ba'i dogs pa bsu bar lan 'debs so //
translated: In response to the qualm that a result arises from a heterogeneous cause, he says, ‚ÄúEven though it is said, etc.‚Äù

original: sogs pa zhes bya ba'i sgras ni ba lang gi rva las smyug ma dang / ba lang gi spu dang lug gi ba la dag las rtsva d'ur ba skye ba bsdu'o //
analyzed: sogs pa zhes bya ba'i sgras ni ba lang gi rva las smyug ma dang / ba lang gi spu dang lug gi ba la dag las rtsva d'ur ba skye ba bsdu'o //
translated: The word ‚Äúetc.‚Äù includes bamboo from a cow‚Äôs horn, and durva grass from cow hair and sheep wool.

original: de la yang zhes bya ba ni rigs mi mthun pa las 'bras bu skye ba la yang ngo //
analyzed: de la yang zhes bya ba ni rigs mi mthun pa las 'bras bu skye ba la yang ngo //
translated: ‚ÄúEven there‚Äù means even in the case of the arising of a result from a heterogeneous cause.

original: de skad du brjod kyang zhes bya ba ni autpala la sogs pa rigs mi mthun pa las skye pa la autpala @55a * //üîΩla sogs pa zhes brjod kyang ngo //
analyzed: de skad du brjod kyang zhes bya ba ni autpala la sogs pa rigs mi mthun pa las skye pa la autpala @55a * //üîΩla sogs pa zhes brjod kyang ngo //
translated: ‚ÄúEven though it is said‚Äù means even though it is said that a result arises from a heterogeneous cause, such as a blue lotus.üîΩ‚ÄúBlue lotus, etc.‚Äù means that the result is called a blue lotus, etc.

original: autpala la sogs pa gang la rang gi sa bon autpala sogs pa'i mtshan nyid las rab tu 'byung zhing skye ba yod par rang gi sa bon las rab tu 'byung ba can yin pa de'i phyir rang gi ngo bo tha dad pa yod pa kho na'o //
analyzed: autpala la sogs pa gang la rang gi sa bon autpala sogs pa'i mtshan nyid las rab tu 'byung zhing skye ba yod par rang gi sa bon las rab tu 'byung ba can yin pa de'i phyir rang gi ngo bo tha dad pa yod pa kho na'o //
translated: The lotus, etc., is that which arises from its own seed, such as the seed of a lotus, etc., because it arises from its own seed. Therefore, it exists with a different intrinsic nature.

original: ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why?

original: rgyu'i rang gi ngo bo tha dad pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: rgyu'i rang gi ngo bo tha dad pa'i phyir te /
translated: Because of the difference in the intrinsic nature of the cause.

original: rgyu tshogs pa gnyis kyi mtshan nyid kyi rang gi ngo bo tha dad pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rgyu tshogs pa gnyis kyi mtshan nyid kyi rang gi ngo bo tha dad pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The intrinsic nature of the cause is characterized by a twofold collection.

original: chu shing gang la sa bon dang sdong bu las skye ba yod pa de la de skad ces bya ste /
analyzed: chu shing gang la sa bon dang sdong bu las skye ba yod pa de la de skad ces bya ste /
translated: The plantain is that which arises from its seed and trunk.

original: de yang rgyu tha dad pa las phan tshun tha dad pa yin no //
analyzed: de yang rgyu tha dad pa las phan tshun tha dad pa yin no //
translated: It is also different from different causes.üîΩThis difference does not need to be established.

original: tha dad pa 'di ni bsgrub mi dgos so zhes bya bar de lta bu ni zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: tha dad pa 'di ni bsgrub mi dgos so zhes bya bar de lta bu ni zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: To show this, he says, ‚Äúit is like the difference between the two collections of causes.‚Äù

original: rnam par 'byed do zhes bya ba ni tha dad par rtogs pa'o //
analyzed: rnam par 'byed do zhes bya ba ni tha dad par rtogs pa'o //
translated: ‚ÄúIt is distinguished‚Äù means it is understood to be different.

original: shin tu rnam par phye ba'i rnam pa can ni 'khrul pa'i rgyu 'dra ba'i rnam pa dag las rnam par phye bas nges pa'i rnam pa can no //
analyzed: shin tu rnam par phye ba'i rnam pa can ni 'khrul pa'i rgyu 'dra ba'i rnam pa dag las rnam par phye bas nges pa'i rnam pa can no //
translated: The aspect of being well distinguished is the aspect of certainty, because it is distinguished from similar aspects that are causes of error.

original: rjes su 'gro ba ni yod pa nyid na yod pa'o //
analyzed: rjes su 'gro ba ni yod pa nyid na yod pa'o //
translated: Pervasion is the existence of the effect when the cause exists.

original: ldog pa ni de med na med pa'o //
analyzed: ldog pa ni de med na med pa'o //
translated: Reversal is the nonexistence of the effect when the cause does not exist.

original: rjes su 'gro ba dang ldog pa ni rjes su 'gro ba dang ldog pa ste /
analyzed: rjes su 'gro ba dang ldog pa ni rjes su 'gro ba dang ldog pa ste /
translated: Pervasion and reversal are pervasion and reversal.

original: de las 'bras bu'i rang bzhin gang zhig rjes su 'gro bar bya ba rgyu gang gi rjes su 'gro bar byed par mthong ba rjes su 'gro bar byed pa de'i rang bzhin ni de'i rgyu can te /
analyzed: de las 'bras bu'i rang bzhin gang zhig rjes su 'gro bar bya ba rgyu gang gi rjes su 'gro bar byed par mthong ba rjes su 'gro bar byed pa de'i rang bzhin ni de'i rgyu can te /
translated: That which is the nature of the effect, which is to be pervaded, is seen to pervade the cause, which is the pervader. The nature of that which is pervaded is the cause of that which pervades.

original: gang la rgyu rjes su 'gro bar bya ba de yod pa zhes bya bar tshig rnam par sbyar ro //
analyzed: gang la rgyu rjes su 'gro bar bya ba de yod pa zhes bya bar tshig rnam par sbyar ro //
translated: That which has the cause to be pervaded is called existent.
