original: gang gi tshe rgyu la ltos nas brjod pa de'i tshe ni rjes su 'gro ba me la sogs pa de'i rang bzhin ni de'i rgyu yin te /
analyzed: gang gi tshe rgyu la ltos nas brjod pa de'i tshe ni rjes su 'gro ba me la sogs pa de'i rang bzhin ni de'i rgyu yin te /
translated: When it is said to be dependent on the cause, then the nature of that pervasion, such as fire, is the cause of that.

original: 'bras bur 'dod pa du ba la sogs pa de'i rgyu yin no //
analyzed: 'bras bur 'dod pa du ba la sogs pa de'i rgyu yin no //
translated: Smoke, etc., which are accepted as effects, are the causes of fire, etc.

original: gang gi phyir de ltar phan tshun ltos pas rgyu dang 'bras bu dag gi rang bzhin nges pa de'i phyir /
analyzed: gang gi phyir de ltar phan tshun ltos pas rgyu dang 'bras bu dag gi rang bzhin nges pa de'i phyir /
translated: Because in this way the nature of cause and effect is ascertained through mutual dependence,

original: rgyu dang rigs mi mthun pa las mi 'byung ngo //
analyzed: rgyu dang rigs mi mthun pa las mi 'byung ngo //
translated: an effect does not arise from a cause that is heterogeneous.

original: de lta bas na lan cig mthong ba dang ma mthong ba dag gis kyang zhes bya ba ni ji skad bshad pa'i mngon sum dang / mi dmigs pa dag gis rgyu dang 'bras bu'i dngos po grub pa'i phyir /
analyzed: de lta bas na lan cig mthong ba dang ma mthong ba dag gis kyang zhes bya ba ni ji skad bshad pa'i mngon sum dang / mi dmigs pa dag gis rgyu dang 'bras bu'i dngos po grub pa'i phyir /
translated: Therefore, even on the basis of a single instance of seeing and not seeing, i.e., on the basis of the direct perception and non-apprehension that have been described, the fact of causality is established.

original: rgyu dang 'bras bu grub pa des de rtogs te rjes su 'gro ba dang ldog pa rtogs so //
analyzed: rgyu dang 'bras bu grub pa des de rtogs te rjes su 'gro ba dang ldog pa rtogs so //
translated: The establishment of causality is the understanding of the invariable concomitance of the effect with the cause and the absence of the effect in the absence of the cause.

original: gzhan du ni ma yin te zhes bya ba ni rgyu dang 'bras bu'i dngos po nges pa ma rtogs pa mthong ba dang / ma mthong ba 'ga' zhig gis rjes su 'gro ba dang ldog pa dag rtogs pa ni ma yin pa'o //
analyzed: gzhan du ni ma yin te zhes bya ba ni rgyu dang 'bras bu'i dngos po nges pa ma rtogs pa mthong ba dang / ma mthong ba 'ga' zhig gis rjes su 'gro ba dang ldog pa dag rtogs pa ni ma yin pa'o //
translated: It is not otherwise, i.e., the invariable concomitance of the effect with the cause and the absence of the effect in the absence of the cause is not understood on the basis of any instance of seeing and not seeing, where the fact of causality is not ascertained.

original: ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is this?

original: rjes su 'gro ba dang ldog pa rtogs pa mthong ba dang ma @55b mthong ba tsam la rag las pa ni ma lus par mthong ba dang ma mthong ba dag la rag las pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: rjes su 'gro ba dang ldog pa rtogs pa mthong ba dang ma @55b mthong ba tsam la rag las pa ni ma lus par mthong ba dang ma mthong ba dag la rag las pa'i phyir te /
translated: The realization of the forward and reverse pervasions is dependent on merely seeing and not seeing, because it is dependent on seeing and not seeing without remainder.

original: mthong ba yang gal te mthun pa'i phyogs ma lus pa la gtan tshigs mthong bar gyur na de lta na rjes su 'gro ba sgrub par byed la /
analyzed: mthong ba yang gal te mthun pa'i phyogs ma lus pa la gtan tshigs mthong bar gyur na de lta na rjes su 'gro ba sgrub par byed la /
translated: If the reason is seen in every homologous case, then the forward pervasion is established.

original: de bzhin du ma mthong ba la yang gal te bsgrub par bya ba ldog pa ma lus pa la gtan tshigs ma mthong bar gyur na de lta na ldog pa sgrub par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de bzhin du ma mthong ba la yang gal te bsgrub par bya ba ldog pa ma lus pa la gtan tshigs ma mthong bar gyur na de lta na ldog pa sgrub par 'gyur ro //
translated: Similarly, if the reason is not seen in every heterogeneous case, then the reverse pervasion is established.

original: ji ltar du ba gsal ba gcig la lan cig mthong bas kyang 'bras bu nyid du grub pas thams cad la de lta bu yin pa de bzhin du mthun pa'i phyogs dang mi mthun pa'i phyogs 'ga' zhig la mthong ba dang ma mthong ba las thams cad la
analyzed: ji ltar du ba gsal ba gcig la lan cig mthong bas kyang 'bras bu nyid du grub pas thams cad la de lta bu yin pa de bzhin du mthun pa'i phyogs dang mi mthun pa'i phyogs 'ga' zhig la mthong ba dang ma mthong ba las thams cad la
translated: Just as the mere seeing of one instance of smoke establishes it as the effect, and thus it is in all cases, so too, in some homologous and heterogeneous cases, the forward and reverse pervasions are established by seeing and not seeing.

original: rjes su 'gro ba dang ldog pa nges par 'gyur ro snyam na yang ldog pa yin te /
analyzed: rjes su 'gro ba dang ldog pa nges par 'gyur ro snyam na yang ldog pa yin te /
translated: But if you think that the pervasion is ascertained by the positive and negative concomitances, then the pervasion is not ascertained.

original: 'di ltar nam mkha' la sogs par gtogs pa lus can ma yin pa nyid 'ga' zhig la rtag pa nyid mthong yang ste 'di ni gzhan la grags pa brjod pa yin no /üîΩ// / bam po drug pa /
analyzed: 'di ltar nam mkha' la sogs par gtogs pa lus can ma yin pa nyid 'ga' zhig la rtag pa nyid mthong yang ste 'di ni gzhan la grags pa brjod pa yin no / // / bam po drug pa /
translated: For example, although one sees that some non-embodiments, such as space, are permanent, this is not a proof that all non-embodiments are permanent.

original: gzhan la zhes bya ba ni bde ba la sogs pa la'o //
analyzed: gzhan la zhes bya ba ni bde ba la sogs pa la'o //
translated: The other is pleasure, etc.

original: gzhan du zhes bya ba ni mi rtag pa nyid la gtan tshigs lus can ma yin pa nyid mthong ba'i phyir gcig la mthong ba thams cad la de lta bu yin par bsgrub pa ma yin no //
analyzed: gzhan du zhes bya ba ni mi rtag pa nyid la gtan tshigs lus can ma yin pa nyid mthong ba'i phyir gcig la mthong ba thams cad la de lta bu yin par bsgrub pa ma yin no //
translated: The other is impermanence. Because the reason, non-embodiment, is seen in the other, it is not a proof that whatever is seen in one is so in all.

original: de'i phyir mthong ba ni rjes su 'gro ba la 'khrul pa can yin no //
analyzed: de'i phyir mthong ba ni rjes su 'gro ba la 'khrul pa can yin no //
translated: Therefore, the reason is mistaken with regard to the positive concomitance.

original: de bzhin du bum pa la sogs pa rtag pa nyid med pa 'ga' zhig la lus can ma yin pa nyid ma mthong ba yang bde ba la sogs pa rtag pa nyid med pa kho na la mthong ba'i phyir te /
analyzed: de bzhin du bum pa la sogs pa rtag pa nyid med pa 'ga' zhig la lus can ma yin pa nyid ma mthong ba yang bde ba la sogs pa rtag pa nyid med pa kho na la mthong ba'i phyir te /
translated: Likewise, the non-apprehension of non-embodiment in some things, such as a pot, which do not have permanence, is seen in only those things, such as pleasure, which do not have permanence.

original: de bas na mi mthun pa'i phyogs gcig la ma mthong ba ldog pa nges par byed pa'i sgrub pa ma yin no //
analyzed: de bas na mi mthun pa'i phyogs gcig la ma mthong ba ldog pa nges par byed pa'i sgrub pa ma yin no //
translated: Therefore, non-apprehension in one instance of the counter-correlate is not a proof that ascertains the negation.

original: de lta bas na rgyu dang 'bras bu'i dngos po nges pa kho na las rjes su 'gro ba dang ldog dpag nges pa yin no //
analyzed: de lta bas na rgyu dang 'bras bu'i dngos po nges pa kho na las rjes su 'gro ba dang ldog dpag nges pa yin no //
translated: Thus, the ascertainment of the pervasion is only from the ascertainment of the relation of cause and effect.

original: gzhan gyis 'bras bu ni zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /üîΩde zhes bya ba ni rgyu dang 'bras bu med na mi 'byung bar ni bsgrubs zin na /
analyzed: gzhan gyis 'bras bu ni zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te / de zhes bya ba ni rgyu dang 'bras bu med na mi 'byung bar ni bsgrubs zin na /
translated: Another says: ‚ÄúThe effect, etc.‚Äù

original: de rang bzhin gyi gtan tshigs la ji ltar med na mi 'byung ba yin zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: de rang bzhin gyi gtan tshigs la ji ltar med na mi 'byung ba yin zhes bya ba'o //
translated: Since the non-occurrence of the effect without the cause has already been established, he says, ‚ÄúThat,‚Äù i.e., the cause, ‚Äúis the natural evidence.‚Äù How is it that the effect does not occur without the cause?

original: rang bzhin yod pa tsam dang 'brel pa can gyi ngo bo yang gtan tshigs yin zhes bya ba la sogs pas rtag pa nyid du rang bzhin gyi gtan tshigs kyi med na mi 'byung ba bsgrubs zin pa ma yin nam zhe na /
analyzed: rang bzhin yod pa tsam dang 'brel pa can gyi ngo bo yang gtan tshigs yin zhes bya ba la sogs pas rtag pa nyid du rang bzhin gyi gtan tshigs kyi med na mi 'byung ba bsgrubs zin pa ma yin nam zhe na /
translated: But didn‚Äôt we already prove that the non-observation of a nature related to mere existence is a correct sign proving the non-existence of a permanent nature?

original: bden na gzhan 'di snyam du rang bzhin de @56a * //üîΩtsam dang 'brel pa ji lta ba bzhin du gyur pa de la med na mi 'byung ba brjod pa de la dam bcas pa'i don gyi phyogs gcig gtan tshigs su 'gyur ro snyam du sems la /üîΩgrub pa'i mtha' smra ba yang gzhan sel ba rab tu bsgrub pa mjug thogs su 'byung bas /
analyzed: bden na gzhan 'di snyam du rang bzhin de @56a * // tsam dang 'brel pa ji lta ba bzhin du gyur pa de la med na mi 'byung ba brjod pa de la dam bcas pa'i don gyi phyogs gcig gtan tshigs su 'gyur ro snyam du sems la / grub pa'i mtha' smra ba yang gzhan sel ba rab tu bsgrub pa mjug thogs su 'byung bas /
translated: If you say that is true, then the other party thinks as follows: ‚ÄúThe non-observation of a nature related to mere existence is a correct sign proving the non-existence of a permanent nature.üîΩBut the opponent thinks that the statement of the non-observation of a nature related to mere existence is a correct sign proving the non-existence of a permanent nature.üîΩThe proponent of tenets thinks that the statement of the non-observation of a nature related to mere existence is a correct sign proving the non-existence of a permanent nature.

original: dam bcas pa'i don gyi phyogs gcig pa nyid yin pa yongs su spangs par sems shing /
analyzed: dam bcas pa'i don gyi phyogs gcig pa nyid yin pa yongs su spangs par sems shing /
translated: But the opponent thinks that the statement of the non-observation of a nature related to mere existence is a correct sign proving the non-existence of a permanent nature.üîΩBut the opponent thinks that the statement of the non-observation of a nature related to mere existence is a correct sign proving the non-existence of a permanent nature.üîΩBut the opponent thinks that the statement of the non-observation of a nature related to mere existence is a correct sign proving the non-existence of a permanent nature.üîΩBut the opponent thinks that the statement of the non-observation of a nature related to mere existence is a correct sign proving the non-existence of a permanent nature.üîΩBut the opponent thinks that the statement of the non-observation of a nature related to mere existence is a correct sign proving the non-existence of a permanent nature.üîΩBut the opponent thinks that the statement of the non-observation of a nature related to mere existence is a correct sign proving the non-existence of a permanent nature.üîΩBut the opponent thinks that the statement of the non-observation of a nature related to mere existence is a correct sign proving the non-existence of a permanent nature.üîΩBut the opponent thinks that the statement of the non-observation of a nature related to mere existence is a correct sign proving the non-existence of a permanent nature.üîΩBut the opponent thinks that the statement of the non-observation of a nature related to mere existence is a correct sign proving the non-existence of a permanent nature.üîΩBut the opponent thinks that the statement of the non-observation of a nature related to mere existence is a correct sign proving the non-existence of a permanent nature.

original: de tsam dang 'brel pa kho na la med na mi 'byung ba sngar bshad pa bzlas te /
analyzed: de tsam dang 'brel pa kho na la med na mi 'byung ba sngar bshad pa bzlas te /
translated: But the opponent thinks that the statement of the non-observation of a nature related to mere existence is a correct sign proving the non-

original: rang bzhin la yang med na mi 'byung ba zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: rang bzhin la yang med na mi 'byung ba zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: If it does not exist even in the essential nature, then the so-called invariable concomitance does not exist.

original: rang bzhin la yang rang bzhin gyi gtan tshigs la yang med na mi 'byung ba'o //
analyzed: rang bzhin la yang rang bzhin gyi gtan tshigs la yang med na mi 'byung ba'o //
translated: If it does not exist even in the essential nature, then the so-called invariable concomitance does not exist even in the essential nature of the reason.

original: bsgrub par bya ba gang yin zhe na /
analyzed: bsgrub par bya ba gang yin zhe na /
translated: What is the probandum?

original: yod pa tsam dang 'brel pa'i yin //
analyzed: yod pa tsam dang 'brel pa'i yin //
translated: It is the mere existence that is related to it.

original: gang zhig ces bya ba la sogs pas ni 'di nyid rnam par 'chad do //
analyzed: gang zhig ces bya ba la sogs pas ni 'di nyid rnam par 'chad do //
translated: This is explained by the words ‚Äúthat which‚Äù and so on.

original: yod pa med na mi 'byung bar 'dod ces bya ba ni yod pa mi rtag pa nyid la sogs pa ste /
analyzed: yod pa med na mi 'byung bar 'dod ces bya ba ni yod pa mi rtag pa nyid la sogs pa ste /
translated: The so-called invariable concomitance is asserted to be the nonexistence of the probandum.

original: 'di ltar de med na bsgrub par bya ba'i chos yod pa tsam dang 'brel pa med na gtan tshigs nyid du smos pa'i yod pa med par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: 'di ltar de med na bsgrub par bya ba'i chos yod pa tsam dang 'brel pa med na gtan tshigs nyid du smos pa'i yod pa med par 'gyur ro //
translated: If the mere existence of the probandum is not related to it, then the so-called reason would not exist in the absence of the existence of the probandum.

original: ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: bsgrub par bya ba dang sgrub pa dag tha dad pa med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: bsgrub par bya ba dang sgrub pa dag tha dad pa med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because the probandum and the proof are not different.

original: tha dad pa med pa nyid ngo bo gang kho na zhes bya ba la sogs pa ston to //
analyzed: tha dad pa med pa nyid ngo bo gang kho na zhes bya ba la sogs pa ston to //
translated: The nondifference is taught by the words ‚Äúthat very nature‚Äù and so on.

original: mi rtag pa nyid la sogs pa'i ngo bo gang kho na byas pa yod pa tsam la rag las pa'i rang bzhin yin par brjod pa de kho na rgyu mtshan gzhan la mi ltos pa'i phyir rang gis dngos su don dam par yod pa yin te byas paüîΩnyid yin no //
analyzed: mi rtag pa nyid la sogs pa'i ngo bo gang kho na byas pa yod pa tsam la rag las pa'i rang bzhin yin par brjod pa de kho na rgyu mtshan gzhan la mi ltos pa'i phyir rang gis dngos su don dam par yod pa yin te byas pa nyid yin no //
translated: Whatever nature of impermanence and so on is said to be the essence that is dependent on mere existence, that is the reason that does not rely on another, and therefore it is ultimately existent by its own nature, because it is produced.

original: yod pa de yang bdag nyid rang gi ngo bor gyur pa mi rtag pa nyid bor nas ji ltar yod par 'gyur /
analyzed: yod pa de yang bdag nyid rang gi ngo bor gyur pa mi rtag pa nyid bor nas ji ltar yod par 'gyur /
translated: Moreover, how could that which exists, having discarded its own nature of impermanence, exist?

original: gzhan gyis 'o na ni zhes bya ba la sogs pa smas te /
analyzed: gzhan gyis 'o na ni zhes bya ba la sogs pa smas te /
translated: BhƒÅviveka says ‚ÄúIf you say that . . .‚Äù

original: dam bcas pa ni phyogs bstan pa'o //
analyzed: dam bcas pa ni phyogs bstan pa'o //
translated: The thesis is the position stated.

original: de'i don ni chos dang chos can spyi'o //
analyzed: de'i don ni chos dang chos can spyi'o //
translated: Its meaning is the general subject matter.

original: de'i phyogs gcig po bsgrub par bya ba'i chos kyi bdag nyid gtan tshigs su 'gyur te /
analyzed: de'i phyogs gcig po bsgrub par bya ba'i chos kyi bdag nyid gtan tshigs su 'gyur te /
translated: One part of that, the probandum, becomes the nature of the reason.

original: 'di ltar sgra ni mi rtag ste /
analyzed: 'di ltar sgra ni mi rtag ste /
translated: In this way, sound is impermanent.

original: mi rtag pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba dang / mi rtag ste byas pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba ni rtsis mgo gcig la de lta yin na ni gtan tshigs ma grub po snyam du bsams pa yin no //
analyzed: mi rtag pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba dang / mi rtag ste byas pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba ni rtsis mgo gcig la de lta yin na ni gtan tshigs ma grub po snyam du bsams pa yin no //
translated: The reason because it is impermanent and because it is impermanent, being produced is not established if one thinks that it is the same in the case of the first topic.

original: grub pa'i mtha' smra bas de ni nyes pa med do zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: grub pa'i mtha' smra bas de ni nyes pa med do zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: The proponent of tenets says, ‚ÄúThat is not a fault,‚Äù and so on.

original: rang bzhin gyi zhes bya ba ni ngo bo nyid kyis so //
analyzed: rang bzhin gyi zhes bya ba ni ngo bo nyid kyis so //
translated: ‚ÄúBy nature‚Äù means by essence.

original: rang rang gi ngo bo ni rang gi ngo bo ste de la gnas pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rang rang gi ngo bo ni rang gi ngo bo ste de la gnas pa'i phyir ro //
translated: ‚ÄúIts own nature‚Äù is its own essence. Because it abides in that.

original: mthun dngos @56b gzhan gyi dngos dag las //
analyzed: mthun dngos @56b gzhan gyi dngos dag las //
translated: From similar and dissimilar things.

original: zhes bya ba la mthun dngos zhes bya ba'i sgras ni rigs mthun par bstan to //
analyzed: zhes bya ba la mthun dngos zhes bya ba'i sgras ni rigs mthun par bstan to //
translated: The term ‚Äúsimilar things‚Äù indicates a similar type.

original: gzhan gyi dngos po ni rigs mi mthun pa'o //
analyzed: gzhan gyi dngos po ni rigs mi mthun pa'o //
translated: ‚ÄúDissimilar things‚Äù are a dissimilar type.

original: de dag las te de ltar yang rigs mthun par 'dod pa dang zhes rnam par 'grel par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de dag las te de ltar yang rigs mthun par 'dod pa dang zhes rnam par 'grel par 'gyur ro //
translated: From those, and thus it is explained in the Subcommentary: ‚ÄúIt is asserted that it is similar.‚Äù

original: gang dag rang dngos gzhan gyi dngos dag gis //
analyzed: gang dag rang dngos gzhan gyi dngos dag gis //
translated: From its own nature and from the nature of others.

original: zhes 'don pa de dag gis kyang rang dngos zhes bya ba'i sgra ni rigs mthun pa'i don du bshad dgos so //
analyzed: zhes 'don pa de dag gis kyang rang dngos zhes bya ba'i sgra ni rigs mthun pa'i don du bshad dgos so //
translated: Also, those who recite the verse the word 'own' is explained to have the meaning of a homogeneous object must explain the word 'own' in the phrase own nature in the same way.

original: sten pa ni sten par byed pa'o //
analyzed: sten pa ni sten par byed pa'o //
translated: The word possessing means having.

original: de gang dag la yod pa de dag la de skad ces bya ste /
analyzed: de gang dag la yod pa de dag la de skad ces bya ste /
translated: Those who have that are called possessors.

original: ldog pa dang ldan pa yin no zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: ldog pa dang ldan pa yin no zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: That is to say, they are possessors of the opposite.

original: de'i rgyu can gyi zhes bya ba ni ldog pa'i rgyu can gyi'o //
analyzed: de'i rgyu can gyi zhes bya ba ni ldog pa'i rgyu can gyi'o //
translated: The phrase having that as its cause means having the opposite as its cause.

original: rigs dbye zhes bya ba ni chos kyi bye brag ste mi rtag pa nyid la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: rigs dbye zhes bya ba ni chos kyi bye brag ste mi rtag pa nyid la sogs pa'o //
translated: The word distinction means a particular quality, such as impermanence.

original: de'i khyad par gyis rtogs 'gyur ba dag ces bya ba ni ldog pa'i rang gi ngo bo'i khyad par bye brag byas pa nyid la sogs pa gang yin pa de'i sgo nas sgra dang rtags dag gis brgyud pas dngos po de lta bu rtogs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de'i khyad par gyis rtogs 'gyur ba dag ces bya ba ni ldog pa'i rang gi ngo bo'i khyad par bye brag byas pa nyid la sogs pa gang yin pa de'i sgo nas sgra dang rtags dag gis brgyud pas dngos po de lta bu rtogs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The phrase that is understood through its distinction means that sound and signs indirectly cause the understanding of that kind of object through the distinction of the nature of the opposite, such as being produced, etc.

original: gang gi phyir de lta bu yin pa de'i phyir ldog pa'i khyad par brtags pa las ldog pa la ltos te /
analyzed: gang gi phyir de lta bu yin pa de'i phyir ldog pa'i khyad par brtags pa las ldog pa la ltos te /
translated: Because it is so, therefore, the distinction of the reverse is imagined, and in dependence on the reverse,

original: rnam par gzhag pa mi rtag pa nyid gang zhig mi rtag pa zhes bya ba'i sgra can gyi chos gang gis go bar 'gyur ba khyad par de ni de las gzhan gyis mi rtag pa zhes bya ba'i sgra las gzhan pa byas pa zhes bya ba'i sgras te
analyzed: rnam par gzhag pa mi rtag pa nyid gang zhig mi rtag pa zhes bya ba'i sgra can gyi chos gang gis go bar 'gyur ba khyad par de ni de las gzhan gyis mi rtag pa zhes bya ba'i sgra las gzhan pa byas pa zhes bya ba'i sgras te
translated: the distinction of impermanence is established, by means of any dharma that has the word impermanent, and that is understood by that word. That distinction is not by another, by the word impermanent, but by the word produced.

original: / de bzhin du thams cad la brjod par bya'o //
analyzed: / de bzhin du thams cad la brjod par bya'o //
translated: And so for all.

original: rgyu des na tha dad rnam par gnas te /
analyzed: rgyu des na tha dad rnam par gnas te /
translated: By that cause, there is a different abiding,

original: sgra'i don rnam par gnas pa tha dad pa yin no //
analyzed: sgra'i don rnam par gnas pa tha dad pa yin no //
translated: a different abiding of the meaning of the word.

original: dngos po thams cad ni zhes bya ba la sogs pas ni tshig le'ur byas pa'i don ston te /üîΩgang dag la rang gi ngo bo la rang gi bdag nyid la gnas pa yod pa de dag la de skad ces bya'o //
analyzed: dngos po thams cad ni zhes bya ba la sogs pas ni tshig le'ur byas pa'i don ston te / gang dag la rang gi ngo bo la rang gi bdag nyid la gnas pa yod pa de dag la de skad ces bya'o //
translated: By ‚Äúall things‚Äù and so on, he shows the meaning of the verse.üîΩThose that have their own nature, their own essence, are said to be so.

original: rang gi ngo bo la gnas pa'i dngos po de dag ni rang dang gzhan du ste /
analyzed: rang gi ngo bo la gnas pa'i dngos po de dag ni rang dang gzhan du ste /
translated: Those things that abide in their own nature are their own and others.

original: rang gi ngo bo las gzhan pa dang 'dra zhing gcig tu mi byed de /
analyzed: rang gi ngo bo las gzhan pa dang 'dra zhing gcig tu mi byed de /
translated: It does not make them similar and one with itself, because they are different from it.

original: ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: 'dre bar bya ba gzhan de gzhan ma yin pa nyid du thal bar 'gyur te /
analyzed: 'dre bar bya ba gzhan de gzhan ma yin pa nyid du thal bar 'gyur te /
translated: Because it follows that what is mixed with something else is not different from it,

original: bdag nyid yin par thal bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: bdag nyid yin par thal bar 'gyur ro //
translated: because it follows that it is itself.

original: gal te bum pa la sogs pa'i bye brag rnams la yon tan gsum po rang gi bdag nyid du gyur pa yod de /
analyzed: gal te bum pa la sogs pa'i bye brag rnams la yon tan gsum po rang gi bdag nyid du gyur pa yod de /
translated: If you think that the three qualities exist in the particulars such as pots,

original: des na 'dres pa kho na yin no snyam du sems na /üîΩde'i phyir gang yang 'di dag gi zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: des na 'dres pa kho na yin no snyam du sems na / de'i phyir gang yang 'di dag gi zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: and therefore they are just mixed,üîΩthen NƒÅgƒÅrjuna explains, ‚ÄúBut it is not possible to designate . . .‚Äù

original: 'di dag gi @57a * //
analyzed: 'di dag gi @57a * //
translated: ‚ÄúThese‚Äù

original: zhes bya ba ni dngos po dag gi'o //
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni dngos po dag gi'o //
translated: refers to entities.

original: rang gi bdag nyid du gyur pa zhes bya ba ni tha mi dad pa'o //
analyzed: rang gi bdag nyid du gyur pa zhes bya ba ni tha mi dad pa'o //
translated: ‚ÄúIn their own nature‚Äù means without being different.

original: ngo bo ni rang gi ngo bo'o //
analyzed: ngo bo ni rang gi ngo bo'o //
translated: ‚ÄúNature‚Äù means own nature.

original: tha mi dad pa zhes bya ba ni gcig pa'o //
analyzed: tha mi dad pa zhes bya ba ni gcig pa'o //
translated: ‚ÄúWithout being different‚Äù means as one.

original: ngo bo de ni bye brag de dag gi yin no zhes bya bar tha snyad gdags par nus pa ma yin no //
analyzed: ngo bo de ni bye brag de dag gi yin no zhes bya bar tha snyad gdags par nus pa ma yin no //
translated: It is not possible to designate that nature as the nature of those particulars.

original: ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: yon tan gsum po gcig gi bdag nyid du gyur pa /
analyzed: yon tan gsum po gcig gi bdag nyid du gyur pa /
translated: The three gunas are the nature of one another.üîΩ

original: de'i tshe bum pa la sogs pa'i khyad par de dag med pa'i phyir ro //üîΩgal te dngos po rnams ngo bo gcig tu gyur na de'i tshe /
analyzed: de'i tshe bum pa la sogs pa'i khyad par de dag med pa'i phyir ro // gal te dngos po rnams ngo bo gcig tu gyur na de'i tshe /
translated: because at that time the distinctions of pot and so on would not exist.

original: de kho na dngos po rnams tha mi dad pa yin par 'gyur te /
analyzed: de kho na dngos po rnams tha mi dad pa yin par 'gyur te /
translated: If things were of one nature, then at that time they would be undifferentiated.

original: tha mi dad pa yin pa'i phyir zhing yod pa'i phyir dang / de la ma gtogs pa tha dad pa'i bdag nyid de la ma gtogs pa tha dad pa yang med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: tha mi dad pa yin pa'i phyir zhing yod pa'i phyir dang / de la ma gtogs pa tha dad pa'i bdag nyid de la ma gtogs pa tha dad pa yang med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because they are undifferentiated, they would exist in the field, and because they are not differentiated, they would not exist apart from that.

original: gal te yon tan gsum po tha mi dad kyang bum pa la sogs pa'i bye brag 'phel ba dang 'grib pas byas par 'gyur ro zhe na /
analyzed: gal te yon tan gsum po tha mi dad kyang bum pa la sogs pa'i bye brag 'phel ba dang 'grib pas byas par 'gyur ro zhe na /
translated: If the three qualities are undifferentiated, but are produced by the increase and decrease of distinctions such as pot,

original: de nyid ces bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: de nyid ces bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: then NƒÅgƒÅrjuna says:

original: yon tan gsum po tha mi dad pa nyid kyang 'phel ba la sogs pas tha dad par 'gal ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: yon tan gsum po tha mi dad pa nyid kyang 'phel ba la sogs pas tha dad par 'gal ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Because the three qualities are undifferentiated, it is contradictory that they are differentiated by increase and so on.

original: de lta bas na dngos po rnams phan tshun rjes su 'gro bar khas len na /
analyzed: de lta bas na dngos po rnams phan tshun rjes su 'gro bar khas len na /
translated: Therefore, if you accept that things are mutually related,

original: ngo bo gcig pa kho nar gnas pa yin no //
analyzed: ngo bo gcig pa kho nar gnas pa yin no //
translated: they must exist as having the same nature.

original: ngo bo gcig pa de yang bdag nyid la rang gi ngo bo nyid la rnam par gnas pas skyes bu'i ngo bo dang ma 'dres pa kho na yin te /
analyzed: ngo bo gcig pa de yang bdag nyid la rang gi ngo bo nyid la rnam par gnas pas skyes bu'i ngo bo dang ma 'dres pa kho na yin te /
translated: Moreover, that same nature is not mixed with the nature of a person, because it exists in its own nature, in its own entity.

original: de lta na yang gzhan sel ba grub pa kho na'o //
analyzed: de lta na yang gzhan sel ba grub pa kho na'o //
translated: Even so, the establishment of the exclusion of other is still tenable.

original: yang bye brag pa rnams ni spyi don gzhan gyis dngos po rnams mtshungs par 'dod de /
analyzed: yang bye brag pa rnams ni spyi don gzhan gyis dngos po rnams mtshungs par 'dod de /
translated: Moreover, the Vai≈õe·π£ikas assert that things are similar because of a different universal.

original: de yang bsal ba'i phyir don gzhan yang zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: de yang bsal ba'i phyir don gzhan yang zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: To refute that, he says, ‚ÄúEven if the other exists, etc.‚Äù

original: yod pa nyid dang ba lang nyid la sogs pa don gzhan yang don du ma dang 'brel du zin kyang gsal ba'i khyad par de dag gi spyi ma yin no //
analyzed: yod pa nyid dang ba lang nyid la sogs pa don gzhan yang don du ma dang 'brel du zin kyang gsal ba'i khyad par de dag gi spyi ma yin no //
translated: Even if existence, cowness, etc., which are different objects, are related to many objects, they are not the universals of those particular instances.

original: ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: de'i ngo bo ma yin pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: de'i ngo bo ma yin pa'i phyir te /
translated: Because they are not its nature.

original: gsal ba'i khyad par dag dang mtshan nyid mi 'dra ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gsal ba'i khyad par dag dang mtshan nyid mi 'dra ba'i phyir ro //
translated: That is because the particular instances and the universal have different characteristics.

original: 'on te de'i ngo bo ma yin yang gcig ma yin pa dag dang ldan pa de tsam gyis de dag gi spyi yin na ni de'i tshe gnyis nyid la sogs pa dang ldan pa dang 'bras bu'i rdzas dag la yang spyi'i ngo bo nyid du thal bar 'gyurüîΩba'i phyir te /
analyzed: 'on te de'i ngo bo ma yin yang gcig ma yin pa dag dang ldan pa de tsam gyis de dag gi spyi yin na ni de'i tshe gnyis nyid la sogs pa dang ldan pa dang 'bras bu'i rdzas dag la yang spyi'i ngo bo nyid du thal bar 'gyur ba'i phyir te /
translated: But if it is not of that nature, but is the universal of those things that are not one, then it follows that duality and so on, and the substance of the effect, would also have the nature of a universal.

original: gnyis nyid kyang rdzas gcig ma yin pa dang ldan no //
analyzed: gnyis nyid kyang rdzas gcig ma yin pa dang ldan no //
translated: For duality is related to that which is not one substance.

original: sogs pa zhes bya ba'i sgra ni mang po nyid la sogs pa bsdu'o //
analyzed: sogs pa zhes bya ba'i sgra ni mang po nyid la sogs pa bsdu'o //
translated: The word ‚Äúand so on‚Äù includes plurality and so on.

original: de bzhin du ldan pa yang rdzas gcig ma yin pa'i rten @57b can yin no //
analyzed: de bzhin du ldan pa yang rdzas gcig ma yin pa'i rten @57b can yin no //
translated: Similarly, inherence is the substratum of that which is not one substance.

original: 'bras bu'i rdzas ni yan lag can zhes bya ba ste /
analyzed: 'bras bu'i rdzas ni yan lag can zhes bya ba ste /
translated: The substance of the effect is called the whole,

original: rtsom par byed pa'i rdzas du ma dang ldan pa yin no //
analyzed: rtsom par byed pa'i rdzas du ma dang ldan pa yin no //
translated: and it is related to many substances that are its components.

original: gal te khyad par yod de 'di ltar gnyis nyid la sogs pa dang 'brel du zin kyang gsal ba rnams mtshungs pa'i ngo bor mi 'gyur gyi ba lang nyid la sogs pa dang 'brel na ni 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gal te khyad par yod de 'di ltar gnyis nyid la sogs pa dang 'brel du zin kyang gsal ba rnams mtshungs pa'i ngo bor mi 'gyur gyi ba lang nyid la sogs pa dang 'brel na ni 'gyur ro //
translated: If there is a difference, then even though it is related to duality and so on, the individual things do not become of the same nature, but if it is related to cowness and so on, they do.

original: de bas na ba lang nyid la sogs pa kho na spyi yin no snyam du sems na /
analyzed: de bas na ba lang nyid la sogs pa kho na spyi yin no snyam du sems na /
translated: Therefore, if you think that only the universal cow, etc. is the universal,

original: de'i phyir 'brel pa can gzhan gyis kyang zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos so //
analyzed: de'i phyir 'brel pa can gzhan gyis kyang zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos so //
translated: then to explain this, he says, ‚ÄúEven though it is related to another related object, etc.‚Äù

original: 'di skad bstan pa yin te /
analyzed: 'di skad bstan pa yin te /
translated: This is the explanation:

original: ba lang nyid la sogs pa dang 'brel du zin kyang gsal ba'i khyad par rnams kyi thun mong ma yin pa'i ngo bo 'dor ba ni med na ;
analyzed: ba lang nyid la sogs pa dang 'brel du zin kyang gsal ba'i khyad par rnams kyi thun mong ma yin pa'i ngo bo 'dor ba ni med na ;
translated: Even though it is related to the universal cow, etc., the particular instances do not lose their individual natures.

original: / de ji ltar ba lang nyid la sogs pa dang 'brel kyang mtshungs pa'i ngo bo nyid yin /
analyzed: / de ji ltar ba lang nyid la sogs pa dang 'brel kyang mtshungs pa'i ngo bo nyid yin /
translated: How then can they be related to the universal cow, etc. and still have the same nature?

original: de bas na 'brel pa can ba lang nyid la sogs pa gsal ba dang ldan pa gnyis nyid la sogs pa dang 'dra ba gzhan gyis kyang gsal ba'i khyad par gzhan dag mtshungs pa ni ma yin gyi khyad par rnams de dang ldan pa spyi dang ldan pa
analyzed: de bas na 'brel pa can ba lang nyid la sogs pa gsal ba dang ldan pa gnyis nyid la sogs pa dang 'dra ba gzhan gyis kyang gsal ba'i khyad par gzhan dag mtshungs pa ni ma yin gyi khyad par rnams de dang ldan pa spyi dang ldan pa
translated: Therefore, even though the related universal cow, etc. is related to the particular instances, it is not the same as the particular instances. The particular instances are related to that, the universal,

original: dag tu ni 'gyur te /
analyzed: dag tu ni 'gyur te /
translated: and they are related to each other.

original: 'byung po'i mgul chings lta bu'o //
analyzed: 'byung po'i mgul chings lta bu'o //
translated: It is like the amulet for warding off demons.

original: 'byung po ni gza' dang rgyu skar dag ste /
analyzed: 'byung po ni gza' dang rgyu skar dag ste /
translated: The spirits are the planets and the stars.

original: de dag gi mgul bar phreng ba ring pos bcings pa de ni 'byung po'i mgul chings so //
analyzed: de dag gi mgul bar phreng ba ring pos bcings pa de ni 'byung po'i mgul chings so //
translated: The long garland that is tied around their necks is called the ‚Äúspirit‚Äôs garland.‚Äù

original: ji ltar 'byung po'i mgul chings gcig po des 'byung po rnams de dang ldan pa yin gyi mtshungs pa ni ma yin pa ltar gsal ba rnams kyang de dang 'dra'o //
analyzed: ji ltar 'byung po'i mgul chings gcig po des 'byung po rnams de dang ldan pa yin gyi mtshungs pa ni ma yin pa ltar gsal ba rnams kyang de dang 'dra'o //
translated: Just as the spirits are not the same even though they are all bound by the same spirit‚Äôs garland, so it is with the manifestations.

original: gang gi phyir gcig dang 'brel du zin kyang gsal ba rnams mtshungs pa ma yin pa de nyid kyi phyir shes pa tha mi dad pa'i yul yang ma yin zhing /
analyzed: gang gi phyir gcig dang 'brel du zin kyang gsal ba rnams mtshungs pa ma yin pa de nyid kyi phyir shes pa tha mi dad pa'i yul yang ma yin zhing /
translated: Since the manifestations are not the same even though they are related to the same thing, therefore the object is not the object of a nondifferent cognition.

original: shes pa rnam pa gcig pa can ma 'khrul pa'i yul yang ma yin te /
analyzed: shes pa rnam pa gcig pa can ma 'khrul pa'i yul yang ma yin te /
translated: And the object is not the object of a nonerroneous cognition that has a single aspect.

original: 'byung po bzhin no //
analyzed: 'byung po bzhin no //
translated: It is like the spirits.

original: ji ltar 'byung po chings ma'i rang bzhin ma yin pa rnams chings ma'i rnam pa gcig pa can gyi yul ma yin pa de dang 'dra'o //
analyzed: ji ltar 'byung po chings ma'i rang bzhin ma yin pa rnams chings ma'i rnam pa gcig pa can gyi yul ma yin pa de dang 'dra'o //
translated: Just as the spirits, which are not of the nature of the garland, are not the object of a cognition that has the single aspect of the garland, so it is with the manifestations.

original: de ltar na re zhig don gzhan ni du ma dang 'brel du zin kyang de dag gi spyi ma yin no //
analyzed: de ltar na re zhig don gzhan ni du ma dang 'brel du zin kyang de dag gi spyi ma yin no //
translated: Thus, even though many things are related to a single universal, that universal is not a plurality.

original: spyi 'dzin par byed pa'i shes pa yang med de /
analyzed: spyi 'dzin par byed pa'i shes pa yang med de /
translated: And there is no cognition that apprehends a universal,üîΩbecause the cognition of those things is mixed with the cognition of their individual natures, and it appears as if it has a universal for its object.üîΩIt is not the case that the cognition of those things is mixed with the cognition of their individual natures, and it appears as if it has a universal for its object.

original: 'di ltar blo ni de dag gis bdag nyid kho na khyad par de dag gi bdag nyid kho na la 'di gnyis ni ngo bo gcig go zhes bsre zhing spyi'i yul can du snang ngo //
analyzed: 'di ltar blo ni de dag gis bdag nyid kho na khyad par de dag gi bdag nyid kho na la 'di gnyis ni ngo bo gcig go zhes bsre zhing spyi'i yul can du snang ngo //
translated: If it were the cognition of those things that were mixed with the cognition of their individual natures, and it appeared as if it had a universal for its object, then the cognition of those things would not be mixed with the cognition of their individual natures, and it would not appear as if it had a universal for its object.

original: gcig dang 'brel pa can dag gi zhes bya ba ni ma yin te zhes bya ba ni 'di dag ni spyi gcig dang 'brel pa can dag yin @58a * //üîΩno zhes bya bar snang ba ni ma yin te /üîΩgal te gcig dang 'brel ba can dag yin no zhes bya bar 'dzin par byed na ni /
analyzed: gcig dang 'brel pa can dag gi zhes bya ba ni ma yin te zhes bya ba ni 'di dag ni spyi gcig dang 'brel pa can dag yin @58a * // no zhes bya bar snang ba ni ma yin te / gal te gcig dang 'brel ba can dag yin no zhes bya bar 'dzin par byed na ni /
translated: If it were the cognition of those things that were mixed with the cognition of their individual natures, and it appeared as if it had a universal for its object, then the cognition of those things would not be mixed with the cognition of their individual natures, and it would not appear as if it had a universal for its object.üîΩIf it were the cognition of those things that were mixed with the cognition of their individual natures, and it appeared as if it had a universal for its object, then the cognition of those things would not be mixed with the cognition of their individual natures, and it would not appear as if it had a universal for its object.üîΩIf it were the cognition of those things that were mixed with the cognition of their individual natures, and it appeared as if it had a universal for its object, then the cognition of those things would not be mixed with the cognition of their individual natures, and it would not appear as if it had a universal for its object.üîΩIf it were the cognition of those things that were mixed with the cognition of their individual natures, and it appeared as if it had a universal for its object, then the cognition of those things would not be mixed with the cognition of their individual natures, and it would not appear as if it had a universal for its object.üîΩIf it were the cognition of those things that were mixed with the cognition of their individual natures, and it appeared as if it had a universal for its object, then the cognition of those things would not be mixed with the cognition of their individual natures, and it would not appear as if it had a universal for its object.

original: de'i tshe spyi'i blos spyi gzung bar 'gyur ro //üîΩ'byung po ltar zhes bya ba ni chos mi mthun pa'i dpe ste /
analyzed: de'i tshe spyi'i blos spyi gzung bar 'gyur ro //üîΩ'byung po ltar zhes bya ba ni chos mi mthun pa'i dpe ste /
translated: If it were the cognition of those things that were mixed with the cognition of their individual

original: ji ltar 'byung po rnams chings ma gcig dang 'brel pa yin no zhes 'dzin pa de lta bur ma yin no zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: ji ltar 'byung po rnams chings ma gcig dang 'brel pa yin no zhes 'dzin pa de lta bur ma yin no zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: It is not like the apprehension of the fact that all living beings are related to a single mother.

original: gal te blos ni spyi 'ba' zhig pa mthong ba kho na ste /
analyzed: gal te blos ni spyi 'ba' zhig pa mthong ba kho na ste /
translated: If the mind sees only the universal,

original: gsal ba rnams la gcig pa nyid du 'dzin pa gang yin pa de ni de mthong ba'i spyi mthong ba'i 'khrul pa yin no zhe na /
analyzed: gsal ba rnams la gcig pa nyid du 'dzin pa gang yin pa de ni de mthong ba'i spyi mthong ba'i 'khrul pa yin no zhe na /
translated: and the apprehension of the one in the particulars is the error of seeing the universal in what is seen,

original: de mthong ngo zhes bya ba ga las blo de spyi mthong ba yin no zhes bya ba ga las nges /
analyzed: de mthong ngo zhes bya ba ga las blo de spyi mthong ba yin no zhes bya ba ga las nges /
translated: how do you know that the mind sees the universal?

original: gal te 'di ni gsal ba rnams kyi spyi yin no zhes bya ba de lta bur spyi'i blo zhig skyes par gyur na ni /
analyzed: gal te 'di ni gsal ba rnams kyi spyi yin no zhes bya ba de lta bur spyi'i blo zhig skyes par gyur na ni /
translated: If the mind thinks, ‚ÄúThis is the universal of the particulars,‚Äù

original: de'i tshe de mthong ba yin no zhes bya bar nges par 'gyur ba zhig na /
analyzed: de'i tshe de mthong ba yin no zhes bya bar nges par 'gyur ba zhig na /
translated: then it would be certain that it sees the universal.

original: 'di ltar spyi'i blo ni dus thams cad du gsal ba'i bdag nyid kho na bsre ba yin par yid ches so //
analyzed: 'di ltar spyi'i blo ni dus thams cad du gsal ba'i bdag nyid kho na bsre ba yin par yid ches so //
translated: But it is certain that the mind always superimposes the universal on the particulars.

original: 'di la sa bon med pa yod pas na sa bon med pa can no //
analyzed: 'di la sa bon med pa yod pas na sa bon med pa can no //
translated: It is the possessor of a seed because it exists without a seed.

original: de ni de lta bu yang yin la 'khrul pa yang yin pas na de skad bshad do //
analyzed: de ni de lta bu yang yin la 'khrul pa yang yin pas na de skad bshad do //
translated: It is like that and it is an error, thus it is called that.

original: gal te de mi rung ba'i phyir te /
analyzed: gal te de mi rung ba'i phyir te /
translated: If that is not correct, because

original: 'khrul pa skye ba ni rgyu mtshan med pa can du mi rung na /
analyzed: 'khrul pa skye ba ni rgyu mtshan med pa can du mi rung na /
translated: it is not correct that an error arises without a reason,

original: ma 'dres pa rnams bsre zhing skye pa 'di yang 'khrul pa yin pas 'di'i rgyu mtshan zhig yod par 'gyur la /
analyzed: ma 'dres pa rnams bsre zhing skye pa 'di yang 'khrul pa yin pas 'di'i rgyu mtshan zhig yod par 'gyur la /
translated: then this arising of the mixing of the unmixed is an error, and so it would have a reason.

original: rgyu mtshan gang yin pa de ni spyi yin no zhes gang dag la 'bras bu spyir shes pa de gcig yod pa 'bras bu gcig pa can de dag 'khrul pa'i sa bon yin no //
analyzed: rgyu mtshan gang yin pa de ni spyi yin no zhes gang dag la 'bras bu spyir shes pa de gcig yod pa 'bras bu gcig pa can de dag 'khrul pa'i sa bon yin no //
translated: Whatever is the reason is the universal. Those who know the universal as the result are the possessors of a single result. They are the seed of error.

original: de dag kho na zhes bya ba ni khyad par rnams te 'di ni 'og nas ston par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de dag kho na zhes bya ba ni khyad par rnams te 'di ni 'og nas ston par 'gyur ro //
translated: Those alone are the particulars. This will be taught later.

original: spyi'i mthus gsal ba rnams la rnam pa gcig pa can gyi 'khrul par yang rigs pa ma yin te /
analyzed: spyi'i mthus gsal ba rnams la rnam pa gcig pa can gyi 'khrul par yang rigs pa ma yin te /
translated: It is not correct that the particulars have a single aspect due to the power of the universal, because

original: 'di ltar 'khrul pa'i rgyu ni 'dra ba yin no //
analyzed: 'di ltar 'khrul pa'i rgyu ni 'dra ba yin no //
translated: in this way, the cause of error is similarity.

original: spyi ni gsal ba dag dang mtshan nyid shin tu mi 'dra ba yang yin te /
analyzed: spyi ni gsal ba dag dang mtshan nyid shin tu mi 'dra ba yang yin te /
translated: And the universal is quite different from the particulars in its characteristics.

original: de ni kha dog dang / dbyibs kyi rnam pa ma yin pa'i phyir la gsal ba rnams ni kha dog dang dbyibs kyi rnam par nges pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de ni kha dog dang / dbyibs kyi rnam pa ma yin pa'i phyir la gsal ba rnams ni kha dog dang dbyibs kyi rnam par nges pa'i phyir ro //
translated: For the universal is not a form of color or shape, while the particulars are ascertained as being forms of color and shape.

original: 'on te gcig dang 'brel pa can dag kho na yin pa'i phyir 'khrul pa'i rgyu mtshan med par yang rnam pa gcig pa can gyi 'khrul pa'i yul du 'gyur ro zhe na /
analyzed: 'on te gcig dang 'brel pa can dag kho na yin pa'i phyir 'khrul pa'i rgyu mtshan med par yang rnam pa gcig pa can gyi 'khrul pa'i yul du 'gyur ro zhe na /
translated: But if they are the same in being related to one thing, then the universal would be the object of a mistaken cognition that has a single aspect even without a cause of error.

original: de'i tshe grangs dang @58b ldan pa dang 'bras bu'i rdzas te /
analyzed: de'i tshe grangs dang @58b ldan pa dang 'bras bu'i rdzas te /
translated: Then the universal would be a substance that has number, unity, and an effect.

original: sogs pa zhes bya ba'i sgras ni rnam par dbye ba la sogs pa bsdu'o //
analyzed: sogs pa zhes bya ba'i sgras ni rnam par dbye ba la sogs pa bsdu'o //
translated: The word ‚Äúetc.‚Äù includes division, etc.

original: gang dag la dngos po gcig cig yod pa de dag ni de dang ldan pa ste de dag la'o //
analyzed: gang dag la dngos po gcig cig yod pa de dag ni de dang ldan pa ste de dag la'o //
translated: Those that have one thing are related to it.

original: 'byung po chings ma gcig pa dag la yang rnam pa gcig pa can gyi 'khrul par 'gyur ba zhig na mi 'gyur te /
analyzed: 'byung po chings ma gcig pa dag la yang rnam pa gcig pa can gyi 'khrul par 'gyur ba zhig na mi 'gyur te /
translated: Even in regard to beings that have different sheaths, there would be a mistaken cognition that has a single aspect, but there is not.

original: de bas na grangs dang ldan pa dang 'bras bu'i rdzas la sogs pa dang ldan pa dag dang 'byung po la sogs pa la yang 'dra bar 'khrul pa med pa'i phyir /
analyzed: de bas na grangs dang ldan pa dang 'bras bu'i rdzas la sogs pa dang ldan pa dag dang 'byung po la sogs pa la yang 'dra bar 'khrul pa med pa'i phyir /
translated: Therefore, there is no error in the case of the number one, the substance of the effect, etc., and the elements, etc.

original: spyi gcig dang 'brel pa'i sgo nas spyi dang ldan pa rnams la 'dra bar 'khrul pa ni ma yin no //
analyzed: spyi gcig dang 'brel pa'i sgo nas spyi dang ldan pa rnams la 'dra bar 'khrul pa ni ma yin no //
translated: Thus, it is not the case that there is an error of sameness in the case of those that possess a universal through the relation of inherence.

original: de bas na zhes bya ba la sogs pas ni mjug sdud de /
analyzed: de bas na zhes bya ba la sogs pas ni mjug sdud de /
translated: The summary of the refutation is stated in ‚ÄúTherefore, etc.‚Äù

original: de bas na zhes bya ba ni de lta bas na'o //
analyzed: de bas na zhes bya ba ni de lta bas na'o //
translated: ‚ÄúTherefore‚Äù means ‚Äúbecause of that.‚Äù

original: spyi ni ji ltar gsal ba dag dang tha dad par 'dod pa de ltar spyi'i blo la zhen pa med pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: spyi ni ji ltar gsal ba dag dang tha dad par 'dod pa de ltar spyi'i blo la zhen pa med pa'i phyir te /
translated: A universal is not different from the particulars, as is claimed, because the cognition of a universal does not exist.

original: snang ba med pa'i phyir spyi ni gzhan ma yin no //
analyzed: snang ba med pa'i phyir spyi ni gzhan ma yin no //
translated: Because it does not appear, a universal is not different.

original: khas blangs nas kyang brjod par bya ste /
analyzed: khas blangs nas kyang brjod par bya ste /
translated: Even if one accepts a universal, it must be stated:

original: spyi yod du chug na yang spyi de yang gsal ba bzhin du rang gi bdag nyid la rang gi ngo bo nyid la rnam par gnas pa'i phyir /
analyzed: spyi yod du chug na yang spyi de yang gsal ba bzhin du rang gi bdag nyid la rang gi ngo bo nyid la rnam par gnas pa'i phyir /
translated: Even if one allows that a universal exists, because that universal, like the particulars, would exist in its own nature,

original: gsal ba'i ngo bo gzhan dang ma 'dres pa yin no //
analyzed: gsal ba'i ngo bo gzhan dang ma 'dres pa yin no //
translated: The nature of clarity is not mixed with anything else.

original: gzhung 'dis ni tshig le'ur byas pa'i cha /
analyzed: gzhung 'dis ni tshig le'ur byas pa'i cha /
translated: This passage explains the verse

original: rang rang ngo bo la gnas phyir //
analyzed: rang rang ngo bo la gnas phyir //
translated: Because they abide in their own nature.

original: zhes de skad ces bya ba la thug pa'i bar rnam par bshad do //
analyzed: zhes de skad ces bya ba la thug pa'i bar rnam par bshad do //
translated: Up to this point.

original: de lta bas na zhes bya ba ni rang rang gi ngo bo la gnas pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de lta bas na zhes bya ba ni rang rang gi ngo bo la gnas pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Therefore means because they abide in their own nature.

original: gzugs la sogs pa'i dngos po thams cad ni rigs mthun par 'dod pa rnam pa mthun pa nyid du 'dod pa dang gzhan las zhes bya ba rigs mi mthun pa las log pa yin te /
analyzed: gzugs la sogs pa'i dngos po thams cad ni rigs mthun par 'dod pa rnam pa mthun pa nyid du 'dod pa dang gzhan las zhes bya ba rigs mi mthun pa las log pa yin te /
translated: All things such as form are asserted to be similar in type, asserted to be similar in aspect and opposite from other types, that is, opposite from dissimilar types.

original: tha dad par gyur pa yin no //
analyzed: tha dad par gyur pa yin no //
translated: They are different.üîΩThis explains the verse:

original: 'dis ni mthun dngos gzhan gyi dngos dag las zhes bya ba de rnam par bkrol to //
analyzed: 'dis ni mthun dngos gzhan gyi dngos dag las zhes bya ba de rnam par bkrol to //
translated: From similar things and other things.

original: ci'i phyir log ce na /üîΩrang gi ngo bo rang bzhin gyis ngo bo gcig pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: ci'i phyir log ce na / rang gi ngo bo rang bzhin gyis ngo bo gcig pa'i phyir te /
translated: Why are they opposite?

original: rang rang gi ngo bo la gnas pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: rang rang gi ngo bo la gnas pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: Because they abide in their own nature, that is, because they abide in their own nature, which is a single nature by its very essence.

original: gang dang gang las zhes bya ba la sogs pas ni tshig le'ur byas pa gnyis pa'i don ston te /
analyzed: gang dang gang las zhes bya ba la sogs pas ni tshig le'ur byas pa gnyis pa'i don ston te /
translated: The meaning of the second verse is taught by ‚Äúfrom that and that,‚Äù etc.üîΩFrom that and that which is different, that and that is different, in order to be known.

original: dngos po rnams gang dang gang las tha dad pa de dang de la tha dad pa ste shes par bya ba'i phyir /
analyzed: dngos po rnams gang dang gang las tha dad pa de dang de la tha dad pa ste shes par bya ba'i phyir /
translated: From that and that which is different, that and that is different, in order to be known.üîΩFrom that and that which is different, that and that is different, in order to be known.üîΩFrom that and that which is different, that and that is different, in order to be known.üîΩFrom that and that which is different, that and that is different, in order to be known.üîΩFrom that and that which is different, that and that is different, in order to be known.

original: tha dad pa so so la tha snyad du byas shing brdar btags pa'i sgra rgyur pa dag gis ngo bo nyid tha mi dad @59a * //üîΩkyang byas pa nyid dang mi rtag pa nyid la sogs pa dang ldan pa'i chos du ma shes par byed kyi chos can gcig la ngo bo nyid du ma yod pa ni ma yin no //üîΩ'o na ji ltar chos du ma nyid yin zhe na /
analyzed: tha dad pa so so la tha snyad du byas shing brdar btags pa'i sgra rgyur pa dag gis ngo bo nyid tha mi dad @59a * // kyang byas pa nyid dang mi rtag pa nyid la sogs pa dang ldan pa'i chos du ma shes par byed kyi chos can gcig la ngo bo nyid du ma yod pa ni ma yin no // 'o na ji ltar chos du ma nyid yin zhe na /
translated: From that and that which is different, that and that is different, in order to be known.

original: de dang de las tha dad pa rgyur byas nas zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: de dang de las tha dad pa rgyur byas nas zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: From that and that which is different, that and that is different, in order to be known.üîΩFrom that and that which is different, that and that is different, in order to be known.üîΩFrom that and that which is different, that and that is different, in order to be known.üîΩFrom that and that which is different, that and that is different, in order to be known.üîΩFrom that and that which is different, that and that is different, in order to be known.üîΩFrom that and that which is different, that and that is different, in order to be known.üîΩFrom that and that which is different, that and that is different, in order to be known.üîΩFrom that and that which is different, that and that is different, in order to be known.üîΩFrom that and that which is different, that and that is different, in order to be known.üîΩFrom that and that which is different, that and that is different, in order to be known.üîΩFrom that and that which is different, that and that is different, in order to be known.üîΩFrom that and that which is different, that and that is different, in order to be known.

original: gang dang gang las log pa de dang de las tha dad pa rgyur byas shing brten nas so //
analyzed: gang dang gang las log pa de dang de las tha dad pa rgyur byas shing brten nas so //
translated: From that and that which is different, that and that is different, in order to be known.üîΩFrom that and that which is different, that and that is different, in order to be known.üîΩFrom that and that which is different, that and that is different, in order to be known.

original: tha dad pa de dang de bstan pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: tha dad pa de dang de bstan pa'i phyir te /
translated: From that and that which is different, that and that is different, in order to be known.üîΩFrom that and that which is different, that and that

original: tha snyad du byas pa'i sgra gang dang gang yin pa de dag kyang rang rang gi tha dad brjod par byed pa nyid du nges pa yin te /
analyzed: tha snyad du byas pa'i sgra gang dang gang yin pa de dag kyang rang rang gi tha dad brjod par byed pa nyid du nges pa yin te /
translated: Whatever words are used conventionally are ascertained to express their individual referents.

original: de bas na sgra gcig gis tha dad pa thams cad mi 'phel mod kyi 'on kyang tha dad pa gcig brjod pas /
analyzed: de bas na sgra gcig gis tha dad pa thams cad mi 'phel mod kyi 'on kyang tha dad pa gcig brjod pas /
translated: Therefore, although a single word does not express all differences, still, by expressing one difference,

original: ldog pa'i tha dad pa gang la tha snyad du byas pa de brjod pas de'i rang gi mtshan nyid dpyis phyin pa kho nar 'gyur te /
analyzed: ldog pa'i tha dad pa gang la tha snyad du byas pa de brjod pas de'i rang gi mtshan nyid dpyis phyin pa kho nar 'gyur te /
translated: the complete intrinsic identity of that difference is expressed, because the difference is made by that word.

original: ldog pa'i rten rang gi mtshan nyid gang yin pa de dpyis phyin pa kho na ste /
analyzed: ldog pa'i rten rang gi mtshan nyid gang yin pa de dpyis phyin pa kho na ste /
translated: The intrinsic identity that is the basis of the difference is completely expressed.

original: de rtogs pa'i mthar thug pa kho nar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de rtogs pa'i mthar thug pa kho nar 'gyur ro //
translated: The complete realization of that is reached.

original: ci'i phyir zhe na /üîΩde gcig las kyang ste /
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na / de gcig las kyang ste /
translated: Why is that?üîΩBecause that is not the cause of that, nor is that the result of that.

original: de'i rgyu can ma yin pa dang / de'i 'bras bu can ma yin pa de gcig las kyang de log pas de'i phyir tha dad pa yod pas so //
analyzed: de'i rgyu can ma yin pa dang / de'i 'bras bu can ma yin pa de gcig las kyang de log pas de'i phyir tha dad pa yod pas so //
translated: That is not the case even for one, because of the existence of difference.

original: de'i phyir zhes bya ba la sogs pas ni tshig le'ur byas pa gnyis pa'i don ston te /
analyzed: de'i phyir zhes bya ba la sogs pas ni tshig le'ur byas pa gnyis pa'i don ston te /
translated: The meaning of the second verse is indicated by ‚ÄúTherefore,‚Äù and so on.

original: gang gi phyir rigs mthun pa dang / rigs mi mthun pa las log pa de'i phyir /
analyzed: gang gi phyir rigs mthun pa dang / rigs mi mthun pa las log pa de'i phyir /
translated: Because of being the opposite of that which is of a homogeneous type and that which is of a heterogeneous type,

original: dngos po gcig la gzhan gyi ngo bo ji snyed pa de la ltos nas /
analyzed: dngos po gcig la gzhan gyi ngo bo ji snyed pa de la ltos nas /
translated: to the extent that there are different natures in one thing,

original: gzhan gyi ngo bo dag las ldog pa de snyed yod do //
analyzed: gzhan gyi ngo bo dag las ldog pa de snyed yod do //
translated: to that extent there is an opposite of those different natures.

original: ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: brjod par 'dod pa'i chos can gang la de la med pa'i ldog pa'i mtshams su gyur pa'i chos can la med pa'i rgyu dang 'bras bu yod pa de ni de la med pa'i rgyu dang 'bras bu can /üîΩde ni de la tha dad pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: brjod par 'dod pa'i chos can gang la de la med pa'i ldog pa'i mtshams su gyur pa'i chos can la med pa'i rgyu dang 'bras bu yod pa de ni de la med pa'i rgyu dang 'bras bu can / de ni de la tha dad pa'i phyir te /
translated: That which is the basis of the desire to speak, in regard to which there is a basis of the opposite of non-existence, which is the basis of the non-existence of the effect and cause, is that which has the opposite of non-existence of effect and cause.

original: de'i rgyu can ma yin pa dang / de'i 'bras bu can ma yin pa de las tha dad pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de'i rgyu can ma yin pa dang / de'i 'bras bu can ma yin pa de las tha dad pa'i phyir ro //
translated: That is different from that, because it is not the cause of that, and it is not the effect of that, because it is different from that.

original: ldog pa ji snyed pa de'i rgyu dang 'bras bu can ma yin pa yongs su spangs par tha snyad kyi don can gyi sgra tha dad du byas pa dag kyang de snyed do //
analyzed: ldog pa ji snyed pa de'i rgyu dang 'bras bu can ma yin pa yongs su spangs par tha snyad kyi don can gyi sgra tha dad du byas pa dag kyang de snyed do //
translated: As many as are the negations, there are that many words that have the meaning of a convention, which are distinguished as having a cause and result or as not having a cause and result.

original: gang la brjod par 'dod pa de'i rgyu dang 'bras bu yod pa de ni de'i rgyu dang 'bras bu can te /
analyzed: gang la brjod par 'dod pa de'i rgyu dang 'bras bu yod pa de ni de'i rgyu dang 'bras bu can te /
translated: That which has a cause and result is one that has a cause and result of that which is desired to be expressed.

original: dper na sgra ni rgyu btsal ba can dang 'bras bu rna ba'i rnam par shes pa can yin pa lta bu'o //
analyzed: dper na sgra ni rgyu btsal ba can dang 'bras bu rna ba'i rnam par shes pa can yin pa lta bu'o //
translated: For example, sound is one that has a cause and result of being sought and of being the result of ear-consciousness.

original: gang zhig de lta bu ma yin pa de ni de'i rgyu dang 'bras bu can ma yin pa ste /üîΩde @59b yongs su ma spangs par tha snyad kyi don can te /
analyzed: gang zhig de lta bu ma yin pa de ni de'i rgyu dang 'bras bu can ma yin pa ste / de @59b yongs su ma spangs par tha snyad kyi don can te /
translated: That which is not like that is one that does not have a cause and result of that which is desired to be expressed.üîΩThat which is not distinguished as having a cause and result is one that does not have a cause and result of that which is desired to be expressed.

original: gang dag la 'bras bu 'jug pa dang ldog pa'i mtshan nyid kyi don yod pa zhes bya bar tshig rnam par sbyar ro //
analyzed: gang dag la 'bras bu 'jug pa dang ldog pa'i mtshan nyid kyi don yod pa zhes bya bar tshig rnam par sbyar ro //
translated: The words are to be analyzed as follows: ‚ÄúThat which has the meaning of a convention is one that has the meaning of a result that is engaged and disengaged.‚Äù

original: dper na sgra ni btsal ma thag tu 'byung ba can dang zhes bya ba la sogs pas ni dpe ston to //
analyzed: dper na sgra ni btsal ma thag tu 'byung ba can dang zhes bya ba la sogs pas ni dpe ston to //
translated: For example, sound is one that arises immediately upon being sought.

original: gang la rgyu btsal ba yod pa de ni /
analyzed: gang la rgyu btsal ba yod pa de ni /
translated: That which has a cause being sought is called

original: btsal ma thag tu 'byung ba can zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: btsal ma thag tu 'byung ba can zhes bya ba'o //
translated: ‚Äúhaving a cause that is sought immediately.‚Äù

original: des na sgra btsal ma thag tu 'byung ba can ni de'i rgyu can ma yin pa ste /
analyzed: des na sgra btsal ma thag tu 'byung ba can ni de'i rgyu can ma yin pa ste /
translated: Therefore, ‚Äúhaving a cause that is sought immediately‚Äù is not having a cause that is sought.

original: btsal ba'i rgyu can ma yin pa glog la sogs pa yongs su spangs pa'i don yin no //
analyzed: btsal ba'i rgyu can ma yin pa glog la sogs pa yongs su spangs pa'i don yin no //
translated: The meaning is that it is excluded from being like lightning, etc., which do not have a cause that is sought.

original: gang la 'bras bu rna ba'i rnam par shes pa yod pa de ni /
analyzed: gang la 'bras bu rna ba'i rnam par shes pa yod pa de ni /
translated: That which has an effect, the auditory consciousness, is called

original: nyan pa can te /
analyzed: nyan pa can te /
translated: ‚Äúhaving hearing.‚Äù

original: des na sgra nyan pa can ni de'i 'bras bu ma yin pa can yongs su spang pa'i don yin no //
analyzed: des na sgra nyan pa can ni de'i 'bras bu ma yin pa can yongs su spang pa'i don yin no //
translated: Therefore, ‚Äúhaving hearing‚Äù has the meaning of excluding that which does not have it as its effect.

original: tha snyad thams cad ni don byed pa'i rgyu mtshan yin pa'i phyir la /
analyzed: tha snyad thams cad ni don byed pa'i rgyu mtshan yin pa'i phyir la /
translated: Because all conventions are the reason for the performance of a function,

original: don byed pa yang rgyu dang 'bras bu dngos po'i mtshan nyid yin pa'i phyir /
analyzed: don byed pa yang rgyu dang 'bras bu dngos po'i mtshan nyid yin pa'i phyir /
translated: and because the performance of a function is the characteristic of the relation of cause and effect,

original: bum pa la sogs pa'i sgra la yang de'i rgyu dang 'bras bu can ma yin pa yongs su spangs pa'i don sbyar bar bya'o //
analyzed: bum pa la sogs pa'i sgra la yang de'i rgyu dang 'bras bu can ma yin pa yongs su spangs pa'i don sbyar bar bya'o //
translated: the meaning of ‚Äúhaving a cause and an effect‚Äù should be applied to the word ‚Äúpot,‚Äù etc., with the exclusion of that which does not have a cause and an effect.

original: de'i phyir zhes bya ba la sogs pas ni tshigs su bcad pa gsum pa ston to /
analyzed: de'i phyir zhes bya ba la sogs pas ni tshigs su bcad pa gsum pa ston to /
translated: The third verse is stated by ‚ÄúTherefore, etc.‚Äù

original: gang gi phyir ldog pa'i bye brag dag kyang tha dad la /
analyzed: gang gi phyir ldog pa'i bye brag dag kyang tha dad la /
translated: Because the different types of exclusions are different,

original: mnyan pa dag kyang tha dad pa la bdag nyid ji lta ba bzhin nges pa de'i phyir chos can gcig la ngo bo nyid tha dad pa med du zin kyang ngo //
analyzed: mnyan pa dag kyang tha dad pa la bdag nyid ji lta ba bzhin nges pa de'i phyir chos can gcig la ngo bo nyid tha dad pa med du zin kyang ngo //
translated: and the listeners are different, the ascertainment is just as it is. Therefore, even though there is no difference in the nature of a single subject,üîΩthe difference of the exclusions is the difference of the exclusions.

original: khyad par zhes bya ba 'di ni rnam par dbye ba ni tha dad pa gang zhig ces bya ba yin te /
analyzed: khyad par zhes bya ba 'di ni rnam par dbye ba ni tha dad pa gang zhig ces bya ba yin te /
translated: This is the analysis of the difference of the exclusions.

original: ldog pa'i tha dad pa gang zhig go //
analyzed: ldog pa'i tha dad pa gang zhig go //
translated: The difference of the exclusions is the difference of the exclusions.

original: chos gang gis zhes bya ba 'di'i rnam par 'grel pa ni /üîΩming zhes bya ba 'di yin no //
analyzed: chos gang gis zhes bya ba 'di'i rnam par 'grel pa ni / ming zhes bya ba 'di yin no //
translated: The analysis of the word ‚Äúproperty‚Äù isüîΩthe word ‚Äúproperty‚Äù is the word ‚Äúproperty‚Äù of the word ‚Äúproperty.‚ÄùüîΩThe meaning of the word ‚Äúsound‚Äù is the meaning of the word ‚Äúsound.‚ÄùüîΩThe word ‚Äúproperty‚Äù is the word ‚Äúproperty‚Äù of the word ‚Äúproperty.‚Äù

analyzed: ngo bo kho na rtogs par byed pa ni ma yin na zhes bya ba 'di ji ltar shes te /

analyzed: rnam par bcad pa ni gzhan bzlog pa'o //

original: tshad ma gzhan dang zhes bya ba la sogs pas ni lan 'debs te /

analyzed: de bzhin du chos can ro la sogs pa rtogs kyang chos ma grags pa'i khyad par rtogs par bya ba'i phyir / sgra gzhan ro mngar ro //
translated: Similarly, although the subject, taste, etc. is realized, in order to realize the unestablished attribute,üîΩthe other words ‚Äúsweet taste,‚Äù

original: gang ngo // 'jam mo //
analyzed: gang ngo // 'jam mo //
translated: ‚Äúsmooth,‚Äù

original: lci'o zhes bya ba 'jug go //
analyzed: lci'o zhes bya ba 'jug go //

original: gal te rtags kyis kyang sgrub pas dngos po kho na rtogs par byed na ni de'i tshe mngon sum gyi dngos po cha shas med pa'i rnam pa thams cad kyang gzung ba'i phyir /üîΩde la gang zhig rtogs par bya ba'i phyir /
analyzed: gal te rtags kyis kyang sgrub pas dngos po kho na rtogs par byed na ni de'i tshe mngon sum gyi dngos po cha shas med pa'i rnam pa thams cad kyang gzung ba'i phyir / de la gang zhig rtogs par bya ba'i phyir /
translated: If a reason also proves only an existent thing, then at that time, since direct perception apprehends all aspects of the partless thing,

analyzed: tshad ma gzhan rjes su dpag pa 'jug par 'gyur ba dngos po'i cha shas ma bzung ba gzhan ci zhig yod /
translated: what other part of the thing not apprehended is there that another valid knowledge, inference, would be engaged in order to realize it?

original: de bzhin du sgra gzhan yang ma grags pa rtogs par bya ba'i phyir sbyor bar mi 'gyur te /
analyzed: de bzhin du sgra gzhan yang ma grags pa rtogs par bya ba'i phyir sbyor bar mi 'gyur te /

original: tshad ma dang sgra dang po kho nas bsgrub pas thams cad rtogs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: tshad ma dang sgra dang po kho nas bsgrub pas thams cad rtogs pa'i phyir ro //

original: gang gi tshe chos gzhan sgro 'dogs pa rnam par bcad pa'i phyir tshad ma gzhan dang sgra gzhan 'jug pa de'i tshe ni tshad ma gcig gis sgro 'dogs pa gang zhig gsal ba ma byas pa de bsal ba'i phyir tshad ma gzhan dang sgra gzhan 'jug par 'gyur
analyzed: gang gi tshe chos gzhan sgro 'dogs pa rnam par bcad pa'i phyir tshad ma gzhan dang sgra gzhan 'jug pa de'i tshe ni tshad ma gcig gis sgro 'dogs pa gang zhig gsal ba ma byas pa de bsal ba'i phyir tshad ma gzhan dang sgra gzhan 'jug par 'gyur
translated: When another valid cognition and another sound are applied in order to eliminate superimpositions onto another object, then another valid cognition and another sound are applied in order to eliminate the superimposition that was not eliminated by the one valid cognition.

original: ro // de bas na tshad ma gzhan dang sgra gzhan 'jug pa'i phyir /
analyzed: ro // de bas na tshad ma gzhan dang sgra gzhan 'jug pa'i phyir /
translated: Therefore, because another valid cognition and another sound are applied,

original: sgra dang rtags dag gis gzhan rnam par bcad pa rtogs par byed do //
analyzed: sgra dang rtags dag gis gzhan rnam par bcad pa rtogs par byed do //
translated: sound and signs cause the understanding of the elimination of other.

original: de nyid bstan pa'i phyir 'di ltar zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: de nyid bstan pa'i phyir 'di ltar zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: In order to demonstrate just that, he says, ‚ÄúIn this way,‚Äù and so on.

original: don gyi rang gi ngo bo ni don gyi bdag nyid do //
analyzed: don gyi rang gi ngo bo ni don gyi bdag nyid do //
translated: The nature of the object is the nature of the object.

original: gcig ni cha shas med pa ste bdag nyid rang gi ngo bos mngon sum yin pa la rjes su dpag pa zhes bya ba'i tshad ma rnams kyis brtag par bya ba gang yin pa ma mthong cha gzhan pa ci zhig yod mngon sum du mthong ba'i ngo bo
analyzed: gcig ni cha shas med pa ste bdag nyid rang gi ngo bos mngon sum yin pa la rjes su dpag pa zhes bya ba'i tshad ma rnams kyis brtag par bya ba gang yin pa ma mthong cha gzhan pa ci zhig yod mngon sum du mthong ba'i ngo bo
translated: One is partless, that is, its own nature is directly perceived, and it is not seen to be something to be examined by any other valid cognition called ‚Äúinference.‚Äù What other part is there?

original: nyid las gzhan pa ma mthong ba'i ngo bo nyid gzhan ci zhig yod de /
analyzed: nyid las gzhan pa ma mthong ba'i ngo bo nyid gzhan ci zhig yod de /
translated: What other nature is there that is not seen, apart from the nature that is directly perceived?

original: ngo bo nyid la cha shas med pa'i phyir thams cad mthong ba kho na yin no //
analyzed: ngo bo nyid la cha shas med pa'i phyir thams cad mthong ba kho na yin no //
translated: Because the nature itself is partless, everything is seen.

original: de lta bas na tshad ma gzhan gyis brtags par bya ba ma yin par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de lta bas na tshad ma gzhan gyis brtags par bya ba ma yin par 'gyur ro //
translated: Therefore, it is not something to be examined by another valid cognition.

original: tshad ma rnams kyis zhes bya ba ni gsal ba'i bye brag gis mang ba'i tshig tu @60b byas pa yin no //
analyzed: tshad ma rnams kyis zhes bya ba ni gsal ba'i bye brag gis mang ba'i tshig tu @60b byas pa yin no //
translated: The plural particle in ‚Äúthe valid cognitions‚Äù is used because of the variety of the individual instances.

original: don gyi bdag nyid gcig pa zhes bya ba la sogs pas ni rnam par 'grel te /
analyzed: don gyi bdag nyid gcig pa zhes bya ba la sogs pas ni rnam par 'grel te /
translated: He explains the meaning of ‚Äúone nature of the object‚Äù and so on.

original: don gyi bdag nyid gcig pa ni cha shas med pa'o //
analyzed: don gyi bdag nyid gcig pa ni cha shas med pa'o //
translated: ‚ÄúOne nature of the object‚Äù means partless.

original: gang la rjes su dpag pa 'jug pa de ni re zhig mngon sum pa yin par khas blangs dgos so //
analyzed: gang la rjes su dpag pa 'jug pa de ni re zhig mngon sum pa yin par khas blangs dgos so //
translated: Whatever is engaged by inference must first be accepted as being a matter of direct perception.

original: ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is this?

original: sngar tshad mas chos can ma grub na sgrub pa mi srid pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: sngar tshad mas chos can ma grub na sgrub pa mi srid pa'i phyir te /
translated: If the subject is not established by a valid cognition, then it is impossible to prove it.

original: gzhi ma grub pa nyid kyis rtags mi srid pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gzhi ma grub pa nyid kyis rtags mi srid pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because without a basis, a reason is impossible.

original: de lta bas na chos can rab tu grub pa dgos te /
analyzed: de lta bas na chos can rab tu grub pa dgos te /
translated: Therefore, the establishment of the subject is necessary.

original: dper na sgra mi rtag par bsgrub par bya ba la sgra mngon sum gyis grub pa lta bu ste /
analyzed: dper na sgra mi rtag par bsgrub par bya ba la sgra mngon sum gyis grub pa lta bu ste /
translated: For example, in the proof that sound is impermanent, sound is established by direct perception.

original: de'i phyir rang gi ngo bo mngon sum kho nas grub pa'i phyir /
analyzed: de'i phyir rang gi ngo bo mngon sum kho nas grub pa'i phyir /
translated: Therefore, because its nature is established by direct perception alone,

original: rnam pa thams cad 'grub po //
analyzed: rnam pa thams cad 'grub po //
translated: all aspects are established.

original: ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is this?

original: de las gzhan pa sgra sgrub pa'i ngo bo nyid las gzhan pa ma grub pa'i ngo bo nyid med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de las gzhan pa sgra sgrub pa'i ngo bo nyid las gzhan pa ma grub pa'i ngo bo nyid med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because apart from that, there is no other nature of the proof of sound, no other unestablished nature.

original: 'on te ma grub pa'i ngo bo nyid gcig yod na grub pa dang ma grub pa dag ngo bo nyid gcig pa nyid du 'gal ba'i phyir de'i ngo bo nyid ma yin te /
analyzed: 'on te ma grub pa'i ngo bo nyid gcig yod na grub pa dang ma grub pa dag ngo bo nyid gcig pa nyid du 'gal ba'i phyir de'i ngo bo nyid ma yin te /
translated: But if one of them has an unestablished nature, then it is contradictory for an established and an unestablished to have the same nature, so it is not its nature.

original: sgra'i ngo bo nyid ma yin no //
analyzed: sgra'i ngo bo nyid ma yin no //
translated: It is not the nature of sound.

original: de nyid gang zhig gang dang zhes bya ba la sogs pas ston te /
analyzed: de nyid gang zhig gang dang zhes bya ba la sogs pas ston te /
translated: This is shown by the passage beginning ‚ÄúThat which is established and that which is not established . . .‚Äù

original: grub pa ni chos ma thob pa las 'brel pa'o //
analyzed: grub pa ni chos ma thob pa las 'brel pa'o //
translated: ‚ÄúEstablished‚Äù means to be related to a non-acquired property.

original: bde ba ni thob pa rjes su 'jug pa'o //
analyzed: bde ba ni thob pa rjes su 'jug pa'o //
translated: ‚ÄúHappiness‚Äù means to be related to an acquired property.

original: gang la grub pa dang bde ba gcig pa yod pa de skad ces bya ste /
analyzed: gang la grub pa dang bde ba gcig pa yod pa de skad ces bya ste /
translated: That which has the same establishment and happiness is called that.

original: chos nyid mtshungs pa zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: chos nyid mtshungs pa zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: This means that they have the same nature.üîΩThat which is not established and happy with that, and which has a different establishment and happiness, is not its nature.

original: ngo bo nyid gang zhig gang dang lhan cig grub pa dang bde ba gcig pa can ma yin zhing grub pa dang bde ba tha dad pa can de ni de'i ngo bo nyid yin par gang dang grub pa dang bde ba tha dad pa de'i ngo bo nyid
analyzed: ngo bo nyid gang zhig gang dang lhan cig grub pa dang bde ba gcig pa can ma yin zhing grub pa dang bde ba tha dad pa can de ni de'i ngo bo nyid yin par gang dang grub pa dang bde ba tha dad pa de'i ngo bo nyid
translated: That which is established and happy with that is not its nature.

original: yin par rigs pa ma yin zhes bya bar sbyar te /
analyzed: yin par rigs pa ma yin zhes bya bar sbyar te /
translated: This is the meaning of the passage.

original: tha dad pa'i tha snyad tha dad pa nyid du rnam par gzhag pa'i rgyu ni de tsam du zad pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: tha dad pa'i tha snyad tha dad pa nyid du rnam par gzhag pa'i rgyu ni de tsam du zad pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because that is the extent of the cause for positing the convention of difference as different.üîΩIf it were not so,

original: de lta ma yin na zhes bya ba ni gal te tha dad pa'i rgyu 'di mi 'dod na de'i tshe tha dad pa'i tha snyad med par thal bar 'gyur ro zhes tha dad pa'am /
analyzed: de lta ma yin na zhes bya ba ni gal te tha dad pa'i rgyu 'di mi 'dod na de'i tshe tha dad pa'i tha snyad med par thal bar 'gyur ro zhes tha dad pa'am /
translated: if one did not accept this cause of difference, then it would follow that the convention of difference would not exist.

original: rgyu tha dad pa ni 'di zhes bya ba'i skabs su bshad zin to //
analyzed: rgyu tha dad pa ni 'di zhes bya ba'i skabs su bshad zin to //
translated: The difference or the cause of difference has already been explained in the section beginning ‚ÄúThis is . . .

original: gang gi phyir de lta yin pa de'i phyir chos can sgra la sogs pa mngon sum pa la de'i ngo bo nyid mtha' dag yongs su gcad pa'i phyir chos can de la tshad ma gzhan rjes su dpag pa 'jug pa'i go skabs med cing yul med do //üîΩgal te khyod la yang @61a * //
