analyzed: gang gi phyir de lta yin pa de'i phyir chos can sgra la sogs pa mngon sum pa la de'i ngo bo nyid mtha' dag yongs su gcad pa'i phyir chos can de la tshad ma gzhan rjes su dpag pa 'jug pa'i go skabs med cing yul med do // gal te khyod la yang @61a * //
translated: ‚Äù Since that is the case, because the entire nature of the subject, such as sound, is ascertained by direct perception, there is no opportunity for another valid cognition, such as inference, to engage that subject.

original: nyes pa mtshungs so zhe na /
analyzed: nyes pa mtshungs so zhe na /
translated: If you say, ‚ÄúThe same fault applies to you,‚ÄùüîΩwe reply, ‚ÄúNo, because we do not accept that the object of direct perception is different from the object of inference.‚Äù

original: gzugs chos mthun pa mthong ba las zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: gzugs chos mthun pa mthong ba las zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: ‚ÄúSeeing a similar form‚Äù and so on.

original: nya phyis la dngul gyi rnam pa lta bur sbyor bar mi byed na ste /
analyzed: nya phyis la dngul gyi rnam pa lta bur sbyor bar mi byed na ste /
translated: One does not apply silver to an oyster shell.

original: ltar zhes bya ba'i sgra ni lta bur zhes bya ba'i don yin no //
analyzed: ltar zhes bya ba'i sgra ni lta bur zhes bya ba'i don yin no //
translated: The word ‚Äúlike‚Äù means ‚Äúas if.‚Äù

original: ji ltar zhe na /
analyzed: ji ltar zhe na /
translated: How so?

original: dngul gyi gzugs dang nya phyis kyi gzugs chos mthun pa gang yin pa de mthong ba las te /
analyzed: dngul gyi gzugs dang nya phyis kyi gzugs chos mthun pa gang yin pa de mthong ba las te /
translated: From seeing the similarity of the form of silver and the form of an oyster shell.

original: nya phyis kyi gzugs khyad par nges par ma zin pa kho na 'dra bar shes pa'i rgyu yin pa'i phyir gzugs kyi chos mthun pa nyid du bshad kyi /
analyzed: nya phyis kyi gzugs khyad par nges par ma zin pa kho na 'dra bar shes pa'i rgyu yin pa'i phyir gzugs kyi chos mthun pa nyid du bshad kyi /
translated: Because the form of an oyster shell is the cause of the cognition of similarity, without ascertaining the specific form, the similarity of form is explained.

original: chos mthun pa zhes bya ba ni cung zad kyang med do //
analyzed: chos mthun pa zhes bya ba ni cung zad kyang med do //
translated: But there is no similarity at all.

original: gal te zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni 'khrul pa'i rgyu mtshan 'dra ba gzhan 'byung ba la sogs pa'i rgyus rnam par rtog pa'i blos yon tan gzhan brtan pa nyid la sogs pa sbyor bar mi byed cing sgro 'dogs par mi byed na'o //
analyzed: gal te zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni 'khrul pa'i rgyu mtshan 'dra ba gzhan 'byung ba la sogs pa'i rgyus rnam par rtog pa'i blos yon tan gzhan brtan pa nyid la sogs pa sbyor bar mi byed cing sgro 'dogs par mi byed na'o //
translated: ‚ÄúIf‚Äù and so on means that if the conceptual mind does not apply other qualities, such as solidity, and does not superimpose them due to the arising of another similar cause of error, and so on.

original: 'di skad du gal te 'khrul pa'i rgyu mtshan gyis yon tan gzhan sbyor bar mi byed na ni kho bo la yang nyes par 'gyur ba zhig na /
analyzed: 'di skad du gal te 'khrul pa'i rgyu mtshan gyis yon tan gzhan sbyor bar mi byed na ni kho bo la yang nyes par 'gyur ba zhig na /
translated: If one does not apply another quality because of a mistaken reason, then it would be a fault for me.

original: 'on kyang sgro 'dogs par byed de /
analyzed: 'on kyang sgro 'dogs par byed de /
translated: However, it is superimposition.

original: de bas na sgro 'dogs pa rnam par bcad pa'i phyir gzhan sel bar smra ba ltar tshad ma gzhan 'jug go //
analyzed: de bas na sgro 'dogs pa rnam par bcad pa'i phyir gzhan sel bar smra ba ltar tshad ma gzhan 'jug go //
translated: Therefore, in order to eliminate superimposition, another valid cognition engages, as in the case of the proponent of other-exclusion.

original: gal te zhes bya ba la sogs pas na rnam par 'grel te /
analyzed: gal te zhes bya ba la sogs pas na rnam par 'grel te /
translated: The phrase if, etc. is an explanation.

original: gang la de kho na nyid rang gi ngo bo thams cad mthong ba yod pa zhes tshig rnam par sbyar te /
analyzed: gang la de kho na nyid rang gi ngo bo thams cad mthong ba yod pa zhes tshig rnam par sbyar te /
translated: It is to be construed as where there is the seeing of all the natures of reality.

original: ji ltar nya phyis gzugs khyad par can du gzung ba la yang dkar po'i chos mthun pas dngul gyi rnam pa sbyor par byed pa de ltar nges pa'i gags su gyur pa ji ltar mthong ba nges pa'i gags byed pa 'khrul pa'i rgyu mtshan 'dra ba gzhan 'byung
analyzed: ji ltar nya phyis gzugs khyad par can du gzung ba la yang dkar po'i chos mthun pas dngul gyi rnam pa sbyor par byed pa de ltar nges pa'i gags su gyur pa ji ltar mthong ba nges pa'i gags byed pa 'khrul pa'i rgyu mtshan 'dra ba gzhan 'byung
translated: Just as in the case of apprehending the distinctive form of a mother-of-pearl stone, one applies the aspect of silver due to the similarity of its white quality, so too, when there is the arising of another similar mistaken reason that obstructs the ascertainment of what is seen,

original: ba la sogs pa'i mtshan nyid kyi yon tan gzhan bstan pa nyid la sogs pa sbyor bar mi byed cing sgro 'dogs par mi byed na'o //
analyzed: ba la sogs pa'i mtshan nyid kyi yon tan gzhan bstan pa nyid la sogs pa sbyor bar mi byed cing sgro 'dogs par mi byed na'o //
translated: and one does not apply the term ‚Äúsilver‚Äù to the shell, nor does one superimpose the shell on the silver.

original: gal te nya phyis la gzugs khyad par can bzung nas dngul lo zhes sgro 'dogs pa ni ma yin gyi /
analyzed: gal te nya phyis la gzugs khyad par can bzung nas dngul lo zhes sgro 'dogs pa ni ma yin gyi /
translated: If one thinks, ‚ÄúI do not superimpose silver on the shell by apprehending a particular form of silver,

original: 'on kyang nya phyis la dngul gyi gzugs kyi spyi gang yin pa de mthong nas so snyam du sems na /üîΩde'i phyir nya phyis la ni zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: 'on kyang nya phyis la dngul gyi gzugs kyi spyi gang yin pa de mthong nas so snyam du sems na / de'i phyir nya phyis la ni zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: but rather, having seen the universal of the form of silver in the shell, I think, ‚ÄòIt is silver.‚Äô ‚ÄùüîΩTo respond, it is said, ‚ÄúThe shell does not have two natures,

original: nya phyis la ni dngul dang mtshungs pa dang khyad par can thun mong ma yin pa dang / ngo bo gnyis yod pa ni ma yin no //
analyzed: nya phyis la ni dngul dang mtshungs pa dang khyad par can thun mong ma yin pa dang / ngo bo gnyis yod pa ni ma yin no //
translated: a nature similar to silver and a particular, uncommon nature.‚Äù

original: ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: de ltar spyi dang khyad par gyi ngo bor 'dren mar snang bar rtogs par thal bar 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de ltar spyi dang khyad par gyi ngo bor 'dren mar snang bar rtogs par thal bar 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it would follow that the universal and the particular would be perceived alternately.

original: @61b bye brag tu ma rtogs na ni zhes bya ba ni 'di ni spyi'o //
analyzed: @61b bye brag tu ma rtogs na ni zhes bya ba ni 'di ni spyi'o //
translated: If one does not understand the distinction, one thinks, ‚ÄúThis is a universal.

original: 'di ni khyad par ro zhes de ltar bye brag tu rnam par dbye par mi rtogs na ni gnyis nyid du brtags pa mi rung ba'i phyir te /
analyzed: 'di ni khyad par ro zhes de ltar bye brag tu rnam par dbye par mi rtogs na ni gnyis nyid du brtags pa mi rung ba'i phyir te /
translated: If one does not understand that the difference is a particular, then it is not possible to impute duality,

original: dngul la ngo bo gnyis yod do zhes brtags pa mi rung ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: dngul la ngo bo gnyis yod do zhes brtags pa mi rung ba'i phyir ro //
translated: because it is not possible to impute two natures to silver.

original: snang ba tha dad pa med na gnyis nyid du brtags pa ha cang thal bar 'gyur pa'i yang phyir te /
analyzed: snang ba tha dad pa med na gnyis nyid du brtags pa ha cang thal bar 'gyur pa'i yang phyir te /
translated: And because it is absurd to impute duality when there is no difference in appearance,

original: gcig pa nyid du 'dod pa gzhan la yang gnyis nyid du brtags par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gcig pa nyid du 'dod pa gzhan la yang gnyis nyid du brtags par 'gyur ro //
translated: because it would follow, absurdly, that even those who maintain that there is only one would impute duality.

original: de lta bas na nya phyis la ngo bo gnyis mi rung ba'i phyir nya phyis kyi gzugs mthong ba'i skyes bus khyad par kho na rang gi mtshan nyid kho na mthong gi spyi ni ma yin no //
analyzed: de lta bas na nya phyis la ngo bo gnyis mi rung ba'i phyir nya phyis kyi gzugs mthong ba'i skyes bus khyad par kho na rang gi mtshan nyid kho na mthong gi spyi ni ma yin no //
translated: Therefore, because it is not possible for there to be two natures in a mother-of-pearl shell, a person who sees the form of a mother-of-pearl shell sees only a particular, not a universal.

original: nges pa'i rkyen ni goms pa la sogs pa ste /
analyzed: nges pa'i rkyen ni goms pa la sogs pa ste /
translated: The determining conditions are familiarity and so on.

original: de dag ma tshang pa'i phyir nya phyis kyi gzugs kyi khyad par gtan la ma phebs pas de spyi dngul gyi gzugs kyi spyi mthong ngo snyam du rlom par byed do //
analyzed: de dag ma tshang pa'i phyir nya phyis kyi gzugs kyi khyad par gtan la ma phebs pas de spyi dngul gyi gzugs kyi spyi mthong ngo snyam du rlom par byed do //
translated: Because they are incomplete, they do not ascertain the specific features of the oyster shell. Therefore they presume that they see the universal form of silver.

original: de'i phyir zhes bya ba ni dngul gyi gzugs kyi spyi 'dzin par mngon pa'i nga rgyal byed pa'i phyir lta ba po 'di nya phyis la dngul du sgro 'dogs shing /
analyzed: de'i phyir zhes bya ba ni dngul gyi gzugs kyi spyi 'dzin par mngon pa'i nga rgyal byed pa'i phyir lta ba po 'di nya phyis la dngul du sgro 'dogs shing /
translated: Because of that, because of the pride of apprehending the universal form of silver, this viewer superimposes silver on the oyster shell.

original: ji ltar nya phyis la dngul du sgro 'dogs pa de ltar chos can sgra la sogs pa mthong ba la 'khrul pa'i rgyu mtshan 'dra ba gzhan skye bas /
analyzed: ji ltar nya phyis la dngul du sgro 'dogs pa de ltar chos can sgra la sogs pa mthong ba la 'khrul pa'i rgyu mtshan 'dra ba gzhan skye bas /
translated: Just as he superimposes silver on the oyster shell, so too, because of the similarity of the reasons for error in seeing the subject, such as sound, and so on,

original: skad cig ma 'dra ba gnyis pa skye bas skad cig ma snga phyi dag tha dad pa nyid du ma 'phrigs pa'i skyes bu de'i ngo bor sgro btags pa'i phyir /
analyzed: skad cig ma 'dra ba gnyis pa skye bas skad cig ma snga phyi dag tha dad pa nyid du ma 'phrigs pa'i skyes bu de'i ngo bor sgro btags pa'i phyir /
translated: a second similar instant arises. Because of the superimposition of the entity of that person who does not understand that the former and latter moments are different, because of the arising of a second similar instant,

original: skad cig ma snga ma des kyang phyis kyang ngo bor sgro btags shing yod par sgro btags pa'i phyir gnas par 'khrul lo //
analyzed: skad cig ma snga ma des kyang phyis kyang ngo bor sgro btags shing yod par sgro btags pa'i phyir gnas par 'khrul lo //
translated: and the former moment of sound is also mistaken as enduring because it is reified as the later moment and reified as existent.

original: de lta bas na sgra la sogs pa skad cig ma dang bdag med pa la sogs pa'i ngo bo nyid 'di la gzhan gyi dngos po brtan pa nyid la sogs pa ji snyed pa rang gi rgyu mtshan ji lta ba las 'byung ba'i ste /
analyzed: de lta bas na sgra la sogs pa skad cig ma dang bdag med pa la sogs pa'i ngo bo nyid 'di la gzhan gyi dngos po brtan pa nyid la sogs pa ji snyed pa rang gi rgyu mtshan ji lta ba las 'byung ba'i ste /
translated: Therefore, in regard to this nature of sound, etc., which is momentary, selfless, etc., the superimpositions of other entities such as endurance, etc., arise in accordance with their own causal conditions.

original: gzhan zhig gang gi rgyu mtshan du 'tsham pa las 'byung ba'i sgro 'dogs par yang de snyed kho na yin pas de rnam par gcod par byed pa /
analyzed: gzhan zhig gang gi rgyu mtshan du 'tsham pa las 'byung ba'i sgro 'dogs par yang de snyed kho na yin pas de rnam par gcod par byed pa /
translated: And the superimpositions of other entities that are not suitable as causal conditions arise in just the same way.

original: sgro 'dogs pa de rnam par gcod par byed pa'i tshad ma rnams ma 'byung zhing skye ba'i 'bras bu dang bcas par 'gyur te /
analyzed: sgro 'dogs pa de rnam par gcod par byed pa'i tshad ma rnams ma 'byung zhing skye ba'i 'bras bu dang bcas par 'gyur te /
translated: Therefore, the valid knowledges that eliminate those superimpositions arise and are accompanied by the result of production.

original: don dang bcas par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: don dang bcas par 'gyur ro //
translated: They are accompanied by the object.

original: tshad ma rnams zhes bya ba ni gsal ba'i bye brag gis mang po'i tshig tu smos pa yin no //
analyzed: tshad ma rnams zhes bya ba ni gsal ba'i bye brag gis mang po'i tshig tu smos pa yin no //
translated: The pluralizing particle in ‚Äúthe valid knowledges‚Äù is stated in accordance with the individual instances.

original: rnam par gcod pa'i 'bras bu can sgro 'dogs pa 'gog pa'i 'bras bu can gyi tshad ma de dag ni dngos po'i cha shas dngos @62a * //
analyzed: rnam par gcod pa'i 'bras bu can sgro 'dogs pa 'gog pa'i 'bras bu can gyi tshad ma de dag ni dngos po'i cha shas dngos @62a * //
translated: Valid knowledge that has the result of elimination and valid knowledge that has the result of stopping superimposition.üîΩ

original: po'i cha ma rtogs pa rtogs par bya ba rab tu gsal bar bya ba'i phyir /
analyzed: po'i cha ma rtogs pa rtogs par bya ba rab tu gsal bar bya ba'i phyir /
translated: The results of the valid cognitions that eliminate superimpositions and that eliminate misconceptions are not engaged in order to understand what was not understood about a part of a thing.

original: 'jug pa ma yin te chos can bltar rung ba cha shad med pa la dngos po'i cha shas de ni mthong zin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'jug pa ma yin te chos can bltar rung ba cha shad med pa la dngos po'i cha shas de ni mthong zin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: This is because the part of a thing is seen in the partless object that is suitable to be seen.

original: ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: cha shas med pa la phyogs gcig mthong ba mi rung ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: cha shas med pa la phyogs gcig mthong ba mi rung ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it is not suitable to see one part of a partless object.

original: gang gi phyir de lta yin pa de'i phyir dngos po mngon sum gyis mthong ba'i yon tan mtha' dag ste ngo bo nyid ril mthong ba nyid do //
analyzed: gang gi phyir de lta yin pa de'i phyir dngos po mngon sum gyis mthong ba'i yon tan mtha' dag ste ngo bo nyid ril mthong ba nyid do //
translated: Therefore, all the qualities of seeing a thing with direct perception are seeing the whole nature of the thing.

original: 'on kyang 'khrul pa'i rgyu nges par mi byed pa'i phyir /
analyzed: 'on kyang 'khrul pa'i rgyu nges par mi byed pa'i phyir /
translated: However, because the cause of error is not ascertained,

original: bsgrub pa zhes bya ba la 'khrul pa sel bar byed pa'i rjes su dpag pa rab tu 'jug pa yin /
analyzed: bsgrub pa zhes bya ba la 'khrul pa sel bar byed pa'i rjes su dpag pa rab tu 'jug pa yin /
translated: an inference that eliminates error is engaged in, which is called ‚Äúproof.‚Äù

original: rjes su dpag pa las zhes bya ba la sogs pa las kyang zhes bya ba ni mngon sum la ltos nas bsdu ba'i don yin te /
analyzed: rjes su dpag pa las zhes bya ba la sogs pa las kyang zhes bya ba ni mngon sum la ltos nas bsdu ba'i don yin te /
translated: ‚ÄúFrom inference, etc.‚Äù means that it is included in relation to direct perception.

original: rjes su dpag pa'i gtan tshigs kyang bsgrub pa'i ngo bor dngos po 'dzin par khas len na /
analyzed: rjes su dpag pa'i gtan tshigs kyang bsgrub pa'i ngo bor dngos po 'dzin par khas len na /
translated: If you accept that the reason for inference apprehends the entity of the probandum,

original: me la sogs pa chos can gyi chos gcig nges par gyur pas /
analyzed: me la sogs pa chos can gyi chos gcig nges par gyur pas /
translated: then when one property of the subject, such as fire, is ascertained,

original: chos can la cha shas med pa'i phyir chos kun 'dzin te /
analyzed: chos can la cha shas med pa'i phyir chos kun 'dzin te /
translated: all properties are apprehended, because the subject is partless.

original: de lta yin na tshad ma gzhan don med do snyam du bsams pa yin no //
analyzed: de lta yin na tshad ma gzhan don med do snyam du bsams pa yin no //
translated: If that were so, other means of valid knowledge would be pointless.

original: sel ba'i sgro 'dogs pa rnam par gcod pa ste /
analyzed: sel ba'i sgro 'dogs pa rnam par gcod pa ste /
translated: The superimposition of exclusion is eliminated.

original: de rjes su dpag pas rtogs par byed pa khas len na bshad ma thag pa'i nyes pa 'dir thal bar mi 'gyur ro //üîΩ'ga' zhig ces bya ba la sogs pas ni rnam par 'grel pa yin no //
analyzed: de rjes su dpag pas rtogs par byed pa khas len na bshad ma thag pa'i nyes pa 'dir thal bar mi 'gyur ro // 'ga' zhig ces bya ba la sogs pas ni rnam par 'grel pa yin no //
translated: If you accept that it is understood through inference, the previously explained error would not ensue.üîΩ‚ÄúSome‚Äù and so on is an explanation.

original: chos can 'ga' zhig mngon sum gyis mthong ba la zhes bya bar sbyar te /
analyzed: chos can 'ga' zhig mngon sum gyis mthong ba la zhes bya bar sbyar te /
translated: ‚ÄúSome‚Äù is connected to ‚Äúthe subject is seen by direct perception.‚Äù

original: mngon sum du mthong ba'i chos can 'ga' zhig ces bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: mngon sum du mthong ba'i chos can 'ga' zhig ces bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: The phrase ‚Äúsome directly perceived phenomena‚Äù means some phenomena that are directly perceived.

original: chos can thams cad mngon sum du mi 'gyur ba 'ga' zhig la zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: chos can thams cad mngon sum du mi 'gyur ba 'ga' zhig la zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: The phrase ‚Äúall phenomena that are not directly perceived‚Äù means some phenomena that are not directly perceived.

original: bshad ma thag pa'i tshul gyis tshad ma gzhan mi 'jug pa'o //üîΩgang gi tshe rjes su dpag pas kyang bsgrub pas /
analyzed: bshad ma thag pa'i tshul gyis tshad ma gzhan mi 'jug pa'o // gang gi tshe rjes su dpag pas kyang bsgrub pas /
translated: The phrase ‚Äúthe other means of valid knowledge do not apply‚Äù means that the other means of valid knowledge that have been explained do not apply.

original: me la sogs pa'i dngos po rtogs par byed do zhes bya bar 'dod kyi /
analyzed: me la sogs pa'i dngos po rtogs par byed do zhes bya bar 'dod kyi /
translated: The phrase ‚Äúwhen a thing such as fire is understood through inference‚Äù means when a thing such as fire is understood through inference.

original: sgro 'dogs pa rnam par gcod par byed pa ni ma yin pa'o //
analyzed: sgro 'dogs pa rnam par gcod par byed pa ni ma yin pa'o //
translated: The phrase ‚Äúit is not the case that a superimposition is eliminated‚Äù means that a superimposition is not eliminated.

original: de'i tshe zhes bya ba ni bsgrub pa'i tshul gyis shes par byed pa'i tshe /
analyzed: de'i tshe zhes bya ba ni bsgrub pa'i tshul gyis shes par byed pa'i tshe /
translated: The phrase ‚Äúat that time‚Äù means at the time when understanding is produced through the method of proof.

original: chos gcig nges na de dang tha mi dad pa'i phyir nges pa'i chos dang tha mi dad pa'i phyir chos thams cad nges pas tshad ma gzhan mi 'jug ste /
analyzed: chos gcig nges na de dang tha mi dad pa'i phyir nges pa'i chos dang tha mi dad pa'i phyir chos thams cad nges pas tshad ma gzhan mi 'jug ste /
translated: The phrase ‚Äúbecause all phenomena are ascertained‚Äù means because all phenomena are ascertained. The phrase ‚Äúthe other means of valid knowledge do not apply‚Äù means that the other means of valid knowledge do not apply.

original: rjes su dpag pa gzhan mi 'jug go //
analyzed: rjes su dpag pa gzhan mi 'jug go //
translated: The phrase ‚Äúanother inference does not apply‚Äù means another inference does not apply.

original: gal te tha mi dad pa yin du zin kyang chos thams cad nges pa ni @62b ma yin no zhe na /
analyzed: gal te tha mi dad pa yin du zin kyang chos thams cad nges pa ni @62b ma yin no zhe na /
translated: If, even though they are not different, all phenomena are not ascertained,

original: de nges na zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: de nges na zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: then the response is ‚ÄúIf it is ascertained‚Ä¶‚Äù

original: de zhes bya ba ni rjes su dpag pa dang pos nges pa'i chos te /
analyzed: de zhes bya ba ni rjes su dpag pa dang pos nges pa'i chos te /
translated: ‚ÄúIt‚Äù refers to the phenomenon ascertained by the first inference.

original: de'i bdag nyid ces bya ba nges pa'i chos kyi bdag nyid yin pas /
analyzed: de'i bdag nyid ces bya ba nges pa'i chos kyi bdag nyid yin pas /
translated: Since it is the nature of the ascertained phenomenon,

original: ma nges pa ni rigs pa ma yin no //
analyzed: ma nges pa ni rigs pa ma yin no //
translated: it is not reasonable that it is not ascertained.üîΩThis fault does not arise in the case of exclusion.

original: sel ba la nyes pa 'di ni thal bar mi 'gyur zhes bya ba 'di'i rnam par 'grel pa ni /
analyzed: sel ba la nyes pa 'di ni thal bar mi 'gyur zhes bya ba 'di'i rnam par 'grel pa ni /
translated: The commentary on this statement ‚ÄúThis fault does not arise in the case of exclusion‚Äù is as follows.

original: gang gi tshe zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: gang gi tshe zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: The statement ‚ÄúWhen‚Ä¶‚Äù and so on.

original: de'i tshe na rjes su dpag pa gcig gis sgro 'dogs pa gcig rnam par gcad pas sgro 'dogs pa gzhan rnam par gcad pa byas pa ma yin pa'i phyir /
analyzed: de'i tshe na rjes su dpag pa gcig gis sgro 'dogs pa gcig rnam par gcad pas sgro 'dogs pa gzhan rnam par gcad pa byas pa ma yin pa'i phyir /
translated: At that time, since one superimposition is eliminated by one inference, another superimposition is not eliminated.

original: de'i don du sgro 'dogs pa gzhan rnam par gcad pa'i don du'o //
analyzed: de'i don du sgro 'dogs pa gzhan rnam par gcad pa'i don du'o //
translated: For that purpose, for the purpose of eliminating another superimposition.

original: gzhan zhes bya ba ni rjes su dpag pa bzhin no //
analyzed: gzhan zhes bya ba ni rjes su dpag pa bzhin no //
translated: ‚ÄúAnother‚Äù is like the inference.

original: gzhan gyis ma rtogs pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa smras te /
analyzed: gzhan gyis ma rtogs pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa smras te /
translated: One might say: But it is not understood by others.

original: sngar de las bzlog pa'i rnam par sgro 'dogs pa'i phyin ci log 'jug pa la phyis der phyin ci log sngon du 'gro ba can gyi don mi shes pa rtags las nges par 'gyur ro zhes bya ba'i nges pa 'di ni med de /
analyzed: sngar de las bzlog pa'i rnam par sgro 'dogs pa'i phyin ci log 'jug pa la phyis der phyin ci log sngon du 'gro ba can gyi don mi shes pa rtags las nges par 'gyur ro zhes bya ba'i nges pa 'di ni med de /
translated: This certainty that the error of superimposition, which is the opposite of that, occurs earlier, and that later the non-understanding of the object, which is preceded by the error, is ascertained from the evidence, does not exist,

original: phyin ci log dang bral ba la yang rjes su dpag pa srid pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: phyin ci log dang bral ba la yang rjes su dpag pa srid pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because inference is possible even for one free from error.

original: de nyid dper na zhes bya ba la sogs pas ston te /
analyzed: de nyid dper na zhes bya ba la sogs pas ston te /
translated: That very thing is shown by For example, etc.

original: du ba glo bur ba las zhes bya ba ni phyogs 'ga' zhig na ma bsams pa las du ba glo bur du byung ba las me rtogs pa lta bu'o //
analyzed: du ba glo bur ba las zhes bya ba ni phyogs 'ga' zhig na ma bsams pa las du ba glo bur du byung ba las me rtogs pa lta bu'o //
translated: From adventitious smoke, means from the adventitious occurrence of smoke in some place, without thought, the understanding of fire.

original: de la ni zhes bya ba ni glo bur ba las me rtogs pa las me ma yin par sgro 'dogs pa mi srid do //
analyzed: de la ni zhes bya ba ni glo bur ba las me rtogs pa las me ma yin par sgro 'dogs pa mi srid do //
translated: There, means in the understanding of fire from the adventitious occurrence of smoke, the superimposition of non-fire is not possible.

original: de bas na zhes bya ba ni de lta bas na rjes su dpag pas thams cad la rnam par gcod par byed pa ni ma yin no zhe na /
analyzed: de bas na zhes bya ba ni de lta bas na rjes su dpag pas thams cad la rnam par gcod par byed pa ni ma yin no zhe na /
translated: Therefore, if you say, ‚ÄúSince that is so, inference does not eliminate everything,‚Äù

original: slob dpon gyis 'di la zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: slob dpon gyis 'di la zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: the master BuddhapƒÅlita says, ‚ÄúHere, in this system of the master NƒÅgƒÅrjuna, the response to that has already been explained.‚Äù

original: rjes su dpag pa bsgrub pa'i tshul du 'jug pa 'di la lan bshad zin te /
analyzed: rjes su dpag pa bsgrub pa'i tshul du 'jug pa 'di la lan bshad zin te /
translated: The response to the objection that the subject is not established has already been explained.

original: mngon sum gyis chos can rtogs na /üîΩde'i chos rnams chos can las tha mi dad pa'i phyir thams cad rtogs par 'gyur bas rjes su dpag pa don med do zhes bya ba dang 'on te chos can las chos tha dad par khas len na ni tha dad par khas blangs pa'i phyir chos can dang
analyzed: mngon sum gyis chos can rtogs na / de'i chos rnams chos can las tha mi dad pa'i phyir thams cad rtogs par 'gyur bas rjes su dpag pa don med do zhes bya ba dang 'on te chos can las chos tha dad par khas len na ni tha dad par khas blangs pa'i phyir chos can dang
translated: If the subject is realized by direct perception,üîΩthen since its properties are not different from the subject, everything would be realized. Therefore inference would be pointless.

original: lhan cig de'i bdag nyid kyi mtshan nyid kyi 'brel pa ma yin no //
analyzed: lhan cig de'i bdag nyid kyi mtshan nyid kyi 'brel pa ma yin no //
translated: If you accept that the property is different from the subject, then because you accept that it is different, the subject and the property are not related by the defining characteristic of being the same nature.

original: mi rtag pa nyid la sogs pa yang chos can gyi rang gi ngo bo las 'byung ba yang ma yin la /
analyzed: mi rtag pa nyid la sogs pa yang chos can gyi rang gi ngo bo las 'byung ba yang ma yin la /
translated: Impermanence and so on do not arise from the nature of the subject.

original: chos can yang mi rtag pa nyid la sogs pa las 'byung ba yang ma yin no //
analyzed: chos can yang mi rtag pa nyid la sogs pa las 'byung ba yang ma yin no //
translated: Nor does the subject arise from impermanence, etc.

original: da bas na @63a * //
analyzed: da bas na @63a * //
translated: Therefore,

original: chos ma 'brel pa ni chos can de la rtogs pa med do zhes bya ba 'di yang rgyu dang 'bras bur ma gyur pa ni de la rjes su dpag pa mi srid pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba'i bar skabs der bshad zin to //
analyzed: chos ma 'brel pa ni chos can de la rtogs pa med do zhes bya ba 'di yang rgyu dang 'bras bur ma gyur pa ni de la rjes su dpag pa mi srid pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba'i bar skabs der bshad zin to //
translated: the non-related property is not understood in that subject. This has already been explained in the section beginning with ‚ÄúBecause that which is not cause and effect cannot be inferred from it.‚Äù

original: gang gi phyir de lta yin pa de'i phyir du ba glo bur du mthong ba las me rtogs pa de la yang de mthong ba la phyogs mthong ba'i skyes bu la de'i rang gi ngo bo ma nges pa med dang ldan pa'i rang bzhin gyi ngo bo ma
analyzed: gang gi phyir de lta yin pa de'i phyir du ba glo bur du mthong ba las me rtogs pa de la yang de mthong ba la phyogs mthong ba'i skyes bu la de'i rang gi ngo bo ma nges pa med dang ldan pa'i rang bzhin gyi ngo bo ma
translated: Since that is so, even in the case of understanding fire from seeing smoke suddenly, for that person who sees that, there is no uncertainty about its nature, which is endowed with the nature of possessing that.

original: nges pa ni yod pa kho na'o //
analyzed: nges pa ni yod pa kho na'o //
translated: The uncertainty about its nature definitely exists.

original: ma nges pa de yang ga las she na /
analyzed: ma nges pa de yang ga las she na /
translated: And from what is that uncertainty?

original: phyin ci log kho na las yin te /
analyzed: phyin ci log kho na las yin te /
translated: It is only from error.

original: me dang ldan pa ma yin pa'i sa phyogs dang 'dra ba nyid du 'dzin pa kho na sa yin no //
analyzed: me dang ldan pa ma yin pa'i sa phyogs dang 'dra ba nyid du 'dzin pa kho na sa yin no //
translated: It is only the apprehension of being like a place that is not endowed with fire.

original: de nyid de yang zhes bya ba la sogs pas ston te /
analyzed: de nyid de yang zhes bya ba la sogs pas ston te /
translated: ‚ÄúThat itself‚Äù and so on.

original: de yang zhes bya ba ni skyes bu'o //
analyzed: de yang zhes bya ba ni skyes bu'o //
translated: ‚ÄúThat itself‚Äù refers to the person.

original: phyogs de me dang ldan pa yin yang blo ji lta bu zhig gis she na /
analyzed: phyogs de me dang ldan pa yin yang blo ji lta bu zhig gis she na /
translated: But how does the mind apprehend that place as possessing fire?

original: me dang ldan par 'dzin pa dang bral bas te /
analyzed: me dang ldan par 'dzin pa dang bral bas te /
translated: It is free from apprehending it as possessing fire.

original: me dang ldan par sems pa med pa des dben pa zhes bya ba mes dben pa ste ngos dben pa'i ngo bor nges pa byed pa na /
analyzed: me dang ldan par sems pa med pa des dben pa zhes bya ba mes dben pa ste ngos dben pa'i ngo bor nges pa byed pa na /
translated: When one ascertains the nature of the place as being isolated from fire, that is, as being isolated from fire,

original: de ma yin pa la der 'dzin pa'i phyir ji ltar phyin ci log pa ma yin phyin ci log pa kho na yin te /
analyzed: de ma yin pa la der 'dzin pa'i phyir ji ltar phyin ci log pa ma yin phyin ci log pa kho na yin te /
translated: then, because one apprehends what is not fire as fire, how could that not be a misconception? It is definitely a misconception.

original: 'di ltar ji srid dus phyogs der du ba ma mthong ba de srid du /
analyzed: 'di ltar ji srid dus phyogs der du ba ma mthong ba de srid du /
translated: As long as one does not see smoke in that place,

original: de yang me med pa'i sa phyogs gzhan dang 'dra bar 'dzin to //
analyzed: de yang me med pa'i sa phyogs gzhan dang 'dra bar 'dzin to //
translated: one apprehends it as being similar to another place that is devoid of fire.

original: rjes su dpag par bya ba 'ga' zhig la /
analyzed: rjes su dpag par bya ba 'ga' zhig la /
translated: With regard to some object to be inferred,

original: phyin ci log gi shes pa med du zin kyang 'on kyang de la the tshom yod par 'gyur la the tshom yang gnyi ga'i cha la brten pa yin pas /
analyzed: phyin ci log gi shes pa med du zin kyang 'on kyang de la the tshom yod par 'gyur la the tshom yang gnyi ga'i cha la brten pa yin pas /
translated: Even if there were no erroneous cognition, still there would be doubt about it, and doubt is based on both sides.

original: phyogs la der 'khrul pa la reg par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: phyogs la der 'khrul pa la reg par 'gyur ro //
translated: Therefore, one would touch error in regard to the position.

original: de'i phyir the tshom bsal ba la yang rtags kyis rnam par gcad par bya ba kho na yin no //
analyzed: de'i phyir the tshom bsal ba la yang rtags kyis rnam par gcad par bya ba kho na yin no //
translated: Therefore, even in the case of the removal of doubt, the object to be eliminated is only by means of a reason.

original: rtags kho nas rjes su dpag par bya ba rtogs par byed pa ni rjes su dpag par bya ba de la gdon mi za bar phyin ci log dang / the tshom dag dang ldan par 'gyur te /
analyzed: rtags kho nas rjes su dpag par bya ba rtogs par byed pa ni rjes su dpag par bya ba de la gdon mi za bar phyin ci log dang / the tshom dag dang ldan par 'gyur te /
translated: When one understands the object to be inferred only by means of a reason, one necessarily has error and doubt in regard to that object to be inferred.

original: 'di ltar de'i rnam par sgro 'dogs pa dang / the tshom dang bral bar me'i rnam par sgro 'dogs pa dang / the tshom dang bral ba'i skyes bu ni de rtogs par bya ba la rtags kyi rjes su 'brang bar yang mi byed de phyogs kyi chos la brten par mi byed la /
analyzed: 'di ltar de'i rnam par sgro 'dogs pa dang / the tshom dang bral bar me'i rnam par sgro 'dogs pa dang / the tshom dang bral ba'i skyes bu ni de rtogs par bya ba la rtags kyi rjes su 'brang bar yang mi byed de phyogs kyi chos la brten par mi byed la /
translated: Thus, a person who is free from superimposition and doubt in regard to the form of fire does not follow the reason in order to understand that, does not rely on the property of the subject.

original: de bzhin du rtags de'i rjes su 'gro ba dang ldog pa dag la gus par yang mi byed pa zhig na /
analyzed: de bzhin du rtags de'i rjes su 'gro ba dang ldog pa dag la gus par yang mi byed pa zhig na /
translated: Likewise, one should not respect the pervasion and counter-pervasion of that reason.

original: 'di ltar rjes su 'brang bar yang @63b byed gus par yang byed de /
analyzed: 'di ltar rjes su 'brang bar yang @63b byed gus par yang byed de /
translated: However, one does follow it and does respect it.

original: de lta bas na rtogs par byed pa po de'i rnam par sgro 'dogs pa dang / the tshom dang ldan pa ni rjes su dpag par bya ba 'ga' zhig la rtags kyi stobs kyis sgro 'dogs pa dang / the tshom sel bar byed pas de bas na thams cad la sgro 'dogs pa rnam par gcod par byed do //
analyzed: de lta bas na rtogs par byed pa po de'i rnam par sgro 'dogs pa dang / the tshom dang ldan pa ni rjes su dpag par bya ba 'ga' zhig la rtags kyi stobs kyis sgro 'dogs pa dang / the tshom sel bar byed pas de bas na thams cad la sgro 'dogs pa rnam par gcod par byed do //
translated: Therefore, the one who is the cognizer, who has doubt and superimposition, eliminates superimposition and doubt with regard to some object of inference through the power of the reason. Thus, he eliminates superimposition with regard to everything.

original: de'i phyir de ltar bshad pa'i rnam pas sel ba'i yul can yin te /
analyzed: de'i phyir de ltar bshad pa'i rnam pas sel ba'i yul can yin te /
translated: Therefore, the object of elimination is in the manner explained.

original: rnam par gcod pa'i yul can yin no //
analyzed: rnam par gcod pa'i yul can yin no //
translated: It is the object of elimination of the object of elimination.üîΩOtherwise, if one understood an entity from a reason without relying on elimination,

original: gzhan du zhes bya ba ni rnam par gcod pa la mi ltos par rtags las dngos po rtogs par 'gyur na ni /
analyzed: gzhan du zhes bya ba ni rnam par gcod pa la mi ltos par rtags las dngos po rtogs par 'gyur na ni /
translated: then one would understand it even from a dissimilar example.

original: tshad ma 'ga' zhig gis chos can grub par gyur na de las grub pa'i ngo bo nyid las chos can de'i ngo bo ma grub pas gang zhig rtogs par bya ba'i phyir rtags 'jug par 'gyur ba gzhan ci zhig yod /
analyzed: tshad ma 'ga' zhig gis chos can grub par gyur na de las grub pa'i ngo bo nyid las chos can de'i ngo bo ma grub pas gang zhig rtogs par bya ba'i phyir rtags 'jug par 'gyur ba gzhan ci zhig yod /
translated: If a subject is established by some valid cognition, then since the nature of that subject is established from that, what other thing is there that would be realized for which a reason would be employed?

original: re zhig sgro 'dogs pa yod na ni de rnam par bcad pa'i phyir 'jug pa'i rtags gzhan sel ba'i yul can yin grang na /
analyzed: re zhig sgro 'dogs pa yod na ni de rnam par bcad pa'i phyir 'jug pa'i rtags gzhan sel ba'i yul can yin grang na /
translated: If superimposition exists, then a reason that engages in order to eliminate that would have an object of exclusion of other.

original: mngon sum gyi rjes su 'byung ba rnam par rtog pa can gyi shes pa gang yin pa de go sgro 'dogs pa med na ji ltar gzhan rnam par gcod pa'i yul can yin /
analyzed: mngon sum gyi rjes su 'byung ba rnam par rtog pa can gyi shes pa gang yin pa de go sgro 'dogs pa med na ji ltar gzhan rnam par gcod pa'i yul can yin /
translated: But if there is no superimposition in the conceptual consciousness that arises after a perception, how could it have an object that is the exclusion of other?

original: de yang gdon mi za bar gzhan sel ba'i yul can du ni 'dod par bya dgos te /
analyzed: de yang gdon mi za bar gzhan sel ba'i yul can du ni 'dod par bya dgos te /
translated: Moreover, it must be accepted that it is an object that is the exclusion of other.

original: khyed kyi lta ba spyi'i yul can yin pa'i phyir la /
analyzed: khyed kyi lta ba spyi'i yul can yin pa'i phyir la /
translated: This is because, according to you, it is an object of a view and

original: spyi'i yang gzhan sel ba'i mtshan nyid yin pa'i phyir ro zhe na /
analyzed: spyi'i yang gzhan sel ba'i mtshan nyid yin pa'i phyir ro zhe na /
translated: a universal, and a universal is defined as the exclusion of other.

original: de'i phyir mthong ba 'ga' la'ang zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: de'i phyir mthong ba 'ga' la'ang zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: Therefore, he says, ‚ÄúEven in some cases of seeing, etc.‚Äù

original: gzugs la sogs pa mngon sum du mthong ba 'ga' la'ang de'i rjes la 'byung ba'i shes pa gang yin pa spyi'i don zhes bya ba ni spyi'i yul can te /
analyzed: gzugs la sogs pa mngon sum du mthong ba 'ga' la'ang de'i rjes la 'byung ba'i shes pa gang yin pa spyi'i don zhes bya ba ni spyi'i yul can te /
translated: Even in some cases of directly seeing form, etc., the subsequent consciousness is called ‚Äúhaving a general object‚Äù because it has a general object.

original: de nyid kyi phyir rnam par rtog pa'o //üîΩrnam pa gang la gzhan gyi cha ste /
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir rnam par rtog pa'o // rnam pa gang la gzhan gyi cha ste /
translated: Therefore, it is conceptual.üîΩThe aspect that is not imputed to be another part,

original: zla bo rnam pa sgro ma btags pa de ni gzhan gyi cha sgro ma btags pa'o //
analyzed: zla bo rnam pa sgro ma btags pa de ni gzhan gyi cha sgro ma btags pa'o //
translated: that is, to be a counterpart, is not imputed to be another part.

original: de la 'jug pa de yang de tsam sel ba'i spyod yul can cha sgro ma btags pa gang yin pa de tsam gyi rnam par gcod pa'i yul can yin no //
analyzed: de la 'jug pa de yang de tsam sel ba'i spyod yul can cha sgro ma btags pa gang yin pa de tsam gyi rnam par gcod pa'i yul can yin no //
translated: The engagement in that is also the domain of the mere exclusion of that. It is the domain of the mere exclusion of that much.

original: 'di skad du mngon sum gyi rjes la 'byung ba'i shes pa rnam par rtog pa can gyis sgro 'dogs pa sngar zhugs pa sel bar mi byed mod kyi /
analyzed: 'di skad du mngon sum gyi rjes la 'byung ba'i shes pa rnam par rtog pa can gyis sgro 'dogs pa sngar zhugs pa sel bar mi byed mod kyi /
translated: This is what it says: The conceptual subsequent consciousness does not eliminate the superimposition that has already occurred.

original: 'on kyang de ni sgro 'dogs pa'i yul la med pa'i phyir de rnam par gcod pa'i yul can kho na yin no zhes bya bar shes @64a * //
analyzed: 'on kyang de ni sgro 'dogs pa'i yul la med pa'i phyir de rnam par gcod pa'i yul can kho na yin no zhes bya bar shes @64a * //
translated: But since it does not exist in the object of reification, it is known to be the subject that eliminates that.

original: so ; / gal te yang rnam par rtog pa can gyi shes pa de dngos po la bsgrub par 'jug par 'gyur na ni /
analyzed: so ; / gal te yang rnam par rtog pa can gyi shes pa de dngos po la bsgrub par 'jug par 'gyur na ni /
translated: If the conceptual cognition engages in establishing the thing,

original: rnam pa thams cad la nges pa 'gyur ro zhes bshad pa yin no //
analyzed: rnam pa thams cad la nges pa 'gyur ro zhes bshad pa yin no //
translated: it would be ascertained in all aspects.

original: gzugs la sogs pa zhes bya ba la sogs pas ni tshigs su bcad pa ston te /
analyzed: gzugs la sogs pa zhes bya ba la sogs pas ni tshigs su bcad pa ston te /
translated: The verse beginning with form, etc. teaches this.

original: sogs pa zhes bya ba'i sgras ni sgra la sogs pa bsdu'o //
analyzed: sogs pa zhes bya ba'i sgras ni sgra la sogs pa bsdu'o //
translated: The word etc. includes sound, etc.

original: 'di la rtags med pas na rtags can ma yin pa ste /
analyzed: 'di la rtags med pas na rtags can ma yin pa ste /
translated: Since there is no reason here, it is unreasonable,

original: 'di ni gzugs la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: 'di ni gzugs la sogs pa'o //
translated: this is form, etc.

original: zhes nges pa'i shes pa'o //
analyzed: zhes nges pa'i shes pa'o //
translated: is a determinate cognition.

original: sgro 'dogs pa med na zhes bya ba ni gzugs la sogs pa mngon sum du mthong ba la ni de'i tshe phyin ci log gi rnam par sgro 'dogs pa med na de ji ltar rnam par gcod pa'i yul can du 'gyur 'di tsam gyis ni tshigs su bcad
analyzed: sgro 'dogs pa med na zhes bya ba ni gzugs la sogs pa mngon sum du mthong ba la ni de'i tshe phyin ci log gi rnam par sgro 'dogs pa med na de ji ltar rnam par gcod pa'i yul can du 'gyur 'di tsam gyis ni tshigs su bcad
translated: If there is no superimposition, then at the time of directly seeing form and so on, if there is no superimposition of distorted aspects, how could it be a subject that eliminates?

original: pa'i phyed gong ma phyogs snga ma'i tshul du rnam par bshad pa yin no //
analyzed: pa'i phyed gong ma phyogs snga ma'i tshul du rnam par bshad pa yin no //
translated: This much explains the first half of the verse as the opponent's position.

original: sgro ma btags pa'i yul la yod pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba la sogs pas ni lan yin te /
analyzed: sgro ma btags pa'i yul la yod pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba la sogs pas ni lan yin te /
translated: The response is because it exists in a non-superimposed object and so on.

original: nges pa'i shes pas te sgro btags pa'i yul la med pa'i phyir de rnam par gcod pa'i yul can yin no zhes bya ba rnal ma dang sbyar ro //
analyzed: nges pa'i shes pas te sgro btags pa'i yul la med pa'i phyir de rnam par gcod pa'i yul can yin no zhes bya ba rnal ma dang sbyar ro //
translated: It is a subject that eliminates because it does not exist in a superimposed object, connecting it with the natural order.

original: de nyid gang la zhes bya ba la sogs pas sel bar byed de /
analyzed: de nyid gang la zhes bya ba la sogs pas sel bar byed de /
translated: He refutes that with what is that? and so on.

original: khyad par gang la 'di'i zhes bya ba ni skyes bu'o //
analyzed: khyad par gang la 'di'i zhes bya ba ni skyes bu'o //
translated: The person is in whom with respect to the distinction.

original: sgro btags pa'i yul gyi khyad par de la mi brten pa'o zhe'am bdag med pa'o snyam du nges par mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: sgro btags pa'i yul gyi khyad par de la mi brten pa'o zhe'am bdag med pa'o snyam du nges par mi 'gyur ro //
translated: It would not be ascertained that the object of superimposition does not exist, or that it is selfless.

original: ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: nges pa dang ni sgro 'dogs yid //
analyzed: nges pa dang ni sgro 'dogs yid //
translated: Because ascertainment and superimposition

original: gnod bya gnod byed ngo bo'i phyir //
analyzed: gnod bya gnod byed ngo bo'i phyir //
translated: are mutually exclusive by nature.

original: nges pa'i shes pa dang de las bzlog pa sgro 'dogs pa'i shes pa ni gnod par bya ba dang / gnod par byed pa'i ngo bo yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: nges pa'i shes pa dang de las bzlog pa sgro 'dogs pa'i shes pa ni gnod par bya ba dang / gnod par byed pa'i ngo bo yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Ascertaining cognition and the opposite of that, superimposing cognition, are mutually exclusive by nature.

original: dngos po thams cad las zhes bya ba la sogs pas ni gnod par bya ba ni gnod par bya ba dang / gnod par byed pa'i ngo bo kho na sgrub par byed de /
analyzed: dngos po thams cad las zhes bya ba la sogs pas ni gnod par bya ba ni gnod par bya ba dang / gnod par byed pa'i ngo bo kho na sgrub par byed de /
translated: By ‚Äúfrom all things‚Äù and so on, he proves that they are mutually exclusive by nature.

original: dngos po rigs mthun pa dang rigs mi mthun pa thams cad las tha dad pa mthong yang de kho na bzhin du zhes bya ba ji ltar mthong ba bzhin rnam pa thams cad du mngon par shes shing nges pa ni ma yin zhes bya bar sbyar ro //
analyzed: dngos po rigs mthun pa dang rigs mi mthun pa thams cad las tha dad pa mthong yang de kho na bzhin du zhes bya ba ji ltar mthong ba bzhin rnam pa thams cad du mngon par shes shing nges pa ni ma yin zhes bya bar sbyar ro //
translated: Even though one sees all things of the same type and of different types, one does not ascertain and cognize them exactly as they are seen, in all aspects.

original: ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why?

original: skad cig ma nyid la sogs pa'i khyad par 'ga' zhig la bar du gcod pa srid pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: skad cig ma nyid la sogs pa'i khyad par 'ga' zhig la bar du gcod pa srid pa'i phyir te /
translated: Because it is possible that there will be an obstruction to some particular thing, such as momentariness.

original: 'khrul pa'i rgyu mtshan srid pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'khrul pa'i rgyu mtshan srid pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because the cause of error is possible.

original: dper na nya phyis thams cad las log pa mthong yang nya phyis @64b nyid la 'khrul pa'i rgyu mtshan dngul dang chos mthun pa srid pa'i phyir mi nges pa lta bu'o //
analyzed: dper na nya phyis thams cad las log pa mthong yang nya phyis @64b nyid la 'khrul pa'i rgyu mtshan dngul dang chos mthun pa srid pa'i phyir mi nges pa lta bu'o //
translated: For example, even though one sees the opposite of all oysters, it is not certain that there is no silver, because it is possible that the cause of error with respect to silver exists in the oyster.

original: rnam pa gang la 'khrul pa'i rgyu mtshan med pa de kho na la ni de mthong ba khyad par med kyang rnam pa thams cad la mngon sum khyad par med kyang rtogs pa po 'di'i dran pa nyams su myong ba'i dus kyi 'og rol du 'byung ba ngesüîΩpar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: rnam pa gang la 'khrul pa'i rgyu mtshan med pa de kho na la ni de mthong ba khyad par med kyang rnam pa thams cad la mngon sum khyad par med kyang rtogs pa po 'di'i dran pa nyams su myong ba'i dus kyi 'og rol du 'byung ba nges par 'gyur ro //
translated: But in the case of that which has no cause of error with respect to a form, even though there is no difference in seeing it, the one who understands it will definitely experience the memory of it later, even though there is no difference in the perception of all forms.

original: gang gi phyir mngon sum la khyad par med kyang sgro 'dogs pa dang bral ba'i yul kho na la nges par 'gyur ba de'i phyir /
analyzed: gang gi phyir mngon sum la khyad par med kyang sgro 'dogs pa dang bral ba'i yul kho na la nges par 'gyur ba de'i phyir /
translated: Because even though there is no difference in perception, one is certain only with respect to the object free from superimposition.

original: sgro 'dogs pa dang nges pa dag gnod par bya ba dang gnod par byed pa'i ngo bo yin par shes so //
analyzed: sgro 'dogs pa dang nges pa dag gnod par bya ba dang gnod par byed pa'i ngo bo yin par shes so //
translated: One understands that superimposition and ascertainment have the nature of that which is to be refuted and that which refutes.

original: gnod par bya ba dang gnod par byed pa'i ngo bo nyid yin pa rgyu de'i phyir nges pa /
analyzed: gnod par bya ba dang gnod par byed pa'i ngo bo nyid yin pa rgyu de'i phyir nges pa /
translated: Because they have the nature of that which is to be refuted and that which refutes, ascertainmentüîΩis understood to engage the absence of superimposition and the presence of superimposition.

original: 'di ni sgro 'dogs dban pa la sgro 'dogs pa dang bral ba la 'jug ces bya bar shes pa yin sgro 'dogs pas dben pa la 'jug tu zad mod /
analyzed: 'di ni sgro 'dogs dban pa la sgro 'dogs pa dang bral ba la 'jug ces bya bar shes pa yin sgro 'dogs pas dben pa la 'jug tu zad mod /
translated: It is merely the engagement of the absence of superimposition.

original: 'on kyang gzhan sel ba'i yul can nyid ma yin no zhe na /üîΩde dben pa nyid gzhan sel bar yin no zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: 'on kyang gzhan sel ba'i yul can nyid ma yin no zhe na / de dben pa nyid gzhan sel bar yin no zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: However, it is not the subject that is the object of exclusion.

original: sgra 'dogs pas dben pa nyid do //
analyzed: sgra 'dogs pas dben pa nyid do //
translated: The absence of superimposition is exclusion.

original: de lta bas na sgro 'dogs pa dang bral ba la 'jug pa'i phyir /
analyzed: de lta bas na sgro 'dogs pa dang bral ba la 'jug pa'i phyir /
translated: Therefore, because it engages the absence of superimposition,

original: nges pa'i shes pa mngon sum gyi rjes su 'byung ba de yang de tsam gyis sel ba'i spyod yul can yin gyi /
analyzed: nges pa'i shes pa mngon sum gyi rjes su 'byung ba de yang de tsam gyis sel ba'i spyod yul can yin gyi /
translated: ascertaining consciousness that arises from direct perception has that alone as its object of exclusion.

original: sgrub pas dngos por rang gi ngo bo nges par byed pa ni ma yin no ;
analyzed: sgrub pas dngos por rang gi ngo bo nges par byed pa ni ma yin no ;
translated: It does not ascertain the essential nature of an entity through affirmation.

original: / ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: / ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is this?

original: 'di ltar gzugs nyid la sogs pa'i rnam pa 'ga' zhig nges pa la yang skad cig pa nyid la sogs pa rnam pa gzhan ma gtogs pa mthong ba'i phyir ro /üîΩ// / bam po bdun pa /
analyzed: 'di ltar gzugs nyid la sogs pa'i rnam pa 'ga' zhig nges pa la yang skad cig pa nyid la sogs pa rnam pa gzhan ma gtogs pa mthong ba'i phyir ro / // / bam po bdun pa /
translated: Because even when a certain aspect of form and so on is ascertained, one sees other aspects such as momentariness and so on.

original: gal te nges pa'i shes pa mngon sum gyi rdzas la 'byung bas sgrub pa kho na nas dngos po'i rang gi ngo bo nges par byed na ni /
analyzed: gal te nges pa'i shes pa mngon sum gyi rdzas la 'byung bas sgrub pa kho na nas dngos po'i rang gi ngo bo nges par byed na ni /
translated: If the nature of things is ascertained only through the substance of direct perception that arises from proof,

original: de'i tshe de'i rang gi ngo bo nges pa la ni dngos po la cha shas med pa'i phyir de mi rung ba'i phyir te /
analyzed: de'i tshe de'i rang gi ngo bo nges pa la ni dngos po la cha shas med pa'i phyir de mi rung ba'i phyir te /
translated: then at that time, because the nature of that is ascertained, it is not tenable because there are no parts of a thing.

original: rnam pa gzhan mi nges pa mi rung ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rnam pa gzhan mi nges pa mi rung ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it is not tenable that other aspects are not ascertained.

original: gang gi phyir nges pa dang sgra sgro 'dogs pa rnam par gcod pa kho nar 'jug go //
analyzed: gang gi phyir nges pa dang sgra sgro 'dogs pa rnam par gcod pa kho nar 'jug go //
translated: Because ascertainment and the elimination of superimposition by words operate only in that way.

original: sgrub pa ma yin pa de'i phyir dngos po gcig la cha shas sgro 'dogs pa ste /
analyzed: sgrub pa ma yin pa de'i phyir dngos po gcig la cha shas sgro 'dogs pa ste /
translated: Since it is not a proof, therefore in one thing, as many parts as are superimposed,

original: ngo bo gzhan sgro 'dogs pa ji snyed pa /
analyzed: ngo bo gzhan sgro 'dogs pa ji snyed pa /
translated: as many natures as are superimposed,

original: de bsal ba'i phyir sgro 'dogs pa bsal ba'i phyir nges pa de snyed pa kho na dang sgra yang de snyed kho na 'jug go //
analyzed: de bsal ba'i phyir sgro 'dogs pa bsal ba'i phyir nges pa de snyed pa kho na dang sgra yang de snyed kho na 'jug go //
translated: In order to eliminate that, in order to eliminate superimposition, there are just that many ascertainments and just that many terms that engage.

original: rgyu nges na nges pa dang sgra de dag spyod yul tha dad pa can yin no //
analyzed: rgyu nges na nges pa dang sgra de dag spyod yul tha dad pa can yin no //
translated: When the cause is ascertained, those ascertainments and terms have different spheres of activity.

original: @65a * // gzhan du zhes bya ba ni blo dang sgra dag gis rnam par bcad pa la mi ltos par dngos po'i ngo bo gsal bar byed na ni /
analyzed: @65a * // gzhan du zhes bya ba ni blo dang sgra dag gis rnam par bcad pa la mi ltos par dngos po'i ngo bo gsal bar byed na ni /
translated: If, without depending on the exclusion by cognition and terms, the entity‚Äôs nature were to be clarified,

original: dngos po gcig pu gcig cig la /
analyzed: dngos po gcig pu gcig cig la /
translated: then with respect to a single, solitary entity,

original: sgra'am blo gcig gis khyab na rnam pa thams cad du yul du byas na /
analyzed: sgra'am blo gcig gis khyab na rnam pa thams cad du yul du byas na /
translated: if it were pervaded by a single term or cognition, it would be completely objectified.

original: des pa'i bdag nyid kyis khyab pa'i phyir /
analyzed: des pa'i bdag nyid kyis khyab pa'i phyir /
translated: Because it would be pervaded by that cognition,

original: gzhan yul ma yin no //
analyzed: gzhan yul ma yin no //
translated: it would not be the object of another.

original: 'di ni gzhan yang yin la yul te rnam pa yang yin pas gzhan yul te /
analyzed: 'di ni gzhan yang yin la yul te rnam pa yang yin pas gzhan yul te /
translated: This is also different and is the object, or aspect. Therefore it is ‚Äúdifferent object.‚Äù

original: ma bzung ba'i rnam pa med pa'i phyir dngos po de'i rnam pa gzhan yul la yin no zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: ma bzung ba'i rnam pa med pa'i phyir dngos po de'i rnam pa gzhan yul la yin no zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: Because there is no aspect that is not apprehended, that entity‚Äôs aspect is the different object. This is what it means.

original: yang na dngos po de shes par byed pa'i sgra dang blo gzhan gyi yul ma yin pa'o //
analyzed: yang na dngos po de shes par byed pa'i sgra dang blo gzhan gyi yul ma yin pa'o //
translated: Or else, it is not the object of a word or of another cognition that causes that entity to be known.

original: rgyu de'i phyir rnam par rtogs zin pa de kho na la 'jug pa'i sgra dang blo rnam pa ni rnam grangs pa ni nyid du 'gyur yul gcig pa can nyid du 'gyur ro //
analyzed: rgyu de'i phyir rnam par rtogs zin pa de kho na la 'jug pa'i sgra dang blo rnam pa ni rnam grangs pa ni nyid du 'gyur yul gcig pa can nyid du 'gyur ro //
translated: For that reason, the word and the cognition that engage only that which has already been cognized become synonyms, they become identical in their object.

original: gang gi ltar zhes bya ba la sogs pas ni phyogs snga ma nye bar 'god de bye brag pa gang gi ltar na'o //üîΩbum pa la sogs pa'i don gang la phan tshun dang rten las tha dad pa'i phyir /
analyzed: gang gi ltar zhes bya ba la sogs pas ni phyogs snga ma nye bar 'god de bye brag pa gang gi ltar na'o // bum pa la sogs pa'i don gang la phan tshun dang rten las tha dad pa'i phyir /
translated: The opponent‚Äôs position is presented in the lines beginning ‚ÄúAccording to the Vai≈õe·π£ikas, etc.‚ÄùüîΩThe object, such as a pot, has various different features that are distinct from each other and from the substance.

original: khyad par bya brag sna tshogs tha dad pa yod pa de ni khyad par sna tshogs pa can te /
analyzed: khyad par bya brag sna tshogs tha dad pa yod pa de ni khyad par sna tshogs pa can te /
translated: It has various different features.

original: blo ni don khyad par gyi bye brag de kho na las tha dad pa de sgrub pa kho nas 'dzin cing nges par byed pa'i bdag nyid yin no //
analyzed: blo ni don khyad par gyi bye brag de kho na las tha dad pa de sgrub pa kho nas 'dzin cing nges par byed pa'i bdag nyid yin no //
translated: The cognition is the very thing that apprehends and ascertains that particular object, that particular feature, and nothing else.

original: de yang khyad par re re la tha dad de blo'i yul gyi bye brag bstan pas /
analyzed: de yang khyad par re re la tha dad de blo'i yul gyi bye brag bstan pas /
translated: Moreover, each particular is different from the other, because the particular of the object of cognition is taught.

original: sgra rnams kyi yang don gyis bstan pa kho na yin no //
analyzed: sgra rnams kyi yang don gyis bstan pa kho na yin no //
translated: The meaning of the words is taught by the words themselves.

original: de nyid gang zhig ces bya ba la sogs pas ston te /
analyzed: de nyid gang zhig ces bya ba la sogs pas ston te /
translated: That very thing is shown by what is that? and so on.

original: khyad par rnams ni rdzas nyid la sogs pa ste /
analyzed: khyad par rnams ni rdzas nyid la sogs pa ste /
translated: The particulars are substance and so on.

original: phan tshun gcig las gcig tha dad pa yin no //
analyzed: phan tshun gcig las gcig tha dad pa yin no //
translated: They are mutually different from each other.

original: rten las zhes bya ba ni khyad par can las tha dad pa yin pa'o //
analyzed: rten las zhes bya ba ni khyad par can las tha dad pa yin pa'o //
translated: From the basis means different from the particular.

original: de'i rgyu can ni khyad par tha dad pa'i rgyu can no //
analyzed: de'i rgyu can ni khyad par tha dad pa'i rgyu can no //
translated: Having that as its cause means having the cause of the difference of particulars.

original: mnyan pa smos pa ni nye bar mtshon pa ste /
analyzed: mnyan pa smos pa ni nye bar mtshon pa ste /
translated: The mention of hearing is an illustration.

original: blo dag kyang de dang 'dra'o //üîΩde dag gi rten zhes bya ba ni khyad par de dag gi rten to //
analyzed: blo dag kyang de dang 'dra'o // de dag gi rten zhes bya ba ni khyad par de dag gi rten to //
translated: The cognitions are also like that.üîΩThe basis of those means the basis of those particulars.

original: de dag kho na la zhes bya ba ni khyad par dag kho na la 'jug pa ste /
analyzed: de dag kho na la zhes bya ba ni khyad par dag kho na la 'jug pa ste /
translated: Only those means only the particulars.

original: rjod par byed pa nyid du 'jug go //
analyzed: rjod par byed pa nyid du 'jug go //
translated: It operates as the expresser.

original: de bas na zhes bya ba ni de lta bas na ste /
analyzed: de bas na zhes bya ba ni de lta bas na ste /
translated: Therefore means because of that.

original: sgra dang zhes pa gzhan dag rnam grangs pa nyid du 'gyur ba'i mtshan nyid kyi thal ba'i 'dir mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: sgra dang zhes pa gzhan dag rnam grangs pa nyid du 'gyur ba'i mtshan nyid kyi thal ba'i 'dir mi 'gyur ro //
translated: The word and indicates that the other characteristics are also not the characteristics of the effect here.

original: lan du de'i ltar na yang zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: lan du de'i ltar na yang zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: In response, he says, Even so, etc.

original: khyad par rnam pa sna tshogs la phan pa'i yan lag @65b ste //üîΩrgyu nus pa gang dag yin pa de ga las mi gzhan pa'i bdag nyid khyad par can nges pa'i shes pa gcig gis bdag nyid kun du gzung ba byas na phan bya'i ste khyad par gyi tshogs kyi bye brag gang khyad par gyi bye brag gang zhig ma
analyzed: khyad par rnam pa sna tshogs la phan pa'i yan lag @65b ste // rgyu nus pa gang dag yin pa de ga las mi gzhan pa'i bdag nyid khyad par can nges pa'i shes pa gcig gis bdag nyid kun du gzung ba byas na phan bya'i ste khyad par gyi tshogs kyi bye brag gang khyad par gyi bye brag gang zhig ma
translated: The various aspects are the parts that are helpful.üîΩIf the cause, which is the power, is not different from that, then the special nature is ascertained by a single cognition. If the nature is completely grasped, then the collection of the special parts, i.e. the various special parts, are not ascertained.

original: nges par 'gyur te /
analyzed: nges par 'gyur te /
translated: Which one?

original: thams cad nges pa kho na yin no //
analyzed: thams cad nges pa kho na yin no //
translated: All are definitely ascertained.

original: de bstan par khyad par zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: de bstan par khyad par zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: To explain that, he says, The special, etc.

original: khyad par tha dad pa dag kho na don khyad par can la sgra dang shes pa gzhan dag 'jug pa'i rgyu mtshan yin par khas lan du zin kyang de dang ldan pa khyad par dang ldan pa'i don gcig pu nyid de ni sgra dang shes pa de dagüîΩgis nye bar len cing yul du byed do /
analyzed: khyad par tha dad pa dag kho na don khyad par can la sgra dang shes pa gzhan dag 'jug pa'i rgyu mtshan yin par khas lan du zin kyang de dang ldan pa khyad par dang ldan pa'i don gcig pu nyid de ni sgra dang shes pa de dag gis nye bar len cing yul du byed do /
translated: However, that very thing that possesses that, which is the qualified object, is appropriated and taken as an object by those words and cognitions.

original: khyad par can khyad par sna tshogs la phan pa'i rten nus pa gang dag yin pa de'i ngo bo nyid de ni bdag nyid la ste rang gi ngo bo la tha dad pa med do //
analyzed: khyad par can khyad par sna tshogs la phan pa'i rten nus pa gang dag yin pa de'i ngo bo nyid de ni bdag nyid la ste rang gi ngo bo la tha dad pa med do //
translated: The nature of those which are the bases that benefit the various distinctions is not distinct from itself, from its own nature.

original: de'i phyir khyad par gcig gi sgo nas bzung ba na yang bdag nyid thams cad du gzung ba yin no //
analyzed: de'i phyir khyad par gcig gi sgo nas bzung ba na yang bdag nyid thams cad du gzung ba yin no //
translated: Therefore, when it is apprehended by means of one distinction, it is apprehended in all its aspects.

original: de lta yin na de'i khyad par gyi bye brag ma nges pa gang zhig yod de nges pa kho na yin no //
analyzed: de lta yin na de'i khyad par gyi bye brag ma nges pa gang zhig yod de nges pa kho na yin no //
translated: If that is so, what is the indefinite particular of that? It is only definite.

original: ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: khyad par thams cad la phan 'dogs par byed pa nyid du gzung ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: khyad par thams cad la phan 'dogs par byed pa nyid du gzung ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it is apprehended as that which benefits all distinctions.

original: gal te khyad par gcig gi sgo nas khyad par can gyi rang gi ngo bo kho na gzung gi /
analyzed: gal te khyad par gcig gi sgo nas khyad par can gyi rang gi ngo bo kho na gzung gi /
translated: If you say that the nature of the qualified is apprehended only in terms of a single distinction,

original: khyad par la phan par byed pa nyid ni ma yin no zhe na /
analyzed: khyad par la phan par byed pa nyid ni ma yin no zhe na /
translated: and that it is not apprehended as that which benefits,

original: rang gi ngo bor zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos so //
analyzed: rang gi ngo bor zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos so //
translated: then NƒÅgƒÅrjuna says, ‚ÄúIts nature is not apprehended as that which benefits.‚Äù

original: phan par byed pa nyid ni rang gi ngo bo las tha mi dad pa'i phyir rang gi ngo bor gzung ba'o //
analyzed: phan par byed pa nyid ni rang gi ngo bo las tha mi dad pa'i phyir rang gi ngo bor gzung ba'o //
translated: Because that which benefits is not different from its nature, it is apprehended as its nature.

original: de'i zhes bya ba ni khyad par can gyi ste /
analyzed: de'i zhes bya ba ni khyad par can gyi ste /
translated: ‚Äú Its‚Äù refers to the qualified.

original: phan par byed pa nyid ma gzung ba gzhan ni med pa kho na'o zhes bya ba 'di dang sbyar ro //
analyzed: phan par byed pa nyid ma gzung ba gzhan ni med pa kho na'o zhes bya ba 'di dang sbyar ro //
translated: There is no other that is not apprehended as that which benefits.üîΩThis is how it should be applied.

original: gang gi phyir de lta yin pa rgyu de'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gang gi phyir de lta yin pa rgyu de'i phyir ro //
translated: ‚Äú Because‚Äù is the reason.

original: 'di'i zhes bya ba ni khyad par can gyi ste /
analyzed: 'di'i zhes bya ba ni khyad par can gyi ste /
translated: ‚Äú Its‚Äù refers to the qualified.

original: rang gi ngo bo rang gi bdag nyid du gzung ba gang yin pa de nyid phan par byed pa nyid du yang gzung ba yin no //
analyzed: rang gi ngo bo rang gi bdag nyid du gzung ba gang yin pa de nyid phan par byed pa nyid du yang gzung ba yin no //
translated: That which is apprehended as its nature is apprehended as that which benefits.

original: khyad par gcig gi sgo nas khyad par can gyi khyad par thams cad la phan par byed pa nyid rang gi ngo bor gyur pa 'dzin du zad mod /
analyzed: khyad par gcig gi sgo nas khyad par can gyi khyad par thams cad la phan par byed pa nyid rang gi ngo bor gyur pa 'dzin du zad mod /
translated: In particular, the universal is the nature of that which benefits all particulars through a single property.

original: de dang tha dad pa khyad par rnams ko ji ltar 'dzin ce na /
analyzed: de dang tha dad pa khyad par rnams ko ji ltar 'dzin ce na /
translated: But how can it apprehend the particulars that are different from it?

original: de'i phyir de dag ces bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: de'i phyir de dag ces bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: Therefore he says, ‚Äúbecause they are related to it,‚Äù etc.

original: khyad par tshogs dang khyad par can phan par bya ba dang phan par byed pa por gyur pa dag ni bdag nyid la rang gi ngo bo la 'brel pa'i phyir de phan par bya ba dang / phan par @66a * //
analyzed: khyad par tshogs dang khyad par can phan par bya ba dang phan par byed pa por gyur pa dag ni bdag nyid la rang gi ngo bo la 'brel pa'i phyir de phan par bya ba dang / phan par @66a * //
translated: The collection of particulars and the universal, which is that which is benefited and that which benefits, are related to their own nature.

original: byed pa po 'brel pa ni bdag nyid du gyur pa yin no zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: byed pa po 'brel pa ni bdag nyid du gyur pa yin no zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: The relation between that which is benefited and that which benefits is itself.

original: de'i phyir phan par byed pa'i ngo bo gcig shes na /
analyzed: de'i phyir phan par byed pa'i ngo bo gcig shes na /
translated: Therefore, when one knows the single nature of that which benefits,

original: 'brel pa'i phyir gnyi ga gzung ste /
analyzed: 'brel pa'i phyir gnyi ga gzung ste /
translated: because of the relation, both are apprehended.

original: khyad par dang khyad par can dag gzung ba yin no //
analyzed: khyad par dang khyad par can dag gzung ba yin no //
translated: The particulars and the universal are apprehended.

original: de nyid khyad par zhes bya ba la sogs pas ston te /
analyzed: de nyid khyad par zhes bya ba la sogs pas ston te /
translated: He demonstrates just that in, ‚ÄúThat itself is the particular,‚Äù etc.

original: 'di ltar re zhag khyad par can gzung na /
analyzed: 'di ltar re zhag khyad par can gzung na /
translated: Thus, when a special day is apprehended,

original: de'i bdag nyid du gyur pa phan par byed pa'i ngo bo gzung ba yin no //
analyzed: de'i bdag nyid du gyur pa phan par byed pa'i ngo bo gzung ba yin no //
translated: the essence of that which is to be benefited, which is the nature of that, is also apprehended.

original: de gzung na khyad par rnams kyi bdag nyid du gyur pa phan par bya ba'i ngo bo yang gzung ba yin te /
analyzed: de gzung na khyad par rnams kyi bdag nyid du gyur pa phan par bya ba'i ngo bo yang gzung ba yin te /
translated: When that is apprehended, the essence of that which is to be benefited, which is the nature of the distinctions, is also apprehended,

original: phan par byed pa'i ngo bo 'dzin pa ni de 'dzin pa med na med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: phan par byed pa'i ngo bo 'dzin pa ni de 'dzin pa med na med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because the apprehension of the essence of that which is to be benefited does not occur without the apprehension of that.

original: de'i phyir gcig shes na khyad par dang khyad par can gnyi ga gzung bas /
analyzed: de'i phyir gcig shes na khyad par dang khyad par can gnyi ga gzung bas /
translated: Therefore, when one is apprehended, both the distinction and the distinguished are apprehended.

original: khyad par can de khyad par gcig gis khyad par du byas pa gzung na yang khyad par thams cad gzung ba yin no //
analyzed: khyad par can de khyad par gcig gis khyad par du byas pa gzung na yang khyad par thams cad gzung ba yin no //
translated: When the distinguished is apprehended as distinguished by one distinction, all distinctions are apprehended,

original: de 'dzin pa med na med pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba ni khyad par 'dzin pa med pa na med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de 'dzin pa med na med pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba ni khyad par 'dzin pa med pa na med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because the apprehension of that does not occur without the apprehension of those.

original: gzhan du na zhes bya ba ni khyad par rnams mi 'dzin na'o //
analyzed: gzhan du na zhes bya ba ni khyad par rnams mi 'dzin na'o //
translated: ‚ÄúOtherwise‚Äù means if the distinctions are not apprehended.

original: de ltar yang 'dzin par mi 'gyur ro zhes bya ba ni khyad par can ni khyad par rnams la phan par byed pa po yin no zhes bya ba de ltar yang 'dzin par mi 'gyur ba'o //
analyzed: de ltar yang 'dzin par mi 'gyur ro zhes bya ba ni khyad par can ni khyad par rnams la phan par byed pa po yin no zhes bya ba de ltar yang 'dzin par mi 'gyur ba'o //
translated: Thus, it is not grasped as a qualifier of the qualified.üîΩIf it is said that the qualifier is the cause of the application of cognition and word, then only that which is the cause of the application of cognition and word is grasped as the qualifier, not another qualifier.üîΩIf it is said that the qualifier is that which is the cause of the application of cognition and word, then only that which is the cause of the application of cognition and word is grasped as the qualifier, not another qualifier.

original: gal te khyad par can la de'i tshe shes pa dang sgra 'jug pa'i rgyu mtshan gyi khyad par gang yin pa de kho na la phan par byed pa nyid du gzung gi khyad par gzhan la phan par byed pa nyid du ni ma yin no zhe na /üîΩgzhan la phan par byed pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: gal te khyad par can la de'i tshe shes pa dang sgra 'jug pa'i rgyu mtshan gyi khyad par gang yin pa de kho na la phan par byed pa nyid du gzung gi khyad par gzhan la phan par byed pa nyid du ni ma yin no zhe na / gzhan la phan par byed pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: If it is said that the qualifier is that which is the cause of the application of cognition and word, then only that which is the cause of the application of cognition and word is grasped as the qualifier, not another qualifier.üîΩIf it is said that the qualifier is that which is the cause of the application of cognition and word, then only that which is the cause of the application of cognition and word is grasped as the qualifier, not another qualifier.üîΩIf it is said that the qualifier is that which is the cause of the application of cognition and word, then only that which is the cause of the application of cognition and word is grasped as the qualifier, not another qualifier.üîΩIf it is said that the qualifier is that which is the cause of the application of cognition and word, then only that which is the cause of the application of cognition and word is grasped as the qualifier, not another qualifier.üîΩIf it is said that the qualifier is that which is the cause of the application of cognition and word, then only that which is the cause of the application of cognition and word is grasped as the qualifier, not another qualifier.üîΩIf it is said that the qualifier is that which is the cause of the application of cognition and word, then only that which is the cause of the application of cognition and word is grasped as the qualifier, not another qualifier.üîΩIf it is said that the qualifier is that which is the cause of the application of cognition and word, then only that which is the cause of the application of cognition and word is grasped as the qualifier, not another qualifier.

original: gzhan la phan par byed pa zhes bya ba khyad par gzhan la phan par byed pa po'i ngo bo nyid gang zhig ma bzung ba ni med de /üîΩdngos po la sha chas med pa'i phyir thams cad gzung ba kho na yin no //
analyzed: gzhan la phan par byed pa zhes bya ba khyad par gzhan la phan par byed pa po'i ngo bo nyid gang zhig ma bzung ba ni med de /üîΩdngos po la sha chas med pa'i phyir thams cad gzung ba kho na yin no //
translated: If it is said that the qualifier is that which is the cause of the application of cognition and word, then only that which is the cause of the application of cognition and word is grasped as the qualifier, not another qualifier.üîΩIf it is said that the qualifier is that which is the cause of the application of cognition and word, then only that which is the cause of the application of cognition and word is grasped as the qualifier,

original: gal te khyad par can 'brel pa can la mi ltos pa la phan 'dogs par byed pa po yin no zhes bya ba kho nar 'dzin gyi 'di la phan par byed pa po yin no zhes bya bar ni ma yin pas /
analyzed: gal te khyad par can 'brel pa can la mi ltos pa la phan 'dogs par byed pa po yin no zhes bya ba kho nar 'dzin gyi 'di la phan par byed pa po yin no zhes bya bar ni ma yin pas /
translated: If you think that a qualifier is a benefactor that does not rely on the qualified, but is apprehended only as a benefactor, not as a qualifier,üîΩthen NƒÅgƒÅrjuna explains:üîΩIf it is apprehended in that way,

original: de'i phyir khyad par rnams mi 'dzin to snyam du sems na /üîΩde'i phyir phan par byed pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /

analyzed: phan par byed pa po de la yang phan pa po @66b yin no zhes de ltar ma bzung bar thal bar 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
translated: If it is apprehended in that way, then the qualifier is not apprehended.üîΩIf it is apprehended in that way

original: 'di skad du 'brel pa can yin pa'i phyir 'brel pa can gnyis pa gzung ba med par phan par byed pa po la phan par byed pa po yin no zhes bya bar 'dzin pa yang med do zhes bshad pa yin no //
analyzed: 'di skad du 'brel pa can yin pa'i phyir 'brel pa can gnyis pa gzung ba med par phan par byed pa po la phan par byed pa po yin no zhes bya bar 'dzin pa yang med do zhes bshad pa yin no //
translated: This is what is being said: ‚ÄúBecause they are related, the second related object is not apprehended without the object that is the beneficiary, and the object that is the beneficiary is not apprehended without the object that is the benefactor.‚Äù

original: de lta bu'i dper yang rje khol bzhin no zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: de lta bu'i dper yang rje khol bzhin no zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: In that case, the example is like a master and a servant, he says.

original: khol po gzung ba med par rje bo nyid du 'dzin pa ni med do //
analyzed: khol po gzung ba med par rje bo nyid du 'dzin pa ni med do //
translated: Without apprehending a servant, a master is not apprehended.

original: gang gi phyir de ltar khyad par gcig gi sgo nas shes pa dang / sgra gcig zhugs na yang khyad par thams cad dang / khyad par can bdag nyid thams cad du gzung ba yin pa de'i phyir khyad par don gzhan yin par smra ba la yang ste /
analyzed: gang gi phyir de ltar khyad par gcig gi sgo nas shes pa dang / sgra gcig zhugs na yang khyad par thams cad dang / khyad par can bdag nyid thams cad du gzung ba yin pa de'i phyir khyad par don gzhan yin par smra ba la yang ste /
translated: Since in this way, when a single instance of consciousness and a single sound engage, all the instances of the object‚Äôs features and all the instances of the object‚Äôs nature are apprehended, therefore, even for those who assert that the object‚Äôs features are different objects, the object‚Äôs features are not different objects.

original: khyad par rnams don gzhan du gyur pa yin no zhes de skad du smra ba la yang sgra dang shes pa gzhan rnams rnam grangs pa nyid du 'gyur ro zhes bya bar thal bar 'gyur bar mtshungs so //
analyzed: khyad par rnams don gzhan du gyur pa yin no zhes de skad du smra ba la yang sgra dang shes pa gzhan rnams rnam grangs pa nyid du 'gyur ro zhes bya bar thal bar 'gyur bar mtshungs so //
translated: But in the same way, it follows that sound and other cognitions are only synonyms.

original: nus pa dang ldan pas nus pa gang dag gis khyad par la phan 'dogs pa'i nus pa de dag nus pa dang ldan pa las tha dad pa yin no //
analyzed: nus pa dang ldan pas nus pa gang dag gis khyad par la phan 'dogs pa'i nus pa de dag nus pa dang ldan pa las tha dad pa yin no //
translated: The capacity that is possessed is different from the capacity that is possessed, by which capacity it benefits the specific property.üîΩTherefore, this reductio does not apply,

original: de'i phyir thal ba 'dir mi 'gyur ro zhes bya ba ni khyad par gcig la phan par byed pa po nus pa'i bye brag gzung na /
analyzed: de'i phyir thal ba 'dir mi 'gyur ro zhes bya ba ni khyad par gcig la phan par byed pa po nus pa'i bye brag gzung na /
translated: because when the specific capacity that benefits a single specific property is apprehended,

original: nus pa thams cad gzung ba yin la /
analyzed: nus pa thams cad gzung ba yin la /
translated: all capacities are apprehended.üîΩAnd by apprehending them, all specific properties are apprehended.

original: de dag gzung bas kyang khyad par thams cad gzung ba yin no zhes bya ba'i thal ba 'dir 'gyur ba med pa'o //
analyzed: de dag gzung bas kyang khyad par thams cad gzung ba yin no zhes bya ba'i thal ba 'dir 'gyur ba med pa'o //
translated: This reductio does not apply.

original: lan du chos phan zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
