analyzed: lan du chos phan zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: The reply is that the property is said to be the beneficiary, etc.

original: chos ni khyad par rnams te /
analyzed: chos ni khyad par rnams te /
translated: The property is the specific properties.

original: de dag la phan par byed pa po'i nus pa gang dag yin pa de dag nus pa dang ldan pa la tha dad par khas len na nus pa can de'i ci yin par 'gyur te /
analyzed: de dag la phan par byed pa po'i nus pa gang dag yin pa de dag nus pa dang ldan pa la tha dad par khas len na nus pa can de'i ci yin par 'gyur te /
translated: If you accept that those that are the agents that benefit those that possess the potential are different from those that possess the potential, then what are those that possess the potential?

original: ci yang ma yin zhing de dang 'brel pa can dag ma yin no zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: ci yang ma yin zhing de dang 'brel pa can dag ma yin no zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: They are nothing at all and are not related to those that possess the potential.

original: gang gi tshe zhe na /
analyzed: gang gi tshe zhe na /
translated: When?

original: gal te nus pa can de las nus pa de dag las phan pa med pa na'o //
analyzed: gal te nus pa can de las nus pa de dag las phan pa med pa na'o //
translated: If those that possess the potential do not benefit those that possess the potential.

original: 'on te 'brel pa grub par bya ba'i phyir phan par byed pa por 'dod na de'i tshe nus pa gang dag gis nus pa la phan par byed pa nus pa la phan 'dogs pa'i nus pa tha dad pa gzhan dag khas blang dgos shing de dag la yang
analyzed: 'on te 'brel pa grub par bya ba'i phyir phan par byed pa por 'dod na de'i tshe nus pa gang dag gis nus pa la phan par byed pa nus pa la phan 'dogs pa'i nus pa tha dad pa gzhan dag khas blang dgos shing de dag la yang
translated: But if you assert that they are agents that benefit in order to establish a relationship, then at that time you must accept that those that possess the potential benefit those that possess the potential through other potentials that benefit those that possess the potential.

original: 'brel pa grub pa'i phyir phan gdags par bya dgos la /
analyzed: 'brel pa grub pa'i phyir phan gdags par bya dgos la /
translated: And in order to establish a relationship with those, they must be benefited.

original: de la yang nus pa gzhan rtog na de lta yin na thug med 'gyur de nyid gal te zhes bya ba la sogs pas @67a * //
analyzed: de la yang nus pa gzhan rtog na de lta yin na thug med 'gyur de nyid gal te zhes bya ba la sogs pas @67a * //
translated: And if you imagine that they have other potentials, then if that were the case, there would be an infinite regress.

original: ston te / khyad par dang khyad par can ni khyad par re re'o //
analyzed: ston te / khyad par dang khyad par can ni khyad par re re'o //
translated: The specific and the general are each a particular.

original: phan par byed pa nyid dag ces bya ba ni nus pa dag ste /
analyzed: phan par byed pa nyid dag ces bya ba ni nus pa dag ste /
translated: The word ‚Äúbeneficial‚Äù means ‚Äúcapable.‚Äù

original: khyad par can de'i rang gi bdag nyid du gyur pa ma yin zhing ngo bo nyid du gyur pa ma yin gyi /
analyzed: khyad par can de'i rang gi bdag nyid du gyur pa ma yin zhing ngo bo nyid du gyur pa ma yin gyi /
translated: The general does not become the nature of the specific, nor does it become its essence.

original: 'on kyang tha dad pa kho na yin no //
analyzed: 'on kyang tha dad pa kho na yin no //
translated: However, it is only different from it.

original: khyad par can de las phan pa nyams su myong ba yang med cing bdag nyid kyir byed pa yang med na ci ste de'i de dag yin zhes bya ste /
analyzed: khyad par can de las phan pa nyams su myong ba yang med cing bdag nyid kyir byed pa yang med na ci ste de'i de dag yin zhes bya ste /
translated: If the general does not experience benefit from the specific, and if it does not make itself into the specific, then why is it called ‚Äúits‚Äù?

original: 'brel pa med pas ci'i phyir khyad par dang ldan pa'i nus pa dag ces bya /
analyzed: 'brel pa med pas ci'i phyir khyad par dang ldan pa'i nus pa dag ces bya /
translated: Since there is no relation, why is it called ‚Äúthe capability of the specific‚Äù?

original: 'on te 'brel pa grub par bya ba'i phyir khyad par can las khyad par la phan 'dogs pa'i nus pa de rnams la phan pa khas lan na ni khyad par can 'dis nus pa gang dag gis khyad par la phan 'dogs pa'i nus pa la phan 'dogs pa
analyzed: 'on te 'brel pa grub par bya ba'i phyir khyad par can las khyad par la phan 'dogs pa'i nus pa de rnams la phan pa khas lan na ni khyad par can 'dis nus pa gang dag gis khyad par la phan 'dogs pa'i nus pa la phan 'dogs pa
translated: If you accept that the capability of benefiting the specific is established through a relation, then the general benefits the capability of benefiting the specific through the specific.

original: de dag gal te de'i bdag nyid du gyur pa yin par 'dod na ni /
analyzed: de dag gal te de'i bdag nyid du gyur pa yin par 'dod na ni /
translated: If you maintain that they are of the same nature,

original: de'i tshe khyad par can cha shas med pa 'di gcig pus rang gi bdag nyid du gyur pa'i nus pa dag gis khyad par la phan 'dogs pa'i nus pa la phan par byed pa na'o //
analyzed: de'i tshe khyad par can cha shas med pa 'di gcig pus rang gi bdag nyid du gyur pa'i nus pa dag gis khyad par la phan 'dogs pa'i nus pa la phan par byed pa na'o //
translated: then at that time, this partless particular would be the very nature of the potencies, and it would be the one that benefits the potency that benefits the particular.

original: 'di ltar zhes bya ba la sogs pas ni bdag nyid thams cad du gzung ba sgrub par byed de /
analyzed: 'di ltar zhes bya ba la sogs pas ni bdag nyid thams cad du gzung ba sgrub par byed de /
translated: In the passage beginning with ‚ÄúIn that case,‚Äù he proves that the whole is apprehended.

original: khyad par gcig gzung na de la phan 'dogs pa'i khyad par la phan 'dogs pa'i nus pa tha dad par gzung ba yin no //
analyzed: khyad par gcig gzung na de la phan 'dogs pa'i khyad par la phan 'dogs pa'i nus pa tha dad par gzung ba yin no //
translated: When one particular is apprehended, the potency that benefits it, the particular that benefits it, is also apprehended as different.

original: de gzung na zhes bya ba ni khyad par la phan 'dogs pa'i nus pa gzung na'o //
analyzed: de gzung na zhes bya ba ni khyad par la phan 'dogs pa'i nus pa gzung na'o //
translated: ‚Äú When that is apprehended‚Äù means when the particular that benefits the potency is apprehended.

original: de la phan par byed pa po ni khyad par la phan 'dogs pa'i nus pa la phan par byed pa'o //
analyzed: de la phan par byed pa po ni khyad par la phan 'dogs pa'i nus pa la phan par byed pa'o //
translated: ‚Äú The one that benefits it‚Äù is the one that benefits the potency that benefits the particular.

original: ji lta bu zhig ce na /
analyzed: ji lta bu zhig ce na /
translated: What is it like?

original: nus pa la phan pa rang gi bdag nyid du gyur pa mtha' dag dang ldan pa ste /
analyzed: nus pa la phan pa rang gi bdag nyid du gyur pa mtha' dag dang ldan pa ste /
translated: It is the one that possesses the whole of the benefit to the potency that is of the same nature as itself.

original: gang la khyad par la phan 'dogs pa'i nus pa rnams la phan pa'i nus pa rang gi bdag nyid du gyur pa mtha' dag yod pa de ste dngos po de lta bu gzung bas khyad par thams cad la phan 'dogs par byed pa'i nus pa 'dzin par byed
analyzed: gang la khyad par la phan 'dogs pa'i nus pa rnams la phan pa'i nus pa rang gi bdag nyid du gyur pa mtha' dag yod pa de ste dngos po de lta bu gzung bas khyad par thams cad la phan 'dogs par byed pa'i nus pa 'dzin par byed
translated: If the thing that is the object of apprehension has the capacity to benefit all the specific things that are benefited by its capacity to benefit, then the apprehension of that thing would apprehend the capacity to benefit all the specific things that are benefited.

original: pa la nus pa gzung ba de dag gis kyang rang gis kyang phan gdags par bya ba'i khyad par rnams 'dzin par byed pas bye brag ma nges pas gang zhig yod ces bshad pa gang yin pa'i thal bar 'gyur ba so na 'dug pa yin no //
analyzed: pa la nus pa gzung ba de dag gis kyang rang gis kyang phan gdags par bya ba'i khyad par rnams 'dzin par byed pas bye brag ma nges pas gang zhig yod ces bshad pa gang yin pa'i thal bar 'gyur ba so na 'dug pa yin no //
translated: And since those apprehensions of capacity would also apprehend the specific things that are benefited by that capacity, there would be no certainty about the particulars. Therefore, the consequence that you would have to accept would remain.

original: 'on te nyes pa 'dir 'gyur du 'ong zhes te /
analyzed: 'on te nyes pa 'dir 'gyur du 'ong zhes te /
translated: But if you accept that this fault would ensue,

original: nus pa la phan 'dogs pa'i nus pa de dag kyang khyad par can gyi dngos po las tha dad pa kho na yin @67b par 'dod na ni de'i tshe de la phan 'dogs pa'i nus pa tha dad pa dag kyang brtag dogs la /
analyzed: nus pa la phan 'dogs pa'i nus pa de dag kyang khyad par can gyi dngos po las tha dad pa kho na yin @67b par 'dod na ni de'i tshe de la phan 'dogs pa'i nus pa tha dad pa dag kyang brtag dogs la /
translated: and if you assert that those capacities that are the capacity to benefit are only different from the thing that is benefited, then at that time, those different capacities to benefit would also be apprehended.

original: de bzhin du de la phan 'dogs pa dag kyang brtag dgos pas de lta na thug pa med pa'i phyir khyad par dang / de'i nus pa rnams te khyad par la phan pa'i nus pa rnams nus pa gzhan dang gzhan dag kho na la mthar thug pa med cing thug pa med par sbyor ba'i phyir te 'brel pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de bzhin du de la phan 'dogs pa dag kyang brtag dgos pas de lta na thug pa med pa'i phyir khyad par dang / de'i nus pa rnams te khyad par la phan pa'i nus pa rnams nus pa gzhan dang gzhan dag kho na la mthar thug pa med cing thug pa med par sbyor ba'i phyir te 'brel pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Thus, the particularities and their potencies, i.e., the potencies that benefit the particularities, are connected, i.e., related, to other and other potencies without end, i.e., to infinity.

original: 'di ltar khyad par rnams ni nus pa tha dad pa dag dang / 'brel pa de dag kyang tha dad pa dag kho na dang 'brel te /
analyzed: 'di ltar khyad par rnams ni nus pa tha dad pa dag dang / 'brel pa de dag kyang tha dad pa dag kho na dang 'brel te /
translated: Thus, the particularities are related to different potencies, and those are related to different potencies.

original: de bzhin du nus pa snga ma snga ma rnams nus pa tha dad pa phyi ma phyi ma dag kho na dang thug pa med par 'brel gyi /
analyzed: de bzhin du nus pa snga ma snga ma rnams nus pa tha dad pa phyi ma phyi ma dag kho na dang thug pa med par 'brel gyi /
translated: In the same way, the earlier potencies are related to infinity, i.e., to the later potencies, which are different.

original: khyad par can dang ni ma yin no //
analyzed: khyad par can dang ni ma yin no //
translated: But they are not related to the particularities.

original: de bas na de la phan pa'i bdag nyid ces bya ba ni nus pa la phan pa'i bdag nyid do //
analyzed: de bas na de la phan pa'i bdag nyid ces bya ba ni nus pa la phan pa'i bdag nyid do //
translated: Therefore, the so-called ‚Äúidentity of benefit to it‚Äù is the identity of benefit to the potency.

original: khyad par la phan 'dogs pa'i nus pa rnams kyi nus pa gang dag yin pa de'i bdag nyid ces bya ba'i tha tshig ste /
analyzed: khyad par la phan 'dogs pa'i nus pa rnams kyi nus pa gang dag yin pa de'i bdag nyid ces bya ba'i tha tshig ste /
translated: In particular, the meaning of ‚Äúthe nature of those which have the capacity to benefit the qualifier‚Äù is the capacity of those which have the capacity to benefit the qualifier.

original: nus pa rnams ni de dang tha mi dad pa'i phyir ro ;
analyzed: nus pa rnams ni de dang tha mi dad pa'i phyir ro ;
translated: Because the capacities are not different from that.

original: / khyad par can de gcig pu nam yang khyad par la phan 'dogs pa'i nus pa de dag dang lhan cig ma bzung bas de dang ldan pa nyid du khyad par la phan 'dogs pa'i nus pa dang ldan pa nyid du 'dzin par mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: / khyad par can de gcig pu nam yang khyad par la phan 'dogs pa'i nus pa de dag dang lhan cig ma bzung bas de dang ldan pa nyid du khyad par la phan 'dogs pa'i nus pa dang ldan pa nyid du 'dzin par mi 'gyur ro //
translated: Since that single qualifier is never apprehended together with those capacities that benefit the qualifier, it is not apprehended as having the capacity to benefit the qualifier.

original: der mi 'dzin pa'i phyir khyad par can nyid du yang 'dzin par mi 'gyur bas de'i phyir khyad par du rtogs pa don med pa kho na'o snyam du bsams pa yin no //
analyzed: der mi 'dzin pa'i phyir khyad par can nyid du yang 'dzin par mi 'gyur bas de'i phyir khyad par du rtogs pa don med pa kho na'o snyam du bsams pa yin no //
translated: Since it is not apprehended as that, it is also not apprehended as a qualifier. Therefore it is thought that the realization of the qualifier is meaningless.

original: re zhig de ltar gang gi tshe khyad par can la shes pa dang / sgra dag 'jug pa de'i tshe nyes pa bshad pa yin no //
analyzed: re zhig de ltar gang gi tshe khyad par can la shes pa dang / sgra dag 'jug pa de'i tshe nyes pa bshad pa yin no //
translated: Thus, when consciousness and words engage the qualifier, the faults explained previously apply.

original: gang gi tshe khyad par kho na la 'jug pa de'i tshe yang nyes pa brjod dgos pas de brjod pa'i phyir /üîΩyang gal te zhes bya ba la sogs pas khyad par gyi phyogs nye bar 'god de /
analyzed: gang gi tshe khyad par kho na la 'jug pa de'i tshe yang nyes pa brjod dgos pas de brjod pa'i phyir / yang gal te zhes bya ba la sogs pas khyad par gyi phyogs nye bar 'god de /
translated: When it engages only the distinctions, then also the fault must be stated.

original: gal te sgra dang shes pa rnams kyis khyad par bye brag gi khyad par dag nyi tshe la zhes bya ba rten dang bral ba la nye bar sbyor bar 'gyur zhing shes par byed pa nyid du rten par 'gyur na /
analyzed: gal te sgra dang shes pa rnams kyis khyad par bye brag gi khyad par dag nyi tshe la zhes bya ba rten dang bral ba la nye bar sbyor bar 'gyur zhing shes par byed pa nyid du rten par 'gyur na /
translated: In order to state that, he says, ‚ÄúMoreover, if sound and consciousnesses were to connect only with distinctions, with particularities, which are free from a basis, and if they were to be supported as that which causes understanding,

original: khyad par can de sgra dang shes pa dag gis ma 'brel pa'i phyir yul du ma byas pa'i phyir de rtogs pa'i sgo nas sgra dang shes pa gcig gis kyang khyad par thams cad rtogs par mi 'gyur ro zhe na /üîΩ'di la yang nyes pa de'i tshe yang zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: khyad par can de sgra dang shes pa dag gis ma 'brel pa'i phyir yul du ma byas pa'i phyir de rtogs pa'i sgo nas sgra dang shes pa gcig gis kyang khyad par thams cad rtogs par mi 'gyur ro zhe na / 'di la yang nyes pa de'i tshe yang zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: then because the possessor of the distinctions would not be connected by those sounds and consciousnesses, because it would not be taken as an object, then even a single sound and consciousness would not understand all the distinctions by way of understanding that.‚ÄùüîΩIn response to that, he says, ‚ÄúMoreover, if that were the case, then it would follow that all distinctions would be understood by a single sound and consciousness.‚Äù

original: de zhes bya ba ni khyad pa @68a * //
analyzed: de zhes bya ba ni khyad pa @68a * //
translated: ‚ÄúThat‚Äù refers to the distinctions.

original: can no // ma 'phangs pa'i phyir zhes bya ba ni ma bstan pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: can no // ma 'phangs pa'i phyir zhes bya ba ni ma bstan pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it is not projected, i.e., because it is not taught.

original: de la zhes bya ba ni khyad par can la'o //
analyzed: de la zhes bya ba ni khyad par can la'o //
translated: In that regard means in regard to the special.

original: ji ltar don med ce na /
analyzed: ji ltar don med ce na /
translated: How is it meaningless?

original: sgrub pa dang dgag pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: sgrub pa dang dgag pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: He says, because of affirmation and negation, etc.

original: don bya ba la gtad nas 'jug pa'i phyir tha snyad gdags pa gang la rten dmigs pa don byed pa yod pa de la de skad ces bya'o //
analyzed: don bya ba la gtad nas 'jug pa'i phyir tha snyad gdags pa gang la rten dmigs pa don byed pa yod pa de la de skad ces bya'o //
translated: A designation is so called because it engages in the performance of an object's function after it has been directed to it.

original: thams cad ces bya ba ni rtogs pa sngon du gtong ba rnams kyi tha snyad phan pa dang mi phan pa'i yul can ji snyed pa'o //
analyzed: thams cad ces bya ba ni rtogs pa sngon du gtong ba rnams kyi tha snyad phan pa dang mi phan pa'i yul can ji snyed pa'o //
translated: All means all designations of benefit and non-benefit for those who have understanding as their antecedent.

original: de yang rnam pa gsum pa mi srid pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de yang rnam pa gsum pa mi srid pa'i phyir ro //
translated: And that is impossible in the case of the third.

original: rnam pa gnyis kyis yin pas /
analyzed: rnam pa gnyis kyis yin pas /
translated: Because it is of two kinds,

original: sgrub pa dang dgag pa dag gis zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: sgrub pa dang dgag pa dag gis zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: he says, because of affirmation and negation.

original: 'di ni de lta bur gyur pa'i mtshan nyid kyi gsum pa yin no //
analyzed: 'di ni de lta bur gyur pa'i mtshan nyid kyi gsum pa yin no //
translated: This is the third characteristic of that kind.

original: ba lang nyid la sogs pa khyad par rnams kyis ni don bya ba der mi nus la nus pa la gsal ba'i bye brag ni sgra rnams kyis mi brjod pas sgra sbyor ba 'bras bu med pa dag gis ci zhig bya /
analyzed: ba lang nyid la sogs pa khyad par rnams kyis ni don bya ba der mi nus la nus pa la gsal ba'i bye brag ni sgra rnams kyis mi brjod pas sgra sbyor ba 'bras bu med pa dag gis ci zhig bya /
translated: But the particularities such as bovine nature are not able to perform the function of the object. And since the particularities of the manifest are not expressed by words, what is the point of using words that are ineffective?

original: gang gi phyir de ltar sgra dag gis don byed par nus pa gsal ba'i bye brag mi brjod pa de'i phyir khyad par rnams su 'dod pa ba lang nyid la sogs pa ni khyad par ma yin par 'gyur zhing bye brag ma yin par 'gyur te /
analyzed: gang gi phyir de ltar sgra dag gis don byed par nus pa gsal ba'i bye brag mi brjod pa de'i phyir khyad par rnams su 'dod pa ba lang nyid la sogs pa ni khyad par ma yin par 'gyur zhing bye brag ma yin par 'gyur te /
translated: Since words do not express the particularities of the manifest that are able to perform a function, therefore the so-called particularities such as bovine nature that are asserted to be particularities are not particularities and are not differentiations.

original: 'di ltar khyad par can 'ga' zhig la khyad par gyi sgo nas sgra'am shes pa zhugs par gyur na ni gtso bo khyad par gyi gzhi khyad par can 'ga'i yan lag tu gyur pa'i phyir /
analyzed: 'di ltar khyad par can 'ga' zhig la khyad par gyi sgo nas sgra'am shes pa zhugs par gyur na ni gtso bo khyad par gyi gzhi khyad par can 'ga'i yan lag tu gyur pa'i phyir /
translated: In this way, if a word or consciousness engages a particularity in dependence on a particularized thing, then the primary thing becomes a part of a particularized thing, a particularity.

original: khyad par du gyur pa'i phyir de la ltos nas gtso bo la ltos nas de skad ces brjod ces bya ba khyad par dag ces brjod de /
analyzed: khyad par du gyur pa'i phyir de la ltos nas gtso bo la ltos nas de skad ces brjod ces bya ba khyad par dag ces brjod de /
translated: Because it becomes a particularity, it is called a particularity in dependence on that, in dependence on the primary thing.

original: 'di ni khyad par rnam par gzhag pa'i rigs pa yin no //
analyzed: 'di ni khyad par rnam par gzhag pa'i rigs pa yin no //
translated: This is the principle of the classification of the specific.

original: gang gi tshe sgras khyad par dag kho na brjod pa de'i tshe ni sgra dag gis khyad par can de mi 'phen cing /
analyzed: gang gi tshe sgras khyad par dag kho na brjod pa de'i tshe ni sgra dag gis khyad par can de mi 'phen cing /
translated: When the words express only the specific properties, then the words do not indicate the possessor of the specific properties,

original: mi ston pa'i phyir khyad par de dag gtso bo gang gi yang yan lag tu gyur pa ma yin pas /
analyzed: mi ston pa'i phyir khyad par de dag gtso bo gang gi yang yan lag tu gyur pa ma yin pas /
translated: because they do not show it. Therefore, those specific properties are not the parts of any one principal thing.

original: ji ste khyad par dag yin te /
analyzed: ji ste khyad par dag yin te /
translated: If you say that they are the specific properties,

original: ma yin pa kho na'o zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: ma yin pa kho na'o zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: we reply that this is not so.

original: yang gal te khyad par can mi brjod du zin kyang /
analyzed: yang gal te khyad par can mi brjod du zin kyang /
translated: Moreover, even if the possessor of the specific properties is not expressed,

original: 'on kyang sgra dag gis shes par byas pa'i khyad par gang dag yin pa de dag gis khyad par can mtshon pa'i phyir nyes pa med de /
analyzed: 'on kyang sgra dag gis shes par byas pa'i khyad par gang dag yin pa de dag gis khyad par can mtshon pa'i phyir nyes pa med de /
translated: nevertheless, the possessor of the specific properties is indicated by those specific properties that are understood from the words, so there is no fault.

original: sgra sbyor ba don med pa'i nyes pa med do zhe na /
analyzed: sgra sbyor ba don med pa'i nyes pa med do zhe na /
translated: There is no fault of the uselessness of the application of the words.

original: khyad par thams cad 'dzin pa'i thal bar 'gyur bar mtshungs so //
analyzed: khyad par thams cad 'dzin pa'i thal bar 'gyur bar mtshungs so //
translated: The consequence that all specific properties would be apprehended is the same.

original: de nyid re zhig ces bya ba la @68b sogs pas ston te /
analyzed: de nyid re zhig ces bya ba la @68b sogs pas ston te /
translated: The same is shown by the words ‚Äúand so on‚Äù in the line ‚Äúthat very thing . . . ‚Äù

original: med na med pa'i phyir zhes bya ba ni khyad par ni khyad par can la 'khrul pa med pas so //
analyzed: med na med pa'i phyir zhes bya ba ni khyad par ni khyad par can la 'khrul pa med pas so //
translated: This is because a qualifier is not mistaken with regard to the qualified.

original: de zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: de zhes bya ba ni /
translated: That is,

original: khyad par can te khyad par gcig gi nye par mtshon na yang cha shas med pa'i phyir bdag nyid thams cad nye bar mtshon pa yin pas khyad par thams cad 'dzin pa'i thal bar 'gyur ba son 'dug pa yin no //
analyzed: khyad par can te khyad par gcig gi nye par mtshon na yang cha shas med pa'i phyir bdag nyid thams cad nye bar mtshon pa yin pas khyad par thams cad 'dzin pa'i thal bar 'gyur ba son 'dug pa yin no //
translated: the qualified. Even if one qualifier is indicated, because it is partless, it is indicated in its entirety, and so it follows that all qualifiers are apprehended.

original: gal te gang la sgras mngon sum du khyad par can brjod pa de la thal ba 'dir 'gyur gyi /
analyzed: gal te gang la sgras mngon sum du khyad par can brjod pa de la thal ba 'dir 'gyur gyi /
translated: If you think that this consequence holds only when the qualified is directly expressed by the word,

original: gang la don gyi dbang gis brjod pa de la ni ma yin no snyam du sems na de'i phyir 'di sgras nye bar mtshon par byed kyang rung zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: gang la don gyi dbang gis brjod pa de la ni ma yin no snyam du sems na de'i phyir 'di sgras nye bar mtshon par byed kyang rung zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: but not when it is expressed by the power of the meaning, then the response is that even if it is indicated by the word, etc.

original: khyad par can 'di sgras mngon sum du ston par byed kyang rung khyad par can 'di des nye bar mtshon pa'i sgras nye bar mtshon pa'i khyad par dag gis nye bar mtshon par yang rung ste /
analyzed: khyad par can 'di sgras mngon sum du ston par byed kyang rung khyad par can 'di des nye bar mtshon pa'i sgras nye bar mtshon pa'i khyad par dag gis nye bar mtshon par yang rung ste /
translated: It is suitable for the word to directly indicate the qualifier, or it is suitable for the word that indicates the qualifier to indicate the qualifier.

original: 'di la khyad par ci zhig yod khyad par 'ga' yang med de /
analyzed: 'di la khyad par ci zhig yod khyad par 'ga' yang med de /
translated: What is the difference between these two? There is no difference at all.

original: 'di ltar re zhig khyad par gyi stobs kyis mtshon pa'i dus de'i tshe khyad par can de dag thams cad la phan par byed pa po yin no zhes khyad par thams cad la phan par byed pa po yin no zhes bya bar nges par byed do //
analyzed: 'di ltar re zhig khyad par gyi stobs kyis mtshon pa'i dus de'i tshe khyad par can de dag thams cad la phan par byed pa po yin no zhes khyad par thams cad la phan par byed pa po yin no zhes bya bar nges par byed do //
translated: For example, at the time of being indicated by the power of the qualifier, it is ascertained that all the qualifiers are the benefactors.

original: de lta yin na ni snga ma bzhin du khyad par thams cad 'dzin pa'i thal bar 'gyur bas shes par byas pas mtshon pa'i phyir zhes smras pa gang yin pa de ni gyi na ste /
analyzed: de lta yin na ni snga ma bzhin du khyad par thams cad 'dzin pa'i thal bar 'gyur bas shes par byas pas mtshon pa'i phyir zhes smras pa gang yin pa de ni gyi na ste /
translated: If that were the case, then as before, it would follow that all the qualifiers would be apprehended, so what was said, ‚Äúbecause it is indicated by the word that is understood,‚Äù is nonsense.

original: sngar bshad pa'i nyes pas mi rung ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: sngar bshad pa'i nyes pas mi rung ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it is unsuitable due to the previously explained faults.

original: gang gi phyir khyad par la phan 'dogs pa'i nus pa rnams tha dad na thug pa med par 'gyur bas de las nus pa rnams tha mi dad pa de'i phyir khyad par can de khyad par gcig la phan par byed par gzung bar khas len na /
analyzed: gang gi phyir khyad par la phan 'dogs pa'i nus pa rnams tha dad na thug pa med par 'gyur bas de las nus pa rnams tha mi dad pa de'i phyir khyad par can de khyad par gcig la phan par byed par gzung bar khas len na /
translated: Because if the potencies that benefit the distinctions were different, there would be an infinite regress. Therefore, since the potencies are not different, if you accept that the possessor of the distinctions benefits one distinction, then it follows that it would not benefit the others.üîΩ

original: khyad par gcig la phan 'dogs pa'i rang gi ngo bo de las khyad par can de mthong na ma mthong bar gyur pa gang dag yin pa khyad par gzhan rnams la phan pa nus pa'i bye brag rnams gzhan min zhing gzhan dag tu mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: khyad par gcig la phan 'dogs pa'i rang gi ngo bo de las khyad par can de mthong na ma mthong bar gyur pa gang dag yin pa khyad par gzhan rnams la phan pa nus pa'i bye brag rnams gzhan min zhing gzhan dag tu mi 'gyur ro //
translated: Because if the potencies that benefit the distinctions are different, there would be an infinite regress. Therefore, since the potencies are not different, if you accept that the possessor of the distinctions is seen to benefit one distinction, then when that possessor of the distinctions is seen to benefit that one distinction, those other distinctions that are not seen to benefit it would not be different, and would not become different.

original: 'on kyang gzhan ma yin pa nyid de /
analyzed: 'on kyang gzhan ma yin pa nyid de /
translated: However, they are not different.

original: rgyu de'i phyir de gzung na khyad par can de gzung bas khyad par thams cad la phan 'dogs par byed pa'i ngo bo nyid gzung ba yin no //
analyzed: rgyu de'i phyir de gzung na khyad par can de gzung bas khyad par thams cad la phan 'dogs par byed pa'i ngo bo nyid gzung ba yin no //
translated: For that reason, when it is seen to benefit that one distinction, the possessor of the distinctions is seen to benefit all the distinctions.

original: gal te zhes bya ba la sogs pas ni gzhan gyi bsam pa'i @69a * //
analyzed: gal te zhes bya ba la sogs pas ni gzhan gyi bsam pa'i @69a * //
translated: ‚ÄúIf, on the other hand‚Äù and so on presents the opponent‚Äôs response.

original: dogs pa bsu bar byed de nges pa'i shes pa des dngos po'i bdag nyid thams cad gzung ba la yang gzhan zhes bya ba ni tshad ma bzhin no //
analyzed: dogs pa bsu bar byed de nges pa'i shes pa des dngos po'i bdag nyid thams cad gzung ba la yang gzhan zhes bya ba ni tshad ma bzhin no //
translated: To anticipate an objection, that ascertaining consciousness apprehends all the aspects of the object, just as a valid cognition does.

original: gal te 'di snyam du zhes bya ba la sogs pas ni de nyid ston te /üîΩgal te dngos po cha med cing cha shas med par gzung na de'i tshe zhes bya ba dngos po cha med pa'i gzung ba'i tshe /
analyzed: gal te 'di snyam du zhes bya ba la sogs pas ni de nyid ston te / gal te dngos po cha med cing cha shas med par gzung na de'i tshe zhes bya ba dngos po cha med pa'i gzung ba'i tshe /
translated: ‚ÄúIf you think‚Äù and so forth presents the response.

original: ma bzung ba zhes bya ba'i cha gzhan ci zhig yod de /
analyzed: ma bzung ba zhes bya ba'i cha gzhan ci zhig yod de /
translated: If you apprehend an object without parts, without aspects, then at that time, when you apprehend an object without parts, what other part that is not apprehended exists?

original: thams cad du gzung ba kho na yin na de ni bzung yang 'khrul pa nges par mi zin pas so //
analyzed: thams cad du gzung ba kho na yin na de ni bzung yang 'khrul pa nges par mi zin pas so //
translated: If it is apprehended in every way, then it is apprehended, and since error is not ascertained,

original: tshad ma gzhan zhes bya ba ni rjes su dpag pa gzhan no //
analyzed: tshad ma gzhan zhes bya ba ni rjes su dpag pa gzhan no //
translated: another valid cognition is needed.

original: sgrub pa'i mtha' smra bas gal te de lta na zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: sgrub pa'i mtha' smra bas gal te de lta na zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: The proponent of the conclusion says, ‚ÄúIf that is so,‚Äù and so forth.

original: 'khrul pa bzlog pa'i phyir tshad ma phyi mar 'dod pa gang yin pa de rnam par gcod pa'i yul can te /
analyzed: 'khrul pa bzlog pa'i phyir tshad ma phyi mar 'dod pa gang yin pa de rnam par gcod pa'i yul can te /
translated: The one who asserts that a later valid cognition is needed to stop error is one whose object is an exclusion.

original: gzhan sel ba'i yul can du grub po //
analyzed: gzhan sel ba'i yul can du grub po //
translated: It is established as having an object that is an other-exclusion.

original: dus phyis 'byung ba'i tshad ma de las gzhan pa zhes bya ba dus sngar 'byung pa nges pa'i shes pa de dang 'dra ste /
analyzed: dus phyis 'byung ba'i tshad ma de las gzhan pa zhes bya ba dus sngar 'byung pa nges pa'i shes pa de dang 'dra ste /
translated: The later arising valid cognition is called ‚Äúother,‚Äù and the prior arising ascertaining consciousness is similar to that.

original: tshad ma phyi ma dang 'dra bar rnam par gcod pa'i yul can yin no //
analyzed: tshad ma phyi ma dang 'dra bar rnam par gcod pa'i yul can yin no //
translated: It is an object-possessor that excludes, like the later valid cognition.

original: ci'i phyir zhe na /üîΩsgro 'dogs med pa'i yul la ni //
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na / sgro 'dogs med pa'i yul la ni //
translated: Why is that?

original: 'jug phyir zhes bya ba smos so //
analyzed: 'jug phyir zhes bya ba smos so //
translated: It is said, ‚Äúbecause it engages an object that is without superimposition.‚Äù

original: 'khrul pa bzlog pa'i phyir zhes bya ba la sogs pas ni tshigs su bcad pa ston te /üîΩrnam pa gzhan sgro 'dogs pa gang yin pa de rnam par gcod pa'i 'bras bu can yin pa'i phyir /
analyzed: 'khrul pa bzlog pa'i phyir zhes bya ba la sogs pas ni tshigs su bcad pa ston te / rnam pa gzhan sgro 'dogs pa gang yin pa de rnam par gcod pa'i 'bras bu can yin pa'i phyir /
translated: The verse is taught by ‚Äúin order to reverse error‚Äù and so on.üîΩBecause it has the effect of excluding any other superimposition,

original: gzhan sel ba'i yul can du grub la /
analyzed: gzhan sel ba'i yul can du grub la /
translated: it is established as having an object that is an other-exclusion.

original: gzhan nges pa'i shes pa snga ma yang de dang 'dra bar gzhan sel ba'i yul can yin no //
analyzed: gzhan nges pa'i shes pa snga ma yang de dang 'dra bar gzhan sel ba'i yul can yin no //
translated: The prior ascertaining consciousness of the other is also similar in that it is an object-possessor that is an other-exclusion.

original: gtan tshigs su sgro 'dogs pa med pa'i zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: gtan tshigs su sgro 'dogs pa med pa'i zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: In order to prove that, it says, ‚Äúbecause it engages an object that is without superimposition‚Äù and so on.

original: sgro 'dogs pa med pa'i yul la 'jug pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: sgro 'dogs pa med pa'i yul la 'jug pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it engages an object that is free from superimposition.

original: 'di nyid kyi rnam par bshad pa gang la 'di'i zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: 'di nyid kyi rnam par bshad pa gang la 'di'i zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: In the explanation of this, he says, ‚ÄúIn regard to which aspect of this . . .‚Äù

original: rnam pa gang la 'di'i zhes bya ba ni rtogs par byed pa po'i'o //
analyzed: rnam pa gang la 'di'i zhes bya ba ni rtogs par byed pa po'i'o //
translated: ‚ÄúIn regard to which aspect of this‚Äù is the aspect of the cognizer.

original: rgyu de'i phyir sgro 'dogs pa la 'jug par nges pa'i shes pa sngar 'byung ba ni /
analyzed: rgyu de'i phyir sgro 'dogs pa la 'jug par nges pa'i shes pa sngar 'byung ba ni /
translated: For that reason, the prior ascertainment that engages superimposition

original: gzhan sel ba'i yul can du grub po //
analyzed: gzhan sel ba'i yul can du grub po //
translated: is established as having an object of exclusion of other.

original: gzhan yang nges par gzung ba'i don la yang 'khrul pa bzlog pa'i phyir tshad ma gzhan 'dod pas ni nges pa'i yul yang yin la nges pa yang ma yin no zhes bya bar khas blangs par @69b 'gyur te /
analyzed: gzhan yang nges par gzung ba'i don la yang 'khrul pa bzlog pa'i phyir tshad ma gzhan 'dod pas ni nges pa'i yul yang yin la nges pa yang ma yin no zhes bya bar khas blangs par @69b 'gyur te /
translated: Moreover, because another valid cognition is accepted in order to eliminate error even in regard to a determined object, it would be accepted that the object is determined but the cognition is not.

original: gzhan du na 'khrul pa mi rung ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gzhan du na 'khrul pa mi rung ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Otherwise, error would be impossible.

original: de yang rigs pa ma yin pas gzhan yang zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: de yang rigs pa ma yin pas gzhan yang zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: That is also unreasonable. Therefore, he says, ‚ÄúMoreover . . .‚Äù and so on.

original: ngo bo gang zhig nges pa rnams kyis ma nges pa'i ngo bo de ji ltar nges pa de dag gi yul yin te /
analyzed: ngo bo gang zhig nges pa rnams kyis ma nges pa'i ngo bo de ji ltar nges pa de dag gi yul yin te /
translated: How can a nature that is ascertained by those who ascertain it be the object of those who ascertain it?

original: yul ma yin pa kho na'o //
analyzed: yul ma yin pa kho na'o //
translated: It is not an object.

original: ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: 'di ltar nges pa rnams kyis rang gi don rtogs pa ni /
analyzed: 'di ltar nges pa rnams kyis rang gi don rtogs pa ni /
translated: Because the realization of their own object by those who ascertain it

original: 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'di lta ste /
translated: is just this:

original: don de nges pa gang yin pa 'di kho na yin na gal te nges pa'i yul du 'dod pa de rnam pa gzhan bzhin du nges pa'i yul nyid du mi 'dod pa gang yin pa de bzhin du'o //
analyzed: don de nges pa gang yin pa 'di kho na yin na gal te nges pa'i yul du 'dod pa de rnam pa gzhan bzhin du nges pa'i yul nyid du mi 'dod pa gang yin pa de bzhin du'o //
translated: If it is asserted that the object of ascertainment is just this, then just as it is not asserted that the object of ascertainment is another aspect, it is the same for that which is not asserted.

original: de dag gis zhes bya ba ni nges pa dag gis so //
analyzed: de dag gis zhes bya ba ni nges pa dag gis so //
translated: ‚ÄúBy them‚Äù refers to those who ascertain.

original: gzhan gyis da ni ji ltar zhes bya ba la sogs pa smras te /
analyzed: gzhan gyis da ni ji ltar zhes bya ba la sogs pa smras te /
translated: The other says, ‚ÄúNow, how?‚Äù and so on.

original: mngon sum gyis gzung ba la sgro 'dogs pa rnam par bcad pa'i phyir tshad ma gzhan 'dod pa gzhan sel bar smra ba yang rnam pa ma nges pa mngon sum gyis gzung ba nyid du ni 'dod na /
analyzed: mngon sum gyis gzung ba la sgro 'dogs pa rnam par bcad pa'i phyir tshad ma gzhan 'dod pa gzhan sel bar smra ba yang rnam pa ma nges pa mngon sum gyis gzung ba nyid du ni 'dod na /
translated: Because superimposition is eliminated in the object apprehended by perception, the assertion of another valid knowledge is the proponent of other-exclusion. If it is asserted that the object apprehended by perception is just that,

original: gal te nges pa'i dbang kho nas 'dzin pa yin na ko da ji ltar ma nges pa'i mngon sum gyis kyang gzung ba yin te /
analyzed: gal te nges pa'i dbang kho nas 'dzin pa yin na ko da ji ltar ma nges pa'i mngon sum gyis kyang gzung ba yin te /
translated: If it is only by the power of ascertainment that there is apprehension, then how is it that non-ascertaining perception also apprehends?

original: de bas na thal bar 'gyur bar mtshungs so zhe na /
analyzed: de bas na thal bar 'gyur bar mtshungs so zhe na /
translated: Therefore, the reductio is similar.

original: mngon sum ni zhes bya ba la sogs pas len 'debs te /
analyzed: mngon sum ni zhes bya ba la sogs pas len 'debs te /
translated: The response to that is ‚ÄúPerception, etc.‚Äù

original: rtogs pas dben pa'i phyir ro snyam du bsams pa yin no //
analyzed: rtogs pas dben pa'i phyir ro snyam du bsams pa yin no //
translated: The idea is that it is because it is devoid of conceptualization.

original: des zhes bya ba ni mngon sum gyis so //
analyzed: des zhes bya ba ni mngon sum gyis so //
translated: ‚ÄúBy it‚Äù means by perception.

original: sngon po la sogs pa'i rnam pa gang zhig 'dzi pa zhes bya ba'i 'dzin pa de yang nges pas ni ma yin no //
analyzed: sngon po la sogs pa'i rnam pa gang zhig 'dzi pa zhes bya ba'i 'dzin pa de yang nges pas ni ma yin no //
translated: The aspect of blue, etc., which is apprehended, is not ascertained.

original: 'o na ci zhe na /
analyzed: 'o na ci zhe na /
translated: What is it, then?

original: der snang bas te dngos po cha shas med pa'i rnam pa thams cad snang bas /
analyzed: der snang bas te dngos po cha shas med pa'i rnam pa thams cad snang bas /
translated: It is the appearance as that, because all the aspects of the partless entity appear.

original: rnam pa thams cad 'dzin pa yin no //
analyzed: rnam pa thams cad 'dzin pa yin no //
translated: Therefore, it apprehends all aspects.

original: de bas na zhes bya ba ni de lta bas na'o //
analyzed: de bas na zhes bya ba ni de lta bas na'o //
translated: ‚ÄúTherefore‚Äù means ‚Äúfor that reason.‚Äù

original: nges pa dang ma nges pa'i dbang gis go rims bzhin du mngon sum gyis 'dzin pa dang / mi 'dzin pa dag ma yin gyi /
analyzed: nges pa dang ma nges pa'i dbang gis go rims bzhin du mngon sum gyis 'dzin pa dang / mi 'dzin pa dag ma yin gyi /
translated: It is not that perception apprehends or does not apprehend by the power of ascertainment or non-ascertainment, respectively.

original: 'on kyang snang ba dang mi snang ba'i dbang gis yin no //
analyzed: 'on kyang snang ba dang mi snang ba'i dbang gis yin no //
translated: However, it is due to the power of appearance and non-appearance.

original: de lta bas na nges pa ma yin na snang ba tsam gyis mngon sum gyis gzung bar rnam par gzhag pa mi 'gal lo //
analyzed: de lta bas na nges pa ma yin na snang ba tsam gyis mngon sum gyis gzung bar rnam par gzhag pa mi 'gal lo //
translated: Therefore, if it is not ascertained, it is not contradictory to posit that it is apprehended by mere appearance through direct perception.

original: nges pa rnams kyis ni de ltar mngon sum bzhin du rnam pa ma nges pa yang snang ba tsam gyis 'dzin pa ni ma yin no //
analyzed: nges pa rnams kyis ni de ltar mngon sum bzhin du rnam pa ma nges pa yang snang ba tsam gyis 'dzin pa ni ma yin no //
translated: But for those who are certain, it is not like direct perception, and it is not apprehended by mere appearance through an uncertain aspect.

original: gal te ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: gal te ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: If one asks why,

original: 'ga' zhig ces bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: 'ga' zhig ces bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: he says some and so on.

original: dper na skyes bu mthong nas skyes bu nyid du nges kyang /üîΩchom @70a * //
analyzed: dper na skyes bu mthong nas skyes bu nyid du nges kyang / chom @70a * //
translated: For example, having seen a person, one may be certain that it is a person,

original: rkun la sogs pa gzhan la ma nges pas 'jug pa tha dad cing tha snyad tha dad pa lta bu'o //
analyzed: rkun la sogs pa gzhan la ma nges pas 'jug pa tha dad cing tha snyad tha dad pa lta bu'o //
translated: but because it is uncertain whether it is a thief or not, one's engagement and conventions will be different.

original: 'di ltar skyes bu nyid du nges pas ni skyes bu nyid dang 'tsham pa'i tha snyad yid gcugs pa la sogs par snang la /
analyzed: 'di ltar skyes bu nyid du nges pas ni skyes bu nyid dang 'tsham pa'i tha snyad yid gcugs pa la sogs par snang la /
translated: In this way, by being certain that it is a person, one makes the convention of a trustworthy person and so on, which is appropriate for a person.

original: chom rkun pa nyid du ma nges pas ni de dang 'tsham pa'i tha snyad 'jigs pa la sogs par mi snang ngo //
analyzed: chom rkun pa nyid du ma nges pas ni de dang 'tsham pa'i tha snyad 'jigs pa la sogs par mi snang ngo //
translated: Since it is not ascertained as a thief, the convention that is suitable to it, such as fear, does not appear.

original: de'i phyir gang la nges pa dang 'tsham pa'i 'jug pa tha dad pa yod pa de ni nges pas 'dzin pa yin la /
analyzed: de'i phyir gang la nges pa dang 'tsham pa'i 'jug pa tha dad pa yod pa de ni nges pas 'dzin pa yin la /
translated: Therefore, that which has a different engagement that is suitable to the ascertainment is ascertained as apprehending.

original: gang la nges pa dang 'tsham pa 'jug pa'i tha dad pa med pa de ni /
analyzed: gang la nges pa dang 'tsham pa 'jug pa'i tha dad pa med pa de ni /
translated: That which does not have a different engagement that is suitable to the ascertainment

original: mi 'dzin pa yin no //
analyzed: mi 'dzin pa yin no //
translated: is not ascertained as apprehending.

original: gang gi phyir de lta yin pa de'i phyir zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: gang gi phyir de lta yin pa de'i phyir zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: Because that is so, it is said, ‚Äúfor that reason, etc.‚Äù

original: 'di zhes bya ba ni rnam pa'o //
analyzed: 'di zhes bya ba ni rnam pa'o //
translated: ‚ÄúThis‚Äù refers to the aspect.

original: de lta ma yin na zhes bya ba ni gal te nges pa'i dbang gis de 'dzin par rnam par mi gzhag na de'i tshe /
analyzed: de lta ma yin na zhes bya ba ni gal te nges pa'i dbang gis de 'dzin par rnam par mi gzhag na de'i tshe /
translated: Otherwise, if it is not posited that it is apprehended due to the power of ascertainment, then

original: rnam pa gcig la yang nges pa nyid du 'dod pa'i rnam pa la yang der zhes bya ba nges par 'dzin par mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: rnam pa gcig la yang nges pa nyid du 'dod pa'i rnam pa la yang der zhes bya ba nges par 'dzin par mi 'gyur ro //
translated: even in the case of a single aspect, the aspect that is asserted as ascertainment would not be ascertained as that.

original: gzhan gyis yang ci'i phyir zhes bya ba la sogs pa smras te /
analyzed: gzhan gyis yang ci'i phyir zhes bya ba la sogs pa smras te /
translated: Another says, ‚ÄúWhy is that?‚Äù and so on.

original: thams cad las tha dad pa zhes bya ba ni rigs mthun pa dang / rigs mi mthun pa las log pa'o //
analyzed: thams cad las tha dad pa zhes bya ba ni rigs mthun pa dang / rigs mi mthun pa las log pa'o //
translated: ‚ÄúDistinct from all‚Äù means that it is distinguished from things of the same kind and from things of a different kind.

original: de kho na bzhin du zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: de kho na bzhin du zhes bya ba ni /
translated: ‚ÄúJust as it was experienced‚Äù means

original: ci'i phyir ji ltar nyams su myong ba bzhin du khyad par thams cad las dran pa'i nges pa mi 'byung ste /
analyzed: ci'i phyir ji ltar nyams su myong ba bzhin du khyad par thams cad las dran pa'i nges pa mi 'byung ste /
translated: Why is it that, just as it was experienced, there is no ascertainment of all the aspects by memory?

original: gang gis na gzhan sel bar smra bas rnam pa gzhan rnam par bcad pa'i don du khyad par gzhan la tshad ma gzhan 'jug par 'dod ce na /
analyzed: gang gis na gzhan sel bar smra bas rnam pa gzhan rnam par bcad pa'i don du khyad par gzhan la tshad ma gzhan 'jug par 'dod ce na /
translated: How is it that the proponent of apoha asserts that another valid cognition is applied to another distinction in order to eliminate other aspects?

original: grub pa'i mtha' smra bas /
analyzed: grub pa'i mtha' smra bas /
translated: The proponent of the tenets

original: lhan cig byed pa ma tshang ba'i phyir ro zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: lhan cig byed pa ma tshang ba'i phyir ro zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: says, ‚ÄúBecause the cooperating conditions are incomplete.‚Äù

original: nges pa'i rgyu ni nyam su myong ba tsam du zad do //
analyzed: nges pa'i rgyu ni nyam su myong ba tsam du zad do //
translated: The cause of ascertainment is merely the experience.

original: 'on kyang goms pa la sogs pa lhan cig byed pa rnams kyang yin te /
analyzed: 'on kyang goms pa la sogs pa lhan cig byed pa rnams kyang yin te /
translated: However, familiarity and so on are also cooperating conditions.

original: gang la de dag yod pa'i rnam pa de kho na la nges pa 'byung gi / gzhan la ni ma yin no //
analyzed: gang la de dag yod pa'i rnam pa de kho na la nges pa 'byung gi / gzhan la ni ma yin no //
translated: Ascertainment arises only in regard to the aspects in which those are present, not in regard to others.

original: de nyid de bas na zhes bya ba la sogs pas ston te /
analyzed: de nyid de bas na zhes bya ba la sogs pas ston te /
translated: That itself is taught by ‚ÄúTherefore, that . . .‚Äù

original: thams cad las log pa sngon po la sogs pa rang gi mtshan nyid kyi khyad par cha shas rnams spangs pa cha med pa /
analyzed: thams cad las log pa sngon po la sogs pa rang gi mtshan nyid kyi khyad par cha shas rnams spangs pa cha med pa /
translated: The partless is the exclusion of all, the particulars of the intrinsic identity of blue, etc., the parts.

original: mngon sum gyis bdag nyid thams cad du gzung ba la'ang /
analyzed: mngon sum gyis bdag nyid thams cad du gzung ba la'ang /
translated: Even though it is apprehended by direct perception in all its aspects,

original: khyad par gang la rtogs pa'i lhan cig byed pa'i rkyen yod de ni rtogs par 'gyur nges par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: khyad par gang la rtogs pa'i lhan cig byed pa'i rkyen yod de ni rtogs par 'gyur nges par 'gyur ro //
translated: whatever particular has a condition that is a co-originator of the understanding, that will be understood, will certainly be understood.

original: thams cad las tha dad pa zhes bya ba la sogs @70b pas ni 'chad par byed de /
analyzed: thams cad las tha dad pa zhes bya ba la sogs @70b pas ni 'chad par byed de /
translated: ‚Äú Different from all . . .‚Äù and so on explains.

original: de tsam gyis zhes bya ba ni nyams su myong ba tsam gyis so //
analyzed: de tsam gyis zhes bya ba ni nyams su myong ba tsam gyis so //
translated: ‚Äú By that alone‚Äù means by mere experience.

original: khyad par thams cad la zhes bya ba ni skad cig ma nyid la sogs pa la ste /
analyzed: khyad par thams cad la zhes bya ba ni skad cig ma nyid la sogs pa la ste /
translated: ‚Äú In all particulars‚Äù means in momentariness, etc.

original: nyams su myong ba'i shes pa ni nges pa bskyed par bya ba la rgyu gzhan la ltos pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: nyams su myong ba'i shes pa ni nges pa bskyed par bya ba la rgyu gzhan la ltos pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The consciousness of experience is dependent on another cause in order to generate certainty.

original: rgyu gzhan la ltos pa nyid nyams su myong ba ni zhes bya ba la sogs pas ston par byed de /
analyzed: rgyu gzhan la ltos pa nyid nyams su myong ba ni zhes bya ba la sogs pas ston par byed de /
translated: ‚ÄúThe experience of dependence on other causes‚Äù is indicated by the words ‚Äúand so on.‚Äù

original: rnam par rtog pa la ji ltar goms pa bzhin zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: rnam par rtog pa la ji ltar goms pa bzhin zhes bya ba ni /
translated: ‚ÄúIn accordance with the degree of habituation to conceptual thought‚Äù means

original: gang la rnam par rtog pa la goms pa ji lta bu yod pa'i lhan cig byed pa nges bskyed do zhes bya ba'i don to //üîΩdper brjod pa dper na zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: gang la rnam par rtog pa la goms pa ji lta bu yod pa'i lhan cig byed pa nges bskyed do zhes bya ba'i don to // dper brjod pa dper na zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: that the particular co-operating cause that is produced is in accordance with the degree of habituation to conceptual thought.üîΩAn example is given: ‚ÄúFor example, when a man sees the corpse of a woman with whom he has had experience, he will have a conceptual thought of her as a putrid corpse, a conceptual thought of her as a skeleton, or a conceptual thought of her as a corpse that is being eaten by worms.‚Äù

original: bud med shi ba'i gzugs mthong ba la khyad par med kyang /üîΩkun du rgyu dang 'phyon ma dang khyi rnams la go rims bzhin du /
analyzed: bud med shi ba'i gzugs mthong ba la khyad par med kyang / kun du rgyu dang 'phyon ma dang khyi rnams la go rims bzhin du /
translated: Although there is no difference in the appearance of the corpse of a woman who has died,üîΩthe co-operating causes of the three types of conceptual thought arise in the three types of people, the ascetic, the prostitute, and the dog, respectively, in accordance with the degree of habituation to conceptual thought.

original: rnam par rtog pa la ji ltar goms pa bzhin ro myags pa dang / nyal po bya ba dang / bza' bar bya ba'i rnam par rtog pa dag 'byung ba lta bu'o //
analyzed: rnam par rtog pa la ji ltar goms pa bzhin ro myags pa dang / nyal po bya ba dang / bza' bar bya ba'i rnam par rtog pa dag 'byung ba lta bu'o //
translated: The conceptual thought of putridity arises in the ascetic, the conceptual thought of sexual intercourse arises in the prostitute, and the conceptual thought of eating arises in the dog.

original: lhan cig byed pa ni rnam par rtog pa la goms pa 'ba' zhig tu yang ma zad kyi /
analyzed: lhan cig byed pa ni rnam par rtog pa la goms pa 'ba' zhig tu yang ma zad kyi /
translated: The co-operating cause is not only the degree of habituation to conceptual thought.

original: 'on kyang gzhan yang yod pas de la ni zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: 'on kyang gzhan yang yod pas de la ni zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: But there is another, so he says, ‚Äúand that is . . . ‚Äù

original: de la zhes bya ba ni gzugs mthong ba la khyad par med pa la yang ngo //
analyzed: de la zhes bya ba ni gzugs mthong ba la khyad par med pa la yang ngo //
translated: ‚ÄúThat‚Äù refers to the fact that there is no difference in seeing form.

original: blo gsal ba ni rno ba nyid do //
analyzed: blo gsal ba ni rno ba nyid do //
translated: ‚ÄúClear mind‚Äù means sharpness.

original: dper na rnal 'byor pa rnams kyi blo gsal bas mthong ba tsam gyis skad cig ma nyid la sogs par nges pa lta bu'o //
analyzed: dper na rnal 'byor pa rnams kyi blo gsal bas mthong ba tsam gyis skad cig ma nyid la sogs par nges pa lta bu'o //
translated: For example, it is like the fact that yogins ascertain momentariness and so on merely through seeing with their clear minds.

original: de'i bag chags goms pa ni nges pa'i shes pa de'i bag chags de goms shing rgyun chags su 'jug pa ste /
analyzed: de'i bag chags goms pa ni nges pa'i shes pa de'i bag chags de goms shing rgyun chags su 'jug pa ste /
translated: ‚ÄúHabituation to its imprints‚Äù means the imprints of that ascertaining consciousness are habituated and continuously engaged.

original: dper na skyes bu 'ga' zhig la yon tan du ma yod du zin kyang ji ltar goms pa bzhin du yon tan nges pa lta bu'o //
analyzed: dper na skyes bu 'ga' zhig la yon tan du ma yod du zin kyang ji ltar goms pa bzhin du yon tan nges pa lta bu'o //
translated: For example, it is like the fact that even if a person has many good qualities, his good qualities are ascertained in accordance with his habituation.

original: 'dis ni rnam par rtog pa la ji ltar goms pa bzhin zhes bshad pa gang yin pa de kho na'i gtan tshigs bskang bar bya ba'i phyir yang bzlas pa yin no //
analyzed: 'dis ni rnam par rtog pa la ji ltar goms pa bzhin zhes bshad pa gang yin pa de kho na'i gtan tshigs bskang bar bya ba'i phyir yang bzlas pa yin no //
translated: This is a repetition that fulfills the requirement of a reason for what was explained as ‚Äúin accordance with habituation to conceptuality.‚Äù

original: skabs ni skabs su bab pa ste /
analyzed: skabs ni skabs su bab pa ste /
translated: ‚ÄúThe occasion‚Äù is the appropriate time.

original: dper na sman pa la sogs pa'i gtam gyi skabs su bab pa na /
analyzed: dper na sman pa la sogs pa'i gtam gyi skabs su bab pa na /
translated: For example, when the occasion arises for a doctor and so on,

original: de mthong ba las skyes bu chos du ma yod du zin kyang sman pa la sogs pa nyid du nges pa lta bu'o zhes bya ba la sogs pa zhes bya ba ni de lta bu la sogs pa ste /
analyzed: de mthong ba las skyes bu chos du ma yod du zin kyang sman pa la sogs pa nyid du nges pa lta bu'o zhes bya ba la sogs pa zhes bya ba ni de lta bu la sogs pa ste /
translated: although there are many qualities of a person, it is ascertained as just a doctor and so on.

original: stsogs pa zhes bya ba'i sgras ni don du gnyer ba nyid dang shugs la sogs pa yongs su @71a * //
analyzed: stsogs pa zhes bya ba'i sgras ni don du gnyer ba nyid dang shugs la sogs pa yongs su @71a * //
translated: The phrase ‚Äúand so on‚Äù includes the need for the object and the force of the object.

original: bsdu'o // nye bar len pa'i rgyu nyams su myong ba mngon sum las khyad par nges pa bye brag nges pa skye ba'i lhan cig byed pa dag yin no //
analyzed: bsdu'o // nye bar len pa'i rgyu nyams su myong ba mngon sum las khyad par nges pa bye brag nges pa skye ba'i lhan cig byed pa dag yin no //
translated: The causes of appropriation are the conditions that give rise to the ascertainment of a specific object.

original: 'o na gang gi tshe nges pa mang po dag la ji skad bshad pa'i rgyu dag yod pa de'i tshe nges pa de rnams kyi go rims ji ltar 'byung zhe na /
analyzed: 'o na gang gi tshe nges pa mang po dag la ji skad bshad pa'i rgyu dag yod pa de'i tshe nges pa de rnams kyi go rims ji ltar 'byung zhe na /
translated: If there are many ascertainment in regard to the causes of ascertainment as explained, then what is the order of those ascertainment?

original: de dag kho na zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: de dag kho na zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: The phrase ‚Äújust those‚Äù and so on is stated.

original: de dag ces bya ba ni nges pa'i rgyu rnams so //
analyzed: de dag ces bya ba ni nges pa'i rgyu rnams so //
translated: ‚ÄúThose‚Äù refers to the causes of ascertainment.

original: shin tu dang ches shin tu nye ba la sogs pa'i bye brag gis zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: shin tu dang ches shin tu nye ba la sogs pa'i bye brag gis zhes bya ba ni /
translated: ‚ÄúBy the distinctions of very, extremely, and so on‚Äù means

original: nges pa gang zhig gis nges pa'i rgyu ches shin tu nye ba de ni re zhig dang por skye'o //
analyzed: nges pa gang zhig gis nges pa'i rgyu ches shin tu nye ba de ni re zhig dang por skye'o //
translated: that the cause of ascertainment that is very, extremely, and so on, is ascertained first.

original: sogs pa zhes bya ba'i sgras ni /
analyzed: sogs pa zhes bya ba'i sgras ni /
translated: The word ‚Äúand so on‚Äù

original: shin tu dang ches shin tu che ba nyid la sogs pa'i bye brag gis nges pa rnams snga phyi nyid du 'gyur ba bsdu'o //
analyzed: shin tu dang ches shin tu che ba nyid la sogs pa'i bye brag gis nges pa rnams snga phyi nyid du 'gyur ba bsdu'o //
translated: includes the distinctions of very and extremely great and so on, which are ascertained earlier and later.

original: dper na zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni dper brjod pa ston te /
analyzed: dper na zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni dper brjod pa ston te /
translated: For example, when the father is also the abbot,

original: gang gi tshe pha nyid mkhan po yin pa de'i tshe skyes bu gcig la skyed par byed pa dang / 'dod du 'jug par byed pa nyid du khyad par med kyang pha 'ongs pa mthong nas bdag gi pha 'ong ngo snyam du nges par byed kyi /
analyzed: gang gi tshe pha nyid mkhan po yin pa de'i tshe skyes bu gcig la skyed par byed pa dang / 'dod du 'jug par byed pa nyid du khyad par med kyang pha 'ongs pa mthong nas bdag gi pha 'ong ngo snyam du nges par byed kyi /
translated: although there is no difference between the father and the abbot in terms of being the one who gives birth and the one who makes one enter the desire realm, when the father comes, one ascertains, ‚ÄúMy father is coming,‚Äù

original: mkhan po 'ong ngo snyam pa ni ma yin pa lta bu ste /
analyzed: mkhan po 'ong ngo snyam pa ni ma yin pa lta bu ste /
translated: but one does not ascertain, ‚ÄúThe abbot is coming.‚Äù

original: pha nyid du nges pa'i rgyu ches shin tu nye ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: pha nyid du nges pa'i rgyu ches shin tu nye ba'i phyir ro //
translated: This is because the cause of ascertainment of being the father is very, extremely close.

original: skad cig ma nyid yin la /
analyzed: skad cig ma nyid yin la /
translated: It is momentary.

original: bdag med pa nyid du rnam par rtog pa la goms pa'i lhan cig byed pa yod du zin kyang ;
analyzed: bdag med pa nyid du rnam par rtog pa la goms pa'i lhan cig byed pa yod du zin kyang ;
translated: Even though there is the cooperative condition of the repeated practice of the conception of selflessness,

original: / de kho na nyid ma mthong ba rnams la /
analyzed: / de kho na nyid ma mthong ba rnams la /
translated: for those who have not seen reality,

original: mngon sum gyi skad cig ma nyid la sogs par nges par mi 'gyur ba ma yin nam zhe na /
analyzed: mngon sum gyi skad cig ma nyid la sogs par nges par mi 'gyur ba ma yin nam zhe na /
translated: is it not the case that the ascertainment of the momentariness of direct perception and so forth will not occur?üîΩTherefore, Candrakirti says,

original: de'i phyir nges pa der yang 'gyur ba na zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: de'i phyir nges pa der yang 'gyur ba na zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: If that ascertainment occurs, then it is not non-mistaken.

original: 'khrul pa'i rgyu med na 'gyur gyi /
analyzed: 'khrul pa'i rgyu med na 'gyur gyi /
translated: If there is no cause of error, it will occur,

original: nges pa'i rgyu rkyen tsam gyis ni ma yin no //
analyzed: nges pa'i rgyu rkyen tsam gyis ni ma yin no //
translated: but not merely through the conditions of ascertainment.

original: gang gi phyir de ltar 'khrul pa'i rgyu yang med la /
analyzed: gang gi phyir de ltar 'khrul pa'i rgyu yang med la /
translated: Since there is no cause of error,

original: lhan cig byed pa'i rkyen yang tshang na mngon sum las nges pa skye'i /
analyzed: lhan cig byed pa'i rkyen yang tshang na mngon sum las nges pa skye'i /
translated: and since the cooperative conditions are complete, ascertainment arises from direct perception,üîΩbut not from mere direct perception. Therefore, Candrakirti says,

original: 'ba' zhig las ni ma yin pa de'i phyir nyams su myong ba kho nas ni zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: 'ba' zhig las ni ma yin pa de'i phyir nyams su myong ba kho nas ni zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: It is only through experience.

original: de lta bas na sgra dang rtags dag gis gzhan rnam par gcod pa grub po zhes bya ba 'di gnas pa yin no //
analyzed: de lta bas na sgra dang rtags dag gis gzhan rnam par gcod pa grub po zhes bya ba 'di gnas pa yin no //
translated: Therefore, it is established that sound and signs eliminate other things.

original: yang gang gi tshe rta las ba lang gi rdzas kyis ldog pa dang / rta las ba lang ldog pa zhes brjod pa'am /
analyzed: yang gang gi tshe rta las ba lang gi rdzas kyis ldog pa dang / rta las ba lang ldog pa zhes brjod pa'am /
translated: Moreover, when one says that a cow is eliminated from a horse, or that a cow is eliminated from a horse,

original: shes pa de'i tshe ci ldog pa dang / ldog pa dang ldan pa dag dngos su tha dad pa yod dam 'on te med /
analyzed: shes pa de'i tshe ci ldog pa dang / ldog pa dang ldan pa dag dngos su tha dad pa yod dam 'on te med /
translated: at that time, is there an actual difference between the eliminated and the eliminator, or is there not?

original: rnam par rtog pa dang po ltar na ni spyi kho na @71b la ldog pa'o zhes ming gzhan du brjod par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: rnam par rtog pa dang po ltar na ni spyi kho na @71b la ldog pa'o zhes ming gzhan du brjod par 'gyur ro //
translated: If it is as in the first conception, then it would be a mere universal that is eliminated, and it would be called by another name.

original: gnyis pa la yang shes pa dang // sgra dag tha dad par mi 'gyur ro zhe na /
analyzed: gnyis pa la yang shes pa dang // sgra dag tha dad par mi 'gyur ro zhe na /
translated: If it is as in the second conception, then the cognition and the sound would not be different.

original: de'i phyir de la yang zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: de'i phyir de la yang zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: Therefore, he says, ‚ÄúIn that case, etc.‚Äù

original: sgra gzhan sel ba'i don can de la yang gzhan las ldog pa dang / gzhan las 'di log pa zhes bya ba'i sgra chos dang chos can rjod par byed pa dang / nges pa gnyi ga'i yul can gang dag yin pa de dag ni /
analyzed: sgra gzhan sel ba'i don can de la yang gzhan las ldog pa dang / gzhan las 'di log pa zhes bya ba'i sgra chos dang chos can rjod par byed pa dang / nges pa gnyi ga'i yul can gang dag yin pa de dag ni /
translated: The meaning of the exclusion of other is also the object of both the exclusion of other and the exclusion of what is other than that, and the terms ‚Äúexclusion of other‚Äù and ‚Äúexclusion of what is other than that‚Äù express the property and the possessor of the property.

original: brda'i rjes su byed pa yin /
analyzed: brda'i rjes su byed pa yin /
translated: They are in accord with the convention.

original: brda dang mthun par 'di dag gi yul chos dang chos can rnam par dbye'i //
analyzed: brda dang mthun par 'di dag gi yul chos dang chos can rnam par dbye'i //
translated: In accord with the convention, the object of these is distinguished as the property and the possessor of the property.

original: don dam par ni ldog pa dang ldog pa dang ldan pa dag tha dad pa med do zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: don dam par ni ldog pa dang ldog pa dang ldan pa dag tha dad pa med do zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: In the ultimate, the exclusion and that which possesses the exclusion are not different.üîΩThis is the meaning of the statement.

original: de nyid gzhan sel ba de la yang zhes bya ba la sogs pas ston te /
analyzed: de nyid gzhan sel ba de la yang zhes bya ba la sogs pas ston te /
translated: That itself is the exclusion of other.

original: rta las ba lang gi ldog pa yang gzhan la rta las ba lang log pa yang gzhan pa nyid do zhes bya ba 'di ni med kyi /
analyzed: rta las ba lang gi ldog pa yang gzhan la rta las ba lang log pa yang gzhan pa nyid do zhes bya ba 'di ni med kyi /
translated: The exclusion of an ox from a horse is one thing, and the exclusion of an ox from a horse is another.

original: 'on kyang log pa gang yin pa de nyid ldog pa yin no //
analyzed: 'on kyang log pa gang yin pa de nyid ldog pa yin no //
translated: However, that which is excluded is itself the exclusion.

original: gal te rta las ldog pa rta ma yin pa nyid ba lang gi rdzas las gzhan pa zhig tu gyur na de'i tshe /
analyzed: gal te rta las ldog pa rta ma yin pa nyid ba lang gi rdzas las gzhan pa zhig tu gyur na de'i tshe /
translated: If the reversal from horse were different from the substance of cow,

original: tha dad pa'i phyir rta las ldog pa las ba lang gi rdzas kyang log par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: tha dad pa'i phyir rta las ldog pa las ba lang gi rdzas kyang log par 'gyur ro //
translated: then the substance of cow would be reversed from the reversal from horse, because they are different.

original: de bas na de las log pa las rta las ldog pa /
analyzed: de bas na de las log pa las rta las ldog pa /
translated: Therefore, it follows that the cow would exist in the reversal from that,

original: rta ma yin pa nyid las log pa ba lang las de yod par thal bar 'gyur ba'i phyir te /üîΩrta yod phar thal bar 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rta ma yin pa nyid las log pa ba lang las de yod par thal bar 'gyur ba'i phyir te / rta yod phar thal bar 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
translated: in the reversal from the non-horse, because the horse would exist there.

original: gal te 'di rta nyid du gyur na de lta na rta las ldog pa rta ma yin pa nyid kyi mtshan nyid las ba lang log pa yin no //
analyzed: gal te 'di rta nyid du gyur na de lta na rta las ldog pa rta ma yin pa nyid kyi mtshan nyid las ba lang log pa yin no //
translated: If this were a horse, then the cow would be reversed from the definition of the non-horse, the reversal from horse.

original: de lta yin na ni ba lang la rta yod par 'gyur ba'i phyir /
analyzed: de lta yin na ni ba lang la rta yod par 'gyur ba'i phyir /
translated: If that were so, then the horse would exist in the cow.

original: rta las ba lang gi ldog pa gang yin pa de med do //
analyzed: rta las ba lang gi ldog pa gang yin pa de med do //
translated: Therefore, the reversal from horse to cow does not exist.

original: gang gi phyir de lta yin pa de'i phyir zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: gang gi phyir de lta yin pa de'i phyir zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: Because that is so, therefore, and so on, is stated.

original: 'di ni phyi rol gyi rang gi mtshan nyid la gtan nas ldog pa dang ldog pa dang ldan pa dag gi de kho na nyid bshad pa yin te /
analyzed: 'di ni phyi rol gyi rang gi mtshan nyid la gtan nas ldog pa dang ldog pa dang ldan pa dag gi de kho na nyid bshad pa yin te /
translated: This is the explanation of the reality of the external, which is never the opposite of the own characteristic, and which is endowed with the opposite.

original: log pa'i rang gi mtshan nyid kho na log pa'i ngo bo yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: log pa'i rang gi mtshan nyid kho na log pa'i ngo bo yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because the own characteristic of the unreal is just the nature of the unreal.

original: 'di ni dngos su sgra'i don ma yin mod kyi /
analyzed: 'di ni dngos su sgra'i don ma yin mod kyi /
translated: This is not actually the meaning of the word,

original: 'on kyang smra ba po dang nyan pa po rnams snang ba dang / rnam par brtag par bya ba don dag gcig tu byas nas de la yang sgra'i don nyid du mngon pa'i nga rgyal byed pas de yang skabs 'dir bstan to //
analyzed: 'on kyang smra ba po dang nyan pa po rnams snang ba dang / rnam par brtag par bya ba don dag gcig tu byas nas de la yang sgra'i don nyid du mngon pa'i nga rgyal byed pas de yang skabs 'dir bstan to //
translated: but nevertheless, the speaker and the hearer, having made the appearance and the object of investigation one, also take pride in it as the meaning of the word. Therefore, that is also taught in this context.

original: nam zhig phyi'i don la brten nas rnam par rtog pa la yod pa'i chos can @72a * //
analyzed: nam zhig phyi'i don la brten nas rnam par rtog pa la yod pa'i chos can @72a * //
translated: When one imagines that the subject that exists in the conceptualization in dependence on the external object is the basis of various properties,

original: chos sna tshogs kyi rten nyid du yongs su rtog par byed ba na de nyid sgra'i don yin pas de kho na la gzhi mthun pa la sogs pa yod la /
analyzed: chos sna tshogs kyi rten nyid du yongs su rtog par byed ba na de nyid sgra'i don yin pas de kho na la gzhi mthun pa la sogs pa yod la /
translated: then that is the meaning of the word, and therefore it is that alone which has the common locus, etc.

original: sgra'i don du gyur pa chos can de las kyang ldog pa rnams de nyid dang gzhan nyid du brjod par bya ba ma yin te /
analyzed: sgra'i don du gyur pa chos can de las kyang ldog pa rnams de nyid dang gzhan nyid du brjod par bya ba ma yin te /
translated: The object of the word, the subject, is also not to be expressed as either the same as or different from the exclusion.

original: 'di ni 'og nas 'chad par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: 'di ni 'og nas 'chad par 'gyur ro //
translated: This will be explained below.

original: gal te ldog pa dang de dang ldan pa dag tha dad pa med pa ji ltar sgra dang shes pa tha dad de 'di ltar de'i rta ma yin pa nyid ces bya ba'i sgra yang gzhan yin la /
analyzed: gal te ldog pa dang de dang ldan pa dag tha dad pa med pa ji ltar sgra dang shes pa tha dad de 'di ltar de'i rta ma yin pa nyid ces bya ba'i sgra yang gzhan yin la /
translated: If the exclusion and that which possesses it are not different, how are the word and the cognition different? In this way, the word ‚Äúnon-horse‚Äù is one thing,

original: rta ma yin pa zhes bya ba'i sgra yang gzhan yin no //
analyzed: rta ma yin pa zhes bya ba'i sgra yang gzhan yin no //
translated: and the word ‚Äúnon-ox‚Äù is another.

original: de bzhin du shes bya yang tha dad de /
analyzed: de bzhin du shes bya yang tha dad de /
translated: In the same way, the objects of knowledge are also different.

original: rta ma yin pa nyid ces smra na ni chos tsam shes par 'gyur la /
analyzed: rta ma yin pa nyid ces smra na ni chos tsam shes par 'gyur la /
translated: If one says ‚Äúnon-horse,‚Äù one understands the mere property.üîΩIf one says ‚Äúnon-ox,‚Äù one understands the subject.

original: rta ma yin pa zhes smra na ni chos can shes par 'gyur ro zhe na de'i phyir /
analyzed: rta ma yin pa zhes smra na ni chos can shes par 'gyur ro zhe na de'i phyir /
translated: Therefore, it is said:

original: sgra dang zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: sgra dang zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: ‚ÄúThe cognition from the word‚Äù and so on.

original: chos dang chos can rjod par byed pa'i sgra las rtogs pa gang yin pa de ni sgras rtogs pa'o //
analyzed: chos dang chos can rjod par byed pa'i sgra las rtogs pa gang yin pa de ni sgras rtogs pa'o //
translated: The cognition from the word is the cognition from the word that expresses the property and the subject.

original: sgra dang sgra rtogs pa zhes mi 'dra ba gcig lus par byas pa yin te /
analyzed: sgra dang sgra rtogs pa zhes mi 'dra ba gcig lus par byas pa yin te /
translated: The difference between the word and the understanding is left out.

original: sgra'i tha dad pa dang / sgra las rtogs pa gang yin pa de'i tha dad pa zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: sgra'i tha dad pa dang / sgra las rtogs pa gang yin pa de'i tha dad pa zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: The difference of the word and the difference of the understanding that is derived from the word, that is what is meant by the difference.

original: brda ni ming dang ming can 'brel par byed pa ste /
analyzed: brda ni ming dang ming can 'brel par byed pa ste /
translated: The convention is the connection of the name with the thing named.

original: de'i bye brag gis yin no //
analyzed: de'i bye brag gis yin no //
translated: It is by its particularities.

original: brda'i bye brag kyang 'og nyid nas khyad par gzhan ni spong ba dang zhes bya ba la sogs pas ston par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: brda'i bye brag kyang 'og nyid nas khyad par gzhan ni spong ba dang zhes bya ba la sogs pas ston par 'gyur ro //
translated: The particularities of the convention will be shown later on, beginning with the line, ‚ÄúThe difference is the exclusion of another.

original: brjod par bya ba la ni tha dad pa med do zhes bya ba ni dngos su na chos dang chos can gyi sgra dag gis zhes bya ba kho nas drang ngo //
analyzed: brjod par bya ba la ni tha dad pa med do zhes bya ba ni dngos su na chos dang chos can gyi sgra dag gis zhes bya ba kho nas drang ngo //
translated: ‚Äù There is no difference in the object of expression, that is, in reality, the word ‚Äúproperty‚Äù and the word ‚Äúproperty-possessor‚Äù are to be interpreted as referring to the same thing.

original: gzhan gyis brjod par bya ba tha dad pa med pa'i phyir zhes bya ba la sogs pa smras so //
analyzed: gzhan gyis brjod par bya ba tha dad pa med pa'i phyir zhes bya ba la sogs pa smras so //
translated: The other, namely, ‚Äúbecause there is no difference in the object of expression,‚Äù and so on, is stated.

original: gal te brjod par bya ba khyad par med kyang brda tha dad pa ci ste mi rung zhe na /
analyzed: gal te brjod par bya ba khyad par med kyang brda tha dad pa ci ste mi rung zhe na /
translated: If there is no difference in the object of expression, why is the convention not suitable as being different?

original: gnyi gas zhes bya ba la sogs pa smras te /
analyzed: gnyi gas zhes bya ba la sogs pa smras te /
translated: The response is Both... and so on.

original: chos dang chos can gyi sgra gnyi gas don gcig brjod pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: chos dang chos can gyi sgra gnyi gas don gcig brjod pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: The terms property and possessor of the property both express the same meaning. This is the point.

original: gal te gnyi gas brjod par bya ba gcig yin na ni des brda don med pa yin no //üîΩde lta na zhes bya ba ni chos dang chos can dag tha mi dad na'o //
analyzed: gal te gnyi gas brjod par bya ba gcig yin na ni des brda don med pa yin no // de lta na zhes bya ba ni chos dang chos can dag tha mi dad na'o //
translated: If both express the same meaning, then the convention is meaningless.üîΩIf the property and the possessor of the property are not different, then....

original: tha dad par 'byed pa zhes bya ba ni tha dad par brjod pa ste /
analyzed: tha dad par 'byed pa zhes bya ba ni tha dad par brjod pa ste /
translated: The response is The differentiation... The differentiation is the expression of difference.

original: ba lang gi ba lang nyid ces bya ba drug pa'o //
analyzed: ba lang gi ba lang nyid ces bya ba drug pa'o //
translated: The sixth case, of the cow, is used.

original: de ni zhes bya ba ni tha dad par 'byed pa'i rnam par dbye ba ste /üîΩtha dad pa la brten pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de ni zhes bya ba ni tha dad par 'byed pa'i rnam par dbye ba ste / tha dad pa la brten pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The response is That... The differentiation is the distinction.üîΩBecause it is based on difference, it is said that it is based on difference.

original: gzhi tha dad pa la brten @72b nas 'jug pa'i phyir /
analyzed: gzhi tha dad pa la brten @72b nas 'jug pa'i phyir /
translated: Because it is based on a different substratum, it is said that it is based on a different substratum.

original: dper na lha sbyin gyis ril ba spyi blugs zhes bya ba lta bu'o //
analyzed: dper na lha sbyin gyis ril ba spyi blugs zhes bya ba lta bu'o //
translated: For example, it is like Devadatta's water pot.

original: de ltar brda med pa dang tha dad par 'byed pa'i rnam par dbye ba med par brgal ba la re zhig rnam par dbye ba med pa'i nyes pa spangs pa'i phyir gnyi gas zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: de ltar brda med pa dang tha dad par 'byed pa'i rnam par dbye ba med par brgal ba la re zhig rnam par dbye ba med pa'i nyes pa spangs pa'i phyir gnyi gas zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: In response to the objection that the word and the referent are not different, and that therefore they cannot be differentiated, BhƒÅviveka says, ‚ÄúBoth are expressed by the words that express the property and the property-bearer,‚Äù and so on.

original: chos dang chos can rjod par byed pa'i sgra dag gis don gcig cig brjod mod kyi /
analyzed: chos dang chos can rjod par byed pa'i sgra dag gis don gcig cig brjod mod kyi /
translated: The words that express the property and the property-bearer do express the same object.

original: brjod par bya ba la brdas tha dad par byas pa'i shan tsam gyi khyad par yod pa gang yin pa'i rgyu de yin gyi don dam par dngos po tha dad pa'i sgo nas ni ma yin te /üîΩrnam dbye tha dad 'byed pa yis tha dad par rjod par byed pa'i drug pas bzhin zhes bya ba'i sgra rim pa bzhin du sbyar pa ste /
analyzed: brjod par bya ba la brdas tha dad par byas pa'i shan tsam gyi khyad par yod pa gang yin pa'i rgyu de yin gyi don dam par dngos po tha dad pa'i sgo nas ni ma yin te / rnam dbye tha dad 'byed pa yis tha dad par rjod par byed pa'i drug pas bzhin zhes bya ba'i sgra rim pa bzhin du sbyar pa ste /
translated: However, the reason that they are different is that they are differentiated by convention with respect to the object. The difference is merely a difference in the words themselves. It is not a difference in terms of ultimate entities.üîΩThe words ‚Äújust as‚Äù should be applied in order, as in the following examples:üîΩ‚Äújust as the different cases are differentiated by the different case endings,‚Äù and ‚Äújust as the different numbers are differentiated by the different numbers.‚Äù

original: don tha dad pa bzhin du sgrub par byed cing ston par byed do //
