analyzed: don tha dad pa bzhin du sgrub par byed cing ston par byed do //
translated: The words ‚Äújust as‚Äù are used to show that the words are established as different in the same way that the objects are established as different.

original: de nyid sgra rnams kyi 'jug pa zhes bya ba la sogs pas ston te /
analyzed: de nyid sgra rnams kyi 'jug pa zhes bya ba la sogs pas ston te /
translated: This is shown by the passage beginning with ‚ÄúThe engagement of words is in terms of the object.‚Äù

original: yul gyi rang gi ngo bo la rag las pa zhes bya ba ni phyi rol gyi rang gi mtshan nyid la rag las pa'o //
analyzed: yul gyi rang gi ngo bo la rag las pa zhes bya ba ni phyi rol gyi rang gi mtshan nyid la rag las pa'o //
translated: ‚ÄúDependent on the intrinsic reality of the object‚Äù means dependent on the external particular itself.

original: ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: med pa dag la yang 'dod pas skyes bu'i 'dod pa'i dbang gis 'jug pa med par thal bar 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: med pa dag la yang 'dod pas skyes bu'i 'dod pa'i dbang gis 'jug pa med par thal bar 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it would follow that even nonexistent things would be engaged by the power of the person‚Äôs desire.

original: de dag ces bya ba ni 'dod pa la rag las te 'jug pa'i sgra dag go //
analyzed: de dag ces bya ba ni 'dod pa la rag las te 'jug pa'i sgra dag go //
translated: ‚ÄúThose‚Äù refers to the words that are engaged in dependence on desire.

original: tha dad pa la ni dper na rgyal po'i mi zhes bya ba lta bu'o //
analyzed: tha dad pa la ni dper na rgyal po'i mi zhes bya ba lta bu'o //
translated: In the case of difference, it is like saying ‚Äúthe king‚Äôs man.‚Äù

original: tha dad pa ma yin pa la ni dper na bdag gi lta ba po bdag nyid do zhes bya ba lta bu'o //
analyzed: tha dad pa ma yin pa la ni dper na bdag gi lta ba po bdag nyid do zhes bya ba lta bu'o //
translated: In the case of nondifference, it is like saying ‚Äúthe seer is the self itself.‚Äù

original: ji ltar zhes bya ba ni tha dad par ston par byed pa'i rnam pa gang gis so //
analyzed: ji ltar zhes bya ba ni tha dad par ston par byed pa'i rnam pa gang gis so //
translated: ‚ÄúIn what way‚Äù means in what mode of showing difference.

original: de ltar sbyar ba zhes bya ba ni don tha dad med kyang tha dad pa lta bu la brten nas sbyar ba ste /
analyzed: de ltar sbyar ba zhes bya ba ni don tha dad med kyang tha dad pa lta bu la brten nas sbyar ba ste /
translated: ‚ÄúSuch a connection‚Äù means that even though there is no difference in meaning, a connection is made as if there were difference.

original: don de dngos po'i rang gi mtshan nyid la tha dad pa med kyang tha dad pa lta bur gags byed pa med par rab tu ston par byed do //
analyzed: don de dngos po'i rang gi mtshan nyid la tha dad pa med kyang tha dad pa lta bur gags byed pa med par rab tu ston par byed do //
translated: Although the meaning is not different from the intrinsic identity of the thing, it is taught without obstruction as if it were different.

original: gang gi phyir de lta yin pa rgyu de'i phyir ro //üîΩba lang zhes bya ba chos can rjod par byed pa bstan to //
analyzed: gang gi phyir de lta yin pa rgyu de'i phyir ro // ba lang zhes bya ba chos can rjod par byed pa bstan to //
translated: Because it is so, for that reason.üîΩThe word ‚Äúcow‚Äù is the expression that indicates the subject.

original: ba lang nyid ces bya ba ni chos rjod par byed pa bstan te /
analyzed: ba lang nyid ces bya ba ni chos rjod par byed pa bstan te /
translated: The word ‚Äúcowness‚Äù is the expression that indicates the property.

original: 'di gnyis kyi don gcig brjod mod kyi /
analyzed: 'di gnyis kyi don gcig brjod mod kyi /
translated: Although these two express the same meaning,

original: khyad par 'ga' zhig shes par bya ba'i phyir zhes bya ba ba lang ma yin pa las ldog pa'i mtshan nyid ba lang nyid rab tu bstan pa'i phyir ba lang nyid kyi sgras ba lang nyid ma yin pa las ldog pa tsam bstan par bya ba yin no
analyzed: khyad par 'ga' zhig shes par bya ba'i phyir zhes bya ba ba lang ma yin pa las ldog pa'i mtshan nyid ba lang nyid rab tu bstan pa'i phyir ba lang nyid kyi sgras ba lang nyid ma yin pa las ldog pa tsam bstan par bya ba yin no
translated: in order to make known a certain distinction, the word ‚Äúcowness‚Äù is used to teach the definition of a cow as the exclusion of non-cow.

original: zhes de ltar brdas khyad par du byas na /
analyzed: zhes de ltar brdas khyad par du byas na /
translated: Thus, having distinguished it by convention,

original: don gzhan ma yin @73a * //
analyzed: don gzhan ma yin @73a * //
translated: it is not a different object.

original: yang zhes bya ba chos tha dad pa ma yin yang tha dad pa'i don can gyi rnam par dbye bas /
analyzed: yang zhes bya ba chos tha dad pa ma yin yang tha dad pa'i don can gyi rnam par dbye bas /
translated: The word ‚Äúalso‚Äù means that although the entities are not different, they are differentiated by the differentiation of their meanings.

original: 'di'i ba lang nyid ces bya ba'i drug pas te /üîΩgang la don tha dad pa yod pa zhes tshig rnam par sbyar ro //
analyzed: 'di'i ba lang nyid ces bya ba'i drug pas te / gang la don tha dad pa yod pa zhes tshig rnam par sbyar ro //
translated: The genitive case in the phrase ‚Äúthe cowness of that‚Äù isüîΩa genitive of relation.

original: chos can las chos don tha dad pa lta bur ston par snang ngo //
analyzed: chos can las chos don tha dad pa lta bur ston par snang ngo //
translated: It appears as if the property is different from the basis of the property.

original: ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: de ltar sbyor ba mthong ba la goms pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: de ltar sbyor ba mthong ba la goms pa'i phyir te /
translated: Because one is accustomed to seeing the application of the genitive case in that way.

original: lha sbyin gyis ril ba spyi blugs zhes bya ba la sogs pa dngos po tha dad pa la drug pa sbyor ba mthong ba la goms pa'i phyir ro //üîΩ'di skad du dngos po tha dad yin yang rung /
analyzed: lha sbyin gyis ril ba spyi blugs zhes bya ba la sogs pa dngos po tha dad pa la drug pa sbyor ba mthong ba la goms pa'i phyir ro // 'di skad du dngos po tha dad yin yang rung /
translated: One is accustomed to seeing the application of the genitive case in such expressions as ‚Äúthe water jar of Devadatta,‚Äù where the entities are different.

original: 'on te ma yin yang rung ste /
analyzed: 'on te ma yin yang rung ste /
translated: In this way, whether the entities are different or not,üîΩthe genitive case is applied.

original: yang tha dad par 'byed pa'i rnam par dbye ba'i 'dod pa tsam gyi dor byed pas ni sbyor ba mthong ba goms pa las sgra'i don tha dad pa lta bur ston par byed pa 'ba' zhig tu zad do zhes bshad pa yin no //
analyzed: yang tha dad par 'byed pa'i rnam par dbye ba'i 'dod pa tsam gyi dor byed pas ni sbyor ba mthong ba goms pa las sgra'i don tha dad pa lta bur ston par byed pa 'ba' zhig tu zad do zhes bshad pa yin no //
translated: Moreover, it is explained that the mere desire to distinguish by a distinction is only a display of the meaning of the word as if it were different from the application that is seen in practice.

original: de tsam gyis zhes bya ba ni rnam par dbye ba'i sbyor ba cam gyis so //
analyzed: de tsam gyis zhes bya ba ni rnam par dbye ba'i sbyor ba cam gyis so //
translated: By that alone means by the mere application of distinction.

original: thams cad la zhes bya ba ni don tha mi dad pa la yang ngo //
analyzed: thams cad la zhes bya ba ni don tha mi dad pa la yang ngo //
translated: In all cases means even in the case of non-different meanings.

original: ba lang gi ba lang nyid ces bya ba la sogs pa la don dam par chos dang chos can dag tha dad par yang med de /
analyzed: ba lang gi ba lang nyid ces bya ba la sogs pa la don dam par chos dang chos can dag tha dad par yang med de /
translated: In the case of cow and cowness, etc., ultimately the property and the possessor of the property are not different.

original: 'di ltar don tha mi dad pa gzhan la yang skyes bu'i 'dod pa'i dbang gis tha dad par rjod par byed pa'i sgra 'jug pa la gags byed pa med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'di ltar don tha mi dad pa gzhan la yang skyes bu'i 'dod pa'i dbang gis tha dad par rjod par byed pa'i sgra 'jug pa la gags byed pa med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Thus, in the case of other non-different meanings, there is no obstruction to the application of words that express them as different by the power of the person's desire.

original: phyi rol gyis brjod par bya ba de lta bur med bzhin du yang skyes bu'i 'dod pa'i dbang gis sgra rnams 'jug pa la yang mthong bas /
analyzed: phyi rol gyis brjod par bya ba de lta bur med bzhin du yang skyes bu'i 'dod pa'i dbang gis sgra rnams 'jug pa la yang mthong bas /
translated: Although external objects are not as they are expressed, one sees that sounds are used by the power of the desire of persons.

original: dper na zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: dper na zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: For example, etc.

original: dngos po gcig la skabs 'ga' zhig tu gcig gi tshig ston te /
analyzed: dngos po gcig la skabs 'ga' zhig tu gcig gi tshig ston te /
translated: In one thing, in some contexts, the word ‚Äúone‚Äù is used.

original: dper na khyod ces bya ba lta bu'o //
analyzed: dper na khyod ces bya ba lta bu'o //
translated: For example, ‚Äúyou.‚Äù

original: der khyad par med kyang gcig pa nyid du khyad par med kyang dngos po de nyid la mang po'i tshig gis ston te /
analyzed: der khyad par med kyang gcig pa nyid du khyad par med kyang dngos po de nyid la mang po'i tshig gis ston te /
translated: There, although there is no difference, in that very thing, the word ‚Äúmany‚Äù is used, although there is no difference in one.

original: dper na khyed ces lta bu'o //
analyzed: dper na khyed ces lta bu'o //
translated: For example, ‚Äúyou all.‚Äù

original: de bas ni gcig la yang mang po'i tshig mthong ba'i phyir sgra rnams 'jug pa nyid don ji lta ba bzhin ma yin no zhes bya bar shes so //
analyzed: de bas ni gcig la yang mang po'i tshig mthong ba'i phyir sgra rnams 'jug pa nyid don ji lta ba bzhin ma yin no zhes bya bar shes so //
translated: Therefore, because one also sees the word ‚Äúmany‚Äù used for one, one should understand that the use of sounds is not according to the meaning.

original: kha cig ltar na bla ma khyed la zhes bsgre ba'i tshig las gcig la yang mang po'i tshig sbyar ro zhe na /
analyzed: kha cig ltar na bla ma khyed la zhes bsgre ba'i tshig las gcig la yang mang po'i tshig sbyar ro zhe na /
translated: According to some, the word ‚Äúmany‚Äù is used for one in the expression ‚Äúyou all, my teachers.‚Äù

original: 'di ni bsam par bya ba yin te /
analyzed: 'di ni bsam par bya ba yin te /
translated: This should be considered.

original: ci bsgre bas gcig la mang po nyid du byed dam 'on te ci'i mang po'i tshig tsam ma thob pa thob par byed /
analyzed: ci bsgre bas gcig la mang po nyid du byed dam 'on te ci'i mang po'i tshig tsam ma thob pa thob par byed /
translated: Is it that many are made from one by adding something, or is it that many are made from one by adding nothing?

original: re zhig phyogs dang po ni ma yin te /
analyzed: re zhig phyogs dang po ni ma yin te /
translated: The first possibility is not so,

original: tshig tsam @73b gyis dngos po rnams byed pa mi srid pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: tshig tsam @73b gyis dngos po rnams byed pa mi srid pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it is not possible for things to be made by mere words.

original: phyogs gnyis pa ltar na yang 'dod pa tsam gyis sgra rnams 'jug go zhes bya ba grub pa kho na yin te /
analyzed: phyogs gnyis pa ltar na yang 'dod pa tsam gyis sgra rnams 'jug go zhes bya ba grub pa kho na yin te /
translated: If it is the second possibility, then it is established that words are used by mere desire,

original: re zhig de ltar na tha dad par byed pa'i rnam par dbye ba med pa'i nyes pa yongs su spangs ba yin no //
analyzed: re zhig de ltar na tha dad par byed pa'i rnam par dbye ba med pa'i nyes pa yongs su spangs ba yin no //
translated: and thus the fault of the absence of a distinction that makes different is completely avoided.

original: brda'i bye brag med pa'i nyes pa yongs su spangs pa'i phyir de nyid nye bar 'god par dgos pa med pa'i phyir zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: brda'i bye brag med pa'i nyes pa yongs su spangs pa'i phyir de nyid nye bar 'god par dgos pa med pa'i phyir zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: In order to completely avoid the fault of the absence of a distinction of convention, he says, ‚ÄúBecause there is no need to posit that which is already established,‚Äù and so on.

original: chos dang chos can gyi sgra dag gis gcig cig brjod pa'i phyir dgos pa med do zhe na dgos pa de yang yod pa kho na ste /
analyzed: chos dang chos can gyi sgra dag gis gcig cig brjod pa'i phyir dgos pa med do zhe na dgos pa de yang yod pa kho na ste /
translated: If one says that there is no need because the words ‚Äúproperty‚Äù and ‚Äúpossessor of the property‚Äù express the same thing, then that need does exist.

original: ba lang nyid la ltos nas rdzas nyid dang sa las gyur pa nyid la sogs pa ni khyad par gzhan no //
analyzed: ba lang nyid la ltos nas rdzas nyid dang sa las gyur pa nyid la sogs pa ni khyad par gzhan no //
translated: In relation to the cow, the substance, the earth, etc., are other specific properties.

original: de dag spong ba ni rang gir mi byed ba'o //
analyzed: de dag spong ba ni rang gir mi byed ba'o //
translated: The exclusion of these is the non-appropriation of these.

original: mi spong ba ni rang gir byed pa ste /
analyzed: mi spong ba ni rang gir byed pa ste /
translated: The non-exclusion is the appropriation of these.

original: spong ba dang mi spong ba de dag ni go rims bzhin du chos dang chos can rjod par byed pa'i sgra de gnyis kyi brda'i bye brag khyad par ji lta bu can zhig gi zhe na /
analyzed: spong ba dang mi spong ba de dag ni go rims bzhin du chos dang chos can rjod par byed pa'i sgra de gnyis kyi brda'i bye brag khyad par ji lta bu can zhig gi zhe na /
translated: The exclusion and the non-exclusion of these are, respectively, the two sounds that express the property and the property-possessor. What is the specific difference of the two signs?

original: rtog pa po'i 'dod pa'i rjes su byed pa rtog par byed pa'i 'dod pa'i rjes su byed pa gang yin pa de'i gzhi de rgyu yin no //
analyzed: rtog pa po'i 'dod pa'i rjes su byed pa rtog par byed pa'i 'dod pa'i rjes su byed pa gang yin pa de'i gzhi de rgyu yin no //
translated: The basis of that is the cause of that which is in accordance with the desire of the one who conceives, in accordance with the desire of the one who conceives.

original: 'di skad du ril po gcig la rta ma yin pa nyid dang / ma he ma yin pa nyid la sogs pa khyad par gzhan dag nges par yod mod kyi khyad par gzhan la mi ltos par rta rnam par gcod pa'i mtshan nyid rta ma yin pa nyid tsam ni rta ma yin pa nyid kyi sgra chos rjod par byed pa'iüîΩbrda'i bye brag gi rgyu yin la /
analyzed: 'di skad du ril po gcig la rta ma yin pa nyid dang / ma he ma yin pa nyid la sogs pa khyad par gzhan dag nges par yod mod kyi khyad par gzhan la mi ltos par rta rnam par gcod pa'i mtshan nyid rta ma yin pa nyid tsam ni rta ma yin pa nyid kyi sgra chos rjod par byed pa'i brda'i bye brag gi rgyu yin la /
translated: This is what is being said: ‚ÄúIn a single whole, there are certainly other differences, such as not being a horse and not being a buffalo, but the mere exclusion of a horse, which does not depend on other differences, is the cause of the specific convention that expresses the word ‚Äònon-horse‚Äô as the property-signifier.

original: rta ma yin pa de kho na khyad par gzhan yongs su ma spangs pa ni rta ma yin pa nyid kyi sgra chos can rjod par byed pa'i brda'i bye brag gi rgyu yin no zhes bshad pa yin no //
analyzed: rta ma yin pa de kho na khyad par gzhan yongs su ma spangs pa ni rta ma yin pa nyid kyi sgra chos can rjod par byed pa'i brda'i bye brag gi rgyu yin no zhes bshad pa yin no //
translated: That very non-horse, without completely abandoning the other differences, is the cause of the specific convention that expresses the word ‚Äònon-horse‚Äô as the property-signifier.‚Äù

original: de nyid 'grel pas gsal par bya ba'i phyir gang gi tshe zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: de nyid 'grel pas gsal par bya ba'i phyir gang gi tshe zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: In order to clarify that very point, he says ‚Äúwhen,‚Äù and so on.

original: rtog par byed pa zhes bya ba ni nyan pa pa'o //
analyzed: rtog par byed pa zhes bya ba ni nyan pa pa'o //
translated: ‚ÄúThe one who conceives‚Äù is the listener.

original: rta de las gzhan pa ma he la sogs pa gang yin pa de las rnam par gcad pa ni ma he ma yin pa nyid la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: rta de las gzhan pa ma he la sogs pa gang yin pa de las rnam par gcad pa ni ma he ma yin pa nyid la sogs pa'o //
translated: The exclusion of that cow from other things, such as buffaloes, is the non-buffalo, etc.

original: de yod pa la mi ltos par te yod pa la ltos pa med par ro //
analyzed: de yod pa la mi ltos par te yod pa la ltos pa med par ro //
translated: That is, it is not dependent on the existence of the cow.

original: gong bu'i khyad par la zhes bya ba'i ba lang la ste /
analyzed: gong bu'i khyad par la zhes bya ba'i ba lang la ste /
translated: The particular shape of the aggregate is in the cow.

original: ci 'di la rta ma yin pa nyid dam zhes rta rnam par gcad pa tsam shes par 'dod pa na'o //üîΩde lta bur shes par bya ba'i phyir zhes bya ba ni rtog par byed pa po di ltar shes par 'dod par de'i dor rta las @74a * //
analyzed: ci 'di la rta ma yin pa nyid dam zhes rta rnam par gcad pa tsam shes par 'dod pa na'o // de lta bur shes par bya ba'i phyir zhes bya ba ni rtog par byed pa po di ltar shes par 'dod par de'i dor rta las @74a * //
translated: If one wishes to know the mere exclusion of horse in the cow, ‚ÄúIs this not a horse?‚ÄùüîΩIn order to know that, that is, in order for the one who is conceiving to know it in that way,

original: tha dad pa tsam de lta bu shes par bya ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: tha dad pa tsam de lta bu shes par bya ba'i phyir ro //
translated: in order to know that mere difference from horse, which is the referent of the word cow.

original: de ltar brdar byas pa'i sgras zhes bya ba ni rta rnam par gcad pa tsam khyad par gzhan spangs pa la brdar byas pa'i rta ma yin pa nyid kyi sgras gong bu 'di la rta ma yin pa nyid yod do zhes rab tu shes par byed cing rab
analyzed: de ltar brdar byas pa'i sgras zhes bya ba ni rta rnam par gcad pa tsam khyad par gzhan spangs pa la brdar byas pa'i rta ma yin pa nyid kyi sgras gong bu 'di la rta ma yin pa nyid yod do zhes rab tu shes par byed cing rab
translated: The words ‚Äúin that way‚Äù refer to the mere exclusion of horse, which is devoid of other features. The words ‚Äúnon-horse‚Äù indicate that this entity has non-horse.

original: tu ston par byed do //
analyzed: tu ston par byed do //
translated: The words ‚Äúit is understood‚Äù mean that it is known and taught.

original: rta las rnam par gcad pa rta ma yin pa nyid kyang yin pa de la ltos nas ma he la sogs pa ldog pa na rnam par gcad pa gzhan no //
analyzed: rta las rnam par gcad pa rta ma yin pa nyid kyang yin pa de la ltos nas ma he la sogs pa ldog pa na rnam par gcad pa gzhan no //
translated: The non-horse, which is the exclusion of horse, is also dependent on that. When buffalo and so on are excluded, it is a different exclusion.

original: de dag mi 'dod pa med par zhes bya ba ni ltos pa dang bcas par te /
analyzed: de dag mi 'dod pa med par zhes bya ba ni ltos pa dang bcas par te /
translated: The words ‚Äúwithout the desire to deny them‚Äù mean that they are dependent.

original: rtog par byed pa'o //
analyzed: rtog par byed pa'o //
translated: The words ‚Äúit is imagined‚Äù mean that it is conceived.

original: de zhes bya ba ni ba lang gi ril po ste /
analyzed: de zhes bya ba ni ba lang gi ril po ste /
translated: The words ‚Äúthat‚Äù refer to the whole of the cow.

original: rta rnam par gcad pa khyad par gzhan ma spangs ba dang ldan pa'i ba lang gi rdzas shes par 'dod pa zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: rta rnam par gcad pa khyad par gzhan ma spangs ba dang ldan pa'i ba lang gi rdzas shes par 'dod pa zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: The words ‚Äúthe substance of the cow, which is the exclusion of horse, which is devoid of other features‚Äù mean that it is the substance of the cow that is desired to be known.

original: de ltar rab tu bstan pa'i phyir rnam par gcad pa gzhan yongs su ma spangs pa la 'di ni rta ma yin pa yin no zhes sgra rab tu sbyar ro zhes bya ba ni gang gis ma he la sogs pa rnam par gcad pa gzhan dag yongs suüîΩma spangs pa'i khyad par gzhan dag yongs su ma spangs pa de la ste /
analyzed: de ltar rab tu bstan pa'i phyir rnam par gcad pa gzhan yongs su ma spangs pa la 'di ni rta ma yin pa yin no zhes sgra rab tu sbyar ro zhes bya ba ni gang gis ma he la sogs pa rnam par gcad pa gzhan dag yongs su ma spangs pa'i khyad par gzhan dag yongs su ma spangs pa de la ste /
translated: In order to demonstrate that, the term ‚Äúnon-horse‚Äù is applied to that which does not exclude another exclusion.

original: rta rnam par gcad pa de nyid la smra ba pos 'di ni rta ma yin pa yin no zhes chos can rjod par byed pa'i sgra rab tu sbyor ro //
analyzed: rta rnam par gcad pa de nyid la smra ba pos 'di ni rta ma yin pa yin no zhes chos can rjod par byed pa'i sgra rab tu sbyor ro //
translated: That is, the term ‚Äúnon-horse‚Äù is applied by the speaker to the subject in order to indicate that very exclusion of horse, which does not exclude other exclusions such as buffalo, etc.

original: ci'i phyir rab tu sbyong bar byed ce na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir rab tu sbyong bar byed ce na /
translated: Why is it applied?

original: de ltar rab tu bstan pa'i phyir zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: de ltar rab tu bstan pa'i phyir zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: In order to demonstrate that, he says, ‚Äúin order to demonstrate that.‚Äù

original: rta rnam par gcad pa khyad par gzhan ma spangs pa rab tu bstan pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rta rnam par gcad pa khyad par gzhan ma spangs pa rab tu bstan pa'i phyir ro //
translated: In order to demonstrate that the exclusion of horse does not exclude other exclusions.

original: gzhan dag ni de ltar rab tu bstan pa'i phyir rta rnam par gcad pa khyad par gzhan ma spangs pa de nyid rab tu sbyar ro zhes 'don to //
analyzed: gzhan dag ni de ltar rab tu bstan pa'i phyir rta rnam par gcad pa khyad par gzhan ma spangs pa de nyid rab tu sbyar ro zhes 'don to //
translated: Others, in order to demonstrate this, quote the following passage: ‚ÄúThe very exclusion of horse is applied without the exclusion of another attribute.‚Äù

original: de'i tshe yang don ni 'di yin te /
analyzed: de'i tshe yang don ni 'di yin te /
translated: But even then, the meaning is this:

original: 'di ni rta ma yin pa yin no zhes bya ba chos can brjod pa'i sgra 'dis rta rnam par gcad pa khyad par gzhan ma spangs pa de nyid rab tu sbyor ro //
analyzed: 'di ni rta ma yin pa yin no zhes bya ba chos can brjod pa'i sgra 'dis rta rnam par gcad pa khyad par gzhan ma spangs pa de nyid rab tu sbyor ro //
translated: The word that expresses the subject, ‚ÄúThis is not a horse,‚Äù applies the very exclusion of horse without the exclusion of another attribute.

original: gang gi phyir zhe na /
analyzed: gang gi phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is this?

original: de ltar rab tu bstan pa'i phyir te khyad par gzhan ma spangs pa rab tu bstan pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de ltar rab tu bstan pa'i phyir te khyad par gzhan ma spangs pa rab tu bstan pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it is demonstrated in this way, because another attribute is not excluded.

original: gang gi phyir chos rjod par byed pa'i sgra khyad par gzhan spangs pa yin pa de nyid kyi phyir snga ma las zhes bya ba ni chos brjod pa'i sgra la'o //
analyzed: gang gi phyir chos rjod par byed pa'i sgra khyad par gzhan spangs pa yin pa de nyid kyi phyir snga ma las zhes bya ba ni chos brjod pa'i sgra la'o //
translated: Because the word that expresses the attribute excludes another attribute, therefore, as was said previously, with regard to the word that expresses the attribute,

original: sgra rgyu mtshan tha dad pa can dag gzhan gcig la 'jug pa ni gzhi mthun pa nyid do //
analyzed: sgra rgyu mtshan tha dad pa can dag gzhan gcig la 'jug pa ni gzhi mthun pa nyid do //
translated: the different signifieds of the word are the common locus of the different signifieds of the word.

original: rnam par gcad par bya ba dang / rnam par gcod par byed pa'i ngo bo ni /
analyzed: rnam par gcad par bya ba dang / rnam par gcod par byed pa'i ngo bo ni /
translated: The nature of the object of exclusion and the means of exclusion

original: khyad par dang khyad par gyi gzhi'i dngos @74b po'o //
analyzed: khyad par dang khyad par gyi gzhi'i dngos @74b po'o //
translated: is the qualifier and the qualified.

original: dper brjod pa 'di'i ba lang nyid dkar po'o zhes bya ba lta bu'o zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: dper brjod pa 'di'i ba lang nyid dkar po'o zhes bya ba lta bu'o zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: The example is like ‚Äúthe cowness of the white cow.‚Äù

original: de ltar na chos tsam la 'jug pa 'di dag dang gzhi mthun pa nyid kyang ma yin la khyad par dang khyad par gyi gzhi'i dngos po yang ma yin no //
analyzed: de ltar na chos tsam la 'jug pa 'di dag dang gzhi mthun pa nyid kyang ma yin la khyad par dang khyad par gyi gzhi'i dngos po yang ma yin no //
translated: Thus, these that engage mere phenomena are not even a common locus, nor are they the entity of the qualifier and the qualified.

original: ci'i phyir gzhi mthun pa nyid ma yin zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir gzhi mthun pa nyid ma yin zhe na /
translated: Why are they not a common locus?

original: de tsam gyi zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos so //
analyzed: de tsam gyi zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos so //
translated: He says ‚Äúmerely that‚Äù and so on.

original: 'di skad du bstan pa yin te /
analyzed: 'di skad du bstan pa yin te /
translated: This is what is being taught.

original: blo la snang ba'i don kho na la gzhi mthun pa nyid la sogs pa yod kyi /üîΩphyi rol gyi rang gi mtshan nyid la ni ma yin te /
analyzed: blo la snang ba'i don kho na la gzhi mthun pa nyid la sogs pa yod kyi / phyi rol gyi rang gi mtshan nyid la ni ma yin te /
translated: A common locus and so on exist only for objects that appear to the mind.

original: de ni brjod par bya ba ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de ni brjod par bya ba ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: They do not exist for external particularities because those are inexpressible.

original: gal te chos gnyis dang ldan pa'i chos can gcig snang ba sgra gnyis kyis bskyed pa'i blo gcig skye na ni gzhi mthun pa nyid du 'gyur ba zhig na /
analyzed: gal te chos gnyis dang ldan pa'i chos can gcig snang ba sgra gnyis kyis bskyed pa'i blo gcig skye na ni gzhi mthun pa nyid du 'gyur ba zhig na /
translated: If a single mind that perceives a single subject that possesses two attributes were produced by two terms, then there would be a common locus.

original: 'di la ni de tsam gyi khyad par gyis khyad par gzhan spangs pa /
analyzed: 'di la ni de tsam gyi khyad par gyis khyad par gzhan spangs pa /
translated: But in this case, the mind that is established by the mere difference of the attribute of cowness, which is a difference from other attributes,

original: ba lang nyid tsam gyi khyad par gyis nye bar bsgrub pa'i blos ba lang nyid ces bya ba'i sgra de las byung ba de'i rten du gyur par zhes bya ba gzhi mthun pa nyid kyi rten du gyur par gcig pa nyid du mi snang ba'i phyir te blo
analyzed: ba lang nyid tsam gyi khyad par gyis nye bar bsgrub pa'i blos ba lang nyid ces bya ba'i sgra de las byung ba de'i rten du gyur par zhes bya ba gzhi mthun pa nyid kyi rten du gyur par gcig pa nyid du mi snang ba'i phyir te blo
translated: does not appear to be the same as the common locus of the term ‚Äúcowness,‚Äù which is the basis of the term ‚Äúcowness‚Äù that arises from that mind.

original: ba lang nyid dang dkar po nyid dag dang ldan pa'i chos can gcig 'dzin pa nyid du mi snang ba'i phyir ro zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: ba lang nyid dang dkar po nyid dag dang ldan pa'i chos can gcig 'dzin pa nyid du mi snang ba'i phyir ro zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: The mind does not appear to apprehend a single subject that possesses both cowness and whiteness.

original: 'di ltar 'di la ba lang nyid ces bya bar sbyor ba ni blo chos dkar po'i ngo bo shes par byed par skye ste /
analyzed: 'di ltar 'di la ba lang nyid ces bya bar sbyor ba ni blo chos dkar po'i ngo bo shes par byed par skye ste /
translated: The application of the term ‚Äúcowness‚Äù produces a mind that knows the nature of the attribute whiteness.

original: de'i phyir gzhi mthun pa nyid ma yin no //
analyzed: de'i phyir gzhi mthun pa nyid ma yin no //
translated: Therefore, there is no common locus.

original: chos gzhan spangs pa kho nas blo de las gzhan pa'i khyad par 'dod pa med pa'i phyir khyad par dang khyad par gyi gzhi'i dngos po yang ma yin no //
analyzed: chos gzhan spangs pa kho nas blo de las gzhan pa'i khyad par 'dod pa med pa'i phyir khyad par dang khyad par gyi gzhi'i dngos po yang ma yin no //
translated: And because it is not accepted that the cognition of the other property is a different type of cognition, there is no relation of qualifier and qualificand.

original: gnyis pa chos can brjod pa'i sgra'i phyogs la ni gzhi mthun pa nyid dang / khyad par dang khyad par gyi gzhi'i dngos po yod de ba lang dkar po'o zhes bya ba lta bu'o //
analyzed: gnyis pa chos can brjod pa'i sgra'i phyogs la ni gzhi mthun pa nyid dang / khyad par dang khyad par gyi gzhi'i dngos po yod de ba lang dkar po'o zhes bya ba lta bu'o //
translated: In the second case, where the word expresses the property-possessor, there is a common locus and the relation of qualifier and qualificand, as in the expression ‚Äúwhite cow.‚Äù

original: gzhi mthun pa nyid kyi gtan tshigs su de lta bu'i zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: gzhi mthun pa nyid kyi gtan tshigs su de lta bu'i zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: In response to the question, ‚ÄúWhy is there a common locus?‚Äù he says, ‚ÄúBecause of the convention of the word ‚Äòcow‚Äô,‚Äù and so on.

original: de lta bu'i brda'i rjes su 'brang ba'i phyir zhes bya ba ni rnam par gcad par khyad par gzhan ma spangs pa la chos kyi sgrar brdar gdags pa'i rjes su 'brang ba'i rgyus so //
analyzed: de lta bu'i brda'i rjes su 'brang ba'i phyir zhes bya ba ni rnam par gcad par khyad par gzhan ma spangs pa la chos kyi sgrar brdar gdags pa'i rjes su 'brang ba'i rgyus so //
translated: ‚ÄúBecause of the convention of the word ‚Äòcow‚Äô ‚Äù means that the word ‚Äúcow‚Äù is applied by convention to the exclusion of other, different types of exclusions.

original: rnam par gcad pa'i chos ni rnam par gcad pa'i bdag nyid kyi chos so //
analyzed: rnam par gcad pa'i chos ni rnam par gcad pa'i bdag nyid kyi chos so //
translated: The property of exclusion is the property of the nature of exclusion.

original: bsdus pa ni chos can gcig la sbyor ba ste /
analyzed: bsdus pa ni chos can gcig la sbyor ba ste /
translated: The abbreviated is the application to one subject.

original: de dag ni rnam par gcad pa'i chos mtha' dag kyang yin la bsdus pa yang yin pas zhes las 'dzin pa can du bya ste /üîΩchos rgyur gyur @75a * //
analyzed: de dag ni rnam par gcad pa'i chos mtha' dag kyang yin la bsdus pa yang yin pas zhes las 'dzin pa can du bya ste / chos rgyur gyur @75a * //
translated: They are the ultimate of the subjects that are eliminated and also the abbreviated, and so they are to be taken as having the suffix -tva.

original: pa de dag gis so //
analyzed: pa de dag gis so //
translated: By those subjects that are causes of the phenomena.

original: rnam par dbye ba dang ldan pa zhes bya ba ni chos du ma rnam par dbye ba dang ldan pa'i chos can no //
analyzed: rnam par dbye ba dang ldan pa zhes bya ba ni chos du ma rnam par dbye ba dang ldan pa'i chos can no //
translated: Having a division means that the subject has many phenomena that are divisions.

original: gcig pa lta bur ston cing rab tu ston par blo snang ba'i phyir te /
analyzed: gcig pa lta bur ston cing rab tu ston par blo snang ba'i phyir te /
translated: It is because the mind appears as if it were one and it is taught as if it were one.

original: blo chos can du ma dang ldan pa'i chos can gcig pa lta bur ston par snang ngo zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: blo chos can du ma dang ldan pa'i chos can gcig pa lta bur ston par snang ngo zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: It appears as if the mind were one subject that has many phenomena as its divisions.

original: blo la snang bas bstan pa'i chos can dngos su gcig pa ni ma yin te /
analyzed: blo la snang bas bstan pa'i chos can dngos su gcig pa ni ma yin te /
translated: The subject that is taught by the appearance to the mind is not actually one,

original: rnam par rtog pas sprul pa'i chos dang chos can rnam par dbye ba ni brdzun pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rnam par rtog pas sprul pa'i chos dang chos can rnam par dbye ba ni brdzun pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because the division of the phenomena and subjects that are emanated by the conception is false.

original: gzhan dag ni gcig kho nar zhes 'don te /
analyzed: gzhan dag ni gcig kho nar zhes 'don te /
translated: Others read ‚Äúonly one‚Äù instead of ‚Äúone or many.

original: der yang rtog par byed pa po'i bsam pa'i dbang gis de skad du bshad do zhes bya bar khong du chud par bya'o //
analyzed: der yang rtog par byed pa po'i bsam pa'i dbang gis de skad du bshad do zhes bya bar khong du chud par bya'o //
translated: And in that case, it should be understood that it is explained in that way due to the power of the thought of the one who conceives it.

original: de'i phyir gzhi mthun pa nyid du grub pa yin no //
analyzed: de'i phyir gzhi mthun pa nyid du grub pa yin no //
translated: Therefore, it is established that there is a common locus.

original: gang gi phyir chos can gyi sgra khyad par gzhan ma spangs par 'jug pa de'i phyir blo khyad par gzhan par gzhan ma spangs pa la ltos pa'i phyir khyad par dang khyad par gzhi'i dngos por yang 'gyur te /
analyzed: gang gi phyir chos can gyi sgra khyad par gzhan ma spangs par 'jug pa de'i phyir blo khyad par gzhan par gzhan ma spangs pa la ltos pa'i phyir khyad par dang khyad par gzhi'i dngos por yang 'gyur te /
translated: Because the term ‚Äúsubject‚Äù is used without excluding other attributes, the cognition must rely on that which is not excluded by other attributes. Therefore, it becomes the basis of the attribute and the bearer of the attribute.

original: ci ba lang dkar ram sngo zhes bya ba lta bu'o //
analyzed: ci ba lang dkar ram sngo zhes bya ba lta bu'o //
translated: For example, ‚ÄúIs the cow white or is it black?‚Äù

original: kun la zhes bya ba ni spyi dang spyi dang ldan pa dang yon tan dang yon tan dang ldan pa dang / bya ba dang bya ba dang ldan pa'i yul thams cad la'o //üîΩrdzas brjod pa ni chos can brjod pa'o //
analyzed: kun la zhes bya ba ni spyi dang spyi dang ldan pa dang yon tan dang yon tan dang ldan pa dang / bya ba dang bya ba dang ldan pa'i yul thams cad la'o // rdzas brjod pa ni chos can brjod pa'o //
translated: ‚ÄúIn all cases‚Äù means in all cases of universals and the bearers of universals, qualities and the bearers of qualities, actions and the bearers of actions.üîΩThe expression ‚Äúsubstance‚Äù is the expression of the subject.

original: dngos po brjod pa ni chos brjod pa ste /
analyzed: dngos po brjod pa ni chos brjod pa ste /
translated: The expression ‚Äúentity‚Äù is the expression of the attribute.

original: rdzas dngos po brjod pa'i sgra dag gi khyad par ni chos gzhan spong ba dang mi spong ba'i mtshan nyid 'di nyid yin no //
analyzed: rdzas dngos po brjod pa'i sgra dag gi khyad par ni chos gzhan spong ba dang mi spong ba'i mtshan nyid 'di nyid yin no //
translated: The difference between the words that express substantial entities is precisely the character of the exclusion of other phenomena and the non-exclusion of other phenomena.

original: gang gi phyir de lta yin pa'i rgyu de'i phyir don dam par rdzas dang dngos po'i sgra de dag gis brjod pa la khyad par 'ga' yang yod ma yin te de nyid de lta bas na zhes bya ba la sogs pas ston te ;
analyzed: gang gi phyir de lta yin pa'i rgyu de'i phyir don dam par rdzas dang dngos po'i sgra de dag gis brjod pa la khyad par 'ga' yang yod ma yin te de nyid de lta bas na zhes bya ba la sogs pas ston te ;
translated: Because that is so, therefore, ultimately, there is not the slightest difference in the expression of the words substantial entity and entity.

original: / nges pa'i shes pa'i yul gyi rgyu nyid du khyad par 'ga' yang med de 'di ltar ji ltar ba lang nyid ces brjod na /
analyzed: / nges pa'i shes pa'i yul gyi rgyu nyid du khyad par 'ga' yang med de 'di ltar ji ltar ba lang nyid ces brjod na /
translated: There is not the slightest difference in the cause of the object of a determinate consciousness.

original: ba lang ma yin pa rnam par gcad pa de kho nar nges par 'gyur ba ltar ba lang zhes brjod na yang de dang 'dra'o //
analyzed: ba lang ma yin pa rnam par gcad pa de kho nar nges par 'gyur ba ltar ba lang zhes brjod na yang de dang 'dra'o //
translated: Just as when one says ‚Äúcowhood,‚Äù it is determined precisely as the exclusion of non-cow; in the same way, when one says ‚Äúcow,‚Äù it is also like that.

original: ba lang ma yin par rnam par gcad pa khyad par gzhan ma spangs pa brjod mod kyi /
analyzed: ba lang ma yin par rnam par gcad pa khyad par gzhan ma spangs pa brjod mod kyi /
translated: Although the exclusion of non-cow is expressed as the exclusion of another difference,

original: 'on kyang ba lang ma yin pa rnam par gcad pa tsam du nges par 'gyur gyi /
analyzed: 'on kyang ba lang ma yin pa rnam par gcad pa tsam du nges par 'gyur gyi /
translated: nevertheless, it is determined as the mere exclusion of non-cow.

original: khyad par gzhan rnams kyi mi spong ba tsam du zad do //
analyzed: khyad par gzhan rnams kyi mi spong ba tsam du zad do //
translated: The other differences are merely the exclusion of other things.

original: sgra las gang du nges par 'gyur ba de nyid sgra'i don yang yin pas /
analyzed: sgra las gang du nges par 'gyur ba de nyid sgra'i don yang yin pas /
translated: Since the meaning of a word is just that which is ascertained by the word,

original: dngos po dang rdzas brjod pa'i sgra dag gis brjod @75b bar bya ba la ni khyad par med kyi khyad par gzhan spong ba tsam zhing tha dad par zad do //
analyzed: dngos po dang rdzas brjod pa'i sgra dag gis brjod @75b bar bya ba la ni khyad par med kyi khyad par gzhan spong ba tsam zhing tha dad par zad do //
translated: there is no difference in the referent of words that express things and substances. They are different only in the exclusion of other differences.

original: de nyid gcig gis ni zhes bya ba la sogs pa ston te /
analyzed: de nyid gcig gis ni zhes bya ba la sogs pa ston te /
translated: This is shown by ‚ÄúBy one, etc.‚Äù

original: gcig gis zhes bya ba ni chos can zhes bya ba'i sgras so //
analyzed: gcig gis zhes bya ba ni chos can zhes bya ba'i sgras so //
translated: ‚ÄúBy one‚Äù is by the word ‚Äúsubject.‚Äù

original: de nyid ces bya ba ni ba lang ma yin pa rnam par gcad pa'o //
analyzed: de nyid ces bya ba ni ba lang ma yin pa rnam par gcad pa'o //
translated: ‚ÄúThat‚Äù is the exclusion of non-ox.

original: chos zhes bya ba'i sgra gang gis khyad par gzhan spang ba de la de skad ces bya'o //
analyzed: chos zhes bya ba'i sgra gang gis khyad par gzhan spang ba de la de skad ces bya'o //
translated: The word ‚Äúproperty‚Äù is so called because it excludes other differences.

original: gzhan gyis zhes bya ba ni chos can gyi sgras so //
analyzed: gzhan gyis zhes bya ba ni chos can gyi sgras so //
translated: ‚ÄúBy another‚Äù is by the word ‚Äúsubject.‚Äù

original: gang gi phyir thams cad du khyad par gzhan spong ba dang mi spong ba tsam gyis byas ba'i khyad par gyi bag tsam gyis chos dang chos can du rnam par gzhag gi dngos po tha dad pa'i sgo nas ni ma yin pa de'i phyir khyad par gzhan spong
analyzed: gang gi phyir thams cad du khyad par gzhan spong ba dang mi spong ba tsam gyis byas ba'i khyad par gyi bag tsam gyis chos dang chos can du rnam par gzhag gi dngos po tha dad pa'i sgo nas ni ma yin pa de'i phyir khyad par gzhan spong
translated: Because in every case, phenomena and subjects are posited as such merely through the difference of whether or not other attributes are eliminated, and not through the difference of their entities, therefore, in order to make known the meaning of the definition of the difference of whether or not other attributes are eliminated, one who wishes to make known the object to be known,

original: ba dang mi spong ba'i mtshan nyid kyi don de shes par byed 'dod pas shes par bya bar 'dod pas de la phan pa'i rkyen gyis mtha' can nam byed pa dang ldan pa byed pa dang ldan pa zhes bya ba'i rkyen gyis mtha' can nam gal te byed
analyzed: ba dang mi spong ba'i mtshan nyid kyi don de shes par byed 'dod pas shes par bya bar 'dod pas de la phan pa'i rkyen gyis mtha' can nam byed pa dang ldan pa byed pa dang ldan pa zhes bya ba'i rkyen gyis mtha' can nam gal te byed
translated: through the condition of the suffix -ar, or through the condition of the suffix -in, which has the meaning of having an agent, one should say ‚Äúhaving an agent‚Äù or ‚Äúhaving an action.‚Äù

original: pa dang ldan pa dang / de la phan pa la ma gtogs pa gzhan yin byed kyi mtha' can nam sgra bye brag tu bshad du med pa gzhan dkar po zhes bya la sogs pas brjod kyang rung ste khyad par gzhan spong pa dang / mi spong ba'i mtshan nyid kyi khyad par de las khyad par gzhan med do //
analyzed: pa dang ldan pa dang / de la phan pa la ma gtogs pa gzhan yin byed kyi mtha' can nam sgra bye brag tu bshad du med pa gzhan dkar po zhes bya la sogs pas brjod kyang rung ste khyad par gzhan spong pa dang / mi spong ba'i mtshan nyid kyi khyad par de las khyad par gzhan med do //
translated: And even though it is expressed by another word, such as ‚Äúwhite,‚Äù which does not end in a verbal affix or has no special pronunciation, it is still characterized by the exclusion of another, and there is no other exclusion apart from that.

original: de nyid khyad par de tsam de kho na zhes bya ba la sogs pa ston te /
analyzed: de nyid khyad par de tsam de kho na zhes bya ba la sogs pa ston te /
translated: That very thing is called ‚Äújust that much,‚Äù etc.

original: de tsam zhes bya ba ni khyad par gzhan spangs pa'i mtshan nyid do //
analyzed: de tsam zhes bya ba ni khyad par gzhan spangs pa'i mtshan nyid do //
translated: ‚ÄúJust that much‚Äù is the characteristic of the exclusion of another.

original: de lta bu shes par bya ba'i phyir zhes bya ba ni khyad par gzhan spangs pa shes par bya ba'i phyir ro //üîΩbyed pa dang ldan pas ston kyang rung zhes bya bar sbyar ro //
analyzed: de lta bu shes par bya ba'i phyir zhes bya ba ni khyad par gzhan spangs pa shes par bya ba'i phyir ro // byed pa dang ldan pas ston kyang rung zhes bya bar sbyar ro //
translated: ‚ÄúIn order to make that known‚Äù means in order to make known the exclusion of another.üîΩ‚ÄúEven though it is taught by one endowed with an affix‚Äù is to be supplied.

original: gang gi tshe 'tshed ces bya ba byed pa po la gnas pa'i bya ba rten 'dzugs pa las sogs pa gnas la /
analyzed: gang gi tshe 'tshed ces bya ba byed pa po la gnas pa'i bya ba rten 'dzugs pa las sogs pa gnas la /
translated: When it is said ‚Äúhe cooks,‚Äù the action, which is based on the agent, is based on the person.

original: de nyid la thogs byed kyi rkyen sbyor ba de'i che ni 'tshed pa zhes bya ba'i sgra gcad pa nyid kyi sgra dang gzhi mthun pa yin pas de gnyi ga yang 'tshed pa ma yin par gcad pa khyad par gzhan spangs pa ston par byed pa yin no
analyzed: de nyid la thogs byed kyi rkyen sbyor ba de'i che ni 'tshed pa zhes bya ba'i sgra gcad pa nyid kyi sgra dang gzhi mthun pa yin pas de gnyi ga yang 'tshed pa ma yin par gcad pa khyad par gzhan spangs pa ston par byed pa yin no
translated: The term ‚Äúcooking‚Äù is a common locus with the term ‚Äúcutting,‚Äù which is the condition that obstructs it. Therefore, both terms indicate cutting, which is devoid of any other attribute, and they do not indicate cooking.

original: // gang gi tshe 'tshed ces bya ba'i don las gnas par 'gyur ba yin pa de'i tshe ni 'tshed pa nyid dang 'tshed pa zhes bya ba'i sgra dag don tha dad pa yin no //üîΩrang gis byas pa'i gzhung lugs byed pa dang ldan pa dang de la phan pa lam gtogs pa gzhan yin byed kyi mtha' @76a * //
analyzed: // gang gi tshe 'tshed ces bya ba'i don las gnas par 'gyur ba yin pa de'i tshe ni 'tshed pa nyid dang 'tshed pa zhes bya ba'i sgra dag don tha dad pa yin no // rang gis byas pa'i gzhung lugs byed pa dang ldan pa dang de la phan pa lam gtogs pa gzhan yin byed kyi mtha' @76a * //
translated: When the term ‚Äúcooking‚Äù is derived from the meaning of ‚Äúcooking,‚Äù then the term ‚Äúcooking‚Äù and ‚Äúcooking‚Äù have different meanings.

original: can la sogs pas ston kyang rung zhes bya bar sbyar te /
analyzed: can la sogs pas ston kyang rung zhes bya bar sbyar te /
translated: Even though the term ‚Äúcooking‚Äù is used to indicate the state of being a cook, which is the activity of one who possesses the activity of creating one‚Äôs own scriptural system, and the state of being a cook, which is the activity of one who possesses the activity of benefiting others, and so on,üîΩthe term ‚Äúcooking‚Äù is used to indicate the state of being a cook, which is the activity of one who possesses the activity of creating one‚Äôs own scriptural system, and the state of being a cook, which is the activity of one who possesses the activity of benefiting others, and so on.

original: dper na lha sbyin gyis nyal zhes bya ba dang / ras yug gi dkar po zhes bya ba 'di la yang nyal pa po zhes bya ba'i sgra'i don gang yin pa de nyid nyal ba zhes bya ba khyad par gzhan spangs pa'i don yang yin la de bzhin du ras /üîΩyug dkar po zhes bya ba'i don dkar po ma yin pa rnam par bcad pa khyad par gzhan ma spangs pa gang yin pa de nyid ras yug gi dkar po zhes bya ba khyad par gzhan spangs pa'i don yang yin pa lta bu'o //
analyzed: dper na lha sbyin gyis nyal zhes bya ba dang / ras yug gi dkar po zhes bya ba 'di la yang nyal pa po zhes bya ba'i sgra'i don gang yin pa de nyid nyal ba zhes bya ba khyad par gzhan spangs pa'i don yang yin la de bzhin du ras / yug dkar po zhes bya ba'i don dkar po ma yin pa rnam par bcad pa khyad par gzhan ma spangs pa gang yin pa de nyid ras yug gi dkar po zhes bya ba khyad par gzhan spangs pa'i don yang yin pa lta bu'o //
translated: For example, in ‚ÄúLhajin slept‚Äù and ‚Äúthe white cloth,‚Äù the meaning of the word ‚Äúthe one who slept‚Äù is the very same as the meaning of ‚Äúsleeping,‚Äù which is the exclusion of other attributes.üîΩAnd in the same way, the meaning of ‚Äúwhite cloth,‚Äù which is the exclusion of non-white, is the very same as the meaning of ‚Äúthe white cloth,‚Äù which is the exclusion of other attributes.

original: de skad du brjod pa tsam gyis ni zhes bya ba ni chos can gcig la yod pa'i rnam par gcad pa khyad par gzhan spangs pa dang ma spangs pa brjod pa tsam gyis te /
analyzed: de skad du brjod pa tsam gyis ni zhes bya ba ni chos can gcig la yod pa'i rnam par gcad pa khyad par gzhan spangs pa dang ma spangs pa brjod pa tsam gyis te /
translated: Merely by saying that is not so is to say that the exclusion of other attributes that is and is not present in a single subject is merely a matter of expression.

original: dngos po gcig po de don dam par don gzhan pa nyid du chos dang chos can gyi ngo bor rnam par phye ba nyid du ni mi 'gyur zhes sbyar ro //
analyzed: dngos po gcig po de don dam par don gzhan pa nyid du chos dang chos can gyi ngo bor rnam par phye ba nyid du ni mi 'gyur zhes sbyar ro //
translated: That one thing is not divided into the nature of the property and the property possessor as a different object ultimately.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: de lta bu kho na la khyad par gzhan spangs pa dang ma spangs pa cig kho na shes par bya ba'i phyir chos dang chos can gyi sgra brdar byas pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de lta bu kho na la khyad par gzhan spangs pa dang ma spangs pa cig kho na shes par bya ba'i phyir chos dang chos can gyi sgra brdar byas pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because the terms property and property possessor are used to indicate just that, the exclusion and non-exclusion of other differences.

original: gzhan gyis 'tshed pa nyid ces bya ba ni 'grel pa la bya ba ma yin nam zhes bya ba la sogs pa smras te /üîΩ'brel pa la zhes bya ba ni 'tshed ba'i bya ba dang / 'tshed par byed pa'i byed pa po 'du ba'i mtshan nyid kyi 'brel pa yin te /
analyzed: gzhan gyis 'tshed pa nyid ces bya ba ni 'grel pa la bya ba ma yin nam zhes bya ba la sogs pa smras te / 'brel pa la zhes bya ba ni 'tshed ba'i bya ba dang / 'tshed par byed pa'i byed pa po 'du ba'i mtshan nyid kyi 'brel pa yin te /
translated: Isn't being cooked by another a commentary?üîΩIn relation to what? In relation to the action of cooking and the agent of cooking, which are related by the characteristic of inherence.

original: 'di ltar byed pa dang ldan pa'i mtha' can las ni dngos po'i rkyen 'brel pa rjod par byed par 'dod de /
analyzed: 'di ltar byed pa dang ldan pa'i mtha' can las ni dngos po'i rkyen 'brel pa rjod par byed par 'dod de /
translated: Because it is asserted that from the end of the statement of the agent, the condition of the entity is expressed in relation to the action.

original: ji skad du tshig bsdu ba dang byed pa dang ldan pa dang de la phan pa dag la ni 'brel pa brjod do zhes bshad pa de lta bu ste /
analyzed: ji skad du tshig bsdu ba dang byed pa dang ldan pa dang de la phan pa dag la ni 'brel pa brjod do zhes bshad pa de lta bu ste /
translated: As it is said, ‚ÄúThe relation is expressed in the case of the summary, the agent, the possessor, and that which is beneficial.‚Äù

original: 'tshed pa zhes bya pa'i sgra yang /
analyzed: 'tshed pa zhes bya pa'i sgra yang /
translated: The word ‚Äúcook‚Äù

original: byed pa dang ldan pa'i mtha' can yin no //
analyzed: byed pa dang ldan pa'i mtha' can yin no //
translated: has an agent as its referent.

original: 'tshed pa zhes bya ba'i bdag nyid kho na 'chad pa nyid ces bya ba'i sgras brjod pa ma yin no //
analyzed: 'tshed pa zhes bya ba'i bdag nyid kho na 'chad pa nyid ces bya ba'i sgras brjod pa ma yin no //
translated: The word ‚Äúcook‚Äù does not express the self of the one who cooks.

original: 'di skad du bya ba yang byed pa po la ma gtogs pa gzhan kho na yin zhing byed pa po yang gzhan yin la de gnyis kyi 'brel pa yang gzhan kho na yin no //
analyzed: 'di skad du bya ba yang byed pa po la ma gtogs pa gzhan kho na yin zhing byed pa po yang gzhan yin la de gnyis kyi 'brel pa yang gzhan kho na yin no //
translated: It is said that the action is something other than the agent, the agent is something other than the action, and the relation between them is something other than both.

original: de'i phyir 'tshed ces bya bas byed pa po la gnas pa'i bya ba brjod du zin kyang 'tshed pa dang 'tshed pa nyid kyi sgra dag gis don 'dra ba ma yin no zhes bshad pa yin no /üîΩ// / bam po brgyad pa /
analyzed: de'i phyir 'tshed ces bya bas byed pa po la gnas pa'i bya ba brjod du zin kyang 'tshed pa dang 'tshed pa nyid kyi sgra dag gis don 'dra ba ma yin no zhes bshad pa yin no /üîΩ// / bam po brgyad pa /
translated: Therefore, even though the word ‚Äúcook‚Äù expresses the action that resides in the agent, the words ‚Äúcook‚Äù and ‚Äúcooking‚Äù do not have the same referent.

original: ji skad du zhes bya ba la sogs pas ni lan @76b 'debs pas te /
analyzed: ji skad du zhes bya ba la sogs pas ni lan @76b 'debs pas te /
translated: The response to that is stated by ‚ÄúWhat is it?‚Äù

original: 'tshed pa po zhes bya ba'i sgras ni bye brag pa rnams kyis ji skad du gang la bya ba dang byed pa po 'brel pa dngos por gyur pa yod pa byed pa po bya ba la ma gtogs pa rang dbang can yod do zhes brjod pa lta bur
analyzed: 'tshed pa po zhes bya ba'i sgras ni bye brag pa rnams kyis ji skad du gang la bya ba dang byed pa po 'brel pa dngos por gyur pa yod pa byed pa po bya ba la ma gtogs pa rang dbang can yod do zhes brjod pa lta bur
translated: The term ‚Äúcook‚Äù is like the Vai≈õe·π£ikas‚Äô statement, ‚ÄúThat which is the connection of action and agent is an existent thing. An independent agent not engaged in action exists.‚Äù

original: 'tshed pa po la gnas pa'i bya ba dngos por gyur pa dang ldan pa'i byed pa po gzhan 'ga' kho na zhig rjod par byed pa ni ma yin te /
analyzed: 'tshed pa po la gnas pa'i bya ba dngos por gyur pa dang ldan pa'i byed pa po gzhan 'ga' kho na zhig rjod par byed pa ni ma yin te /
translated: But it does not express that some other agent possesses an action that exists as a thing and is located in the cook.

original: bya ba la ma gtogs pa'i byed pa po rang dbang can de dgag par bya ba yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: bya ba la ma gtogs pa'i byed pa po rang dbang can de dgag par bya ba yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because that independent agent not engaged in action is to be refuted.

original: gal te bya ba'am byed pa po tha dad pa med na gang zhig dngos po'i rkyen gyis brjod par bya ba 'brel pa lta zhig yod re skan snyam du bsams pa yin no //
analyzed: gal te bya ba'am byed pa po tha dad pa med na gang zhig dngos po'i rkyen gyis brjod par bya ba 'brel pa lta zhig yod re skan snyam du bsams pa yin no //
translated: If action and agent are not different, what connection is there that is expressed by the conditions of things?

original: 'di'i brjod par bya ba gang yin pa zhes bya ba ni 'tshed pa po zhes bya ba'i sgra'i brjod par bya ba'i 'tshed pa po ma yin pa rnam par gcad pa khyad par gzhan ma spangs pa'i dngos po tsam mo //
analyzed: 'di'i brjod par bya ba gang yin pa zhes bya ba ni 'tshed pa po zhes bya ba'i sgra'i brjod par bya ba'i 'tshed pa po ma yin pa rnam par gcad pa khyad par gzhan ma spangs pa'i dngos po tsam mo //
translated: The meaning of ‚Äúwhat is expressed by that‚Äù is the mere thing that is the object of expression of the word ‚Äúcook,‚Äù which is not the cook, and which is not excluded from other attributes.

original: 'tshed pa po zhes bya ba'i sgras brjod par bya ba de nyid 'tshed ba nyid ces bya bas kyang brjod do zhes bya ba kho nas drangs te /
analyzed: 'tshed pa po zhes bya ba'i sgras brjod par bya ba de nyid 'tshed ba nyid ces bya bas kyang brjod do zhes bya ba kho nas drangs te /
translated: The meaning of ‚Äúthat which is expressed by the word ‚Äòcook‚Äô is also expressed by the word ‚Äòcooking,‚Äô‚Äù is drawn out by the phrase ‚Äújust that,‚Äù

original: de nyid khyad par gzhan spangs pa brjod pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de nyid khyad par gzhan spangs pa brjod pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it expresses the exclusion of other attributes.

original: 'brel pa brjod pa ni ma yin te de ni med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'brel pa brjod pa ni ma yin te de ni med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: It is not the expression of a relation, because that does not exist.

original: 'tshed pa nyid ces bya ba'i sgras brjod par bya ba ji skad du bshad pa de nyid 'tshed pa zhes bya ba'i sgras kyang rjod par byed do //
analyzed: 'tshed pa nyid ces bya ba'i sgras brjod par bya ba ji skad du bshad pa de nyid 'tshed pa zhes bya ba'i sgras kyang rjod par byed do //
translated: The meaning of ‚Äúthat which is expressed by the word ‚Äòcooking‚Äô is just that which is expressed by the word ‚Äòcook,‚Äô as it has been explained.

original: rnam par 'chad pa gzhan ni gzhan sel bar smra ba'i phyogs la ni gzhan gyis ji skad du brjod ba lta bur 'tshed pa zhes bya ba 'tshed pa zhes bya ba'i sgras 'tshed pa po bya ba gzhan gyi rten du gyur pa gzhan 'ga' kho na zhig brjod
analyzed: rnam par 'chad pa gzhan ni gzhan sel bar smra ba'i phyogs la ni gzhan gyis ji skad du brjod ba lta bur 'tshed pa zhes bya ba 'tshed pa zhes bya ba'i sgras 'tshed pa po bya ba gzhan gyi rten du gyur pa gzhan 'ga' kho na zhig brjod
translated: In the system of the proponents of other-exclusion, the term ‚Äúcook‚Äù expresses a certain other person who is the basis of the action of cooking, as others have claimed.üîΩ

original: par bya ba ni ma yin te /
analyzed: par bya ba ni ma yin te /
translated: In the system of the proponents of other-exclusion, the word ‚Äúcook‚Äù does not express some other thing that is the basis of another action, as others have claimed.

original: bya ba dang byed pa po 'brel pa'i rkyen du gyur pa gang yin pa de ma grub pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: bya ba dang byed pa po 'brel pa'i rkyen du gyur pa gang yin pa de ma grub pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because the condition that is the connection between the action and the agent is not established.

original: 'on kyang khyad par gzhan spong pas 'tshed pa po ma yin pa las ldog pa kho na brjod do //
analyzed: 'on kyang khyad par gzhan spong pas 'tshed pa po ma yin pa las ldog pa kho na brjod do //
translated: However, it does express the mere exclusion of non-cook by excluding another attribute.

original: de nyid 'di'i brjod par bya ba gang yin pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa ston te /
analyzed: de nyid 'di'i brjod par bya ba gang yin pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa ston te /
translated: That is what is indicated by the passage beginning with ‚ÄúThat is what is expressed by this . . .‚Äù

original: 'di'i zhes bya ba ni 'tshed pa zhes bya ba'i sgra'i'o //
analyzed: 'di'i zhes bya ba ni 'tshed pa zhes bya ba'i sgra'i'o //
translated: ‚ÄúThis‚Äù refers to the word ‚Äúcook.‚Äù

original: brjod par bya ba gang yin pa zhes ba ba ni 'tshed pa po ma yin pa las ldog pa'i mtshan nyid khyad par gzhan ma spangs pa'o //
analyzed: brjod par bya ba gang yin pa zhes ba ba ni 'tshed pa po ma yin pa las ldog pa'i mtshan nyid khyad par gzhan ma spangs pa'o //
translated: ‚ÄúThat which is expressed‚Äù is the exclusion of non-cook, which is another attribute that is excluded.

original: de ni bstan ma thag pa yin te /
analyzed: de ni bstan ma thag pa yin te /
translated: That was just explained.

original: 'tshed pa po'i sgras brjod par bya ba de nyis 'tshed pa nyid kyi sgras kyang brjod kyi 'brel pa ni ma yin te /
analyzed: 'tshed pa po'i sgras brjod par bya ba de nyis 'tshed pa nyid kyi sgras kyang brjod kyi 'brel pa ni ma yin te /
translated: The word ‚Äúcook‚Äù expresses that which is to be expressed by the word ‚Äúcooking,‚Äù but there is no relation,

original: de ma grub pa'i phyir ro //üîΩrting mi tshugs pa ni dngos po'i stobs @77a * //
analyzed: de ma grub pa'i phyir ro // rting mi tshugs pa ni dngos po'i stobs @77a * //
translated: because that is not established.

original: kyis 'ongs pa ma yin pa ste /
analyzed: kyis 'ongs pa ma yin pa ste /
translated: The non-establishment of the reason is not due to the power of things.

original: de nyid kyi phyir log pa rnam par rtog pa'o //üîΩyang bya ba tha dad pa'am /
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir log pa rnam par rtog pa'o // yang bya ba tha dad pa'am /
translated: Therefore, it is a false conception.

original: de dag gi 'du ba med pa ji ltar shes she na /
analyzed: de dag gi 'du ba med pa ji ltar shes she na /
translated: Moreover, how is the difference of action or the non-existence of their assemblage known?

original: de'i phyir ji ltar zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: de'i phyir ji ltar zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: Therefore, it is said ‚Äúhow?‚Äù and so on.

original: de dag gi 'du ba zhes bya ba ni bya ba dang byed po'i'o //
analyzed: de dag gi 'du ba zhes bya ba ni bya ba dang byed po'i'o //
translated: Their assemblage means the assemblage of action and agent.

original: gang gi phyir ldog pa dang ldog pa dang ldan pa dag tha dad pa ma yin pa'i rgyu de'i phyir gzhan sel yul la ni /
analyzed: gang gi phyir ldog pa dang ldog pa dang ldan pa dag tha dad pa ma yin pa'i rgyu de'i phyir gzhan sel yul la ni /
translated: Because the reversal and the possessor of reversal are not different, for that reason, in the domain of other-exclusion,

original: de dang ldan pa'i phyogs sgra dag gis rigs dang ldan pa brjod do zhes bya ba de la skyon yod pa gang yin pa de bzhin sel ba la yod do zhes bya ba de ldan phyogs la brjod pa bsal te /
analyzed: de dang ldan pa'i phyogs sgra dag gis rigs dang ldan pa brjod do zhes bya ba de la skyon yod pa gang yin pa de bzhin sel ba la yod do zhes bya ba de ldan phyogs la brjod pa bsal te /
translated: The fault that is in the position that possesses that is also in the exclusion, so the position that possesses that is eliminated.

original: 'di ltar rigs dang de dang ldan pa dag tha dad pa nyid du khas len na de dang ldan pa'i phyogs la brjod pa'i nyes par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: 'di ltar rigs dang de dang ldan pa dag tha dad pa nyid du khas len na de dang ldan pa'i phyogs la brjod pa'i nyes par 'gyur ro //
translated: If one accepts that the universal and that which possesses it are different, then the fault of expressing the position that possesses that arises.

original: des khyad par du byas pa zhes bya ba ni gzhan sel bas khyad par du byas pa'i don sgra dag gis brjod pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: des khyad par du byas pa zhes bya ba ni gzhan sel bas khyad par du byas pa'i don sgra dag gis brjod pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The phrase ‚Äúdistinguished by that‚Äù means that the words express the object distinguished by the exclusion of other.

original: de dang ldan pa'i phyogs la brjod pa zhes bya ba ni de dang ldan pa'i phyogs la brjod pa gang yin pa ste /
analyzed: de dang ldan pa'i phyogs la brjod pa zhes bya ba ni de dang ldan pa'i phyogs la brjod pa gang yin pa ste /
translated: The phrase ‚Äúthe expression of the position that possesses that‚Äù means the expression of the position that possesses that.

original: ji ltar spyi brjod nas de dang ldan pa la 'jug pa'i sgra rang dbang med par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: ji ltar spyi brjod nas de dang ldan pa la 'jug pa'i sgra rang dbang med par 'gyur ro //
translated: Just as after the universal is expressed, the word that applies to that which possesses it becomes independent.

original: des na sgra 'jug pa'i rgyu mtshan du gyur pa spyis dbang du byas pa'i sgras bsal ba la yod pa'i khyad par gzhan ma 'phangs pa'i phyir de dag dang gzhi mthun pa nyid du yang mi 'gyur la /üîΩde dang ldan pa la sgra 'jug pa la yang nye bar btags pa yin no zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i nyes par 'gyur ba de bzhin du ldog pa brjod nas /
analyzed: des na sgra 'jug pa'i rgyu mtshan du gyur pa spyis dbang du byas pa'i sgras bsal ba la yod pa'i khyad par gzhan ma 'phangs pa'i phyir de dag dang gzhi mthun pa nyid du yang mi 'gyur la / de dang ldan pa la sgra 'jug pa la yang nye bar btags pa yin no zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i nyes par 'gyur ba de bzhin du ldog pa brjod nas /
translated: Therefore, since the term, which is governed by the universal that is the reason for the application of the term, does not imply any other attribute that exists in the referent, there is no common locus of those two.üîΩAnd the term applies to that which possesses the universal is a mere designation.üîΩAll of those faults that you ascribe to us will also apply to you.üîΩWhen you state the contrapositive, you will say that the term that applies to that which possesses the universal is not autonomous.

original: de dang ldan pa la 'jug pa'i sgra yang rang dbang med pa yin no zhes bya ba la sogs pa thams cad du thal bar 'gyur ro zhes grags pa gang yin pa de dang ldan pa'i phyogs la brjod pa de yang 'dis zhes bya ba la ldog pa
analyzed: de dang ldan pa la 'jug pa'i sgra yang rang dbang med pa yin no zhes bya ba la sogs pa thams cad du thal bar 'gyur ro zhes grags pa gang yin pa de dang ldan pa'i phyogs la brjod pa de yang 'dis zhes bya ba la ldog pa
translated: All of those consequences will apply to you.

original: dang ldog pa dag ldan pa dag gzhan ma yin pa nyid kyis bsal cing spangs pa yin no 'di ltar de dag dang ldan pa'i phyogs de la ni don gzhan la brten nas spyi dngos por gyur pa la brten nas /
analyzed: dang ldog pa dag ldan pa dag gzhan ma yin pa nyid kyis bsal cing spangs pa yin no 'di ltar de dag dang ldan pa'i phyogs de la ni don gzhan la brten nas spyi dngos por gyur pa la brten nas /
translated: and the opposite, and the possessor of the opposite, are excluded and eliminated by the fact that they are not different.

original: de dang ldan pa'i don gzhan la'o //
analyzed: de dang ldan pa'i don gzhan la'o //
translated: Thus, in the position that possesses those, the word is dependent on another object, and the universal becomes a real entity, and then the word is dependent on another object that possesses that universal.

original: spyi dang ldan pa dang dngos su mi brjod pa'i phyir rang dbang med pa yin te /
analyzed: spyi dang ldan pa dang dngos su mi brjod pa'i phyir rang dbang med pa yin te /
translated: Since the universal and the possessor of the universal are not directly expressed, they are not independent.

original: sogs pa zhes bya ba'i sgras ni gzhi mthun pa nyid ma yin pa dang / nye bar btags pa'i nyes pa bsdu'o //
analyzed: sogs pa zhes bya ba'i sgras ni gzhi mthun pa nyid ma yin pa dang / nye bar btags pa'i nyes pa bsdu'o //
translated: The words ‚Äúand so on‚Äù include the faults of not being a common locus and being a mere designation.

original: gzhan pa sel ba'i @77b phyogs la ni ldog pa dang ldog pa dang ldan pa dag gcig pa'i phyir don gzhan la brten nas don gzhan la sgra 'jug pa ma yin te /
analyzed: gzhan pa sel ba'i @77b phyogs la ni ldog pa dang ldog pa dang ldan pa dag gcig pa'i phyir don gzhan la brten nas don gzhan la sgra 'jug pa ma yin te /
translated: In the position of other-exclusion, since the opposite and the possessor of the opposite are the same, the word is not applied to another object in dependence on another object.

original: de'i phyir rang dbang can ma yin pa la sogs pa'i nyas pa med pas gzhan las ldog pa ni zhes bya ba las sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: de'i phyir rang dbang can ma yin pa la sogs pa'i nyas pa med pas gzhan las ldog pa ni zhes bya ba las sogs pa smos te /
translated: Therefore, since there is no fault of being non-independent and so on, ‚Äúfrom the exclusion of other‚Äù and so on is stated.

original: dngos po gzhan las ldog pa gang yin pa de ni log pa las gzhan ma yin te /
analyzed: dngos po gzhan las ldog pa gang yin pa de ni log pa las gzhan ma yin te /
translated: That which is the opposite of other things is not different from the opposite.

original: chos dang chos can brjod pa'i sgra gnyi gas ldog pa'i khyad par gcig brjod pa'i phyir ro zhes gong nyid du bshad zin to //
analyzed: chos dang chos can brjod pa'i sgra gnyi gas ldog pa'i khyad par gcig brjod pa'i phyir ro zhes gong nyid du bshad zin to //
translated: Because both terms, the property and the property-possessor, express the same difference of the opposite. This has already been explained above.

original: gzhan gyis da ni zhes bya ba la sogs pa smras te /
analyzed: gzhan gyis da ni zhes bya ba la sogs pa smras te /
translated: The opponent now says, ‚ÄúNow, if the universal and the individual . . .‚Äù

original: da ni zhes bya ba ni ldog pa dang de dang ldan pa dag gcig pa nyid yin na'o //
analyzed: da ni zhes bya ba ni ldog pa dang de dang ldan pa dag gcig pa nyid yin na'o //
translated: ‚ÄúNow‚Äù means if the opposite and that which possesses it are the same.

original: rang gi mtshan nyid ldog pa gcig gzhan gyi rjes su mi 'gro ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rang gi mtshan nyid ldog pa gcig gzhan gyi rjes su mi 'gro ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Because the individual characteristic does not follow the other, the opposite.

original: don gzhan dang ma 'brel pa'i phyir ji ltar gzhan las ldog pa rang gi mtshan nyid kyi bdag nyid du gyur pa rang gi mtshan nyid bzhin du rjes su 'gro ba'i ma yin pa spyi yin par 'gyur te /
analyzed: don gzhan dang ma 'brel pa'i phyir ji ltar gzhan las ldog pa rang gi mtshan nyid kyi bdag nyid du gyur pa rang gi mtshan nyid bzhin du rjes su 'gro ba'i ma yin pa spyi yin par 'gyur te /
translated: How could the universal, which is the opposite of other, become the nature of the individual characteristic, like the individual characteristic itself, since it is not related to other objects?

original: mi 'gyur ba nyid ni spyi yin par ni 'dod do //
analyzed: mi 'gyur ba nyid ni spyi yin par ni 'dod do //
translated: It is maintained that the universal is that which does not change.

original: grub pa'i mtha' smra bas de'i blo la zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: grub pa'i mtha' smra bas de'i blo la zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: The proponent of tenets says, ‚ÄúThe cognition of that . . .‚Äù

original: spyi'i blo rnam par rtog pa can la de ltar rnam par gcig tu snang ba'i phyir ldog pa la spyi zhes bya'o //
analyzed: spyi'i blo rnam par rtog pa can la de ltar rnam par gcig tu snang ba'i phyir ldog pa la spyi zhes bya'o //
translated: Because a generally characterized cognition that is conceptual appears as a single aspect, the exclusion is called a ‚Äúuniversal.‚Äù

original: 'di skad du log pa rang gi mtshan nyid kyi bdag nyid du gyur pa'i ldog pa ni spyi ma yin gyi /
analyzed: 'di skad du log pa rang gi mtshan nyid kyi bdag nyid du gyur pa'i ldog pa ni spyi ma yin gyi /
translated: This is what is being said: The exclusion that is the nature of the individual characteristic is not a universal.

original: log pa rang gi mtshan nyid nyams su myong ba'i 'og rol gyi dus su 'byung ba'i rnam par rtog pa ni rang bzhin gyi dngos po 'bras bu gcig pa rnams la rnam pa gcig tu ston pa lta bur skye ste /
analyzed: log pa rang gi mtshan nyid nyams su myong ba'i 'og rol gyi dus su 'byung ba'i rnam par rtog pa ni rang bzhin gyi dngos po 'bras bu gcig pa rnams la rnam pa gcig tu ston pa lta bur skye ste /
translated: After the experience of the individual characteristic, the conceptual cognition that occurs later arises as if it were showing a single aspect to things that have the same effect.

original: rnam par rtog pa de'i dbang gis spyi'i dngos po /
analyzed: rnam par rtog pa de'i dbang gis spyi'i dngos po /
translated: Due to the power of that conceptual cognition,

original: med bzhin du yang spyir 'jog par byed do zhes bshad pa yin no //
analyzed: med bzhin du yang spyir 'jog par byed do zhes bshad pa yin no //
translated: a universal is posited as a thing even though it does not exist.üîΩIn order to clarify that point, the text says, ‚ÄúThe universal . . .‚Äù

original: de nyid gsal bar bya ba'i phyir spyi zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: de nyid gsal bar bya ba'i phyir spyi zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: and so on.

original: dngos por gyur pa snyam du bsams pa yin no //
analyzed: dngos por gyur pa snyam du bsams pa yin no //
translated: The meaning is that it is a thing.

original: 'o na ji ltar spyi dang gzhi mthun pa nyid la sogs par tha snyad 'dogs she na /
analyzed: 'o na ji ltar spyi dang gzhi mthun pa nyid la sogs par tha snyad 'dogs she na /
translated: Well then, how do you designate conventions such as universals, common loci, and so on?

original: sgra'i rten can gyi zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: sgra'i rten can gyi zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: The phrase ‚Äúconceptual consciousnesses that are supported by terms‚Äù indicates that

original: gang la rten sgra la lhan cig byed pa'i rgyu nyid du yod pa'i blo rnam par rtog pa can de nye bar len pa'i rgyu thog ma med pa'i bag chags kyi mthus chos ma 'dres pa dag kyang bsre zhing rnam pa gcig pa lta bur byed cing skye'oüîΩ// @78a * //  blo de rnam pa gcig tu snang ba'i dbang gis spyir rnam par gzhag la chos gnyis dang ldan pa'i chos can gcig tu snang ba'i dbang gis gzhi mthun pa nyid rnam par bzhag ste spyi la sogs pa'i tha snyad 'di ni don 'di ni don med pa bzhin
analyzed: gang la rten sgra la lhan cig byed pa'i rgyu nyid du yod pa'i blo rnam par rtog pa can de nye bar len pa'i rgyu thog ma med pa'i bag chags kyi mthus chos ma 'dres pa dag kyang bsre zhing rnam pa gcig pa lta bur byed cing skye'o // @78a * //  blo de rnam pa gcig tu snang ba'i dbang gis spyir rnam par gzhag la chos gnyis dang ldan pa'i chos can gcig tu snang ba'i dbang gis gzhi mthun pa nyid rnam par bzhag ste spyi la sogs pa'i tha snyad 'di ni don 'di ni don med pa bzhin
translated: conceptual consciousnesses that are supported by terms, which exist as the cooperative conditions of terms, mix discrete phenomena through the power of beginningless latent propensities that are the substantial causes of those consciousnesses, and they arise in the aspect of a single entity.

original: du yang rnam par gzhag ga ;
analyzed: du yang rnam par gzhag ga ;
translated: The universal is posited through the power of the appearance of a single aspect to those consciousnesses. A common locus is posited through the power of the appearance of a single phenomenon that possesses two attributes. These conventions of universals and so on are posited in the same way that the conventions of nonthings are posited.

original: / gal te ci'i phyir don med ce na /
analyzed: / gal te ci'i phyir don med ce na /
translated: If it is asked why they are nonthings,

original: don rnams la zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: don rnams la zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: The response to that is as follows:

original: rang gi mtshan nyid rnams la 'brel pa med pa'i phyir spyi'i don med do //
analyzed: rang gi mtshan nyid rnams la 'brel pa med pa'i phyir spyi'i don med do //
translated: There is no meaning of generality because there is no relation to intrinsic identities.

original: rang gi mtshan nyid gcig la tha dad pa med pa'i phyir gzhi mthun pa nyid kyi don med do //
analyzed: rang gi mtshan nyid gcig la tha dad pa med pa'i phyir gzhi mthun pa nyid kyi don med do //
translated: There is no meaning of common locus because there is no difference in a single intrinsic identity.

original: de'i tha dad pa sngon du 'gro ba can yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de'i tha dad pa sngon du 'gro ba can yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because difference is preceded by that.

original: gal te log pa'i dngos po spyi la sogs pa'i tha snyad kyi yul du mi byed na /
analyzed: gal te log pa'i dngos po spyi la sogs pa'i tha snyad kyi yul du mi byed na /
translated: If one does not take unreal things such as generalities as the objects of conventions,

original: ji ltar sgra'i tha snyad gzhan sel ba'i yul can yin zhe na /
analyzed: ji ltar sgra'i tha snyad gzhan sel ba'i yul can yin zhe na /
translated: how are the conventions of terms subjects that eliminate other possibilities?

original: de'i phyir de thams cad kyi zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: de'i phyir de thams cad kyi zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: Therefore, it is said, ‚ÄúAll of those . . .‚Äù

original: spyi la sogs pa'i tha snyad de dag thams cad kyi rten ni don rnams yin zhes bya bar sbyar ro //
analyzed: spyi la sogs pa'i tha snyad de dag thams cad kyi rten ni don rnams yin zhes bya bar sbyar ro //
translated: The support of all those conventions of generalities and so on is the objects.

original: gang dag la de'i 'bras bu dang de'i rgyu mthun pa yod pa de dag ni de'i 'bras bu dang rgyu can no //
analyzed: gang dag la de'i 'bras bu dang de'i rgyu mthun pa yod pa de dag ni de'i 'bras bu dang rgyu can no //
translated: Those that have that as their result and that which is concomitant with that are those that have that as their result and cause.

original: de'i ngo bo nyid de rgyur gyur pa de'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de'i ngo bo nyid de rgyur gyur pa de'i phyir ro //
translated: Because the nature of that is the cause of that.

original: gzhan dag las zhes bya ba ni de'i 'bras bu dang rgyu can ma yin pa dag las tha dad pa'i don rnams ni spyi la sogs pa'i tha snyad thams cad kyi rten yin no //
analyzed: gzhan dag las zhes bya ba ni de'i 'bras bu dang rgyu can ma yin pa dag las tha dad pa'i don rnams ni spyi la sogs pa'i tha snyad thams cad kyi rten yin no //
translated: ‚ÄúFrom other things‚Äù means that objects that are different from those that are its effect and cause are the basis of all conventions such as ‚Äúgenerality.‚Äù

original: 'di skad du log pa rang gi mtshan nyid de lta bu nyams su myong ba'i mthus byung ba'i blo rnam par rtog pa can gang yin pa de la spyi la sogs pa'i tha snyad 'dogs pa na brgyud pas /
analyzed: 'di skad du log pa rang gi mtshan nyid de lta bu nyams su myong ba'i mthus byung ba'i blo rnam par rtog pa can gang yin pa de la spyi la sogs pa'i tha snyad 'dogs pa na brgyud pas /
translated: In other words, the conceptual cognition that arises through the power of experiencing such a false intrinsic nature is applied to the convention of ‚Äúgenerality‚Äù and so on.

original: log pa rang gi mtshan nyid kyi rten can yin pas /
analyzed: log pa rang gi mtshan nyid kyi rten can yin pas /
translated: Since it is based on a false intrinsic nature,

original: rgyu des na dgra'i tha snyad gzhan sel ba'i yul can du bshad do zhes bshad pa yin no //
analyzed: rgyu des na dgra'i tha snyad gzhan sel ba'i yul can du bshad do zhes bshad pa yin no //
translated: through that cause, the convention of ‚Äúenemy‚Äù is explained to be an object of other-exclusion.

original: gang gi phyir sgra rab tu sbyar bas kyang mi 'dod pa spangs te /
analyzed: gang gi phyir sgra rab tu sbyar bas kyang mi 'dod pa spangs te /
translated: Because of that, even when a term is applied, the unwanted is excluded.

original: mi 'dod pa las log pa rang gi mtshan nyid la skyes bu 'jug par byed pa'i rgyu de'i phyir yang gzhan sel ba'i yul can du bshad de /
analyzed: mi 'dod pa las log pa rang gi mtshan nyid la skyes bu 'jug par byed pa'i rgyu de'i phyir yang gzhan sel ba'i yul can du bshad de /
translated: The reason why a person engages in the intrinsic identity of the opposite of what is not desired is also explained as the object of other-exclusion.

original: 'dis ni nye bar btags pas sgra rnams rang gi mtshan nyid du gtogs pa'i gzhan sel ba'i yul can nyid yin par sgrub pa bstan to //
analyzed: 'dis ni nye bar btags pas sgra rnams rang gi mtshan nyid du gtogs pa'i gzhan sel ba'i yul can nyid yin par sgrub pa bstan to //
translated: This shows the proof that words are the subject of other-exclusion that is included in their intrinsic identity by means of designation.

original: log pa rang gi mtshan nyid mthong ba las 'ongs pa rnam par rtog pa la snang ba'i rnam pa gang yin @78b pa rnam pa gzhan las log pa'i phyir gzhan sel bar gyur pa de ni nye bar btags pa ma yin pa'i ngo bo kho nas sgra'i yul
analyzed: log pa rang gi mtshan nyid mthong ba las 'ongs pa rnam par rtog pa la snang ba'i rnam pa gang yin @78b pa rnam pa gzhan las log pa'i phyir gzhan sel bar gyur pa de ni nye bar btags pa ma yin pa'i ngo bo kho nas sgra'i yul
translated: The aspect that appears in the conceptual cognition that arises from seeing the opposite of the intrinsic identity is other-exclusion because it is the opposite of other aspects. That is the object of words by means of its own nature that is not designated,

original: yin te / de kho na sgra'i shes pa la snang ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: yin te / de kho na sgra'i shes pa la snang ba'i phyir ro //
translated: because that alone appears in the cognition of the word.
