original: de'i tshe ni tha snyad gzhan sel ba'i yul can nyid du grub po //
analyzed: de'i tshe ni tha snyad gzhan sel ba'i yul can nyid du grub po //
translated: At that time, it is established as the subject of other-exclusion in conventional usage.

original: de nyid de lta bas na zhes bya ba la sogs pas ston te /
analyzed: de nyid de lta bas na zhes bya ba la sogs pas ston te /
translated: That itself is shown by ‚ÄúTherefore, . . .‚Äù and so forth.

original: rnam par rtog pa can gyi blo la snang ba'i chos can gang zhig phyi rol gyi don gyi de kho na nyid la mi ltos pa de la de skad ces bya'o //
analyzed: rnam par rtog pa can gyi blo la snang ba'i chos can gang zhig phyi rol gyi don gyi de kho na nyid la mi ltos pa de la de skad ces bya'o //
translated: That which appears to the conceptual mind is called ‚Äúthe apparent entity that does not depend on the reality of external objects.‚Äù

original: blo snang ba'i dbang gis gcig pu du ma las log pa zhes bya ba ni blo du ma las log pa'i chos can la gcig pa lta bur ston par snang ba'i phyir de'i dbang gis du ma las log pa'i chos can gcig tu rnam par bzhag ste /
analyzed: blo snang ba'i dbang gis gcig pu du ma las log pa zhes bya ba ni blo du ma las log pa'i chos can la gcig pa lta bur ston par snang ba'i phyir de'i dbang gis du ma las log pa'i chos can gcig tu rnam par bzhag ste /
translated: ‚ÄúBy the power of the appearance of the mind, it is said to be one, the opposite of many‚Äù means that by the power of the appearance of the mind, the apparent entity that is the opposite of many is posited as one, because it appears to be one to the mind that is the opposite of many.

original: gang gi phyir du ma las log pa de'i phyir de la log pa'i chos kyi khyad par rnams brtag go snyam du bsams pa yin no //
analyzed: gang gi phyir du ma las log pa de'i phyir de la log pa'i chos kyi khyad par rnams brtag go snyam du bsams pa yin no //
translated: ‚ÄúBecause it is the opposite of many, therefore the specific opposite properties are imagined in it‚Äù is the thought.

original: chos can de lta bu de ni sgra rnams kyi yul du byed cing zhes bya bar sbyar te smra ba po rnams kyi rnam par rtog pa snang ba de lta bu bskyed pa'i phyir sgra brjod pa'i phyir ro /
analyzed: chos can de lta bu de ni sgra rnams kyi yul du byed cing zhes bya bar sbyar te smra ba po rnams kyi rnam par rtog pa snang ba de lta bu bskyed pa'i phyir sgra brjod pa'i phyir ro /
translated: ‚ÄúThat kind of apparent entity is taken as the object of words‚Äù is to be supplied. Because it produces the appearance of the conceptual consciousness of the speaker, it is expressed by words.

original: gang gi phyir gzhan las log pa'i rnam par rtog pa'i snang ba'i sgra rnams kyi yul du byed pa de'i phyir ro /
analyzed: gang gi phyir gzhan las log pa'i rnam par rtog pa'i snang ba'i sgra rnams kyi yul du byed pa de'i phyir ro /
translated: Because they make the appearance of the conceptual thought that is the opposite of other things the object of sound, therefore,

original: gzhan sel ba'i yul can nyid du grub po snyam du bsams pa yin no //
analyzed: gzhan sel ba'i yul can nyid du grub po snyam du bsams pa yin no //
translated: it is thought that the object of other-exclusion is established.

original: sgra 'ba' zhig tu ma zad kyi rnam par rtog pa rnams kyis kyang yul du byed pas /
analyzed: sgra 'ba' zhig tu ma zad kyi rnam par rtog pa rnams kyis kyang yul du byed pas /
translated: Not only sound, but also conceptual thoughts make things objects.

original: de nyams su myong ba'i zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: de nyams su myong ba'i zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: Therefore, it says, ‚ÄúThe experience of that . . . ‚Äù and so on.

original: rang gi mtshan nyid de nyams su myong ba ni de nyams su myong ba'o //
analyzed: rang gi mtshan nyid de nyams su myong ba ni de nyams su myong ba'o //
translated: The experience of that is the experience of its own character.

original: des gzhan pa'i bag chags te nus pa'o //
analyzed: des gzhan pa'i bag chags te nus pa'o //
translated: By that, the latent predispositions are the potentiality.

original: de sang pa ni 'bras bu bskyed pa dang mthun pa ste /
analyzed: de sang pa ni 'bras bu bskyed pa dang mthun pa ste /
translated: The maturation of that is compatible with the production of the effect.

original: rnam par rtog pa gang dang dag la de la skye ba yod pa de dag gis yul du byed cing zhes sbyar ro //
analyzed: rnam par rtog pa gang dang dag la de la skye ba yod pa de dag gis yul du byed cing zhes sbyar ro //
translated: Those conceptual thoughts that have the potential to arise make things objects.

original: khyad par ji lta bu can dag gis she na /
analyzed: khyad par ji lta bu can dag gis she na /
translated: What kind of specific conceptual thoughts?

original: de'i dngos po nges pa'i don can rnams kyis te rnam par rtog pa snang ba gang la de'i dngos po phyi rol gyi dngos po nges pa yod pa de ni de'i dngos po nges pa'o //üîΩrnam par rtog pa gang dag la don de lta bu yod pa de dag la de skad ces bya ste /
analyzed: de'i dngos po nges pa'i don can rnams kyis te rnam par rtog pa snang ba gang la de'i dngos po phyi rol gyi dngos po nges pa yod pa de ni de'i dngos po nges pa'o // rnam par rtog pa gang dag la don de lta bu yod pa de dag la de skad ces bya ste /
translated: Those which have a real entity as their object, i.e., which have an external object as their object, are said to have a real entity as their object.üîΩThose conceptual thoughts which have such an object are said to have a real entity as their object.

original: snang ba dang rnam par brtag par bya ba'i don dag gcig tu byas nas 'jug pa rnams kyis zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: snang ba dang rnam par brtag par bya ba'i don dag gcig tu byas nas 'jug pa rnams kyis zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: Those which operate by taking the object of appearance and the object of conceptualization as one are said to have a real entity as their object.

original: @79a * // gzhan las ni de'i dngos po nges pa'i don zhes 'byung ste /
analyzed: @79a * // gzhan las ni de'i dngos po nges pa'i don zhes 'byung ste /
translated: In another text, it says, ‚Äúhaving a real entity as their object.‚Äù

original: de'i tshe de'i dngos po nges pa yang yin la don yang yin pa zhes las 'dzin par bya ste /
analyzed: de'i tshe de'i dngos po nges pa yang yin la don yang yin pa zhes las 'dzin par bya ste /
translated: At that time, it should be taken as ‚Äúhaving a real entity as their object‚Äù and ‚Äúhaving an object.‚Äù

original: de'i dngos po nges pa'i don gcig yin yang du ma las ldog pa zhes sbyar ro //
analyzed: de'i dngos po nges pa'i don gcig yin yang du ma las ldog pa zhes sbyar ro //
translated: Although it is one, having a real entity as its object, it is applied to many, as in ‚Äúhaving a real entity as their object.‚Äù

original: blo snang ba de nyid la chos dang chos can gyi tha snyad ces bya ba ni tha snyad du gdags par bya ba yin pas tha snyad de chos dang chos can dag nyid tha dad yin no //
analyzed: blo snang ba de nyid la chos dang chos can gyi tha snyad ces bya ba ni tha snyad du gdags par bya ba yin pas tha snyad de chos dang chos can dag nyid tha dad yin no //
translated: The so-called ‚Äúconvention of the property-possessor and the property‚Äù in that very appearance of awareness is what is to be designated conventionally, and that convention is different from the property-possessor and the property themselves.

original: 'di zhes bya ba ni khyad par gzhan spong ba dang mi spong ba'i mtshan nyid do //
analyzed: 'di zhes bya ba ni khyad par gzhan spong ba dang mi spong ba'i mtshan nyid do //
translated: ‚ÄúThis‚Äù has the character of excluding and not excluding other distinctions.

original: 'di skad du blo snang ba la chos dang chos can du rnam par gzhag pa gang dag yin pa de dag ni phan tshun de nyid dang gzhan dag tu brjod par bya ba ma yin no zhes bshad pa yin no //
analyzed: 'di skad du blo snang ba la chos dang chos can du rnam par gzhag pa gang dag yin pa de dag ni phan tshun de nyid dang gzhan dag tu brjod par bya ba ma yin no zhes bshad pa yin no //
translated: This is what is being said: Those that are posited as the property-possessor and the property in the appearance of awareness are not to be described as either the same or different.

original: de lta ma yin na ji ltar blo la snang ba'i don gyi khyad par las sgra'i bdag nyid kyi tha snyad de nyid dang / gzhan dag tu brjod par bya ba ma yin par 'gyur /
analyzed: de lta ma yin na ji ltar blo la snang ba'i don gyi khyad par las sgra'i bdag nyid kyi tha snyad de nyid dang / gzhan dag tu brjod par bya ba ma yin par 'gyur /
translated: Otherwise, how could the convention that has the nature of a word be neither the same as nor different from the object that appears to awareness?

original: de nyid dang gzhan nyid dag las nyes pa chos ni chos can las zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: de nyid dang gzhan nyid dag las nyes pa chos ni chos can las zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: In response to that, ‚ÄúThe error in saying that the property is the same as or different from the property-possessor‚Äù and so on is stated.

original: chos ni chos can las gzhan pa ma yin no //
analyzed: chos ni chos can las gzhan pa ma yin no //
translated: The property is not different from the property-possessor.

original: ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: don gzhan mi brjod pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: don gzhan mi brjod pa'i phyir te /
translated: Because it does not express a different meaning.

original: chos dang chos can gyi sgra dag gis rnam par bcad pa gcig brjod pa'i phyir /
analyzed: chos dang chos can gyi sgra dag gis rnam par bcad pa gcig brjod pa'i phyir /
translated: Because the terms property and property-possessor express the same exclusion.

original: chos ni chos can gang yin pa de nyis kyang ma yin no //
analyzed: chos ni chos can gang yin pa de nyis kyang ma yin no //
translated: The property is not the same as the property-possessor.

original: ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: de brjod pa dag bzhin du chos can brjod pa'i sgra dag bzhin du chos brjod pa rnams kyi kyang rnam par gcod pa gzhan 'phen par thal bar 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de brjod pa dag bzhin du chos can brjod pa'i sgra dag bzhin du chos brjod pa rnams kyi kyang rnam par gcod pa gzhan 'phen par thal bar 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Because, like the terms that express the property-possessor, the terms that express the property would also imply another exclusion.

original: de lta na ni 'dod pa shes par mi 'gyur ba'i phyir chos zhes bya pa'i sgras 'dod pa khyad par gzhan spong pa'i khyad par gzhan shes par mi 'gyur ba'i phyir /
analyzed: de lta na ni 'dod pa shes par mi 'gyur ba'i phyir chos zhes bya pa'i sgras 'dod pa khyad par gzhan spong pa'i khyad par gzhan shes par mi 'gyur ba'i phyir /
translated: If that were so, because desire would not be understood, the term property would not make known another distinction that excludes other distinctions of desire.

original: brda'i khyad par mi bya bar 'gyur te /
analyzed: brda'i khyad par mi bya bar 'gyur te /
translated: Therefore, a distinction in terms would not be made.

original: chos zhes bya ba'i sgras rnam par gcad pa'i khyad par gzhan spangs pa ston to zhes bya ba'i brda'i khyad par 'di mi bya bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: chos zhes bya ba'i sgras rnam par gcad pa'i khyad par gzhan spangs pa ston to zhes bya ba'i brda'i khyad par 'di mi bya bar 'gyur ro //
translated: The term ‚Äúdharma‚Äù indicates the exclusion of other specific objects.

original: chos dang chos can dag de nyid dang gzhan nyid dag tu brjod par bya ba bshad ma thag pa 'di ni sgra'i don blo la snang ba bshad pa yin no //
analyzed: chos dang chos can dag de nyid dang gzhan nyid dag tu brjod par bya ba bshad ma thag pa 'di ni sgra'i don blo la snang ba bshad pa yin no //
translated: This explanation of the appearance of the meaning of a word in the mind is the explanation of the just-mentioned expression ‚Äúthe dharma and the dharmin are neither identical nor different.‚Äù

original: dngos po la ni zhes bya ba ni phyi rol gyi la ste /
analyzed: dngos po la ni zhes bya ba ni phyi rol gyi la ste /
translated: ‚ÄúIn a real thing‚Äù means in an external thing.

original: med pa kho na'i phyir de nyid dang gzhan dag tu brjod par bya ba ma yin no //
analyzed: med pa kho na'i phyir de nyid dang gzhan dag tu brjod par bya ba ma yin no //
translated: Because it does not exist, it cannot be said to be either identical with or different from it.

original: gzhan gyis chos dang chos can @79b dag ces bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: gzhan gyis chos dang chos can @79b dag ces bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: An opponent might say that the dharma and the dharmin are not like this.

original: drug pa ni ba lang gi ba lang nyid ces bya ba'o //
analyzed: drug pa ni ba lang gi ba lang nyid ces bya ba'o //
translated: The sixth is the cow‚Äôs cowness.

original: sogs pa zhes bya ba'i sgras ni ba langs la ba lang nyid gnas so //
analyzed: sogs pa zhes bya ba'i sgras ni ba langs la ba lang nyid gnas so //
translated: The word ‚Äúetc.‚Äù indicates that cowness resides in the cow.

original: zhes bya ba dang / ba lang nyid kyi rgyu mtshan gyis ba la lang la sgra 'jug go zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i rnam par dbye ba bsdu'o //
analyzed: zhes bya ba dang / ba lang nyid kyi rgyu mtshan gyis ba la lang la sgra 'jug go zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i rnam par dbye ba bsdu'o //
translated: and ‚ÄúThe word is applied to the cow because of the reason ‚Äòcow-ness,‚Äô etc.‚Äù

original: mthong ba dang zhes bya ba ni sbyor ba dag la dmigs pa dang ngo //
analyzed: mthong ba dang zhes bya ba ni sbyor ba dag la dmigs pa dang ngo //
translated: ‚ÄúSeeing‚Äù refers to the observation of the syllogism.

original: ba lang nyid la sogs pa'i chos mang po'i phyir chos mang po de la mang po'i tshig gi bye brag ba lang nyid dang / rdzas nyid dang sa las gyur pa nyid rnams zhes bya ba mthong ba gang yin pa de yang chos can gcig la'ang mi rung ste ;
analyzed: ba lang nyid la sogs pa'i chos mang po'i phyir chos mang po de la mang po'i tshig gi bye brag ba lang nyid dang / rdzas nyid dang sa las gyur pa nyid rnams zhes bya ba mthong ba gang yin pa de yang chos can gcig la'ang mi rung ste ;
translated: Since there are many properties such as ‚Äúcow-ness,‚Äù etc., the word ‚Äúmany‚Äù is used to distinguish them, as in ‚Äúcow-ness, substance-ness, earth-ness,‚Äù etc. But this is also not correct when applied to a single subject,

original: chos rnams chos can las tha mi dad pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: chos rnams chos can las tha mi dad pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because the properties are not different from the subject.

original: mang po'i tshig 'di ni khyod ni gzhung lugs kyi chos can kho na la sbyar na /
analyzed: mang po'i tshig 'di ni khyod ni gzhung lugs kyi chos can kho na la sbyar na /
translated: If you apply this word ‚Äúmany‚Äù only to the subject of your own system,

original: chos can yang gcig yin pa'i phyir de la mang po'i tshig mi rung ngo //
analyzed: chos can yang gcig yin pa'i phyir de la mang po'i tshig mi rung ngo //
translated: then the word ‚Äúmany‚Äù is not correct, because the subject is one.

original: / grub pa'i mtha' sbra bas /
analyzed: / grub pa'i mtha' sbra bas /
translated: The Tattva·π≠ƒ´kƒÅ says,

original: 'di la bshad zin to zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: 'di la bshad zin to zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: ‚ÄúThis has already been explained.‚Äù

original: sgra rnams kyi 'jug pa yul gyi rang gi ngo bo la rag las pa ni /
analyzed: sgra rnams kyi 'jug pa yul gyi rang gi ngo bo la rag las pa ni /
translated: The engagement of terms depends on the nature of the object.üîΩ

original: 'ga' yang med de zhes bya ba la sogs pas bshad zin to //
analyzed: 'ga' yang med de zhes bya ba la sogs pas bshad zin to //
translated: It has already been explained that the usage of words does not depend on the nature of the object itself.

original: yang rnon gyi don du bya ba bstan pa'i phyir gzhan yang zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /üîΩsmra ba gang dag gi ltar na tshig dngos po'i dbang dngos po la rag las pa yin gyi lhur brjod 'dod pa la mi rten pa /üîΩtshig gang dag lhur gtso cher brjod par 'dod pa la mi rten yang de dag ni lhur brjod par 'dod pa la mi rten pa ste /
analyzed: yang rnon gyi don du bya ba bstan pa'i phyir gzhan yang zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te / smra ba gang dag gi ltar na tshig dngos po'i dbang dngos po la rag las pa yin gyi lhur brjod 'dod pa la mi rten pa / tshig gang dag lhur gtso cher brjod par 'dod pa la mi rten yang de dag ni lhur brjod par 'dod pa la mi rten pa ste /
translated: Again, in order to teach the meaning of ‚Äúsharp,‚Äù it says ‚ÄúMoreover, etc.‚ÄùüîΩFor those who say that the meaning of a word depends on the power of the thing, not on the speaker‚Äôs desire to express it,üîΩthose words do not depend on the speaker‚Äôs desire to express them,

original: dngos por smra ba de dag la'o //
analyzed: dngos por smra ba de dag la'o //
translated: but they do depend on the speaker‚Äôs desire to express them.

original: drug par mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: drug par mi 'gyur ro //
translated: They do not become six.üîΩThey do not become word division, etc.

original: tshig dbye ba la sogs par mi 'gyur ro zhes de skad du drug pa dang / tshig dbye ba la sogs pa la klan ka btsal ba ni /
analyzed: tshig dbye ba la sogs par mi 'gyur ro zhes de skad du drug pa dang / tshig dbye ba la sogs pa la klan ka btsal ba ni /
translated: The objection to the sixth case and word division, etc.

original: drug pa dang tshig dbye ba la sogs pa klan ka'o //
analyzed: drug pa dang tshig dbye ba la sogs pa klan ka'o //
translated: The objection to the sixth case and word division, etc.

original: sogs pa zhes bya ba'i sgras ni //
analyzed: sogs pa zhes bya ba'i sgras ni //
translated: The word ‚Äúetc.‚Äù

original: ba lang gi dngos po ni ba lang nyid du zhes bya ba la sogs pa de la phan pa'i rkyen med par klan ka btsal ba bsdu ste /
analyzed: ba lang gi dngos po ni ba lang nyid du zhes bya ba la sogs pa de la phan pa'i rkyen med par klan ka btsal ba bsdu ste /
translated: The phrase ‚Äúthe entity of an ox is an ox‚Äù and so on is a reductio argument that refutes the opponent‚Äôs position without providing any positive proof.

original: rigs pa dang ldan no //
analyzed: rigs pa dang ldan no //
translated: It is a logical argument.

original: drug pa la sogs pa'i sgra 'di dag skyes bu rnams kyis 'ga' zhig la zhes bya ba dngos po tha mi dad pa la yang bya bar 'dod du zin kyang du ba la sogs pa bzhin du me dang 'brel pa'i du ba me go par byed pas deüîΩlas bzlog pa chu @80a * //
analyzed: drug pa la sogs pa'i sgra 'di dag skyes bu rnams kyis 'ga' zhig la zhes bya ba dngos po tha mi dad pa la yang bya bar 'dod du zin kyang du ba la sogs pa bzhin du me dang 'brel pa'i du ba me go par byed pas de las bzlog pa chu @80a * //
translated: Even though the words ‚Äúsixth‚Äù and so on are asserted to refer to a single entity, they are like smoke and so on, which are related to fire and so on, and thus they are understood to be related to fire and so on.

original: la sogs pa shes par bya ba la sbyar bar mi nus pa bzhin du /
analyzed: la sogs pa shes par bya ba la sbyar bar mi nus pa bzhin du /
translated: They cannot be applied to water and so on, which are the opposite of fire.

original: dngos po dang 'brel pa'i phyir dngos po tha dad pa la rag las pa'i phyir bya bar mi nus na /

original: yang mkha' @81b nyid ces brjod pa 'dis ci zhig bya /
analyzed: yang mkha' @81b nyid ces brjod pa 'dis ci zhig bya /
translated: What is the point of saying ‚Äúspace itself‚Äù?

original: gal te nam mkha'i rang bzhin zhes bya ba'i tshig 'di mkha' nyid ces bya ba yin pas de la phan pa 'di 'jug go zhes bya ba de ston to zhe na /
analyzed: gal te nam mkha'i rang bzhin zhes bya ba'i tshig 'di mkha' nyid ces bya ba yin pas de la phan pa 'di 'jug go zhes bya ba de ston to zhe na /

original: de ni ma yin te rang bzhin zhes bya ba'i don 'di la dngos po'i rkyen sbyor ba ma yin gyi /
analyzed: de ni ma yin te rang bzhin zhes bya ba'i don 'di la dngos po'i rkyen sbyor ba ma yin gyi /
translated: that is not so, because the meaning of the term ‚Äúnature‚Äù is not applied to a condition of a thing.

original: 'o na ci zhe na /
analyzed: 'o na ci zhe na /
translated: What is it then?

original: ngo bo'i don la yin no //
analyzed: ngo bo'i don la yin no //
translated: It is the meaning of essence.

original: de la phan pa 'jug pa bstan pa yang cir yang mi dgos so //
analyzed: de la phan pa 'jug pa bstan pa yang cir yang mi dgos so //
translated: And it is not necessary to show that the benefit is applied to that.

original: de lta bas na kha cig na re so sor sbyor ba gnyis te /
analyzed: de lta bas na kha cig na re so sor sbyor ba gnyis te /
translated: Therefore, some say that there are two applications:

original: nam mkha'i rang bzhin zhes bya ba dang / de bzhin du nam mkha'i mkha' nyid ces bya ba sbyor ba gnyi ga la yang drug pa ni tha dad pa'i rgyu can du mi 'gyur ro zhes bya ba yin no zhes zer ro //
analyzed: nam mkha'i rang bzhin zhes bya ba dang / de bzhin du nam mkha'i mkha' nyid ces bya ba sbyor ba gnyi ga la yang drug pa ni tha dad pa'i rgyu can du mi 'gyur ro zhes bya ba yin no zhes zer ro //
translated: ‚Äúthe nature of space‚Äù and ‚Äúthe space of space.‚Äù In both applications, the sixth case is not based on a different cause.

analyzed: 'di la yang sbyor ba gnyi gas drug pa med pa 'ba' zhig gleng bas gnyis smos pa don med do //
translated: But in this case, the mere mention of the absence of the sixth case in both applications is meaningless.

original: de bas na gzhan dag ni gzhan du 'chad de nam mkha'i rang bzhin zhes bya ba tha dad par byed pa la ni rgyu ci yod /
analyzed: de bas na gzhan dag ni gzhan du 'chad de nam mkha'i rang bzhin zhes bya ba tha dad par byed pa la ni rgyu ci yod /

analyzed: de bzhin du mkha' nyid ces bya bar tha dad par brjod pa'i sgra dngos po'i rkyen can la ni rgyu ci yod ces bya ba yin no zhes zer ro //

analyzed: gang gi tshe zhes bya ba la sogs pas ni 'chad par byed de dus gang gi tshe'o //

translated: ‚ÄúBy what‚Äù means ‚Äúin what way.‚ÄùüîΩ‚ÄúBy

original: gal te bud med dang bye ma gcig la yang nus pa du ma gcig yod de de'i phyir nus pa tha dad pa mang po'i tshig gi rgyu yin no zhe na /
analyzed: gal te bud med dang bye ma gcig la yang nus pa du ma gcig yod de de'i phyir nus pa tha dad pa mang po'i tshig gi rgyu yin no zhe na /
translated: If you say that a woman and a grain of sand have many potencies, and therefore many different potencies are the cause of the word,

original: thams cad du zhes bya ba ni shing zhes bya ba la sogs pa gang la gcig gi tshig tu 'dod pa la yang ngo //
analyzed: thams cad du zhes bya ba ni shing zhes bya ba la sogs pa gang la gcig gi tshig tu 'dod pa la yang ngo //
translated: then in all cases, that is, in all cases where you assert that the word is singular,

original: don nus pa gcig pa med pa'i phyir te thams cad kyi nus pa du ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: don nus pa gcig pa med pa'i phyir te thams cad kyi nus pa du ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: the meaning is not a single potency, because the potency of all is multiple.

original: de lta yin na ni gcig la gcig gi tshig yin no zhes bya ba'i 'bad pa 'di yang don med par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de lta yin na ni gcig la gcig gi tshig yin no zhes bya ba'i 'bad pa 'di yang don med par 'gyur ro //
translated: If that were so, then this effort to say that the word is singular would be pointless.

original: gal te nus pa tha dad kyang dngos po tha mi dad pa'i phyir nus pa'i rten tha mi dad pa'i phyir gzhan la zhes bya ba la gcig gi tshig gi yul shing zhes bya ba dang ras yug ces bya ba la sogs @82a * //üîΩpa la gcig gi tshig tu 'gyur ro zhe na /
analyzed: gal te nus pa tha dad kyang dngos po tha mi dad pa'i phyir nus pa'i rten tha mi dad pa'i phyir gzhan la zhes bya ba la gcig gi tshig gi yul shing zhes bya ba dang ras yug ces bya ba la sogs @82a * //üîΩpa la gcig gi tshig tu 'gyur ro zhe na /
translated: If you say that although the potencies are different, the entity is not different, because the basis of the potency is not different, then in other cases, that is, in cases where the word is singular, the word would refer to a tree, a cloth, and so on.

original: btsun mo rnams zhes bya ba la sogs pa 'di la yang gcig gi tshig tu 'gyur te bud med gcig la dngos po tha dad pa med pa'i phyir ro //üîΩgang gi phyir de ltar sgra 'jug pa'i bye brag dngos po'i rten can nam nus pa'i rten can ma yin pa de'i phyir sgra 'jug pa'i nges pa dngos po ma yin zhing dngos po la brten pa ma yin pa 'di byed pa na sgra sbyor ba la skyes
analyzed: btsun mo rnams zhes bya ba la sogs pa 'di la yang gcig gi tshig tu 'gyur te bud med gcig la dngos po tha dad pa med pa'i phyir ro // gang gi phyir de ltar sgra 'jug pa'i bye brag dngos po'i rten can nam nus pa'i rten can ma yin pa de'i phyir sgra 'jug pa'i nges pa dngos po ma yin zhing dngos po la brten pa ma yin pa 'di byed pa na sgra sbyor ba la skyes
translated: ‚ÄúThe queens‚Äù and so on would also be singular because a single woman does not have different things.

original: bu'i 'dod pa rang dbang can du ston pa yin no //
analyzed: bu'i 'dod pa rang dbang can du ston pa yin no //
translated: Since the particular application of a term does not depend on a real thing or on the capacity of a real thing, when one applies a term whose application is not determined by a real thing or by a real thing‚Äôs capacity, one is showing that one‚Äôs application of the term is independent and under one‚Äôs own control.

original: gal te grong khyer drug po dag la sdud pa zhes bya ba bya ba'i bdag nyid dam yon tan gyi bdag nyid gcig cig yod de des na gcig gi tshig tu 'gyur ro zhe na /
analyzed: gal te grong khyer drug po dag la sdud pa zhes bya ba bya ba'i bdag nyid dam yon tan gyi bdag nyid gcig cig yod de des na gcig gi tshig tu 'gyur ro zhe na /
translated: If you say that the six cities have a single nature that is the nature of an action or a quality called ‚Äúcollection,‚Äù and that is why it is singular,

original: grong khyer nyid kyang chung kyang med na zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: grong khyer nyid kyang chung kyang med na zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: then we say that even the city itself does not exist.

original: grong khyer zhes bya ba yan lag can gyi rdzas khas mi len pa'i phyir grong khyer de rnams la de skad du brjod par 'gyur ba bya ba'i bdag nyid dam yon tan gyi bdag nyid kyi sdud pa lta ci zhig ga la yod de bya ba dang yon
analyzed: grong khyer zhes bya ba yan lag can gyi rdzas khas mi len pa'i phyir grong khyer de rnams la de skad du brjod par 'gyur ba bya ba'i bdag nyid dam yon tan gyi bdag nyid kyi sdud pa lta ci zhig ga la yod de bya ba dang yon
translated: Because they do not assert that a city is a substance that possesses parts, how could a city be a collection that has the nature of an action or the nature of a quality?

original: tan gyi rdzas la brten pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: tan gyi rdzas la brten pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it is based on the substances of action and quality.

original: ci ste rdzas ma yin zhe na /
analyzed: ci ste rdzas ma yin zhe na /
translated: But if it is not a substance,üîΩthen what is the substance of a city?

original: khang bzangs dang zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /üîΩgrong khyer na khang bzangs la sogs pa'i spyi yin na khang bzangs la sogs pa rigs mi mthun pa rnams kyis kyang rdzas rtsom par khas mi len pa'i phyir ro de rnams kyi spyi lta zhig khang bzangs la sogs pa'i spyi grong khyer lta zhig rdzas yin par
analyzed: khang bzangs dang zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te / grong khyer na khang bzangs la sogs pa'i spyi yin na khang bzangs la sogs pa rigs mi mthun pa rnams kyis kyang rdzas rtsom par khas mi len pa'i phyir ro de rnams kyi spyi lta zhig khang bzangs la sogs pa'i spyi grong khyer lta zhig rdzas yin par
translated: It is said that a city is a collection of houses and so on.

original: ga la 'gyur /
analyzed: ga la 'gyur /
translated: If a city is the generality of houses and so on, then how could a city be a substance, since it is not asserted that houses and so on are composed of substances that are not of the same type?

original: khang bzangs dang rta babs dang skyes bu la sogs pa ji tsam gyi spyi la grong khyer du 'dod pa /
analyzed: khang bzangs dang rta babs dang skyes bu la sogs pa ji tsam gyi spyi la grong khyer du 'dod pa /
translated: To what extent is it asserted that a city is the generality of houses, archways, people and so on?

original: khang bzangs la sogs pa de dag ril la ldan pa med pa'i yang phyir grong khyer rdzas ma yin te /üîΩldan pa grogs byed pa'i rdzas rnams rdzas rtsom par byed pa nyid yin par 'dod na khang bzangs dang skyes bu la sogs pa bral ba rnams la ni gang gis na khang bzangs la sogs pa spyi'i grong khyer rdzas yin par 'gyur ba ldan pa ni med do
analyzed: khang bzangs la sogs pa de dag ril la ldan pa med pa'i yang phyir grong khyer rdzas ma yin te / ldan pa grogs byed pa'i rdzas rnams rdzas rtsom par byed pa nyid yin par 'dod na khang bzangs dang skyes bu la sogs pa bral ba rnams la ni gang gis na khang bzangs la sogs pa spyi'i grong khyer rdzas yin par 'gyur ba ldan pa ni med do
translated: A city is not a substance because it does not possess those houses, etc.üîΩIf it is asserted that substances that possess the quality of being a companion are the components of a substance, then houses, people, etc. that are not connected do not possess the quality of being a companion, by which a house, etc. could be a city in general that is a substance.

original: // gal te khang bzangs la sogs pa ril la ldan pa med du zin kyang grong khyer ni khang bzangs dang skyes bu la sogs pa gang dag la phan tshun ldan pa yod pa de dag gis ldan pa'i bdag nyid yin par 'gyur bas de lta na yang grong
analyzed: // gal te khang bzangs la sogs pa ril la ldan pa med du zin kyang grong khyer ni khang bzangs dang skyes bu la sogs pa gang dag la phan tshun ldan pa yod pa de dag gis ldan pa'i bdag nyid yin par 'gyur bas de lta na yang grong
translated: Even though houses, etc. do not possess the quality of being a companion, a city is the nature of that which possesses the quality of being a companion, which is houses, people, etc. that possess the quality of being a companion.

original: khyer rdzas nyid du grub ste ldan pa ni yon @82b tan gyi dngos po yin pa'i phyir ro snyam du sems na de'i phyir ldan pa ma yin te zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos so //
analyzed: khyer rdzas nyid du grub ste ldan pa ni yon @82b tan gyi dngos po yin pa'i phyir ro snyam du sems na de'i phyir ldan pa ma yin te zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos so //
translated: If you think that the city is established as the very thing that is possessed because it is the substance of the qualities, then NƒÅgƒÅrjuna explains: It is not possessed.

original: grong khyer ni ldan pa'i ngo bo nyid ma yin te 'di ltar shing dang so phag la sogs pa rigs mi mthun pa rnams kyis 'bras bu'i rdzas mi rtsom pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: grong khyer ni ldan pa'i ngo bo nyid ma yin te 'di ltar shing dang so phag la sogs pa rigs mi mthun pa rnams kyis 'bras bu'i rdzas mi rtsom pa'i phyir ro //
translated: A city is not an entity that is possessed because a substance that is the result of heterogeneous things such as wood and bricks and so on is not initiated.

original: khang bzangs kyang rdzas kyi bdag nyid ni ma yin te 'on kyang ldan pa'i ngo bo nyid yin par 'dod do //
analyzed: khang bzangs kyang rdzas kyi bdag nyid ni ma yin te 'on kyang ldan pa'i ngo bo nyid yin par 'dod do //
translated: A mansion is not a substance, but rather it is asserted to be an entity that is possessed.

original: ldan pa yang yon tan rnams yon tan med pa yin pas khang bzangs la gang gis ni de'i ldan pa'i bdag nyid grong khyer yin par 'gyur ba ldan pa lta zhig yong re skan /
analyzed: ldan pa yang yon tan rnams yon tan med pa yin pas khang bzangs la gang gis ni de'i ldan pa'i bdag nyid grong khyer yin par 'gyur ba ldan pa lta zhig yong re skan /
translated: Since the qualities are not qualities, what is the possession that would be the city that is the nature of its possession?

original: de nyid khang bzangs rang nyid ces bya ba la sogs pas ston te /
analyzed: de nyid khang bzangs rang nyid ces bya ba la sogs pas ston te /
translated: This is indicated by the statement ‚ÄúThat very mansion itself‚Äù and so on.

original: gzhan dang zhes bya ba don gzhan mi ldan pa'i yang phyir ldan pa grong khyer ma yin no //
analyzed: gzhan dang zhes bya ba don gzhan mi ldan pa'i yang phyir ldan pa grong khyer ma yin no //
translated: Also, because it does not possess another, i.e., something else, possession is not a city.

original: yang zhes smos pas ni khang bzangs la sogs pa bral ba rnams la ldan pa med pa bstan ma thag pa'i yang phyir ldan pa grong khyer ma yin no zhes bya ba 'di sdud de de ltar na khang bzangs la sogs pa la yang ldan pa med pas
analyzed: yang zhes smos pas ni khang bzangs la sogs pa bral ba rnams la ldan pa med pa bstan ma thag pa'i yang phyir ldan pa grong khyer ma yin no zhes bya ba 'di sdud de de ltar na khang bzangs la sogs pa la yang ldan pa med pas
translated: The word ‚Äúalso‚Äù indicates that because it has been shown that a palace, etc., which is devoid of possession does not have possession, this is included in the statement, ‚Äúpossession is not a city.‚Äù Thus, because a palace, etc., does not have possession,

original: grong khyer ldan pa'i ngo bo nyid yin pa bsal ba yin no //
analyzed: grong khyer ldan pa'i ngo bo nyid yin pa bsal ba yin no //
translated: the essential nature of a city that possesses a palace, etc., is refuted.

original: gal te grong khyer ni khang bzangs la sogs pa'i grangs gang yin pa de'i bdag nyid yin par 'gyur ro zhe na /
analyzed: gal te grong khyer ni khang bzangs la sogs pa'i grangs gang yin pa de'i bdag nyid yin par 'gyur ro zhe na /
translated: If a city is the number of palaces, etc., it would be the nature of that.

original: de nyid kyi phyir grangs kyang med do zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir grangs kyang med do zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: Therefore, it is said that ‚Äúnumber also does not exist.‚Äù

original: gang gi phyir khang bzangs ldan pa'i bdag nyid yin pa rgyu de'i phyir yon tan rnams la yon tan med pa'i khang bzangs la grangs kyang med de /
analyzed: gang gi phyir khang bzangs ldan pa'i bdag nyid yin pa rgyu de'i phyir yon tan rnams la yon tan med pa'i khang bzangs la grangs kyang med de /
translated: Because a palace, etc., is the nature of that which possesses a palace, therefore, a palace, which does not possess qualities, does not have number among the qualities.

original: grangs kyang yon tan gyi ngo bo nyid yin no //
analyzed: grangs kyang yon tan gyi ngo bo nyid yin no //
translated: Number is also the nature of a quality.

original: 'di ni ldan pa yang yin la de yang yin pas ldan pa de ste khang bzangs kyi bdag nyid kyi ldan pa zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: 'di ni ldan pa yang yin la de yang yin pas ldan pa de ste khang bzangs kyi bdag nyid kyi ldan pa zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: It is a possessor, and it is that, thus it is the possessor of that, which is to say, the possessor of the nature of a mansion.

original: gal te grong khyer ni ldan pa de dang skyes bu dag gis khyad par du byas pa'i yod pa yin no zhe na /
analyzed: gal te grong khyer ni ldan pa de dang skyes bu dag gis khyad par du byas pa'i yod pa yin no zhe na /
translated: If a city is an existent that is distinguished by that possessor and by persons,

original: gcig pa nyid yin pa'i phyir dang rtag pa yin pa'i phyir yong pa bogs dbyung du med pa 'di la khyad par ci zhig yod khang bzangs dang skyes bu la sogs pas ni yod pa khyad par du mi byed do bogs dbyung du med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gcig pa nyid yin pa'i phyir dang rtag pa yin pa'i phyir yong pa bogs dbyung du med pa 'di la khyad par ci zhig yod khang bzangs dang skyes bu la sogs pas ni yod pa khyad par du mi byed do bogs dbyung du med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: then what difference is there in this existent that cannot be improved upon, since it is identical and permanent? A mansion, persons, etc. do not distinguish an existent, because it cannot be improved upon.

original: de lta bas na yod pa la khyad par med pas de grong khyer nyid yin na thams cad grong khyer du 'gyur ro snyam du bsams pa yin na //
analyzed: de lta bas na yod pa la khyad par med pas de grong khyer nyid yin na thams cad grong khyer du 'gyur ro snyam du bsams pa yin na //
translated: Thus, since there is no difference in existence, if that is a city, everything would be a city.

original: yod pa yang gcig @83a * //
analyzed: yod pa yang gcig @83a * //
translated: Existence is also one.

original: yin pa'i phyir zhes bya ba ni yod pa ni rdzas dang yon tan dang las dag la khyab pa gcig pu kho na yin no //
analyzed: yin pa'i phyir zhes bya ba ni yod pa ni rdzas dang yon tan dang las dag la khyab pa gcig pu kho na yin no //
translated: ‚ÄúBecause it exists‚Äù means that existence is the sole pervader of substance, quality, and action.

original: grong khyer mang po nyid yin yang zhes bya ba ni grong khyer du rnam par gzhag pa'i rten khang bzangs la sogs pa'i tshogs rnams mang po nyid yin yang zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: grong khyer mang po nyid yin yang zhes bya ba ni grong khyer du rnam par gzhag pa'i rten khang bzangs la sogs pa'i tshogs rnams mang po nyid yin yang zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: ‚ÄúEven though there are many cities‚Äù means that even though there is a collection of houses, etc., which are the bases for the designation of a city, there is only one city.

original: de lta ma yin te yod pa'i bdag nyid kyi grong khyer gyi skabs shig yin na ji ltar grong khyer mang po nyid du 'gyur /
analyzed: de lta ma yin te yod pa'i bdag nyid kyi grong khyer gyi skabs shig yin na ji ltar grong khyer mang po nyid du 'gyur /
translated: If it were not so, then if there were a single city that was the nature of existence, how could there be many cities?

original: gal te gnyis zhes bya ba ni khang bzangs dang skyes bu la sogs pa dang yod pa /
analyzed: gal te gnyis zhes bya ba ni khang bzangs dang skyes bu la sogs pa dang yod pa /
translated: ‚ÄúIf two‚Äù means that if there were two houses, two men, etc.,

original: phan tshun grogs byed pa nyid grong khyer yin no zhe na ste /
analyzed: phan tshun grogs byed pa nyid grong khyer yin no zhe na ste /
translated: and existence, and they were mutually assisting each other, that would be a city.

original: gzhan gyi bsam pa ni de lta bu yin na thams cad la khang bzangs la sogs pa med pa'i phyir thams cad la grong khyer gyi blo yang mi 'byung la /
analyzed: gzhan gyi bsam pa ni de lta bu yin na thams cad la khang bzangs la sogs pa med pa'i phyir thams cad la grong khyer gyi blo yang mi 'byung la /
translated: If that were the intention of the opponent, then since houses, etc., do not exist for all, the idea of a city would not occur for all.

original: khang bzangs la sogs pa'i phyir mang po'i tshig kyang grub po snyam pa yin no //
analyzed: khang bzangs la sogs pa'i phyir mang po'i tshig kyang grub po snyam pa yin no //
translated: and the plural term ‚Äúhouses‚Äù is established.

original: phan par bya ba dang zhes bya ba la sogs pas ni lan 'debs te yod pa dang khang bzangs phan par bya ba dang phan par byed pa po ma yin pa dag la grogs byed pa'i dngos po ci zhig yod /
analyzed: phan par bya ba dang zhes bya ba la sogs pas ni lan 'debs te yod pa dang khang bzangs phan par bya ba dang phan par byed pa po ma yin pa dag la grogs byed pa'i dngos po ci zhig yod /
translated: The response to that is stated in the line ‚ÄúWhat is the relationship between the existent and the house?‚Äù What is the relationship of mutual assistance between the existent and the house, which are not the object of assistance and the assister?

original: 'di ltar grogs byed pa'i don ni rnam pa gnyis te phan tshun bogs 'byin par byed pas rgyud la skad cig ma khyad par can bskyed pa'i mtshan nyid dang rang gi rgyu snga ma'i nus pa kho na las byung ba rnams 'bras bu gcig byed pa'i mtshan nyid
analyzed: 'di ltar grogs byed pa'i don ni rnam pa gnyis te phan tshun bogs 'byin par byed pas rgyud la skad cig ma khyad par can bskyed pa'i mtshan nyid dang rang gi rgyu snga ma'i nus pa kho na las byung ba rnams 'bras bu gcig byed pa'i mtshan nyid
translated: In this context, mutual assistance has two aspects: the characteristic of generating a special moment in the continuum through mutual enhancement and the characteristic of producing a single effect from causes that arise from their own prior potency alone.

original: do // de la re zhig snga ma ni ma yin te yod pa la bogs dbyung du med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: do // de la re zhig snga ma ni ma yin te yod pa la bogs dbyung du med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The first is not the case, because the existent cannot be enhanced.

original: gnyis pa yang ma yin te 'di ltar ji ltar yod pa 'ba' zhig gis grong khyer gyi blo bskyed par mi nus pa ltar khang bzangs la sogs pa grogs byed pas kyang de dang 'dra'o //
analyzed: gnyis pa yang ma yin te 'di ltar ji ltar yod pa 'ba' zhig gis grong khyer gyi blo bskyed par mi nus pa ltar khang bzangs la sogs pa grogs byed pas kyang de dang 'dra'o //
translated: Nor is it the second, because just as the mere existent is not able to generate the idea of a city, so also the mansion, etc., which are the assistants are the same.

original: 'on te nus na ni 'ba' zhig gis kyang bskyed par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: 'on te nus na ni 'ba' zhig gis kyang bskyed par 'gyur ro //
translated: But if they are able, then the mere existent would also generate it.

original: yang gal te de gnyis phan tshun grogs byed pa nyid grong khyer yin na de'i tshe grong khyer gcig bu yang du ma'i bdag nyid du 'gyur te /
analyzed: yang gal te de gnyis phan tshun grogs byed pa nyid grong khyer yin na de'i tshe grong khyer gcig bu yang du ma'i bdag nyid du 'gyur te /
translated: Moreover, if the mutual assistance of those two is the city, then at that time the single city would have the nature of many,

original: khang bzangs la sogs pa'i bdag nyid yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: khang bzangs la sogs pa'i bdag nyid yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it has the nature of the mansion, etc.

original: de bas na skyes bu dang ldan pa dang yod pa rnams kyang med pa'i phyir /
analyzed: de bas na skyes bu dang ldan pa dang yod pa rnams kyang med pa'i phyir /
translated: Therefore, since the existent that is endowed with the person does not exist,

original: grong khyer zhes bya ba gcig pu'i tshig tu mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: grong khyer zhes bya ba gcig pu'i tshig tu mi 'gyur ro //
translated: the word ‚Äúcity‚Äù would not be a singular term.

original: ldan pa zhes bya ba'i sgras ni khang bzangs kyi bdag nyid kyi ldan pa bstan to //
analyzed: ldan pa zhes bya ba'i sgras ni khang bzangs kyi bdag nyid kyi ldan pa bstan to //
translated: The word ‚Äúendowed‚Äù indicates the endowment that has the nature of the mansion, etc.

original: gal te de lta bu rnams @83b zhes bya ba ni skyes bu dang ldan pa dang yod pa phan tshun grogs byed pa rnams so //
analyzed: gal te de lta bu rnams @83b zhes bya ba ni skyes bu dang ldan pa dang yod pa phan tshun grogs byed pa rnams so //
translated: ‚ÄúIf it is like that‚Äù refers to the mutual assistance of the person and existence.

original: don 'ga' zhig la zhes bya ba ni grong khyer zhes bya ba'i shes pa dang sgra bsgrub par bya ba la ste /
analyzed: don 'ga' zhig la zhes bya ba ni grong khyer zhes bya ba'i shes pa dang sgra bsgrub par bya ba la ste /
translated: ‚ÄúIn some matter‚Äù refers to the matter to be established, the cognition called ‚Äútown‚Äù and the word.

original: nus pa tha mi dad pa gcig yod pas so //
analyzed: nus pa tha mi dad pa gcig yod pas so //
translated: Because there is one undifferentiated capacity.

original: de zhes bya ba ni nus pa tha mi dad pas te /
analyzed: de zhes bya ba ni nus pa tha mi dad pas te /
translated: ‚ÄúThat‚Äù refers to the undifferentiated capacity.

original: de gcig gi tshig gi rgyu mtshan yin no zhe na /
analyzed: de gcig gi tshig gi rgyu mtshan yin no zhe na /
translated: If that is the reason for the word ‚Äúone,‚Äù

original: ma yin no //
analyzed: ma yin no //
translated: it is not so.

original: ci'i phyir zhe na nus pa ni dngos po'i ngo bo las tha mi dad pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na nus pa ni dngos po'i ngo bo las tha mi dad pa'i phyir te /
translated: Why is it not so? Because the capacity is not different from the nature of the thing.

original: skyes bu la sogs pa'i dngos po'i ngo bo las tha mi dad pa'i phyir de dag dang 'dra bar du ma nyid yin pas de'i rten can gyi gcig gi tshig tu lta ga la 'gyur //
analyzed: skyes bu la sogs pa'i dngos po'i ngo bo las tha mi dad pa'i phyir de dag dang 'dra bar du ma nyid yin pas de'i rten can gyi gcig gi tshig tu lta ga la 'gyur //
translated: Because it is not different from the nature of the thing, the person, etc., it is like them in being multiple. How then could it be the basis for the word ‚Äúone‚Äù?

original: 'on te nus pa dngos po'i ngo bo las tha dad par khas len na ni nus pa'i ngo bo skyes bu dang ldan pa'i ngo bo dang yod pa rnams kyi phan par bya ba ma yin pa la skyes bu la sogs pa'i gzhan gyi dbang du mi 'gyur
analyzed: 'on te nus pa dngos po'i ngo bo las tha dad par khas len na ni nus pa'i ngo bo skyes bu dang ldan pa'i ngo bo dang yod pa rnams kyi phan par bya ba ma yin pa la skyes bu la sogs pa'i gzhan gyi dbang du mi 'gyur
translated: But if you assert that potential is different from the entity‚Äôs nature, then the nature of the potential would not be dependent on the nature of the person and the existence of those who are benefited.

original: te / des na skyes bu la sogs pa'i nus pa'o zhes 'brel par mi 'gyur ro snyam du bsams pa yin no //üîΩ'on te nus pa tha dad pa la yang skyes bu la sogs pa'i gzhan gyi dbang grub par bya ba'i phyir skyes bu la sogs pas byas pa'i phan pa 'dod na ni de'i tshe nus pa la skyes bu la sogs pas byas pa'i phan pa 'dod na ni
analyzed: te / des na skyes bu la sogs pa'i nus pa'o zhes 'brel par mi 'gyur ro snyam du bsams pa yin no // 'on te nus pa tha dad pa la yang skyes bu la sogs pa'i gzhan gyi dbang grub par bya ba'i phyir skyes bu la sogs pas byas pa'i phan pa 'dod na ni de'i tshe nus pa la skyes bu la sogs pas byas pa'i phan pa 'dod na ni
translated: Therefore it would not be tenable to say that the potential is of the person and so on.üîΩBut if you assert that the person and so on are dependent on the different potentials, and you assert that the person and so on benefit the potential, then at that time the person and so on would benefit the potential.

original: skyes bu la sogs pas nus pa gang gi nus pa dang po la phan 'dogs par byed pa nus pa dang po la phan 'dogs pa'i nus pa yang nus pa dang po bzhin du tha dad de /
analyzed: skyes bu la sogs pas nus pa gang gi nus pa dang po la phan 'dogs par byed pa nus pa dang po la phan 'dogs pa'i nus pa yang nus pa dang po bzhin du tha dad de /
translated: But the benefit that the person and so on provide to the first potential would be a different potential, just as the first potential is different.

original: nus pa la phan 'dogs pa'i nus pa yang tha dad tha dad na ni de kho na bzhin du skyes bu la sogs pas phan mi 'dogs pa'i phyir 'brel pa med pas de la phan 'dogs par rtog na ni nus pa tha dad pas gzhan zhig tu 'gyur
analyzed: nus pa la phan 'dogs pa'i nus pa yang tha dad tha dad na ni de kho na bzhin du skyes bu la sogs pas phan mi 'dogs pa'i phyir 'brel pa med pas de la phan 'dogs par rtog na ni nus pa tha dad pas gzhan zhig tu 'gyur
translated: If you imagine that it benefits, then since the potency that is benefited is different from the potency that benefits, it would be another potency.

original: bas / thug pa med pa'i phyir nam yang skyes bu la sogs pas bdag nyid du gyur pa'i nus pas nus pa dang po la phan 'dogs par mi byed pas skyes bu la sogs pa'i de la phan 'dogs par byed pa nyid du rtogs pa med do //
analyzed: bas / thug pa med pa'i phyir nam yang skyes bu la sogs pas bdag nyid du gyur pa'i nus pas nus pa dang po la phan 'dogs par mi byed pas skyes bu la sogs pa'i de la phan 'dogs par byed pa nyid du rtogs pa med do //
translated: Since there is no end to this, the potency that is the nature of the person would never benefit the original potency, and therefore it would be impossible to conceive that the person benefits it.

original: gal te nus pa dad pa kho na tha dad kyi de la phan 'dogs par ni tha mi dad do zhe na de'i phyir 'on te de dang tha mi dad na ni zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: gal te nus pa dad pa kho na tha dad kyi de la phan 'dogs par ni tha mi dad do zhe na de'i phyir 'on te de dang tha mi dad na ni zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: But if you say that only the potency that is benefited is different, but the potency that benefits is not different, then to respond to that, NƒÅgƒÅrjuna explains, If it is not different from that, then it is not different from the original potency.

original: 'on te nus pa la phan 'dogs pa'i nus pa de tha mi dad na ni nus pa dang po gcig gi tshig rgyu nyid du 'dod pa la yang tha mi dad par thal bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: 'on te nus pa la phan 'dogs pa'i nus pa de tha mi dad na ni nus pa dang po gcig gi tshig rgyu nyid du 'dod pa la yang tha mi dad par thal bar 'gyur ro //
translated: But if the potency that benefits the potency is not different from the first potency, then it follows that it is not different from the first potency that is asserted to be the cause of the first potency.

original: tha mi dad pa'i phyir dngos po @84a * //
analyzed: tha mi dad pa'i phyir dngos po @84a * //
translated: Because it is not different, it is just like the thing itself,

original: dang 'dra ba kho nar mang po yin pas mang po'i tshig tu thal bar 'gyur ba so na 'dug pa'i phyir nus par yongs su rtog pa de ni gyi na'o //
analyzed: dang 'dra ba kho nar mang po yin pas mang po'i tshig tu thal bar 'gyur ba so na 'dug pa'i phyir nus par yongs su rtog pa de ni gyi na'o //
translated: and because it is multiple, the fault remains that it follows that it is a multiple word. Therefore the conception of potency is nonsense.

original: nam mkha'i rang bzhin zhes tha dad pa'i rten can gyi drug par yang mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: nam mkha'i rang bzhin zhes tha dad pa'i rten can gyi drug par yang mi 'gyur ro //
translated: And the genitive case that has a different basis, as in ‚Äúthe nature of space,‚Äù would not occur.

original: drug pa'i rgyu yin pa'i phyir dngos po rkyen kyang nye bar gdags pa'i sgo nas drug pa'i sgra bshad de /
analyzed: drug pa'i rgyu yin pa'i phyir dngos po rkyen kyang nye bar gdags pa'i sgo nas drug pa'i sgra bshad de /
translated: The word ‚Äúgenitive‚Äù is explained by way of the designation of a condition of a thing that is the cause of the genitive case.

original: de na mkha' nyid ces de la phan pa tha dad pa'i rten can 'byung bar mi 'gyur ro zhes bya ba 'di don gzhan yin te nam mkha'i ngo bo ni nam mkha'i nyid do zhes bya ba'i bye brag tu bshad pa 'dis dngos po'i rkyen 'byung ba ni
analyzed: de na mkha' nyid ces de la phan pa tha dad pa'i rten can 'byung bar mi 'gyur ro zhes bya ba 'di don gzhan yin te nam mkha'i ngo bo ni nam mkha'i nyid do zhes bya ba'i bye brag tu bshad pa 'dis dngos po'i rkyen 'byung ba ni
translated: This commentary explains that the condition of an entity is

original: tha dad pa'i rten can nyid yin no //
analyzed: tha dad pa'i rten can nyid yin no //
translated: not a different support.

original: yang ma mkha' nyid ces tha dad pa'i rten can du yang mi 'gyur te /
analyzed: yang ma mkha' nyid ces tha dad pa'i rten can du yang mi 'gyur te /
translated: Moreover, space would not be the support of something different.

original: de la phan pa 'byung bar zhes bya ba kho nas drang ngo //
analyzed: de la phan pa 'byung bar zhes bya ba kho nas drang ngo //
translated: This is implied by the phrase ‚Äúthe support of something different from itself.‚ÄùüîΩThe nature of space is not the sixth case.

original: nam mkha'i rang bzhin zhes drug par yang mi 'gyur zhes ci rigs par sbyar ba dang tshig kyang dbye bar bya ste /
analyzed: nam mkha'i rang bzhin zhes drug par yang mi 'gyur zhes ci rigs par sbyar ba dang tshig kyang dbye bar bya ste /
translated: The appropriate construction and the words should be analyzed.

original: nam mkha'i sgras brjod par bya ba'i don las gzhan pa rang bzhin nam ngo bo gang zhig go rims bzhin du tha dad pa'i drug pa dang de las phan pa'i rgyur 'gyur ba ni med do //
analyzed: nam mkha'i sgras brjod par bya ba'i don las gzhan pa rang bzhin nam ngo bo gang zhig go rims bzhin du tha dad pa'i drug pa dang de las phan pa'i rgyur 'gyur ba ni med do //
translated: There is no nature or essence that is different from the object that is expressed by the word space, which is the sixth case, respectively, and which is the cause of benefit from it.

original: gal te nam mkha'i nyid ces bya ba spyi yod do de ni tha dad pa'i rgyu yin no //
analyzed: gal te nam mkha'i nyid ces bya ba spyi yod do de ni tha dad pa'i rgyu yin no //
translated: If you say that the universal called ‚Äúspace‚Äù exists, and that it is the cause of the differences,

original: zhe na de la spyi ni zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: zhe na de la spyi ni zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: then we reply: Space has no universal, etc.

original: nam mkha'i bdag nyid ni gcig pa'i phyir nam mkha'i spyi med do //
analyzed: nam mkha'i bdag nyid ni gcig pa'i phyir nam mkha'i spyi med do //
translated: Space has no universal, because it is one.

original: nam mkha'i la la yang yod pa nyid dang rdzas nyid yod mod kyi 'on kyang de dag ni nam mkha'i rang bzhin ni ma yin te /
analyzed: nam mkha'i la la yang yod pa nyid dang rdzas nyid yod mod kyi 'on kyang de dag ni nam mkha'i rang bzhin ni ma yin te /
translated: Although existence and substance do exist in space, they are not the nature of space,

original: bum pa dang ras yug la sogs pa dang thun mong yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: bum pa dang ras yug la sogs pa dang thun mong yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because they are common to pots, cloth, etc.

original: yod pa nyid dang rdzas nyid dag ni nam mkha' nyid ces bya ba 'di ltar dngos po'i rkyen gyi rgyu yang ma yin te de dag ni nam mkha' zhes brjod pa dang / shes pa'i rgyu ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: yod pa nyid dang rdzas nyid dag ni nam mkha' nyid ces bya ba 'di ltar dngos po'i rkyen gyi rgyu yang ma yin te de dag ni nam mkha' zhes brjod pa dang / shes pa'i rgyu ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Existence and substance are not even the cause of the designation ‚Äúspace,‚Äù because they are not the cause of the cognition and verbal expression ‚Äúspace.‚Äù

original: dngos po'i rkyen rgyu yin pa ni rang dang mthun pa'i shes pa dang brjod pa'i rgyu yin no //
analyzed: dngos po'i rkyen rgyu yin pa ni rang dang mthun pa'i shes pa dang brjod pa'i rgyu yin no //
translated: The cause of the designation of an entity is the cause of the cognition and verbal expression that accords with it.

original: khyab pa nyid la sogs pa'i yon tan rnams zhes bya ba la sogs pa zhes bya ba'i sgras ni gcig nyid dang gzhan nyid la sogs pa bsdu'o //
analyzed: khyab pa nyid la sogs pa'i yon tan rnams zhes bya ba la sogs pa zhes bya ba'i sgras ni gcig nyid dang gzhan nyid la sogs pa bsdu'o //
translated: ‚ÄúSuch qualities as all-pervasiveness‚Äù and so on. The term ‚Äúand so on‚Äù includes such things as oneness and otherness.

original: de skad du brjod pa zhes bya ba ni nam mkha'i rang bzhin zhes bya bar ro //
analyzed: de skad du brjod pa zhes bya ba ni nam mkha'i rang bzhin zhes bya bar ro //
translated: ‚Äú Are said to be‚Äù means that they are said to be the nature of space.

original: rdzas las don gzhan pa khyab pa nyid la sogs pa yon tan ni de'i rang bzhin yin pa nyid du mi rung ba'i phyir /
analyzed: rdzas las don gzhan pa khyab pa nyid la sogs pa yon tan ni de'i rang bzhin yin pa nyid du mi rung ba'i phyir /
translated: Because it is not tenable that the qualities such as all-pervasiveness, which are different objects from substance, are the nature of that.

original: @84b nam mkha'i rang bzhin yin pa nyid du mi rung ba'i phyir te don gzhan gyi ngo bo nyid don gzhan dang gzhan yin par rigs pa ni ma yin no //
analyzed: @84b nam mkha'i rang bzhin yin pa nyid du mi rung ba'i phyir te don gzhan gyi ngo bo nyid don gzhan dang gzhan yin par rigs pa ni ma yin no //
translated: It is not tenable that they are the nature of space because it is not tenable that the nature of one different object is another different object.

original: yang gal te khyab pa nyid la sogs pa nam mkha'i rang bzhin yin na de'i tshe khyab pa nyid la sogs pa de dag kyang nam mkha'i rang bzhin nyid yin na rang bzhin med pa nyid du thal ba'i phyir te 'di ltar de dag gi yon tan gyi
analyzed: yang gal te khyab pa nyid la sogs pa nam mkha'i rang bzhin yin na de'i tshe khyab pa nyid la sogs pa de dag kyang nam mkha'i rang bzhin nyid yin na rang bzhin med pa nyid du thal ba'i phyir te 'di ltar de dag gi yon tan gyi
translated: Moreover, if all-pervasiveness and so on are the nature of space, then they are the nature of space, and it follows that they are essenceless, because in that case they would be the qualities of space.

original: rang bzhin gang yin pa de ni nam mkha' kho nar 'gyur gyi ngo bo nyid gzhan ni med pas ngo bo nyid med par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: rang bzhin gang yin pa de ni nam mkha' kho nar 'gyur gyi ngo bo nyid gzhan ni med pas ngo bo nyid med par 'gyur ro //
translated: Whatever is its nature would be just space, and since there is no other intrinsic reality, it would be realityless.

original: de dag gi ngo bo nyid med na ni nam mkha'i ngo bo nyid tha dad pa med do snyam du bsams pa yin no //
analyzed: de dag gi ngo bo nyid med na ni nam mkha'i ngo bo nyid tha dad pa med do snyam du bsams pa yin no //
translated: If they are realityless, then there is no difference in their intrinsic reality from space.

original: gal te khyab pa nyid la sogs pa'i rang bzhin yang don gzhan yin no zhe na de yang zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: gal te khyab pa nyid la sogs pa'i rang bzhin yang don gzhan yin no zhe na de yang zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: If you say that the nature of pervasion, etc. is also a different object, then NƒÅgƒÅrjuna addresses this point:

original: de yang zhes bya ba ni khyab pa nyid la sogs pa ste /
analyzed: de yang zhes bya ba ni khyab pa nyid la sogs pa ste /
translated: ‚ÄúThat‚Äù refers to pervasion, etc.

original: gang la rang bzhin don gzhan pa yod pa zhes tshig rnam par sbyar ro //
analyzed: gang la rang bzhin don gzhan pa yod pa zhes tshig rnam par sbyar ro //
translated: ‚ÄúThat which has a different nature‚Äù is the phrase to be completed.

original: ha cang thal bar 'gyur ro zhes bya ba ni khyab pa nyid la sogs pa'i rang bzhin nyid du 'dod pa don tha dad pa gang yin pa de'i rang bzhin yang don gzhan du 'gyur ba ste de lta ma yin na de yang khyab pa nyid la sogs
analyzed: ha cang thal bar 'gyur ro zhes bya ba ni khyab pa nyid la sogs pa'i rang bzhin nyid du 'dod pa don tha dad pa gang yin pa de'i rang bzhin yang don gzhan du 'gyur ba ste de lta ma yin na de yang khyab pa nyid la sogs
translated: ‚ÄúIt would be absurd‚Äù means that whatever is asserted to be the nature of pervasion, etc., that different object would also have a different nature, and if that were not so, then that would also be pervasion, etc.

original: pa las tha mi dad pa'i phyir de dag kho na dang 'dra bar rang bzhin med par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: pa las tha mi dad pa'i phyir de dag kho na dang 'dra bar rang bzhin med par 'gyur ro //
translated: Because they are not different from the parts, they are essenceless, just like the parts.

original: de lta na yang rang bzhin gzhan dang gzhan yongs su tshol bas thug pa med pa'i phyir rang bzhin rting tshugs pa gcig kyang med pas nam mkha' rang bzhin dang po rtogs pa med de de'i phyir de nyid tha dad ba med pa yin no snyam du bsamsüîΩpa yin no //
analyzed: de lta na yang rang bzhin gzhan dang gzhan yongs su tshol bas thug pa med pa'i phyir rang bzhin rting tshugs pa gcig kyang med pas nam mkha' rang bzhin dang po rtogs pa med de de'i phyir de nyid tha dad ba med pa yin no snyam du bsams pa yin no //
translated: Even so, since the search for other and other essences is endless, there is no single definite essence. Therefore, space is not essentially established. Thus, it is thought that it is not different.

original: de bzhin du dngos po drug po rdzas dang yon tan dang las dang spyi dang khyab par dang 'du ba rnams kyi tshigs dang / sogs pa zhes bya ba'i sgras khang bzangs la sogs pa'i phreng ba zhes bya ba la sogs pa la yang tha dad ma na ji ltar drug par 'gyur zhes brjod par bya'o //
analyzed: de bzhin du dngos po drug po rdzas dang yon tan dang las dang spyi dang khyab par dang 'du ba rnams kyi tshigs dang / sogs pa zhes bya ba'i sgras khang bzangs la sogs pa'i phreng ba zhes bya ba la sogs pa la yang tha dad ma na ji ltar drug par 'gyur zhes brjod par bya'o //
translated: Similarly, one should say that if the six things‚Äîsubstance, quality, action, universal, particular, and inherence‚Äîand the aggregates of things such as houses are not different, how could there be six?

original: dngos po drug po de la tshogs kyi sgras brjod par bya ba gang yin pa spyi ni med de rdzas dang yon tan dang las rnams kho na la spyi khas blangs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: dngos po drug po de la tshogs kyi sgras brjod par bya ba gang yin pa spyi ni med de rdzas dang yon tan dang las rnams kho na la spyi khas blangs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The general property that is to be expressed by the word ‚Äúcollection‚Äù in regard to those six things does not exist, because the general property is accepted only in regard to substances, qualities, and actions.

original: de bzhin du grangs dang ldan pa yang mi srid de de gnyis ni yon tan gyi dngos po yin pa nyid kyis rdzas kho na la yod pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de bzhin du grangs dang ldan pa yang mi srid de de gnyis ni yon tan gyi dngos po yin pa nyid kyis rdzas kho na la yod pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Similarly, the number two is not possible, because those two exist in a substance alone, by virtue of being the things that are qualities.

original: gzhan gyis da ni zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: gzhan gyis da ni zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: Another says: Now, etc.üîΩNow means

original: da ni zhes bya ba ni @85a * //
analyzed: da ni zhes bya ba ni @85a * //
translated: at this time.

original: rang bzhin don gzhan yin par khas mi len pa'o //
analyzed: rang bzhin don gzhan yin par khas mi len pa'o //
translated: The nature of space is not accepted as being a different object.

original: nam mkha' zhes bya ba'i sgras brjod par bya ba dang / rang bzhin zhes bya ba'i sgras brjod par bya ba'i don la khyad par med na ji ltar nam mkha' rang bzhin zhes tha dad par ston gyi nam mkha' zhes bya ba kho na ni ma yin te ;
analyzed: nam mkha' zhes bya ba'i sgras brjod par bya ba dang / rang bzhin zhes bya ba'i sgras brjod par bya ba'i don la khyad par med na ji ltar nam mkha' rang bzhin zhes tha dad par ston gyi nam mkha' zhes bya ba kho na ni ma yin te ;
translated: If there is no difference between the object that is expressed by the word ‚Äúspace‚Äù and the object that is expressed by the word ‚Äúnature,‚Äù then why is it taught that space is a nature, but not that space is space?

original: tha dad pa'i rgyu med pa'i phyir tha mi dad pa kho nar bstan pa'i rigs so zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: tha dad pa'i rgyu med pa'i phyir tha mi dad pa kho nar bstan pa'i rigs so zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: Therefore, it is reasonable to teach that it is nondifferent, that is, the meaning.

original: nam mkha'i don gzhan zhes bya ba la sogs pas ni lan 'debs te /
analyzed: nam mkha'i don gzhan zhes bya ba la sogs pas ni lan 'debs te /
translated: In response to that, he says, ‚ÄúThe meaning of space is not different,‚Äù and so on.

original: nam mkha' zhes bya ba ni nam mkha'i sgras brjod par bya ba'i don gyi'o //
analyzed: nam mkha' zhes bya ba ni nam mkha'i sgras brjod par bya ba'i don gyi'o //
translated: The meaning of space is the meaning that is expressed by the term space.

original: sa la sogs pa'i don gzhan dang thun mong ba'i ngo bo ma zin pa'i khyad par gang yin pa de la mi ltos par bor te nam mkha' zhes bya ba'i sgras 'jug pa'i rgyu'i ngo bo rdzas gzhan dang thun mong ma yin pa da lta bur shes par
analyzed: sa la sogs pa'i don gzhan dang thun mong ba'i ngo bo ma zin pa'i khyad par gang yin pa de la mi ltos par bor te nam mkha' zhes bya ba'i sgras 'jug pa'i rgyu'i ngo bo rdzas gzhan dang thun mong ma yin pa da lta bur shes par
translated: Without relying on the particular nonapprehension of the nature that is shared with other objects such as earth, it is as if one has discarded it. The nature that is the cause for engaging the term space is the nature of a substance that is not shared with other substances.

original: 'dod pa la don gzhan gyi ngo bo dang ma 'brel pa shes par 'dod pa la ci nas kyang nam mkha'i rang bzhin ni 'di yin gyi gzhan ni ma yin no zhes shes par bya ba'i phyir nam mkha' rang bzhin zhes bya ba dang / de bzhin du mkha' nyid ces de skad du brjod do //
analyzed: 'dod pa la don gzhan gyi ngo bo dang ma 'brel pa shes par 'dod pa la ci nas kyang nam mkha'i rang bzhin ni 'di yin gyi gzhan ni ma yin no zhes shes par bya ba'i phyir nam mkha' rang bzhin zhes bya ba dang / de bzhin du mkha' nyid ces de skad du brjod do //
translated: In the same way, it is said that space is just space.

original: 'di skad du nam mkha' rang bzhin ston par byed pa na rang bzhin gyi sgras rang bzhin ma yin pa las log pa tsam gyi ston par byed kyi rang bzhin gzhan spangs te de ni ma yin no //
analyzed: 'di skad du nam mkha' rang bzhin ston par byed pa na rang bzhin gyi sgras rang bzhin ma yin pa las log pa tsam gyi ston par byed kyi rang bzhin gzhan spangs te de ni ma yin no //
translated: This is what is being said: when the nature of space is taught, the word ‚Äúnature‚Äù teaches mere exclusion of non-nature, but it does not exclude other natures.

original: mkha' nyid ces bya ba'i sgras ni de nyid ngo bo gzhan spangs nas ston par byed do //
analyzed: mkha' nyid ces bya ba'i sgras ni de nyid ngo bo gzhan spangs nas ston par byed do //
translated: The word ‚Äújust space‚Äù teaches that very nature by excluding other natures.

original: de nas na rang bzhin gzhan spong ba dang mi spong ba'i khyad par gyi bag tsam gyis nam mkha'i rang bzhin zhes tha dad par ston to zhes bshad pa yin no ;
analyzed: de nas na rang bzhin gzhan spong ba dang mi spong ba'i khyad par gyi bag tsam gyis nam mkha'i rang bzhin zhes tha dad par ston to zhes bshad pa yin no ;
translated: Therefore, the difference between excluding and not excluding other natures is merely a slight distinction, and it is taught that the nature of space is different.

original: / gzhan gyis 'di snyam du don gzhan dang thun mong ba'i ngo bo la mi ltos par nam mkha' zhes bya ba'i sgra 'jug pa'i rgyu'i ngo bo la zhes de skad du smras pas ni rang gi mtshan nyid kho nar brjod par bya ba yin par smras so
analyzed: / gzhan gyis 'di snyam du don gzhan dang thun mong ba'i ngo bo la mi ltos par nam mkha' zhes bya ba'i sgra 'jug pa'i rgyu'i ngo bo la zhes de skad du smras pas ni rang gi mtshan nyid kho nar brjod par bya ba yin par smras so
translated: Someone else thinks, ‚ÄúBy saying ‚Äòthe nature of the cause of the application of the term ‚Äúspace,‚Äù without depending on a nature common to other objects,‚Äô he is saying that it is to be expressed as a specifically characterized phenomenon alone.‚Äù

original: snyam du bsams nas thams cad las ldog pa'i zhes bya ba la sogs pa smras so //
analyzed: snyam du bsams nas thams cad las ldog pa'i zhes bya ba la sogs pa smras so //
translated: Thinking this, he says, ‚ÄúThe nature that is the opposite of everything . . .‚Äù

original: grub pa'i mtha' smra bas ngo bo nyid ces bya ba la sogs pa smas te /
analyzed: grub pa'i mtha' smra bas ngo bo nyid ces bya ba la sogs pa smas te /
translated: The Proponent of the Tenets says, ‚ÄúThe nature . . .‚Äù

original: thams cad nyid las log pa'i ngo bo rang gi mtshan nyid kyi bdag nyid gang yin pa de nyid sgras bslang ba'i blo la sgra rnams kyi 'jog pa ni ma yin te zhes bya bar sgyur ro //
analyzed: thams cad nyid las log pa'i ngo bo rang gi mtshan nyid kyi bdag nyid gang yin pa de nyid sgras bslang ba'i blo la sgra rnams kyi 'jog pa ni ma yin te zhes bya bar sgyur ro //
translated: The nature that is the opposite of everything is the nature of a specifically characterized phenomenon. That is not what is referred to by the term ‚Äúnature‚Äù that is raised by the cognition that is raised by the term ‚Äúnature.‚Äù

original: ci'i phyir @85b zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir @85b zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: rang gi mtshan nyid de'i dbang po'i blo la ji lta ba bzhin du sgra'i shes pa la yang snang na ni dbang pos mi song pa nyid ma yin par thal bar 'gyur ba'i phyir te mngon sum nyid du thal bar 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rang gi mtshan nyid de'i dbang po'i blo la ji lta ba bzhin du sgra'i shes pa la yang snang na ni dbang pos mi song pa nyid ma yin par thal bar 'gyur ba'i phyir te mngon sum nyid du thal bar 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
translated: If the specific property of that object appears to the cognition of sound just as it does to the sense cognition, then it follows that it is not not gone to by the sense faculty, because it would follow that it is a direct perception.

original: gal te 'o na sgras ci zhig byed ce na /
analyzed: gal te 'o na sgras ci zhig byed ce na /
translated: If you ask, ‚ÄúWhat does the word do?‚Äù

original: 'di ni zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: 'di ni zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: He says,

original: 'di ni zhes bya ba ni ston pa po'o //
analyzed: 'di ni zhes bya ba ni ston pa po'o //
translated: ‚ÄúThis‚Äù refers to the teacher.

original: snang ba dang rnam par brtag par bya ba'i don dag la gcig pa nyid du zhen pas bslus pa ni thun mong ma yin pa'i don de lta bu shes par bya'o snyam du de ltar sems shing sgra rgyur gyur pas nyan pa po la rnam par rtog pa
analyzed: snang ba dang rnam par brtag par bya ba'i don dag la gcig pa nyid du zhen pas bslus pa ni thun mong ma yin pa'i don de lta bu shes par bya'o snyam du de ltar sems shing sgra rgyur gyur pas nyan pa po la rnam par rtog pa
translated: Deceived by the conception of identity between the appearing object and the object of investigation, he thinks, ‚ÄúI will understand that uncommon object in that way,‚Äù and the word, serving as the cause, causes the listener to imagine

original: gang yin ba de'i gzugs brnyan rnam par gtod par byed pa 'ba' zhig tu zad do //
analyzed: gang yin ba de'i gzugs brnyan rnam par gtod par byed pa 'ba' zhig tu zad do //
translated: that it is merely the presentation of an image of that.

original: ci lta bu zhig ce na /
analyzed: ci lta bu zhig ce na /
translated: What is it like?

original: de'i rang gi ngo bo dang ma 'brel pa ste dngos po'i ngo bo ma bzung ngo //
analyzed: de'i rang gi ngo bo dang ma 'brel pa ste dngos po'i ngo bo ma bzung ngo //
translated: It is not related to its own nature, that is, it does not grasp the nature of a thing.

original: 'di ni slob dpon phyogs kyi glang po yang bzhed do zhes bya bar 'di ltar zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: 'di ni slob dpon phyogs kyi glang po yang bzhed do zhes bya bar 'di ltar zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: This is also accepted by the master Dignaga.

original: don ma mthong ba mtho ris zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i sgra brjod pa la ni nyan pa po la don gyi rnam par rtog pa tsam 'byung gi dngos po la reg pa ni ma yin no //
analyzed: don ma mthong ba mtho ris zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i sgra brjod pa la ni nyan pa po la don gyi rnam par rtog pa tsam 'byung gi dngos po la reg pa ni ma yin no //
translated: When the words ‚Äúheaven‚Äù and so on are uttered, the hearer has only a conceptual thought of the meaning, but does not touch the thing itself.

original: don mthong ba la yang rnam par rtog pa tsam yin mod kyi don mthong ba'i brda'i dus na nyams su myong ba'i phyir tha snyad 'dogs pa'i dus na rang gi mtshan nyid la zhen pa 'byung yang don ma mthong ba'i sgra la ni de yang med pas de'i
analyzed: don mthong ba la yang rnam par rtog pa tsam yin mod kyi don mthong ba'i brda'i dus na nyams su myong ba'i phyir tha snyad 'dogs pa'i dus na rang gi mtshan nyid la zhen pa 'byung yang don ma mthong ba'i sgra la ni de yang med pas de'i
translated: Even when the meaning is seen, it is only a conceptual thought, but because it is experienced at the time of the sign of seeing the meaning, at the time of positing the convention, the conception of the intrinsic identity arises. However, since that does not exist for the word that does not see the meaning,

original: phyir don mthong ba smos pa 'ba' zhig tu zad do //
analyzed: phyir don mthong ba smos pa 'ba' zhig tu zad do //
translated: therefore, it is said that only the meaning is seen.

original: sgras nyan pa po la rnam par rtog pa'i gzugs brnyan bskyed pa de ltar na rtogs par bya ba dang rtogs par byed pa dag gis go rims bzhin du rang gi mtshan nyid rtogs pa dang bstan pa ni ma yin no //üîΩgal te sgras rang gi mtshan nyid rtogs par 'gyur na ni de'i tshe mtho ris zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i sgras thos pa la yang de nyams su myong ba dag dang 'dra bar mtho ris la sogs pa mngon sum du myong pa dang 'dra bar snang ba
analyzed: sgras nyan pa po la rnam par rtog pa'i gzugs brnyan bskyed pa de ltar na rtogs par bya ba dang rtogs par byed pa dag gis go rims bzhin du rang gi mtshan nyid rtogs pa dang bstan pa ni ma yin no // gal te sgras rang gi mtshan nyid rtogs par 'gyur na ni de'i tshe mtho ris zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i sgras thos pa la yang de nyams su myong ba dag dang 'dra bar mtho ris la sogs pa mngon sum du myong pa dang 'dra bar snang ba
translated: If sound causes the listener to generate a conceptual image, then the object of understanding and the means of understanding are not, respectively, the real thing and the representation of it.üîΩIf sound caused the understanding of the real thing, then when one hears the words ‚Äúheaven‚Äù and so on, the appearance of heaven and so on would be as vivid as if one were experiencing it.

original: tha dad pa med par thal bar 'gyur ba'i phyir te nyan pa pos kyang mtho ris la sogs pa'i rang gi mtshan nyid kyi rnam par rtog par 'gyur ro zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: tha dad pa med par thal bar 'gyur ba'i phyir te nyan pa pos kyang mtho ris la sogs pa'i rang gi mtshan nyid kyi rnam par rtog par 'gyur ro zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: Because it would follow, absurdly, that there would be no difference between the two, the listener would also experience the real thing, heaven and so on.

original: gang gi phyir sgra las rang gi mtshan nyid mi rtogs pa de'i phyir nyan pa po 'dis sgra las dngos po'i rang gi ngo @86a * //
analyzed: gang gi phyir sgra las rang gi mtshan nyid mi rtogs pa de'i phyir nyan pa po 'dis sgra las dngos po'i rang gi ngo @86a * //
translated: Because the intrinsic identity of things is not understood from words, therefore this listener does not understand the intrinsic identity of things from words.üîΩ

original: bo ma rtags su zin kyang rnam par rtog pa'i gzugs brnyan de lta bu kho na la dngos po'i rang gi ngo bo dang ma 'brel pa kho na la der lhag par zhen pas /
analyzed: bo ma rtags su zin kyang rnam par rtog pa'i gzugs brnyan de lta bu kho na la dngos po'i rang gi ngo bo dang ma 'brel pa kho na la der lhag par zhen pas /
translated: Because one does not understand the intrinsic identity of a sound, therefore, although this listener does not understand the intrinsic reality of a thing from a sound, he is still attached to a mere conceptual reflection of that sort, which is not connected with the intrinsic reality of a thing, as if it were connected with the intrinsic reality of a thing.

original: rang gi mtshan nyid du lhag par zhen pas bdag gis rang gi mtshan nyid kho na rtogs so zhes mgu bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: rang gi mtshan nyid du lhag par zhen pas bdag gis rang gi mtshan nyid kho na rtogs so zhes mgu bar 'gyur ro //
translated: Thus, he is attached to the intrinsic identity of a thing, and he is satisfied with the thought, ‚ÄúI understand only the intrinsic identity of a thing.‚Äù

original: ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is this?

original: sgra'i don rtogs pa ni de lta bu kho na yin pa'i phyir te rang gi mtshan nyid ma bzung yang rang gi mtshan nyid du lhag par zhen pa'i mtshan nyid ngo bo yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: sgra'i don rtogs pa ni de lta bu kho na yin pa'i phyir te rang gi mtshan nyid ma bzung yang rang gi mtshan nyid du lhag par zhen pa'i mtshan nyid ngo bo yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because the understanding of the meaning of a word is just like that, for even though one does not grasp the intrinsic identity of a thing, one is attached to the intrinsic identity of a thing, because the intrinsic identity of a thing is characterized as the essence of that attachment.

original: gang gi phyir rang gi mtshan nyid du lhag par zhen pas sgra'i don rtogs pa yin pa des na sgras rang gi mtshan nyid bstan to zhes de skad du brjod de don gzhan dang thun mong ba'i ngo bo la mi ltos par nam mkha' zhes bya ba'i sgras
analyzed: gang gi phyir rang gi mtshan nyid du lhag par zhen pas sgra'i don rtogs pa yin pa des na sgras rang gi mtshan nyid bstan to zhes de skad du brjod de don gzhan dang thun mong ba'i ngo bo la mi ltos par nam mkha' zhes bya ba'i sgras
translated: Because the meaning of a word is understood through the conception of its own character, it is said that a word teaches its own character.

original: 'jug pa'i rgyu thun mong ma yin pa'i ngo bo la de skad du brjod do zhes smos pa'i phyir ro //üîΩrang gi ngo bo snang ba'i rnam par shes pa khon bskyed pa'i phyir /
analyzed: 'jug pa'i rgyu thun mong ma yin pa'i ngo bo la de skad du brjod do zhes smos pa'i phyir ro // rang gi ngo bo snang ba'i rnam par shes pa khon bskyed pa'i phyir /
translated: This is because it is said that the uncommon nature that is the cause of engagement by the word ‚Äúspace‚Äù is called that.

original: rang gi mtshan nyid bstan to zhes brjod pa ni ma yin no //
analyzed: rang gi mtshan nyid bstan to zhes brjod pa ni ma yin no //
translated: It is not said that it teaches its own character because it generates consciousness that appears as its own nature.

original: gzhan gyis da ni 'o na zhes bya ba la sogs pa smras te /
analyzed: gzhan gyis da ni 'o na zhes bya ba la sogs pa smras te /
translated: Others say, ‚ÄúWell then, what is the meaning of the statement that a word teaches its own character?‚Äù

original: gang dag la gcig tu log pa'i ngo bo yod pa zhes tshig rnam par sbyar ro //
analyzed: gang dag la gcig tu log pa'i ngo bo yod pa zhes tshig rnam par sbyar ro //
translated: The phrase ‚Äúthose that have a nature that is completely unreal‚Äù is to be applied to this.

original: dngos po de dag ma 'brel pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: dngos po de dag ma 'brel pa'i phyir te /
translated: Because those things are not related.

original: gzhan yang zhes bya ba ni dngos po dag la ma gtogs pa'i spyi'o //
analyzed: gzhan yang zhes bya ba ni dngos po dag la ma gtogs pa'i spyi'o //
translated: Moreover, a universal is not related to things.
