original: grub pa'i mtha' smra bas spyi ji lta bu yin pa ni bshad zin te zhes bya ba smos so //
analyzed: grub pa'i mtha' smra bas spyi ji lta bu yin pa ni bshad zin te zhes bya ba smos so //
translated: The proponent of tenets says, ‚ÄúThe nature of universals has already been explained.‚Äù

original: ji lta bu zhig yin par bshad ce na ma 'dres pa rnams kyi zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: ji lta bu zhig yin par bshad ce na ma 'dres pa rnams kyi zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: What was explained? He says, ‚ÄúThe opposite of the unmixed and so on.‚Äù

original: ma 'dres pa phan tshun log pa rnams kyi cig shos rigs mi mthun pa dang 'brel pa ni dper na ba lang gi gsal ba rnams kyi rta dang 'brel pa lta bu'o //
analyzed: ma 'dres pa phan tshun log pa rnams kyi cig shos rigs mi mthun pa dang 'brel pa ni dper na ba lang gi gsal ba rnams kyi rta dang 'brel pa lta bu'o //
translated: The opposite of the unmixed, which are mutually exclusive, is the relation with the other, which is dissimilar, for example, the relation of a horse with the instances of cow.

original: ma 'brel pa de nyid de las log pa can rnams kyi rta de las log pa can ba lang gi khyad par rnams kyis 'dra ba nyid yin zhing rta ma yin pa nyid yin te /
analyzed: ma 'brel pa de nyid de las log pa can rnams kyi rta de las log pa can ba lang gi khyad par rnams kyis 'dra ba nyid yin zhing rta ma yin pa nyid yin te /
translated: The opposite of that, which is not related, is the similarity and non-horse of the particulars of cow, which are the opposite of that horse.

original: spyi gzhan yang de dang 'dra bar brjod par bya'o //
analyzed: spyi gzhan yang de dang 'dra bar brjod par bya'o //
translated: Another universal should be described in the same way.

original: 'di skad du rang gi mtshan nyid ni rigs mthun ba dang rigs mi mthun pa las log pa dag yin mod kyi 'on kyang rigs mi mthun pa las log pa'i ngo bor bltas pa rnams la spyi zhes nye bar btags ta thams cad rigs mi mthun pa las
analyzed: 'di skad du rang gi mtshan nyid ni rigs mthun ba dang rigs mi mthun pa las log pa dag yin mod kyi 'on kyang rigs mi mthun pa las log pa'i ngo bor bltas pa rnams la spyi zhes nye bar btags ta thams cad rigs mi mthun pa las
translated: It is said that although intrinsic character is the opposite of things that are of a similar type and of a different type, when one sees the entity that is the opposite of things that are of a different type, it is designated as a universal.üîΩ

original: log pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: log pa'i phyir ro //
translated: It is said that although intrinsic identity is the exclusion of the heterogeneous and the homogeneous, still, when the exclusion of the heterogeneous is viewed as the essence, it is designated as the universal, because all are the exclusion of the heterogeneous.

original: de yang / mthun @86b dngos gzhan gyi dngos dag las //
analyzed: de yang / mthun @86b dngos gzhan gyi dngos dag las //
translated: And that is said:

original: ldog pa de ni rten pa can //üîΩzhes bya bar gzhan gyi dngos po la log pa bsnyad bas bshad zin par khong du chud par bya'o zhes bshad pa yin no //
analyzed: ldog pa de ni rten pa can // zhes bya bar gzhan gyi dngos po la log pa bsnyad bas bshad zin par khong du chud par bya'o zhes bshad pa yin no //
translated: The universal is based on the exclusionüîΩof the similar and the dissimilar.üîΩAnd since the exclusion of the dissimilar is referred to as the exclusion of the other, it should be understood that it has already been explained.

original: de ltar na re zhig rang gi mtshan nyid dag kho na la rnam grangs gzhan gyi spyi zhes nye bar gdags so zhes bshad pa yin no //
analyzed: de ltar na re zhig rang gi mtshan nyid dag kho na la rnam grangs gzhan gyi spyi zhes nye bar gdags so zhes bshad pa yin no //
translated: Thus it is said that the universal is designated as the other of the intrinsic identities.

original: rnam pa gcig tu na rang bzhin gyi rnam pa gcig tu snang ba'i rgyur gyur pa'i dngos po rnams la brten nas rnam par rtog pa'i blo rnam pa gcig pa can skye ba na rnam pa gcig pa 'di dngos rnams pa la sgro 'dogs par byed par blo'i
analyzed: rnam pa gcig tu na rang bzhin gyi rnam pa gcig tu snang ba'i rgyur gyur pa'i dngos po rnams la brten nas rnam par rtog pa'i blo rnam pa gcig pa can skye ba na rnam pa gcig pa 'di dngos rnams pa la sgro 'dogs par byed par blo'i
translated: In one way, when a conceptual cognition having a single aspect arises in dependence upon things that are the cause for the appearance of a single aspect, this single aspect superimposes a single entity upon things.

original: rnam par sgra 'jug pa'i yan lag tu gyur pa de kho na spyi yin no //
analyzed: rnam par sgra 'jug pa'i yan lag tu gyur pa de kho na spyi yin no //
translated: That which is the basis for the application of the term ‚Äúaspect‚Äù is the universal.

original: de nyid gzhan yang zhes bya ba la sogs pas ston te /
analyzed: de nyid gzhan yang zhes bya ba la sogs pas ston te /
translated: That itself is taught by ‚Äúthat very thing, etc.‚Äù

original: tha dad pa dngos rnams la brten nas zhes bya ba ni log pa rang gi mtshan nyid rnams la brten nas blo don gcig tu snang ba can skye ba /
analyzed: tha dad pa dngos rnams la brten nas zhes bya ba ni log pa rang gi mtshan nyid rnams la brten nas blo don gcig tu snang ba can skye ba /
translated: ‚ÄúIn dependence upon different things‚Äù means that a cognition having a single object of appearance arises in dependence upon unreal particulars.

original: gang gis rang gi ngo bo yis /
analyzed: gang gis rang gi ngo bo yis /
translated: By the power of its own nature,

original: rang snang bas gzhan gyi ngo bo log pa rang gi mtshan nyid sgrib par byed cing 'gegs par byed pa'o //
analyzed: rang snang bas gzhan gyi ngo bo log pa rang gi mtshan nyid sgrib par byed cing 'gegs par byed pa'o //
translated: it conceals and obstructs the nature of other things, i.e., unreal particulars.

original: des zhes bya ba ni blos so //
analyzed: des zhes bya ba ni blos so //
translated: ‚ÄúBy that‚Äù means by the cognition.

original: khyad par ji lta bu can zhig gis she na kun rdzob kyis te 'dis rang gi mtshan nyid sgrib par byed pas so //üîΩbdag nyid kyis tha dad pa yin yang tha dad pa bsgribs shing tha dad pa nyid bkab pa rnams ngo bo rigs mi mthun pa las ldog par nye bar btags pa ba lang nyid la sogs pa'i ngo bo 'ba' zhig gis /
analyzed: khyad par ji lta bu can zhig gis she na kun rdzob kyis te 'dis rang gi mtshan nyid sgrib par byed pas so // bdag nyid kyis tha dad pa yin yang tha dad pa bsgribs shing tha dad pa nyid bkab pa rnams ngo bo rigs mi mthun pa las ldog par nye bar btags pa ba lang nyid la sogs pa'i ngo bo 'ba' zhig gis /
translated: By what kind of difference? By the conventional, because it conceals its own characteristic.

original: tha dad pa min zhing 'dres pa lta bur snang ngo //
analyzed: tha dad pa min zhing 'dres pa lta bur snang ngo //
translated: Although different by way of their own natures, the differences are concealed, and the differences themselves are covered over. They are figuratively designated as being the opposite of a different type of entity, and they appear as if they were not different and were mixed together, only by way of the entity of cowness, etc.

original: blo de la bsam pa'i dbang gis na rnam pa gcig tu sgro 'dogs pa'i dbang gis ni spyi yod do zhes bya bar rab tu bsgrags te /
analyzed: blo de la bsam pa'i dbang gis na rnam pa gcig tu sgro 'dogs pa'i dbang gis ni spyi yod do zhes bya bar rab tu bsgrags te /
translated: By the power of thought, that cognition is well known as having the existence of universals, because of the superimposition of oneness.

original: blos btags pa'i rnam pa kho na la spyi zhes bshad do zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: blos btags pa'i rnam pa kho na la spyi zhes bshad do zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: The meaning is that the aspect that is imputed by the mind is explained to be a universal.

original: blo des ji ltar kun btags pa sgro btags pa de ltar spyi //
analyzed: blo des ji ltar kun btags pa sgro btags pa de ltar spyi //
translated: A universal is just as it is imagined by that cognition, as a superimposition.

original: de ni dam pa'i don du med //
analyzed: de ni dam pa'i don du med //
translated: It does not exist in the ultimate sense.

original: rnam par rtog pa can gyi zhes bya ba la sogs pas ni 'chad de /
analyzed: rnam par rtog pa can gyi zhes bya ba la sogs pas ni 'chad de /
translated: The phrase ‚Äúthose that are conceptual‚Äù and so on explains this.

original: rnam par rtog pa can zhes bya ba ni blo zhes bya ba 'di dang sbyar ro //
analyzed: rnam par rtog pa can zhes bya ba ni blo zhes bya ba 'di dang sbyar ro //
translated: The phrase ‚Äúthose that are conceptual‚Äù is connected with the phrase ‚Äúthose that are mental.‚Äù

original: gang rnams la rigs mthun pa de dag las gzhan pa de las ldog pa de yod pa'i de rnams ni de dag las gzhan pa las ldog pa can te /
analyzed: gang rnams la rigs mthun pa de dag las gzhan pa de las ldog pa de yod pa'i de rnams ni de dag las gzhan pa las ldog pa can te /
translated: Those that are similar to each other are the ones that are excluded from what is dissimilar to them.

original: rigs mi mthun pa las ldog pa rnams zhes bya @87a * //üîΩba'i tha tshig go //üîΩ/ bam po dgu pa /
analyzed: rigs mi mthun pa las ldog pa rnams zhes bya @87a * // ba'i tha tshig go // / bam po dgu pa /
translated: They are said to be ‚Äúexcluded from what is dissimilar to them.‚ÄùüîΩThis means that they are excluded from what is not of the same type as them.

original: rang gi bag chags kyi rang bzhin ni rnam par rtog pa'i bag chags kyi rang gi ngo bo ste tha dad pa dag las yang tha mi dad pa'i shes pa bskyed pa'i mthu'o //
analyzed: rang gi bag chags kyi rang bzhin ni rnam par rtog pa'i bag chags kyi rang gi ngo bo ste tha dad pa dag las yang tha mi dad pa'i shes pa bskyed pa'i mthu'o //
translated: The phrase ‚Äúthe power of their own habitual tendencies‚Äù means the power of the essential nature of the habitual tendencies of conceptualization to generate a cognition that is not different from them, even though they are different from each other.

original: de'i rjes su byed pa ni mthun par byed pa ste gal te tha dad pa dag la yang rnam pa gcig pa can skye na de lta na des rang gi rgyu dang mthun par byas pa yin no //
analyzed: de'i rjes su byed pa ni mthun par byed pa ste gal te tha dad pa dag la yang rnam pa gcig pa can skye na de lta na des rang gi rgyu dang mthun par byas pa yin no //
translated: The phrase ‚Äúthey conform to that‚Äù means that they are in agreement with it. If a cognition that has a single aspect is produced even though the objects are different from each other, then it conforms to its cause.

original: de dag gi zhes bya ba ni dngos po dag gi'o //
analyzed: de dag gi zhes bya ba ni dngos po dag gi'o //
translated: ‚ÄúThose‚Äù refers to things.

original: zhen par byas te zhes bya ba ni 'di ni dngos po rnams kho na'i ngo bo gcig pa yin no zhes dngos po rnams la sgro btags te'o //
analyzed: zhen par byas te zhes bya ba ni 'di ni dngos po rnams kho na'i ngo bo gcig pa yin no zhes dngos po rnams la sgro btags te'o //
translated: ‚ÄúHaving superimposed‚Äù means that having exaggerated things, thinking ‚ÄúThis is the sameness of the entities.‚Äù

original: dngos po de rnams 'dres shing tha mi dad pa lta bur byed par kun du ston te /
analyzed: dngos po de rnams 'dres shing tha mi dad pa lta bur byed par kun du ston te /
translated: ‚ÄúThey present those things as if they were mixed and undifferentiated.‚Äù

original: ngo bo gcig par ston to zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: ngo bo gcig par ston to zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: This means that they present them as having the same nature.

original: yang ci'i phyir blo de rang gi ngo bo gzhan la sgro 'dogs par byed pa'i snang zhe na /
analyzed: yang ci'i phyir blo de rang gi ngo bo gzhan la sgro 'dogs par byed pa'i snang zhe na /
translated: Why does that cognition present itself as an exaggeration of something else?

original: de'i phyir bsgrub par bya ba dang zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: de'i phyir bsgrub par bya ba dang zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: To answer this, he says, ‚ÄúThe object of affirmation and the means of affirmation are similar,‚Äù and so on.

original: dngos po gang dag la bsgrub par bya ba dang sgrub pa 'dra ba cig yod pa dper na bum pa rnams kyis bsgrub par bya ba chu 'dzin pa la sogs pa dang sgrub par 'dzin pa'i gong bu la sogs pa gcig pa lta bu de dag ni bsgrub
analyzed: dngos po gang dag la bsgrub par bya ba dang sgrub pa 'dra ba cig yod pa dper na bum pa rnams kyis bsgrub par bya ba chu 'dzin pa la sogs pa dang sgrub par 'dzin pa'i gong bu la sogs pa gcig pa lta bu de dag ni bsgrub
translated: Those things that have a similar object of affirmation and means of affirmation, for example, the pots, which have the same object of affirmation, holding water, and the same means of affirmation, the shape of the belly, and so on, are established as similar.

original: par bya ba dang / sgrub pa gcig pa can no //
analyzed: par bya ba dang / sgrub pa gcig pa can no //
translated: and the same in respect to the object to be established and the proof.

original: de'i dngos po ni nyed do //
analyzed: de'i dngos po ni nyed do //
translated: The nature of that is the same.

original: de rgyur gyur pas gzhan de'i bsgrub par bya ba dang / sgrub pa ma yin pa dag las tha dad pa'i dngos po rnams kyi rang bzhin rang gi ngo bo mang pos kyang rang bzhin gyi rnam par rtog pa'i blo rnam pa gcig pa can skyed pa'i mtshan nyid kyang de yin la /
analyzed: de rgyur gyur pas gzhan de'i bsgrub par bya ba dang / sgrub pa ma yin pa dag las tha dad pa'i dngos po rnams kyi rang bzhin rang gi ngo bo mang pos kyang rang bzhin gyi rnam par rtog pa'i blo rnam pa gcig pa can skyed pa'i mtshan nyid kyang de yin la /
translated: Since that is the cause, the nature of things that are different from the object to be established and the proof is the same in respect to the single aspect of the cognition that conceives the nature.

original: rnam par rtog pa de lta bu'i bag chags kyi rang bzhin yang de dag las skye ba can de gang la rnam par rtog pa'i bag chags dang / tha dad pa'i dngos po rnams las grangs bzhin du dngos su dang / brgyud pas skye ba yod pa de la de skad ces bya ste /
analyzed: rnam par rtog pa de lta bu'i bag chags kyi rang bzhin yang de dag las skye ba can de gang la rnam par rtog pa'i bag chags dang / tha dad pa'i dngos po rnams las grangs bzhin du dngos su dang / brgyud pas skye ba yod pa de la de skad ces bya ste /
translated: That is also the nature of the latent potentialities of such a conception. That which arises from those latent potentialities is said to be the same in respect to the direct and indirect arising from things that are different from the latent potentialities of the conception.

original: blo 'di de lta bur rang gi ngo bo gzhan la sgro 'dogs par snang ba gang yin pa de yin no //
analyzed: blo 'di de lta bur rang gi ngo bo gzhan la sgro 'dogs par snang ba gang yin pa de yin no //
translated: This is the nature of the cognition that appears to impute something else to that.

original: de ni zhes bya ba ni blo ste kun rdzob ces bya'o //
analyzed: de ni zhes bya ba ni blo ste kun rdzob ces bya'o //
translated: ‚ÄúThat‚Äù refers to the mind, which is called ‚Äúconventional.‚Äù

original: ji ltar zhe na blo 'dis rang gi ngo bos rang snang bas gzhan gyi ngo bo dngos po'i ngo bo sgrib pa'i phyir ro //üîΩdngos po de dag ni des zhes bya ba blos tha dad pa bsgribs shing tha dad pa nyid bkab pas ngo bo 'ga' zhig @87b gis zhes bya ba /
analyzed: ji ltar zhe na blo 'dis rang gi ngo bos rang snang bas gzhan gyi ngo bo dngos po'i ngo bo sgrib pa'i phyir ro // dngos po de dag ni des zhes bya ba blos tha dad pa bsgribs shing tha dad pa nyid bkab pas ngo bo 'ga' zhig @87b gis zhes bya ba /
translated: How so? Because this mind conceals the nature of things, the nature of others, by its own appearance.

original: rnam par rtog pa can gyi blos sgro btags pas rnam par rtog pa'i blo la snang ngo //
analyzed: rnam par rtog pa can gyi blos sgro btags pas rnam par rtog pa'i blo la snang ngo //
translated: Those things are ‚Äúby it,‚Äù by the mind, concealed as different, and their difference is covered over, so that they appear to the conceptual mind as if they were a single entity.

original: de nas ni zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni rjes su byed pa rtag pa po rnams kyis blo'i snang ba la zhes bya ba rnam par rtog pa can gyi rnam pa la ste blo nye bar gzhag pa'i ngo bo gcig pa la spyi yin bar brjod do
analyzed: de nas ni zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni rjes su byed pa rtag pa po rnams kyis blo'i snang ba la zhes bya ba rnam par rtog pa can gyi rnam pa la ste blo nye bar gzhag pa'i ngo bo gcig pa la spyi yin bar brjod do
translated: Then, those who are followers of the eternalist schools, who posit the existence of a single universal entity, posit the appearance of the mind, the conceptual form, as a single universal entity.

original: zhes bya ba 'di dang sbyar ro //
analyzed: zhes bya ba 'di dang sbyar ro //
translated: ‚ÄúThen‚Äù and so on.

original: gang dag gis spyi zhes brjod ce na blo la snang ba rnams kho na'i ste blo la snang ba de dag kho na'i zhes bya ba dang sbyar ro //üîΩrang gi mtshan nyid nyams su myong nas ji ltar nyams su myong ba bzhin 'di yang bum pa'o //
analyzed: gang dag gis spyi zhes brjod ce na blo la snang ba rnams kho na'i ste blo la snang ba de dag kho na'i zhes bya ba dang sbyar ro // rang gi mtshan nyid nyams su myong nas ji ltar nyams su myong ba bzhin 'di yang bum pa'o //
translated: What is it that is called ‚Äúuniversal‚Äù? It is only that which appears to the awareness.

original: 'di yang bum pa'o zhes rnam par rtog pa'i blo mi gsal ba bum pa la sogs pa'i rnam pa can de dag ni blo la snang ba'i dngos po ste /
analyzed: 'di yang bum pa'o zhes rnam par rtog pa'i blo mi gsal ba bum pa la sogs pa'i rnam pa can de dag ni blo la snang ba'i dngos po ste /
translated: Having experienced the particular, just as it was experienced, the awareness that is not clear, which is the thought ‚ÄúThis is a pot,‚Äù ‚ÄúThis is a pot,‚Äù that has the aspect of pot, etc., is the entity that appears to the awareness.

original: spyi 'di ni dngos su de dag gi yin gyi rang gi mtshan nyid rnams kyi ni ma yin gyi /
analyzed: spyi 'di ni dngos su de dag gi yin gyi rang gi mtshan nyid rnams kyi ni ma yin gyi /
translated: This universal is actually of those, but not of the particular.

original: de rnams spyi'i blo la mi snang ba'i phyir ro //üîΩphyi rol lta bur kun du 'phro ba zhes bya ba ni blo la snang ba zhes bya ba kho na'i khyad par yin te /
analyzed: de rnams spyi'i blo la mi snang ba'i phyir ro // phyi rol lta bur kun du 'phro ba zhes bya ba ni blo la snang ba zhes bya ba kho na'i khyad par yin te /
translated: Because those do not appear to the awareness of the universal.üîΩ‚ÄúRadiating like the external‚Äù is a particular of ‚Äúappears to the awareness.‚Äù

original: phyi'i lta bur snang ba zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: phyi'i lta bur snang ba zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: It means ‚Äúappearing like the external.‚Äù

original: phyi rol lta bur 'phro ba'i rgyur yang rnam pa'i khyad par yongs su 'dzin pas zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: phyi rol lta bur 'phro ba'i rgyur yang rnam pa'i khyad par yongs su 'dzin pas zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: And it is the cause of the appearance of external objects because it holds the special features of those objects.

original: phyi rol gyi don gyi kha dog dang dbyibs mi gsal ba'i rjes su byed pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: phyi rol gyi don gyi kha dog dang dbyibs mi gsal ba'i rjes su byed pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it conforms to the color and shape of external objects.

original: gal te rnam par rtog pa can gyi blos bstan pa'i ngo bor blo la snang ba rnams kho na'i spyi yin na de ni ji ltar gzhan sel ba /
analyzed: gal te rnam par rtog pa can gyi blos bstan pa'i ngo bor blo la snang ba rnams kho na'i spyi yin na de ni ji ltar gzhan sel ba /
translated: If the universal is only that which appears to the mind in the aspect presented by conceptual consciousness, then how can the universal be the essence of the exclusion of other?

original: rang gi mtshan nyid rnams kyi rigs mi mthun pa las ldog pa de dag gi bdag nyid du rgyur pa kho na spyi yin zhes brjod de /üîΩ'di ltar gong nyid du cig shos dang ma 'brel pa ni /
analyzed: rang gi mtshan nyid rnams kyi rigs mi mthun pa las ldog pa de dag gi bdag nyid du rgyur pa kho na spyi yin zhes brjod de / 'di ltar gong nyid du cig shos dang ma 'brel pa ni /
translated: The universal is only the essence of the exclusion of other of those individual things that are of a different type.üîΩBecause it was explained above that the non-connection of one thing with another is the similarity of those that are the opposite of that.

original: de las ldog pa can rnams kyi 'dra ba nyid yin no zhes ni bshad do zhe na grub pa'i mtha' smra bas /
analyzed: de las ldog pa can rnams kyi 'dra ba nyid yin no zhes ni bshad do zhe na grub pa'i mtha' smra bas /
translated: The proponent of tenets says:

original: de nyid ces bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: de nyid ces bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: That itself is the universal.

original: rnam par rtog pa can gyi blo la rnam par gzhag pa'i snang ba'i de nyid gzhan sel ba yin te /
analyzed: rnam par rtog pa can gyi blo la rnam par gzhag pa'i snang ba'i de nyid gzhan sel ba yin te /
translated: The reality of the appearance that is established for the conceptual mind is the exclusion of other,

original: gzhan las tha dad pa'i dngos po mthong ba'i sgo nas 'ongs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gzhan las tha dad pa'i dngos po mthong ba'i sgo nas 'ongs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it comes about through the perception of a thing that is different from other things.

original: de nyid dngos su sgra'i spyod yul yin gyi cig shos dang ma 'brel pa 'dra ba nyid du bshad pa gang yin pa de ni nye bar btags pas yin te /
analyzed: de nyid dngos su sgra'i spyod yul yin gyi cig shos dang ma 'brel pa 'dra ba nyid du bshad pa gang yin pa de ni nye bar btags pas yin te /
translated: That is the actual domain of words. The other, which is explained as being similar to that without being connected to it, is a secondary usage.

original: rgyu mtshan 'di tsam kho nas gsal ba rnams la 'dra ba nyid nye bar btags so @88a * //
analyzed: rgyu mtshan 'di tsam kho nas gsal ba rnams la 'dra ba nyid nye bar btags so @88a * //
translated: It is only on the basis of this reason that similarity is imputed to the manifest things.

original: zhes bstan pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: zhes bstan pa'i phyir ro //
translated: This is what is taught.

original: rnam par rtog pa can gyi blo de ni /
analyzed: rnam par rtog pa can gyi blo de ni /
translated: The conceptual mind

original: de kho na zhes bya ba'i blo la snang ba 'dzin pa na dngos po 'dzin pa lta bur snang ngo //
analyzed: de kho na zhes bya ba'i blo la snang ba 'dzin pa na dngos po 'dzin pa lta bur snang ngo //
translated: appears to apprehend a thing when it apprehends the appearance of what is called reality.

original: ci'i phyir zhe na rnam par rtog pa rnams ni rang bzhin gyis 'khrul pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na rnam par rtog pa rnams ni rang bzhin gyis 'khrul pa'i phyir te /
translated: Why is this? Because conceptual thoughts are by nature mistaken.

original: rang gi ngo bo kho nas rang snang ba la don med kyang /
analyzed: rang gi ngo bo kho nas rang snang ba la don med kyang /
translated: Although things do not exist, they appear to the mind by their own nature.

original: don du 'dzin par 'khrul pa'i phyir ro //üîΩrnam par rtog pa can gyi blo de ni lhag par zhen pa'i dbang gis de las gzhan pa las tha dad pa'i dngos po rang gi mtshan nyid rnams kho na las skye ba na 'bras bu'i sgo nas tha dad pa'i yul can no zhes bya par shes kyiüîΩdngos po'i rang gi ngo bo yul du byed pa'i phyir ni ma yin no //üîΩgzhan gyis bsam pa ma rig nas phyi rol pa rnams zhes bya ba la sogs pa smras so //
analyzed: don du 'dzin par 'khrul pa'i phyir ro // rnam par rtog pa can gyi blo de ni lhag par zhen pa'i dbang gis de las gzhan pa las tha dad pa'i dngos po rang gi mtshan nyid rnams kho na las skye ba na 'bras bu'i sgo nas tha dad pa'i yul can no zhes bya par shes kyi dngos po'i rang gi ngo bo yul du byed pa'i phyir ni ma yin no // gzhan gyis bsam pa ma rig nas phyi rol pa rnams zhes bya ba la sogs pa smras so //
translated: because it is deluded in apprehending the object.

original: spyi las phyi rol pa rnams ni rang gi mtshan nyid rnams zhes bya ba'i don te /üîΩde ltar na nang gi dang phyi rol pa rnams bsdu ba byas par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: spyi las phyi rol pa rnams ni rang gi mtshan nyid rnams zhes bya ba'i don te /üîΩde ltar na nang gi dang phyi rol pa rnams bsdu ba byas par 'gyur ro //
translated: That conceptual cognition, by the power of its special adherence, cognizes the object as different from that, as having a nature that is different from that, as having a nature that is
